column6: No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here for dinner Friday night. Cute place with interesting painting on the wall. The escargot and tuna was good. Our entree of the beef and the surf and turf was not enough for two people. Me and my friend ordered more. The staff was super friendly. So we ordered another appetizer and entree. The octopus and shrimp entree with the foie gras appetizer. We still think the appetizers were the best part of the dinner. The entrees were disappointing. The lava cake dessert was more like a chocolate bread with tiny bit of chocolate inside. The music was a bit loud and it felt like we were in a club. Hard to hear each other. The surf and turf the scallops were warm but the pork belly on it was cold. The size of the octopus in the entree was tiny compare to the salad. Would come back for the appetizers but not the entrees.
No comment

Delicious delicious French restaurant with great cocktails and tapas. I ordered the ouco buco which was great in a creamy mushroom sauce. The meat was real tender and fed off the bone! For drinks I had an espresso martini one of the best I have had excellent and chilled to perfection. Service was quality. The hip hop music playing in the background was not excepted at first but was a nice soundtrack to dinner!

Great food and drinks here! A nice, informal spot to grab dinner with friends. We had the French Bellini, daiquiri, bread, burrata, onion soup, mushroom risotto, pork belly, gratin cauliflower, and some other dishes I can't recall. The only dish that anyone critiqued was the onion soup; the rest was delicious. Our server was kind and efficient, it was easy to make a reservation, and prices were fairly reasonable. It was a little warm in the restaurant but that might have been because we were right next to a heated water pipe. I would come back!

Stopped by quickly to kill time while my friends and I were waiting for Attaboy (across the street). We got some small bites and a round of drinks and it was such a fun atmosphere. Would love to come back to try some more foods. The cocktail menu was expansive!

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: My favorite go to place ! You can get a beautiful espresso martini (as featured in GOTHAM magazine) and a beautiful sea food salad for a great price. The staff are super friendly , they accommodate you and will never have you waiting for a drink. The atmosphere artsy, fun, and young ! Start your night here whenever your in the lower east side , you won't regret ;)
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

You haveee to try the escargot here!! It's absolutely delicious and it tastes reallyy good with the bread! I also ordered the Roasted Octopus Chorizo, Mushroom Risotto and Roasted Ribs Basque Chimichuri. The octopus was not rubbery and had great flavor, the ribs were cooked to perfection and fell off the bone and the risotto was hearty and creamy. Overall, the food and service were great; definitely recommend this restaurant!
No comment
Way too crowded, the staff treated people poorly. Don't even bother. Would do zero if I could.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Cute and cozy atmosphere. Dishes are small and pricey. Their meat dishes are a bit overcooked but tasty. Staff is friendly
No comment

Great food & cocktails. Abraham the bartender was so pleasant and he made fire pineapple daiquiris and whiskey sours. Foiegras was delicious along with the escargot. Only recommendation was to have an option of the escargot without the pastry puff (I apologize I'm a purist). Prices are more than reasonably and amazing friendly staff. Btw open on Christmas Day (the day I went). Will be returning, definitely a gem.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place is amazing!! their espresso martinis are superb but the service here is truly something else. Shoutout abraham and everyone who works here. I've brought different friends here and they all are amazed by how accommodating and friendly they are here. ilyyyyyyy

Came back to Lena just 2 days ago and I tried the baked Camembert with mushroom and truffle oil, steak, and duck crostini. I also got the kir royal french cocktail to drink. I really enjoyed everything but I actually wasn't too crazy about the duck crostini. The duck crostini was more of an aged duck on top of the bread with a good dallop of honey. The baked camembert with mushroom and truffle oil was soo good. Melty cheese with a good amount of mushroom and the delectable taste of truffle. The steak was also really good and the mashed potatoes that came along with it were soft and yummy! The kir royal was a nice light and sparkling drink!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The food is delicious, the cocktails are really good too!! Can't really go wrong when you come here. We tried the burrata, roasted octopus, mushroom risotto and had a few cocktails. My go to when I'm in LES

Came here for a night cap with a group of 6. So, I can't comment on the food. We just had one round of simple drinks. All good. This review is for the chastising that my wife received from the bartender for wearing a mask. The second we walked in, he yelled "no masks here!" We assumed he was just joking. After a few seconds he yelled repeatedly, "we don't like masks here!" After being in shock at the moment, my wife asked "you like Trump?" He said "yeah I like Trump, Biden is raising my taxes." Truly a weird exchange, and one that should've never been initiated by the bartender as soon as we walked in.
I enjoyed the food and the staff at this joint. The food was shareable and cooked with care.It was a great vibe and tunes.
No comment
Amazing drinks, amazing service!!! Super chill spot and nice music. The bartender, Abraham, was super attentive and recommended great drinks.
No comment
Cute place with intimate atmosphere e. Great staff that's super friendly. Food is good. Drinks were solid!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Fantastic little French spot in lower Manhattan! Able to get a table outside with great weather. Me and friend had a round of negronis and split an order of pork belly between me and my friend. The pork belly was amazing with the jalapeño jam and sliced baguette on the side. Hospitality was great and definitely would come back to try more!
No comment
No comment

I've been here a few times and thought it may become a les staple for me. However last time I went there with my friend - 2 weeks ago..I had the worst experience with the bartender. My friend and I enjoyed our first round of drinks and asked for a second, the bartender (I forget his name now, but he had dreadlocks) makes my friend their drink. 10 min later I ask for my drink, he gets angry and throws out my friends drink because I couldn't tell he was busy. I shouldn't have to wait an additional 10 minutes after my friends drink was made to have my drink and by no way should a bartender take your drink and throw it out. Even if they are having a bad day this is unacceptable. Luckily one of the other staff members calmed down the situation- also why I am leaving a 2 star review vs something less.
No comment
No comment

Our group sat at the bar Friday night and had round after round of fantastic cocktails. I think the name of the bartender who chatted and took good care of us was Abraham. We didn't eat but it smelled like garlic and tables had small plates of food. Will definitely be going back.
Food over rating the pizza is a crappy pizza and they came back to force you to tip them what they want. Never coming back
No comment

I will return for the French martini and duck confit appetizer.  Watermelon mojto (non-alcoholic) looked good.  Pleasant outdoor seating on the street -- high walls kept wind away .  Only one bathroom. Service is on the slow side so don't be in a rush.
Adorable spot with coffee up to 4pm and then drinks in the evening. Extremely charming and so sweet when we got stuck in the rain and needed a place to wait.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here on Tuesday night for my anniversary. It was quiet outdoor dining but we liked it（wished they would have put up some outdoor lights) . We went for the trendy drink Eldridge cocktail. It was refreshing and orangey (perfect way to start your evening). For appetizers, we got the duck confit and escargot. Duck was precisely smoked with a touched of honey and crispy bread. The snail was kind of ordinary(I would go for another app). For entree, we ordered the boeuf  bourguinon and roasted octopus. Beef was tender and marinated with red wine sauce along with light veggies. Corn octopus was light and chewy. Loved the combination with corn and olive oil. To finish up, we got creme brûlée to end our wonderful evening. Overall, the waiter was super nice and chill. We will definitely come back again.
No comment
No comment

Came here to kill time around 3pm on a Saturday for another spot in the area and honestly I feel like I was better off just waiting in my car. It was not busy at all, just one other small group and yet the waiter was really slow. It took a good 10 minutes for him to finally take our orders for drinks and then another 10 minutes for us to get the drinks (which were pretty pricey). I wouldn't come back, there's really nothing special about this place.

my fault for getting pizza at a french spot but damn that was terrible. we got 2 pizzas both were cold and looked like lunchables. Looked like store bought crackers with pesto and cold cheese on top. drinks were good other people's orders looked good but damn that pizza was the worst i've had in the city. i asked to get it reheated but nothing can save this sorry ass "pizza"
We enjoyed a lot our time here. The food was delicious and the service was INCREDIBLE.
Abraham was amazing!!! Such a good time hanging with him, he made great cocktails! Super friendly, we didn't try the food because we had already eaten but we head great reviews from other people!

Ordered delivery and this is the eggs Benedict that I got. Surprisingly, it tasted good but was very disappointed that they couldn't take more care with the delivery. Was also disappointed that there was no Canadian bacon or anything; just eggs, hollandaise and the English muffin. While it didn't specify that Canadian bacon came with it on the menu, the description was very vague. Would give this another try if I was going there in person.
No comment

I'm so glad I found this somewhat "lowkey" brunch spot. The food was great and the serve was great as well. I got the scallops, Alla carbonara pasta, Savoyard pizza, and escargot. I recommend the scallops, pasta, and pizza (rich creamy yogurt flavor. Definitely on the stronger side) but I highly recommend it!
No comment
No comment

I came here with my family for a mother's dinner. We made reservations The food was definitely worth waiting for really loved the beet salad and the pizzas they had. The waiters were very sweet. My experience overall went pretty well it's a little wait for food but it was understandable. Really like the decoration inside.
LOVE LENA! best drinks, great environment, friendly staff, and the customers are just the best people.
No comment
It was our first time back in NYC since Covid and we couldn't have picked a better spot. Hard to judge which was the best part because the staff, food and drinks were amazing. Great job Lena.
I really loved the food I had at LENA. Service was great and the Cajun pasta was fantastic. I also had the créeme brûlée, which was great. The meal was a little on the pricey side, but it's worth it.
Fun place! We only had drinks (which were proper!) Great vibe and food looked amazing. Will definitely come back!
No comment
No comment

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: Far exceeded all expectations! Delicious cocktails, and the service was incredible! Sam took great care of us, and we would absolutely come back again. If I could give this place a 10 I would!
No comment

The food was amazing! The Brie with rosemary and honey, the cauliflower cacio e Pepe, the octopus, the creme brûlée was incredible and the service superb. We also had a lovely bottle of petit Chablis which was perfect with our dinner!

When I made the reservation at LĒNA, I almost canceled it because I found out that I was living 45 minutes from the restaurant. It was a great pleasures to find this hidden wonder! I was impressed by the service and the meal we  were served. My brothers and me had a great time catching up. "If you never tried some French food, you will be delighted to be at this place."

Came here for an early Valentine's Day dinner. We had to sit inside because outdoor seating is only for more than 2 people. Was excited to try this place out based on reviews. Unfortunately it was rly cold inside the restaurant that I just wanted to finish my food and leave. Service is amazing though. I ordered the beef dish and I rly enjoyed it. My husband ordered the pesto flatbread but he said it was just ok. I would have to say drinks are overpriced and I would expect them to be amazing but my French Bellini tasted very artificial.
Cute French wine bar with wide ranging food menu.  Great vibe.  Nice outdoor seating.  Super food, drink and service.  Very low hipster quotient for LES.

The outdoor dining igloos are a nice touch, well lit and heated. The cocktails were nice and strong and the service was good. I enjoyed the dishes but they didn't seem entirely French, more a little like French fusion.

First time in NYC and accidentally found this place, best experience me and my wife had in New York period!!!! Pierre (owner) give us best experience!!!and food on whole another level too!!! Thanks Pierre we will b back soon Yan and Alina

Truly a top quality bar and restaurant. Came here after after going to the sip and paint place next door. Not sure if the gentleman with the dreadlocks was the owner, but he deserves a lot of credit. He showed me and my family members an amazing time on our cousins birthday. Drinks and food were top notch. We took the business card to make sure we make our way back from jersey and even as far as Connecticut! 12 out of 10. Keep doing great guys!
No comment
No comment

Stumbled upon Lena while out for a post-birthday dinner stroll in search of a relaxed romantic scene for a glass of wine and dessert. Lena could just as easily be nestled amidst similar cobblestoned Parisian streets and you'd be hard pressed to tell the difference. The inviting staff (Sebastian) treated us as if famille- the scene developed into the care free and easy summer evenings of our youth, watching the staff (and a few patrons) take turns playing catch with a Yankees apparel adorned boy, just barely 5 years old, while his mother sipped wine and enjoyed the evening. Glasses of 2015 Bordeaux came and went, as did the warm glazed rosemary roasted Brie and a light-as-air creme brûlée. The stressed days of COVID, vaccines, and travel restrictions seemed like years behind us as we traveled, if only for a couple hours, to another time and place altogether.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Beautiful wine bar with nice drinks! The staff were very considerate and genuinely nice, and the drinks were both refreshing and well-made, without being too sweet. Love it!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This is my new spot! The food is so amazing! Service so amazing. Abraham out does himself. I have a preference issue with creamy textures and he literally went through all of my choices with me based of cream level and then catered the one o chose to my preference. He also remembered us the next time we came back. The experience is so appreciated esp during corona times! Will be back ASAP.

I love this place! I only came for drinks, so I can't speak to the food menu, but the decor is incredible and they my favorite margarita (order their spicy margarita!) in all of NYC. If you're meeting a small group of friends for drinks, this is the spot!
No comment

Good place for a catch up with friends. I probably wouldn't  pick it to go on a date as it gets busy and loud but as a restaurant it's actually quite nice. I went there for dinner on a Friday night with a friend. We had some red wine, cheese, pizzetta and a chocolate lava cake. The food was very tasty. Service was attentive and friendly. I will most likely return.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Escargot was excellent margaritas were strong and flavorful, nut and olive dish was a surprising snack. Best part was the art by the restroom. Would eat here again.
No comment

A surprise find. Loved having wine here, it was like drinking at a friend's place (minus the couch, plus more than a few tables). Warm service. Stop by if you're in the neighborhood, or need a spot to take a date.

A welcoming, friendly, beautiful, romantic French wine bar!  The food is incredible - boeuf bourguignon!! The cheese selection! And they will guide you toward your perfect wine! Whether you want to sit at the bar and have interesting conversations with your fellow patrons while enjoying a small snack, or meet 8 of your best friends for dinner and drinks, or have a romantic meal à deux, Lena is the place! Every time I walk in there, I can't help but smile!! And, I'm always reluctant to leave! My fave place in NYC!
No comment

This is an excellent, cozy wine bar. I came with a group of 8 on Friday night. We made a reservation which I would recommend. We did a few bottles of wines and lots and lots of small plates. The food was amazing. And our server was great about making recommendations. The prices were also great. For being such a large group and ordering as much as we did, the bill was totally reasonable. I highly recommend for your next date night or wine night with friends.
No comment

Everything here is so so good. You have to get the  Duck Crostini!! They also have such great service here. Came here for brunch but ordered off their regular menu. Must visit! Outdoor dining is very cute as well. The staff here go above and beyond!

Loved this place! Came here with a friend before a concert and, embarrassingly, we pretty much tried everything on the menu. The meatballs and beef bourguignon were terrific. The bone marrow in particular was mmwhah chef's kiss! My friend didn't love the octopus but that was the only sour note. We got there pretty early in the evening and before it got busy we had pretty much every waiter in the place checking on us, which was more humorous than anything else. Overall great food, nice atmosphere and good service.

We were celebrating my birthday and Pierre was an amazing host, him and the staff were so patient while we waited for our party but still checked in and gave us ample time to review the menu. The wine selection is great and food options were amazing. We went with the chicken, beef bourguignon, octopus and a variety of appetizers including the potatoes au gratin. All the food was tasty, fresh and delivered hot! Pierre also have us a wonderful birthday celebration with a lava cake and Prosecco! What a great end to a wonderful evening. Highly recommend going here, you will not be disappointed!
Great place. Service is amazing and so is the food. Nice ambiance. Definitely going to be going again!

I've never had a full meal here, but the cocktails are excellent and the employees are very friendly and kind. They have great coffee, and their outdoor dining situation is comfortable, well-spaced, and protected from the rain.
Really lovely experience here! Food was wonderful, the service so accommodating and friendly and fun atmosphere. My fave was the burrata and the bourguignon was delicious! Lovely place to dine.
Very nice atmosphere. Good for a romantic date or an intimate group gathering. Had the Bourdeaux and enjoyed it. Pierre and staff were very welcoming and friendly.
No comment

The food was terrible. Literally terrible. Everything we order was bland and poorly done. The escargot was horrible and didn't even have snails in all the shells. We had to ask for bread for our charcuterie and duck rillette tasted like garbage. We will not be coming back. Ever.

column3: Town of Brookhaven, Long Island, NY
column6: We hold an speed dating event here. Very romantic space, great wine, food, music and service. Very great experience!!! I will recommend you to come for date. Romantic as Paris!

I have meant to write this review since October but time has gotten away from me. I had my 40th birthday lunch here and it was really such a great experience. From the planning to the execution, I could not have been happier. The food is delish (people keep talking about the Cauliflower gratin) and the service was perfect. It is a very cute and rustic vibe with beautiful artwork all around you. Whether you are planning a party or just having a meal, I highly recommend. Thank you for making my birthday so memorable :)

We went for a late dinner on a Wednesday night. Great food and service. We tried La Bourguignonne Tarte Flambé , Escargot and Scallops, also had some burrata salad. Everything was beautifully presented and delicious. Finished our meal off with some Creme Brûlée and Sauterne Dessert wine. We will definitely be recommending this place to everyone.

Cozy place, romantic atmosphere, friendly service. I've only been twice, but I already love it. The wine has been good both times, as was the food. The first time my boyfriend and I got a "choose four" charcuterie board- we chose brie, a sheep's milk cheese, chorizo and duck. The board was also served with nuts, honey and fruit. The second time we did grilled brie (I think) which came served over toasted bread. So good and I highly recommend it!
No comment

I really hate to write a review on the service because I understand that restaurants sometimes just have a bad night, but the service was really horrible. There seemed to only be two people working the whole restaurant doubling as host and waiters, and it just was too much. I had a reservation and they almost didn't seat us, saying they were full, but they finally gave us a table. We then put in an appetizer and drinks, which was fine. When we ordered our main courses, we sat waiting for almost 2 hours. We tried to flag down a waiter to ask to check on our food, but it took them far too long to check on us. When they did, they told us they forgot to put our food in. They gave us one free round of drinks, but I really think we should've gotten a discount or anything because we were there for so long and hungry. They also had bread baskets but didn't bring it to us until they brought our food. The food was really good though, but just make sure they have more than two people working the restaurant.

The hostess is beyond rude... will not be returning to this place and I wouldn't recommend going here unless you enjoy being in the presence of an absolutely crazy person and verbally assaulted in the bathroom.

Such an amazing find.  Great wine, delicious food and great service.  We had the rosemary Brie to start and were delighted.  Followed by escargot- fabulous, pizza la brittroise - enchanting; and lava cake that made us want  more.  Parfait!

I found this restaurant through yelp for a Thursday girls night and it's so cute. I love the decor and ambience. They did have a small selection for HH which I didn't mind and lasted til 7. Ordered a flat bread and a meat & cheese plate which was all very good. Because of the HH we ended up ordering the bottle which was reasonably cost. We had a creme brulee on the house but still ordered the chocolate cake. Loved the waitress there she was absolutely amazing. I would def go back, check it out !!!

Came here for Sunday Brunch and it was great! Loved the vibes/decor. The food was good as well! Highly recommend getting a couple items and sharing it as a group. Prices are great as well. It wasn't too expensive and the portions were good. If in the area, will come back for dinner and drinks!

AMAZING. Cute wine bar that is perfect for girls night or date night. I went for a bachelorette party dinner and the staff was amazing. Everyone is super helpful and can help with any wine questions. They will also let you try any wine you want before actually committing to it. I would definitely come back!
No comment

Don't do delivery here guys. I ordered the croque monseir Lena and an ice coffee via seamless but instead received a baguette with procuitto and pickles on it and that's it. Was looking forward to trying this place. Such a let down. Luckily got fully refunded from seamless.
This is such a cute little date spot. I found this little gem randomly.  We had some desserts and wine. Server was really attentive and sweet!

Excellent wine selection, excellent service and great cozy date night spot. As a big fam of a variety of wine and cheese, I must say that Lèna really understands the combination of the two. Highly recommend! Will be back.

My mom and I went to LĒNA for an early dinner and drinks before seeing a play. Everything was wonderful from the service to the wine and cocktails, and delicious food. We had the organic cauliflower, La bitteroise French pizza, and beef bourguignon. For drinks we had the whisky sour, bourbon old fashioned, fleur de Lys, Chateau August Bordeaux wine, and ended with coffee and creme brûlée . For me the highlights were the cauliflower, which came with fresh fresh baguette, and the whisky sour. Everything was on point. A small gem with excellent service. Would definitely return!

Cozy and laid back with friendly and attentive service. Only tried the burrata, but it was pretty good - the other menu items sounded interesting so I would definitely want to try more food next time. Good drink selection.
Great drinks and nice atmosphere, tasty food. Due to the tiny portions we left the restaurant, however, hungrier and $55 per person lighter than we entered it.
No comment
No comment

Just opened a week ago. Really nice space, friendly owner, great coffee. I had an almond milk flat white and loved it. Didn't get a chance to try the pastries but they looked good. Also, keep an eye out for when they start serving beer and wine!
No comment
No comment

The food was excellent here and the vibe was great.  I found the place via Yelp search and didn't have high expectations at first when the place was empty to start.  But quickly the room filled up and the food arrived.  The service is extremely slow but perhaps they're just not trying to rush you out which is nice.  I'd like go back -
No comment

I like that it's quiet and not many people were there. You don't have to shout at each other over all the noise. The drinks were good and the food was decent. Service was good, but there is always room for improvement. Definitely a good place to relax and hang out with friends. Overall a good experience.

Best service I've ever experienced.  I've been here two times with my boyfriend and we will be coming many more times.  The food here is amazing, I've never had better duck in my life.  Every time we've went a man by the name of Abraham has always been so welcoming and treated us so kindly.  I definitely recommend this place if you're looking for a higher-end meal for any occasion, or just to enjoy the city with a good meal.  20/10. -Jess

One word to describe this place - AMAZING! Lovely ambiance that is low key with tasty French pizzas! The creme brûlée is creamy and leaves you to always want the next bite. Waiters are super attentive and kind. I definitely recommend the cheese and charcuterie platters. They're huge tasty portions. Dessert was a complete pleasure. The chocolate dessert was decadent with each bite with creme brûlée getting creamier each time. Totally recommend this place any day of the week!

Stumbled across this lovely place with a great vibe, classy, relaxed & romantic. The perfect ambiance for any occasion. The cocktails, wine list and food menu were fantastic. Delicious. A definite return spot.

Nice spot to take a break in the heart of Lower East side. We stopped by before an event nearby and it was perfect. Beautiful Sancerre and by husband enjoyed the Bordeaux. If I ever see a croque monsiuer on a menu that's what I order and it did not disappoint. Not too heavy, nice portion. Also enjoyed one of their flatbreads which had nice bacon on top. Friendly staff, nice decor. Definitely recommend!

One of the best French wine bars in LES. We ordered two bottles of red, the Bordeaux Merlot 2016 and the Cotes du Rhone. We paired these with the meat and cheese plate. Definitely include the smoked duck breast and the comte extra aged on your plate. You can tell that the establishment understands their ingredients and how well it compliments with the wines.

column3: Princeton Junction, West Windsor Township, NJ
column6: We stopped in for a quick glass of wine and were immediately greeted by the nicest and welcoming people. The vino was on point! We had to leave quickly as we had a reservation down the street. However we will definitely be back! :)

I found LENA while searching for an intimate venue to host a wedding shower. I dined at LENA a couple of times before my event. Every time was lovely, the food and wine selection is top notch, the environment is elegant industrial chic, the servers are pleasant. My event went perfectly, we had the whole space to ourselves, the bride to be was so thrilled! Everyone loved everything from the food, drinks and fun servers and gallery of art. I highly recommend LENA for a date, evening with friends or to host your next private affair. We had less than 25, they can go up to 40.

Came here on a Friday night since I heard there was some quaint live music going on from the Opus app! The wine is fairly priced, they have a menu of small bites and charcuterie, the environment there is really cozy like you're just chilling and chatting with friends rather than being in a stuffy formal sit down place. That night they had a great guitarist and violinist that came to perform that really fit the vibe of Lena, completely loved it!
Was there yesterday for Valentine's Day, place was nice foods was delicious and service was awesome! Will definitely go back. Highly recommend.

This place blew us away! My brother and I stumbled upon Lena Wine Bar and had the most fabulous time!! The ambiance was relaxed and inviting, with classic soul music playing and comfy couches to enjoy our wine and cheese, which was all excellent.  The owner Pierre was friendly and made us feel right at home. Our waitress was sooo sweet and knowledgeable about the menu and wine list, and she suggested great pairings that we talked about for days!  I will definitely return the next time I'm in the city!

Very cool spot with interesting by the glass wines and food to snack on while you drink said wines. The Tartes Flambees are like loaded flatbreads and were super filling. Service was really friendly. The sort of place you'd come with a small group of girlfriends you haven't seen in awhile. Would definitely come back for drinks!

UPDATE: the owner Pierre G will message you about your honest post and sound unpleasant. I never spoke with anyone about my disappointment in the soup, ate what I could, and paid for it. The owner claims he had explained to me "yesterday" (not the day I visited) what the soup was like even though I never met anyone other than my waitress. This just shows there are many who do not Iike the soup as he constantly seems to be dealing with it.
wonderful and very cozy place. delicious menu. very attentive staff, and a very skillful bar attender! def on my fave list now!

We went to grab a drink at the bar across the street and had an hour wait. We wanted to find a quick place for a drink and some snacks and stumbled into this place. I wish I lived in NYC or I would keep coming back. The flat bread was amazing, the wine was great and cheap for NYC standards, and the cheese selection was excellent. Not only was the food great but we spent some time talking to Pierre who is the owner and he is an awesome guy and very passionate with what he is doing with his restaurant.

Just want to say that this place BLEW us away. My boyfriend surprised me with an engagement party at this cute wine bar, they let us rent out the whole space on a Saturday for three hours through the app Peerspace. Could not have asked for better service. They let him come down a week before and try out the food and drinks before booking, during the party they were constantly checking in and making our guests feel right at home. The appetizers served were amazing! Overall 10/10 experience. Thank you so much LENA!
No comment

Had a really great time ! Delicious french wines ! Feels like France all over again. The owner Pierre was super friendly & helped me to pick my wine and food! You need to try the Brie tartine  & the french Pizza...ABSOLUTELY delicious. Looking forward to come back with friends.
Amzing wine perfect environment for a great night out . Very friendly and knowledgeable staff. Strongly recommend for a great night out.

Came in for some wine and a cheese/meat plate. Lighting at least during the day is a little odd, the restaurant was very dark so much so that at first we thought it was closed. Wine is fairly priced but I felt that our meat/cheese plate was a little "light" for the price. Also it came on parchment paper on a wood board, which was kind of weird.... do they not wash their wood boards? Service was a little slow but polite. Decor is kind of tacky... but also cozy I would bring a friend here but not a date. I don't think if I was in the area I would come back. Has a lot of potential though.
No comment

Food was fine but not worth the price. The owner was extremely rude, confronting me and my friends about how he thought we hadn't ordered enough to merit being in his restaurant (we were 9 people and had ordered 7 dishes and 4 drinks all together). Lost my business.
Great spot for a coffee, wine, or beer to relax in or get some work done. Chill ambience, friendly servers, and good music.
New coffee shop in the area! I love the atmosphere and decor here! Coffee is great. Try the white truffle egg toast!
No comment
No comment
Good place with great service, coffee is really good. The sandwiches look amazing. I like the barista speaks French and they play Metallica!
No comment

AmaIng! Great wine selection and great food. Romantic and cozy atmosphere with excellent service. Delicious house-made desserts. Amazing assortment of French wines. Very welcoming in a good location not too far from the subway. A nice selection of French music, and an overall awesome experience with a group or for a date.
Another great dining experience at Lena last night. Always hit's the spot. Be sure to have the tarte flambee!
LOVE LENA! Our gorge little nextdoor wine bar. Beautiful range of wines and delish food. Highly recommended local

Couldn't be more happy to find a place like this in the lower Eastside, just few stops away from where I live. What a surprise! I came here with my friends & we enjoyed all dishes. Meat & Cheese, Flat Bread & Bourguignon were totally awesome. Pierre the owner is super friendly & knowledgeable about the wines. I'll come back for sure with a date.
No comment

LÉNA is absolutely amazing! The atmosphere, the food and the service is perfection thanks to Pierre the owner. I tasted the authentic flat bread, and the Boeuf Bourguignon, followed by the chocolate cake. I will definitely come back. The wine is fantastic & of course only French. Will be back with my friends.

Pierre the owner is very welcoming. His staff is really kind and attentive. Best place to hang out and enjoy a beautiful cheese plate together with some wine from their perfect selection. Definitely recommend.

A beautiful space with great atmosphere and great food and  selection of French fine wines.The Croque Madame is perfection and the French tartes are so delicious.  Great little spot for a date or group dinner. Will go back.
Pierre is a great guy with delicious food and the art exhibition adds to a beautiful atmosphere
No comment
The food remind me my own town in france. The Boeuf Bourguignon is incredible. Pierre was very welcoming. I will go back !
No comment
No comment
Beautifully designed space to grab a drink and food, get some reading in or hang out.
No comment
Really nice atmosphere and not too crowded on a Friday night! Great, friendly service and good food and drinks. Definitely take a seat on the couch in the corner for an even cozier time.

This is a hidden gem in the LES! Super intimate vibe with fantastic service. We got the 4 item cheese/charcuterie board,( with French Brie, truffle tremor, Serrano ham and chorizo), the Savoyard flambée, escargot appetizer, and chocolate cake for dessert. The board was a huge portion size, with generous amount of meats and cheese. The Brie paired with the honey was a match made in heaven! The Savoyard flambée was also delicious. The cheese melted in your mouth but the flat bread maintained its crispy crunch. The escargot came out piping hot and delicious. Surprisingly, it had a more parsley/lemony taste that was amazingly fresh and savory. Lastly, the chocolate cake was rich and decadent (but not too sweet) and was the perfect end to our meal. Also did I mention the happy hour?? From 4-7pm they offer $8 Malbecs. Overall amazing vibe,  food and drinks and service!! So glad to have stumbled on this place.

We popped in for a nice glass of wine after a round of dumplings next door and were so pleasantly surprised by the impeccable service and friendly staff, specifically from Alex. Alex is from the same part of California as us, and he went above and beyond to make our experience welcoming and warm. Not only was the pasta absolutely delish, Alex gave us thoughtful recommendations for other restaurants that he thought we may like and sincerely invited us back. We felt so welcomed by him, and the delicious food and Malbec. Thanks to Alex and all Lena staff!

First of all, my husband, friend and I walked out at the end of our meal marveling at how welcoming and friendly everyone was. The waiter chased after us to say goodbye and thank you, and that was after the owner, bartender and other waiter said goodbye as we were leaving. I'll be back for that kind of warmth alone. The food was quite good. I had the meatballs with a side of Brussels sprouts, my friend had the duck confit, my husband had the pork, and all of it was tasty. My husband also ordered escargot as an appetizer and had trouble getting one of the snails out of the shell - so they brought him another whole round on top of what he ate. That was really above and beyond. The wine and cocktail menu is very decent and they even had something non-alcoholic for me and didn't make me feel like a jerk for not drinking. The place was lively and charming, but not obnoxiously loud. We're definitely coming back with more friends.

Had dinner here this evening at the bar with a friend. The French wine was phenomenal, and the food was excellent. But the best part was the people there, the owner is so sweet and we started a conversation with lovely French people and had a fantastic time! Highly recommend.

Turku was a great server..she is super sweet.  Place is cozy n friendly.  Walked in to just have a drink but ended up eating everything...the food was super delicious.  Ordered almost everything.  Definitely going back again!
No comment

I found this little cozy place on yelp and decided to take my date here. Beautiful place. The Boeuf Bourguignon and the onion soup was delicious as were the cocktails!  Magnificent service, very friendly. Would also recommend this place for dessert such as the creme brulee which is house made absolutely outstanding! Definitely a place I will come back too again.
Great place to have a date or a friend to catch up.  Very small.  Rsvp is highly recommended.
Great French wine selection, Cody atmosphere and owner Pierre was a pleasure to talk with. Place just opened and we will be back.
They're young but they're delicious! Amazing wine and food menu. Must try if you're downtown...if you're not downtown then get there!

I had a date and wanted to take her some place special. We had not been here before but had heard good thing. We were not disappointed, two of us had the Beef Bourgogne was excellent and I had the Escargot. Probably the best Escargot I've ever had. The owner/chef Pierre, stopped by our table which was a nice touch. This is an outstanding location with an excellent staff, a decent menu range, and a superbly skilled kitchen staff. I will always bring special guests here as a first choice. Will definitely will be returning!

Wow!! What an amazing experience. Best date night place in the LES hands down. Run don't walk this place is going to be tough to get into soon (open 3 months). The menu is simple french and everything is delicious (charcuterie is great, homemade pâté). The wine list is direct with everything i tried being excellent (ask for recommendations from the knowledgeable staff, you can taste before you commit). Many are by the glass. French classics on the stereo at a volume you can easily talk to (a rarity in the lower east side). Impeccable & friendly service, especially welcome in the middle of a snowstorm. The owner Pierre is a pleasure to chat with & clearly loves his craft. worth every penny and by standards here a deal. the quality is outstanding. Thanks for turning a very cold day into an amazing & memorable night!

This one of the best wine bars in the city! Went for a late night dinner and was very happy with the service and food. We ordered a couple of glasses of the muscadet which was heavenly. It paired really well the Savoyard tarte flambée. The service was very attentive and the ambience and decors made it seem like I was back in France!
Great atmosphere, good tasting wines and superb customer service.  The ambience is great for either friends getting together or for date night!!!
Very comfortable wine bar in the lower east side. The food is tasty, the the wine is great, the help is warm and friendly. A positive vibe.

If is a wonderful cafe!  You wouldn't think to find such gem . When you first walk in you are welcome by a lovely hostess and makes sure from the very beginning that you will have a great experience. I met friends there because it was close se to the gallery we were going to. We liked their wine selection and the food was very good . I do think that they need to work on their escargot,it needs the shell and more butter. We met the owner and he was so great he explained all about the basque region. Overall it was a wonderful place to drink and eat with friends.
My friends and I were visiting the Tenement Museum and came in and sat at the bar. We were treated like family and well looked after. The wine and food was amazing. Great experience.

We had dinner on Friday night before going out to an event. They have a great selection of wine. The food was very good, and the staff was pleasant and efficient, which we appreciated as we were pressed for time. I would definitely recommend this restaurant and we plan on going back very soon.
This place made my entire trip! It was so much fun getting a little taste of Paris and speaking with the amazing chef. Highly recommend. Great cheese and wine selection and warm, cute atmosphere.

horrible service. had to wait to order, slow service, and again took a long time to receive and process the bill. other tables around us were having issues with service as well, so it wasn't just that we were picky!
No comment
No comment
No comment

I haven't been here since pre Covid. So happy they're still around, a staple for this neighborhood. What I love about them is their consistency and service. Definitely try them out for food or lunch. It's kind giving Latin diner vibes, but unique as the food is actually good as are the drinks.
No comment
No comment

I have been here a few times but I have not been here in a while , I was excited to go back because I remember they had great food and drinks. They have a great atmosphere and fun music. The service was so bad I can't even believe how bad it was.... We got there and it took a very long time to even have someone ask if we wanted drinks but finally we placed a drink order and said we just needed a few more minutes to decide on the food ... we got the drinks after a very long wait and no one came back to take an order.... An hour after catching up with my friends and finishing our drinks we realized we had been there an hour and still no one took our order ( no it was not very busy )  finally we asked someone to send out waiter over and he took the order and we ordered another round of drinks .... Again a very long wait until we had to get up and ask someone if we could get our drinks ..... one of the items ordered were peanut butter and jelly waffles that was supongo have banana cream on it ... when we asked someone the waiter came back and we told him this is missing the banana cream and a few min later they brought extra peanut butter and jelly and just put it on the table and walked away, I am so disappointed because I recommended this place and it definitely did not live up to my expectations... I can't say the service was ever superb but it was never this bad I have to be honest I don't think I will be going back again any time soon
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Very Solid Cuban. Great quality pork in the Cuban sandwiches & all around. Amazing that they are open so late but be ready for a bit of a wait. The desserts looked very good too but i was way too full.
Delightful 24/7 cuban/LATAM bar and diner. Pretty solid food for not too much and open whenever you need it.
No comment

I stumbled upon this place looking for late night eats!! And let me tell you, I was so glad I did! I had to bring my friends JUST so they could experience the oxtail empanada! Everyone was very pleased with their meals and cocktails! This will be our new weekend hangout!!
No comment

Food was ok but expensive for the portions. Had half a Cuban sandwich for $14. Such a small sandwich and really just a slice of ham, mustard, pickles and some pork. Not worth it in my opinion. The other dish was some tortilla and cheese and that was about $15. Totally overpriced.
No comment
No comment

Such a cute and welcoming place! It's extremely busy, which can only mean one thing! People love it! I happen to be in the area and walked in, so glad I did! The food was delicious! Drinks were on point, and lots of yummy options. I removed a star due to the service, waiters take a bit to come around. But overall I really enjoyed this place and if I'm ever in the area I will for definitely return.
No comment
No comment

When you need filling food st 3am, this is a great option, open 24 hours.  Staff is friendly and the food is good. My wife and I shared a Cuban sandwich, which was very flavorful. The bread was a little too hard, but since our visit was at an ODD hour, I'll take what's available. The ambience is up lifting. The mojito was good but the caipirinha was average.
The oxtail empanadas are the best! I love it. It's my favorite! I always recommend them to friends!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Why didn't someone tell me they had a 24hr food spot that is sooo good! Delicious food here at Coppelia especially if you hungry at 3 am. They have Latin style / American menu and literally everything is good!

Ordered take out from this place. The food was delicious, certainly more fatty than expected. The flavors in the dishes I got were more on the sweet side, assuming it was the peppers. I like the food that I ordered, if i was in the mood for a more sweet, less savory dish, I'd know exactly where to go. Everything was made well and presented well. No complaints here!

I went late night, the waiter was accommodating and consistently checked on us. The decor was all right wasn't something that I spent much time focusing on but I really enjoyed the Latin feel to it. The FOOD WAS GREAT AND FULLING. Definitely enjoyed and would give it a 8/10!

A 24 hour place to get nachos! We ordered the beef short rib nachos, which came adorned with nacho cheese sauce, guacamole, refried black beans, sour cream, and salsa. The tortilla chips tasted like they were made in house and had a perfect amount of salt to them. They were also a bit thicker than the average grocery store tortilla chip, which I appreciated! Our server also had a very upbeat attitude and was clearly excited to share his passion for the food and culture with his customers.
No comment

It is one of my favorite Latin food restaurants, the customer service is excellent but I think the bathroom should be remodeled, it looks old, it is rusty and with the marks it has it should be painted, it is the only bathroom in the restaurant so I recommend maintenance, otherwise there is nothing bad to say.
No comment
Excellent service, great and authentic food that is served 24 hours a day. I have returned multiple times and have not been disappointed!
No comment

Lovely Cuban sandwich and drinks. Media noche is another fave. The octopus and chorizo sandwich is one of the most unique I've ever had. The yuca fries + mojo are a perfect combo. I can't believe this place is 24/7

Been here many times over the years. It's a decent spot for late night pan-latin fare, but, echoing a lot of the recent reviews -- the way they treat guests has gotten out of hand. I was waiting on my friend to use the restroom after we'd paid our check, and the bouncer (yeah, they have a bouncer at night) told me I had to wait outside. When I told him I was just waiting for my friend, he said "who's your friend?". Not sure what name he was expecting, not sure why it matters. Why are they acting like it's a nightclub?
No comment
This is my and my friend's go to place. Convenient location, phenomenal Cuban food, ambiance gives a cozy feel. Typically packed so keep that in mind. Fun bartenders, nice staff.

Speedy service and great food! Kinda a diner vibe. The empanada was my favorite item from there! The plantain complimented the meat flavor so well and the toppings were so good as well. The pulpo sandwich was pretty good and would be better with some hot sauce. The burger was also pretty good but my favorite was definitely the empanada. Really friendly service as well!
No comment

As someone from South Florida going to Cuban restaurant in NYC seemed wrong.  But Coppelia delivers in atmosphere and in the food. It has a festive  feel and the servers were chill.  Food is a very good value for the price.
Food was absolutely amazing! I had Pernil and spicy kale which was oh so yummy! I would definitely recommend and go back to try other items on their menu.

Did not know what to expect, and so glad I came.  My youngest has learned about it and recommended it.  Well, the service, variety of food and ambience was great.  For being in Manhattan, it also was very reasonable with prices and portions.  I would recommend it for casual fun and great service!
No comment

Our go to Cuban/Latin restaurant when visiting family in the city. Place is always busy but tables turn over pretty fast. But I'm here to tell you about the short rib and mofongo dish they have. To tell you it's the best thing I have ever eaten would be an understatement. As a proud Boricua this dish makes me happy. The perfect, rich short rib coupled with their tasty mofongo is a marriage made in food heaven. This was a special that is now permanently on the menu. My sister in law had the Lomo Saltado and it also sent my eyes rolling into the back of my fat head. The service is excellent and prices are very reasonable for a place in the Village/Chelsea. I'll be back over and over again. You should pay this place a visit!!!

Absolutely Not! The "Bouncers"'at the front door told us "no one fucking told you to come here" when we questions a group being seated before us, after we waited 25+'mins! They were extremely rude, and when we asked for a manager, we were told "don't worry about talking to anyone"'! My wife asked to use the bathroom while waiting and the bouncer tried to use intimidation tactics as if we were going to back off from seeking leadership help! I'm glad we walked away and saved our money! And I will never attempt this establishment again!
No comment

Oxtail empanada was so amazing from the sweetness of the plantain dough to the heartiness of braised oxtail.(A little more oxtail would have been in my favor considering the sweetness of plantain) Definitely wish there was a "s" behind the word empanada ! Now the Lomo saltado was was a fatty fat dream. Fatty short ribs dropping all of it's natural flavor in the pan and getting toss around in a pan with the soy sauce, ginger, fries, red onion, etc. was a perfect choice of cooking style!!
Great atmosphere food and drinks :) our server was very fun and friendly. It's on the pricier side but worth it. would definitely go again!
No comment

This place is my mother fucken SPOT. I probs go here like once a week; the waiters call me and my friends the tequila girls. The food is bomb - I luv the flautas, nachos, chicken noodle soup, Cesar salad, Mac n chicharrón. The bar tender Humberto is super hot. Literally the best place to go at any hour.

3 of us went at 1pm on a Wednesday and the place was jumping with maybe the "lunch" crowd? It took awhile before one of the two waiters attended to us but the wait was well worth it. First note: being in NYC the parking or driving is not recommended, being short staffed was not an issue as we had a lot of catching up with friends. Ropa Vieja was my favorite (see menu pic) but sadly it did not come with fried banana and had to be ordered separately. All our dishes were excellent and with leftovers, another meal was forthcoming. Definitely will go back and bring friends. You will not be disappointed.
The food was delicious, the service excellent, everything was sanitary. We're definitely coming back!
No comment
No comment

So good! We got into the city late after a delayed flight and needed somewhere to eat late. We wanted to eat at a restaurant and luckily found Coppelia! The food and vibe are so great! Everyone who works there was super nice too.

This spot is pretty cool my friend was telling me about it for a while and I finally gave it a try. I had the hash de costillla and it was delicious !!! Definitely worth trying . Also good vibes and good decor !! Pull up if you wana have a great time !

My friends and I dined here the other night, we were seated in back by the kitchen. It was going well, we received our food and it was pretty good. However wait staff was rushing by and food was spilled on me. It was a thick white garlic sauce. It spilled on my dry clean only sweater and my coat. The waiter who spilled it helped clean my coat and was very apologetic. When we told our waiter what happened he was not very eager to make anything right. He spoke to his manager and the best they could do was free dessert. The man who spilled the food offered to pay for my dry cleaning but I am disappointed in how the restaurant management chose to handle this situation or rather lack there of. I understand that mistakes happen but the customer service my friends and I were shown here was terrible. I will never return.

Came here after a night out just cause it was open 24/7 and was pleasantly surprised! They have an extensive menu full of items you definitely want to eat while drunk lol. I had the mac and chicharron which was good (cannot comment on much else bc I wolfed it down and was not sober) and satisfied my cravings. The staff was also very accommodating for our large group. I'd come back here again if I was in the area!
New Yorks hottest club is Coppelia our shining beacon of 24hour hope  short rib nachos or die
Waitress was super attentive and quick! Food was great, there was a green sauce that added a nice touch to my dish. Went to this place with my friends and they also enjoyed the service here as well
Best veggie burger in the city hands down. Great atmosphere and energy, great food, great service. My favorite place to take anyone who visits me.
No comment
No comment

To me this is what a New York dining experience should be if you want a cafe.  Coppelia is a very inviting cafe with a Cuban twist.  I ordered the chicken and rice bowl and found the spices to mix very well.  The price was very reasonable by New York City standards.  Good food and atmosphere at a reasonable price cannot be beat.

Surprisingly good food late night. Splits tabs by cards. I'll never come here and not order the Margarita Cubana -- worth the visit for that itself. The caipirinha's were unanimous by the others in my party.
Amazing food, really good service. The corn on the cob was the best I've ever had but nothing can beat the cubano sandwich. Reasonable priced too!

Im a hungry vegetarian I find things to eat here. I strongly recommend this place and in a Friday night it's very busy. I want to give kudos step I drop my earring and one staff member found me around the corner to give me my earring. For that alone this place gets five stars.

Nice spot!! I came here at like 3am and there were a decent amount of people for sure. The food was well seasoned and was so so sooooo good. They have traditional Cuban dishes as well as new interesting stuff. The arroz con pollo my friends ordered was a tad salty and that says a lot since I love salt but the ropa vieja I got was incredible. Definitely recommend.

Get the Fish tacos and some Tres Leches cake! Those tacos appetizer were delicious. They had a smoky flavor even though they were fried (flounder) not grilled. I'm not sure how they got the smoky flavor in it but those were tasty. We got guacamole and it comes with tortilla,sweet potato and plantain chips. Guacamole could have been fresher but on a Sunday night in a 24hr restaurant I guess it was made earlier for the brunch service. I had Salmon and purple mashed potatoes as main course. The salmon is fine, I recommend getting it medium rare. The purple mashed potatoes are glutinous so I'd get a side to go with it next time. They have nice sides of yuca fries, sweet potatoes fries , maduros or rice and beans or others for $5 . Get a couple for the table with your mains .My friend got the house Burger with sweet potato fries. They'll bring a caddy of sauces out if you ask . That burger is a lot to eat and a bit messy!. So be warned - you may have to deconstruct it . But my friend finished it and liked it. For drinks we got the Margarita Cubano which is delicious with tamarind puree and tangy salt rim . Get this. My friend had the Hemingway Royal with rum Bacardi and ginger syrup and Cava. He liked it but I thought it was more a Summer drink being light and refreshing. Next round I got Atrevido which is really smoky mezcal with pineapple and strawberry puree. Be warned - it's very smoky so if that's your thing you'll like it. My friend got Guarapita with rum, passion fruit, strawberry and cucumber and this was delightful. Get one. Get Tres Leches cake for dessert in a little glass , it has a nice cinnamon flavor and cream. Ask to sit in the back in a booth if you can. They don't take reservations and it's a popular spot in Chelsea. Staff were really nice and extra good review for the bartender! Nice casual spot .
No comment

Coppelia has the feel of a diner, with plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. I tried the Lomo Saltado which was delicious - super flavorful and the meat was so tender, honestly one of the best versions I've had in the city. Service was also great, and we didn't have to wait long before getting our food.
Love this place. Great food and late night kitchen. Service is always great. Brunch is awesome as well.
Great food! Awesome service. Fun place to vibe out and enjoy great music, second time back
No comment

When we arrived around 5pm (because we had a 4-year-old with us), it was already packed.  Service is fast and courteous. Excellent dishes from all over the Hispanic universe. Authentic guacamole (unspoiled with lime juice or anything similar), great mac & cheese, and everybody enjoyed their entrees -- Cuban sandwich, chile relleno (vegetarian version), and skirt steak.  No reservations accepted, so plan accordingly.

Obviously a very popular place. Good HAPPY HOUR too. We've been here several times now. The service is excellent and friendly I think the food is good. The mixed drinks seem to be high on the favorite list here. I think the food is a bit overpriced for what it is. It's good. It would just be better for a couple bucks less. The Chili Relleno was not very good. Plus on saturday night the noise level is incredible. We were hoarse when we left from yelling to be heard.
No comment
Reliable, creative, delicious Latino diner food. Worth a visit! These are more characters for no reason.

If you want to find good food in NYC, ask the bartenders. Coppelia was recommended to us, and it did not disappoint. Great Cuban food, and even though it was shoulder to shoulder packed, the service was top notch!!!!
Was a good environment just the giro said 15-20 min wait n never slaked us we went back in 46-1 he n saw they were sitting people so the girl forgot us but overall food and drinks good

column3: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
column6: No comment
Best cubano I've ever had! The bread is super crispy. My friend ordeeed the lomo saltado and it was sooo good too. The steak was like BUTTAH! Definitely will come back!
No comment
No comment

I love this place.  FANTASTIC breakfasts.  Cheap and delicious and the coffee never stops.  Lunch and dinner are great menus too and the drinks are amazing.  I once went, before Covid, to a Cuban passover dinner.  My grandmother would have loved it.

Whenever I need a good spot to eat that's open 24 hrs 7 days a week this is my go to spot the empanadas are to die for the roast pork it amazing and the Cubans is one of my fav sandwiches to get from here the service is great also
Poor customer service. They have a favorite system, fiends of friends and no reservation system.
No comment
No comment
My go to spot for Cuban in the city. The service is impeccable and always have the nicest staff. If you need a quick place to go or have a date to plan, Coppelia is your place.

I was looking for a late night spot to grab food and I came across this gem . It's open 24 hours ! Perfect for before or after the club since most kitchens close at 10pm. The menu is filled with Cuban and other Latin style dishes . They also have a 24 hour breakfast menu . They have a little bit of everything on the menu from quesadillas to soups , sandwiches and dinner entrees and also desserts. The service is very fast as well . I ordered a beef empanada as an appetizer and it was extremely delicious. The crust was nice and crispy while the inside was warm and gooey . The ground beef was seasoned well and had a little bit of green olives. It came with a chimichurri flavored sauce . For an entree , I ordered the Lomo Saltado and omg ... the meat was so tender and juicy and the sauce was savory and rich. My only complaint was that the white rice was a little undercooked but I still couldn't stop eating it . I definitely recommend trying this place if you're looking for Latin cuisine or if you need a late night pick me up .
No comment

Coppelia is an Italian restaurant with a flare of great service and food. It reminds me of the old restaurants in Italy, the staff are very knowledgeable about the dishes and you will leave the restaurant joyfully stuffed. I'm lucky to have this establishment right in my backyard so I don't have to travel to little Italy in the Bronx or near Canal Street. Please go with your family and enjoy family style dishes

I was surprised at how delicious there food was. I ate there twice and the service was great. Everything on the menu had such reasonable prices.  As I love chicken soup, theirs was possibly the best I ever had. Very clean restaurant and cozy atmosphere. I can't wait to stop by again next time I am in the city.

Our second time to Coppelia and we loved it just as much. Great ambiance, super good food (corncob, huevos rancheros, lemon ricotta pancakes) and friendly service. I appreciated the strong drinks  and the Covid protocol was good.
No comment
Get the Lomo Saltado; you will not be disappointed. Loved that this place was open 24/7 when we were hungry after a long day of exploring New York. Friendly staff and very clean place.
My go to when it's late and diner fare won't do. Coppelia is the place fAn excellent alternative to late night diners if you like Cuban food.  A bit pricey but worth it.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Before going back home from dinner, my friend just want to stop one more place so that is why we come to Coppelia. Even it is close to closing time but they still have a lot of customers and busy. At the bar I have Gran Paloma, I like the taste of passion fruit, grapefruit and lime. I love fruity drink ;) my friend has her favorite Hendricks as usual. Service is good and bartender is very friendly. Because my friend already has lots of drinks tonight, we can't stay long so we will come back here next time.

The warm greeting from the hostess at the door was the first hint that Coppelia was a special place. A perfect corner booth, lively Cuban music playing, friendly waitstaff and incredibly delicious food justified our first impression. Open 24/7, no reservations taken but worth the wait if busy. Enjoy!
No comment
No comment
No comment

I've introduced this place to half a dozen friends with varied tastes, and they all liked it. Better yet, it's open 24/7. It can get loud at times. I love the fish tacos for starters. The oxtail and the pernil are very good. Save room for fresh churros.

Number one breakfast spot for me and my beau. Pedro is the best!! Love Jennifer as well. I've tried almost everything on their breakfast menu that's vegetarian and it all tastes amazing. More than anything the staff is so attentive and caring. We always feel so taken care of here
No comment

A little taste of Miami in NYC. This Cuban style diner hits the spot. Come here to get a churrasco steak covered in chimmichuri  sauce atop a bed of  rice, beans and platanos. The steak was cooked perfectly!! It even came with a little Brussel sprout salad and some cojito cheese. Make sure to ask for the avocado sauce on the side, you won't regret ir!! I was pleasantly surprised with the portion. My mezcal cocktail paired perfectly with my dish. Will definitely return!

My friend and I came to this place after a show so it was pretty late, but that did not matter. We ordered the Mac and cheese chicharrón, vuelve a la vida to start then we had the churrasco and enchiladas suizas as the main course. We ended the meal with a tres leche and flan. We were so happy with our choices. The ambiance was on point, the food was delicious and the staff were so friendly. I definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for good food and service.

Wow wow wow! What a great place to visit while in Chelsea. We all ordered different things and all ate every bite. I loved the decorations and the feel of the restaurant as well. The staff was great and helpful with the menu. The cocktails were wonderful as well. I had a little buzz off of one of the the margaritas... spicy of course! It's just a small place but definitely worth the stop! I would go back!

Horrible customer service!!!! Food was good again but!!!!! The service was really bad.   I hate going somewhere twice in two weeks.   Still getting bad service!   I definitely will not be returning even it's the last place to eat!!! If you don't look like money don't bother.   Can't go to this place looking like a normal person.   SMH prices were different from last week till this week too...

Is it so much to ask when you appear at a casual restaurant in NYC,  a diner specifically, that you're greeted, sat, and asked if you want coffee and water? I arrived at Coppelia perhaps 5 minutes prior to my companion. The restaurant was not even 1/4 filled. When I walked in, there was no acknowledgment. I asked if I could sit down, and I was met with the attitude of "When will your party arrive?" Huh? It's a diner. Anyhow, the man was leading me towards the rear passing a large booth, I asked if we could sit there, and I was met with more attitude but I was given the privilege nonetheless. My friend finally arrived, and we chatted for a long few minutes before a server appeared with menus, no greeting, and did not offer anything. He came back, and gave my friend a hard time over a very basic order of eggs and bacon? When I ordered coffee, he was almost insulted as he said, "What kind? We have cafe con leche, latte, cappuccino, espresso, or americano?" Again, it's a NEW YORK DINER, just bring a mug of freshly brewed hopefully good coffee, ok? Then we waited again before said drinks appeared. The coffee was fine, the food was poor. The chilaquiles were a tasteless homogenized mess, with no differentiation in the flavors and textures. I asked for hot sauce. The food runner brought a fiery green hot concoction that I mistakenly poured over my food, deeming it, inedible. Stupid me, I expected when asking for hot sauce in most restaurants as such, getting Tobasco, or at least be forewarned. I took one bite and I had to blow my nose. If I'd not been on my way to work, I'd of complained but we just paid and left. Was it what we ordered? A bad time to be there? Maybe breakfast isn't their thing? Or they should not be open 24 hours so they can gather their bearings between shifts? I don't know but I don't have any reason to return anytime soon.
No comment
No comment
Every bite was a hit! I had the Coppelia smash as my drink, a beef empanada and the chicken enchiladas! I can't wait to go again and bring friends too. This place is a gem.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I got the churrasco! So good, cooked perfectly and very flavorful. Apparently this place is open 24/7? The portions are huge -- you could for sure share this. All very good quality I will definitely come back
Good service good great drinks I have Hendricks bartender gives me very good drinks very good Hendricks very strong drink I love service.

I've come to Coppelia a number of times over several years and it's a hit every time. The highlights for me have always been the Lomo Saltado and the Ropa Vieja, two consistently delicious meals that I can't recommend enough. The meals are all filling and I leave stuffed every time. This is another place that I love bringing friends to, it has a little bit for everyone. Plus, it's open 24 hours and has all day breakfast! What else do you need?

Been here a few times now! The drinks are reasonably priced and delicious! Also 10/10 recommend the oxtail empanadas!! I've had the Mac n cheese app and tbh it was pretty disappointing, tasted like Kraft Mac n cheese. The nacho apps with short rib are delicious and the Chile releno is also amazing!!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Good food but poor service. Visit this restaurant Frequently but poor service. Couple of missed steps with first the waiter arriving a couple of minutes too long after being seeing to start taking an order, then missed bringing a side that was ordered. After that literally waiter had a blind eye to our table we called someone else to acknowledge us to order a second round of drinks. Thinking he will get the hint noo someone else came to ask if we're done and have our plate to go while our waiter is just talking to coworkers at the bar. Waited for dessert and then we just called on a lady who was very helpful and explained what's going on and she was attentive for what was left of our time there. Fix the service! Food was spot on no complaints. Will be there again to see if this is a one off or happening again.
No comment

Super, super delicious food at Coppelia! The lomo saltado honestly blew me away, and the happy hour margarita special for $8 was great. We will definitely be frequenting this restaurant for its decent prices and really yummy food!
No comment

This place is sooooo good! I got a passion fruit mojito which was refreshing and delicious, but the real star of the night was the Lomo Saltado! The flavor was incredible and the meat was so tender it was like butter! You have to get it if you come here.
No comment
No comment
Excellent service, food quality, and atmosphere. One of my favorite food experiences in NYC. The management, cooks, and wait staff make an overall great spot for food and drinks at all hours.
Went back today am I am delighted to say that the food is still primo and the staff as pleasant and gorgeous as ever. This place rocks (salsas).
No comment

I had such an excellent meal here and so did my dining partner. I had skirt steak, and it was perfectly cooked. Served with a mixture of black beans and rice, perfectly cooked plantains. (They were kind of crispy on the outside and yummy soft on the inside) and sautéed brussels sprouts with a kind of Mexican cheese, grated on top of it, frankly, for $28 I thought it was a steal. It was a really nice size healthy, serving of steak and cooked perfectly. I am pretty picky about medium rare or rare and the waiter made the effort to make sure it was perfect. I had a nice glass of red wine, a large pour for a change! and my dining partner had the Lomo Saltado. No appetizers and we were stuffed.! I could not help noticing the amazing desserts that we're going by and in the dessert case, and I found out they now have their own pastry chef. I have to say they may have had their struggles getting staff at the tail end of the pandemic, but we gave her another chance and I am so glad we did because this will be on my favorites rotation! I'm looking forward to going back and trying some of the great looking cocktails and definitely dessert. Our waiter could not have been nicer, and I complemented the manager on how everything has really come together, and she also was incredibly gracious. I've gotten tired of so many restaurants that have an attitude, are expensive and give you a tiny serving of precious food. This is not one of them!
Wow this was such an amazing experience. Food was soo damn good! Flavors tasted like my mom cooked for me! That's a compliment! Staff is nice and they are safe during pandemic!!

Came here for lunch on the weekend, had to wait a bit for a seat but we got to enjoy the outdoor seating for our meal. The hostess was very friendly and offered recommendations. I got each of the empanadas - beef, chicken, and cheese and corn. The beef was absolutely delicious and would order again. Would come again!
No comment

Returned with a big group and had a great experience. The hash was amazing - definitely going to get that again. Pancakes with mango were also decent, but the blue corn pancakes are better, so I'll stick to those. My boyfriend liked his mojito, and I had a delicious fresh passionfruit juice. We also got some complimentary cookies for the table, which was a nice touch!
By far one if the most consistent places to eat in Manhattan. Th food is remarkable and the service is always impeccable. Oh you gotta try the cocktails too, particularly the Gran Paloma/GRANDE.

Man are these guys fast!! Excellent service, an excellent Spicy Bloody Mary. I the Cuban Benedict which very fast and hot with a side of Brussel sprouts. Service was very friendly. Prepare for a wait for a table but so worth it! Yum!!

We got the oxtail empanada as a snack and it was very tasty! It was different than what I thought - the meat was inside plantain and garnish with white cheese and red onions. The only thing was that the oxtail was grounded which made it taste more like regular ground beef. Could also have been a little spicier to help counteract the sweetness of the plantain - so eat it was another item and not by itself if anyone is sensitive to sweet :).

I have to start with the customer service. There are very attentive and extremely nice. They are always ready to take your order and make suggestions on what is good on the menu(everything is good) happy hour Sunday threw Thursday. Breakfast is survived all day! There dinner there appetizers are great! What more can I say about this place. I have tried many other places around this area. Not one of them can even stand close to Coppelia! I just found out they will be 24/7! If you want to take family or friends somewhere nice with really good food with great service and a price to match! Take them here! I promise you won't be disappointed.

This is the best fucking food I've ever had in my life. I never write reviews and I'm now writing this while eating my food. Get the Lomo Saltado but make sure to drink some Gran Paloma with it. Holy shit man.

I was so glad when Coppelia was back open and running I used to love this place Pre-COVID but my last visit there was EXTREMELY disappointing. My friend and I ordered salads for a light lunch and were rudely handled when they came and the order was incorrect. They served my friend a completely wrong salad and mine had the wrong protein on the salad. Once our order was corrected it looked as though they had just picked the chicken off my salad and replaced it with shrimp because there were left over pieces of chicken. The lettuce  in both of the "new" salad were DRENCHED in water and there was hardly any dressing, they basically served us Caesar salad soup.  Im very disappointed with the service and the food quality.

i walk in to this restaurant expecting well done cuban cuisine and i was sadly mistaken.My husband and i order the ropa vieja and rabo encendido there was no flavor no seasoning i was very much disappointed i couldn't believe that if I a latin American would expect something a little better from a cuban restaurant to have some zest of flavor no i was mistaken. My husband complain the whole time that the food taste burnt and it was bland. never again will i come here . other than that the server was perfect and so was the drinks.
