The food was absolutely amazing and we had the nicest waitress Fiorela, who was completely amazing and very attentive. I ordered the Torta de Milanesa with some spicy fries on the side and used my yelp cupon for a free drink. My friend ordered a Cuban burger and she fell in love with it too. One thing I find odd is how people say it's a Cuban place, considering there menu is vast and offers things from other countries as well it's not just Cuban it's more of a Latin mix.
No comment

Let me start off by saying the outdoor seating was really nice and there's a good amount of spacing between the tables. The server was really sweet, and the experience in general was very pleasing. My only complaint is the food was mediocre. I ordered Arroz con Pollo and Rojo Vieja, for both dishes, parts of the rice were undercooked/hard. The arroz con pollo was good, but tasted like Chinese stir fry..the ropa vieja was okay. Definitely wished it came with a side of greens, maybe avocado? Overall it was a decent experience
Love this place. Easy and casual. Everything is delicious and they have deals on mojitos and other drinks. Very reasonably priced.
No comment

Coppelia is a cute brunch spot. With excellent service and food. I had the Pepito- an amazing steak sandwich with bacon, sweet corn, gouda and shoestring potatoes. The combination of all those ingredients created a truly amazing sandwich beefy but slightly sweet with a little garlic and the potatoes for some crunch. It's a pretty big sandwich but I wasn't complaining. I also had their yucca fries which were thick and crisp. Ohh the sauce for the yucca fries was what I loved most. It was sone kind of basil/herb vinagrette-excellent. Their menu choices were pretty diverse and I'd go back to try other things on the menu. Plus their proces were reasonable for good food

Nice large diner. Came here to get breakfast for dinner and had the eggs coppelia. Food was good, not super imaginative but a solid option where you know what you're getting. Tasty and well presented. Came out really quick too, service was good, they turned us around quickly but there wasn't a feeling of being rushed. They let me sit at the bar for a while to wait for my friend with no pressure either. Overall good experience and I'll be back if in the area

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: Made a point to travel across town to try this place for dinner with a friend from out of town. It did not disappoint! Lovely ambiance, delicious food, and great service. Diner style but with a Cuban twist. I had the Cubano -- classic Cuban sandwich -- which was scrumptious, with an excellent house flan for dessert. Quality, not quantity is the name of the game here.

Fantastic kick ass lomo saltado. It's sooo good there is a solid chance you will come back for it. Scrumptious. Lovely place that is low key and casual but still cool enough to take your date or friends to. I'll definitely be back.
No comment

would leave 5 stars if the waiter wasn't coming by every 15 minutes asking "want to order anything else?". I wasn't there for more than an hour and a half, they must've checked in about 6 times. we ordered 3 coffees, 3 items from the brunch menu, and 4 appetizers all at once. everything was good!

The food was immaculate I had the chicken flautas and they were so crunchy and juicy. I also had the steak and it was so amazing.

one of my favorite lunch spots in the chelsea area. Their avocado cesar salad is delicious! Today I ordered the metador to drink. it has a kick to it so if you enjoy spice you will love this drink.
No comment

No comment

Overall, a really great spot for Cuban food! It had a very Mom & Pop feel to it and the staff was very friendly and helpful! There was a bit of a wait to get served but it was around lunch time so it was not a big deal. The frito de mar was amazing and the sauce was so tasty we asked for more. It was a passion fruit sauce that was slightly sweet. The spicy fries were wonderful and well seasoned. The arroz con pollo was very well seasoned and flavorful. We had hot sauce, which was homemade and incredible hot! If you're not a fan of spicy or can only handle a mild amount, I advise caution with the hot sauce. This was a wonderful restaurant that I would definitely revisit if I'm in the area again.

Came here last week and had a great experience. Came here tonight and hostess was very rude, kept harassing me and when I asked her I'd she wanted my business she responded with no. Very disappointed because my previous experience was great. Won't be returning or recommending unless they reach out and confirm they've addressed their customer service issue.

I order lomo saltado just about every week. I love that dish and this place so so much.
No comment

The musics was too loud! The service was friendly but the kitchen was slow. We ordered a little bit of everything . The only thing I can say that was great was the corn on the cob, everything else needed more flavor. I would suggest using better rice for the Moro. Not a fan of this spot.

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: The oxtails made my friend and I sick. Overall not worth the trip even though I wanted to like and support any business open 24/7 nowadays.

Ordered some food from here was curious to try something different I ordered a Cuban burger which sounded good also ordered a classic Cuban sandwich the burger had some good flavors but was very soggy and mushy real messy to eat want that enjoyable the Cuban sandwich on the other hand was still crispy and crunchy and packed tons of flavors

Decent food but horrible service. The service is unfriendly, poor, and rushed. They serve you how they want and not how you actually requested your food.
No comment

The place is very loud.  You can't heard what the servers are saying because of the loudest and he is rushing to go somewhere else.  Service is bare minimum,  we need to consistently wave to get water refill and take plates away.  The food was ok.  The presentation of the food was pretty but all the flavors was very similar.
No comment

Copellia has a diverse menu for anyone that you really go to at any time of day. A step up fro a diner. I had the huevos rancheros. It was very good. Service got a little slow towards the end, but in their defense it was a busy lunch hour.

If I could leave 0 stars I would. Went to dinner and the waiter spilled an entire glass of RED WINE on me. I tried to be nice about it but after the waiter just handed me a flan as an apology w/o asking if I even liked wanted it I was pissed. They clearly cared so little about their customers of color. Also the food was dry not at all tasty. NEVER GOING BACK AGAIN.

This Cuban place is UNREAL. First off it's open really late so it's good for all your post-bar munchies! They have reasonable prices and really quick service. And this place is very authentic, real-deal Cuban. Their guacamole was honestly some of the best I've ever had in my life. Literally scraped the bowl clean. And it comes with the authentic corn nachos And fried yuca chips, not tostitos from a bag. I also got the burger which was unbelievable, it had something crispy fried on top of it and I'm not even sure what it was but it was delicious! Will certainly be back soon!

We were in NY for an appt and needed somewhere to eat. After passing several restaurants we happened upon Coppelia. The food was served hot, tasted amazing and the service was excellent. I can't wait to visit NY again just for this food. We ordered the salmon, steak and egg, Brussel spouts, spinach and tomato and plantains....Amazing!!!
No comment

Service was exceptional! A group of us came in on a Saturday without a reservation around 9-10PM. They were able to seat us within 15 minutes and get out food out immediately. We were in a rush and they were able to accommodate our schedules.
No comment
Beautiful place!  Very Covid-safe and clean.  11 dollar burger, 2 dollars to add fries , 6 bucks for a draft, .75 to add bacon.  Everything was great, very cool environment.

Walked in with a party of 7 and they took us immediately during a very busy Saturday, so I can not complain (yet). It was packed, good energy, great music. But the wait for service was, well rude. The happy hour priced drinks, made up for the wait. Definitely the reason it was so packed, a good happy hour for sure. I was very pleased with my main course the salmon w/ purple potatoes, cooked just how I requested and very fresh. My friends all seemed happy as well with their meals until it was pay time. The waitress messed up our bills more then once. Hope they get her some help, meaning hire more staff for busy days!
Excellent. Love the lomo saltado. Nice staff and great food. The food was delicious I would eat it again.
No comment

Been craving a cubano sandwich for the longest. Saw the majority of good posts raving about the sandwich and they're right. It's honestly pretty good, I gave it four stars because I wish they'd put some more ham( next time I order I'll definitely be asking for that ) and also wished the French fries were better. The bread was perfectly toasted, pernil was seasoned and shredded well. A good amount of cheese, mustard and pickles. I definitely recommend trying their sandwich.

Boy have they gone downhill since opening. They served us stale plantain chips with bland guac, the steak dish was also not what it used to be and the pancakes were slightly burnt and dry. They are skimping big time on integrity and quality. Thankfully, there are plenty of other restaurants that have remained consistent over the years. Bye Coppelia!

Great good for good prices and nice service. Good atmosphere but a bit noisy. Not good for kids but everything else is fine, casual dates are good too. Walkable to bus stops and subway stations. Quite a few options for drinks and food. Do recommend and I'd definitely be going back sometime again

Yummy food. My favorite was the chile relleno stuffed with veggies. Great service. Will come again.

This is one of nyc's great late night food spots. So lively at nights. Great menu with wholesome courses. Would definitely recommend. This is one restaurant where I would come back constantly to try all their dishes.
No comment
No comment
No comment

My boyfriend has been wanting to come to this place for a while so we decided to give it a shot last night. I wasn't impressed. I was expecting Cuban food but it was nothing like I thought it would be. We shared the mac chicharrón for an app and it tasted like boxed Mac n cheese. I got the camarones Cienfuegos with rice and beans. The rice was extremely hard (nothing like Cuban rice) and the shrimp werent even cleaned out which was gross. The only thing I did enjoy was my capirinah drink. The manager was very welcoming and friendly, but the staff could be a little more attentive. After we got our food they never came back to check on us, but they were also a little busy so I'll assume that's why. This Place is open 24 hours so it's a cool place to go after a night out on the town. But if you're coming for some authentic food, this isn't your place.

Amazing chicken and rice.  My gf only eats gluten free and she had many options to choose from! This place is open 24/7...i repeat...it's always open! Annnnnnnd they have amazing food? What more can you ask for? The chicken and rice almost tastes like Chinese fried Rice but 10x better! I highly recommend coming here.  It's cute and cozy inside and I never had to wait for a table.  I was here a year ago and loved it! And I still do :) I will be back for sure!!!

I love this place to bits. The food is very good. I used to consider this my go to place around 14th st. Each time I visit however I am constantly reminded of how shoddy their service is though. You have to ask for anything multiple times and even ask multiple people. It is almost as if their wait staff is just lazy. Even to get the check, it takes them years. This one element of the coppelia experience is just putting off. More recently, their brunch menu, though delicious is just so minuscule in portion for the price! Even the hash de cost ills has 3 bits of meat with triple the quantity of potatoes - and even after that, the portion is just too small for the price.

!!! This establishment is racist! I came here with my son  and the manager refused to sit us suggesting we couldn't afford to pay. I love the food but this is ridiculous and I refuse to support a racist establishment
Good vibe... Open 24 hours. Good staff... Great food. This one of my favorite spots in New York City. They have a few veggie options that will workout for you if you're a veggie lover.

Coppelia was a decent spot. The perk is that it's open 24 hours so it is a good late night spot if you're hungry and in the area. It's not a huge space but big enough for you to feel comfortable. Service was decent. The food was good. There's a good variety of options depending on what you were in the mood for. I would definitely go back because it was convenient and open 24/7.
No comment

I used to live near this place.   I found myself in Chelsea again and this was my first stop.   Nothing has changed, the food it still outstanding.   I have so many favorite dishes here I can't list them all.   I ended up buying 3 dinners to reheat later.   All were wonderful.  Please support this local business, you won't regret it.

Pretty interesting dishes here, and I'm talking about that Mac & Chicharrón. I'm pretty sure it's not a Cuban dish being that I come from a Cuban family but the flavors blended well. I might not have it again but it's a dish I can say I've tried, well flavored cheese & the chicharrón gave it a smoky flavor in my option. I ended up getting the churrasco dish which came with congris and sweet plantains. Very filling, one serving can probably feed two people. The churrasco was cooked to perfection & was well seasoned. Read some reviews that it was salty, I had gotten the saltiness towards the very end of the strip. The rice was okay, tasted very restaurant and not really 'home'.. more of a box taste. I got crazy and tried two cocktails while I was here on happy hour time ($8). One was the Margarita Cubana which was okay, spicy & thick. Thick because it has tamarindo juice in it and it came as a surprise to try and take that down. Another drink I had which I enjoyed was the Guarapita, this was a better drink! The staff is attentive & friendly, the music was flowing. I'd come back & try the pernil everyone is talking about.
No comment

Pretty nice spot here. As a Cuban myself I had high expectations for the place and although it didn't exceed them it it didn't disappoint in the slightest bit. Ordered the huevos rancheros and medianoche sandwich which were both very good. Bread on the medianoche was excellent and the pork was pretty tender and flavorful. Only criticism I have to bestow is the slow service and the ambiance which could use a bit of a renovation. Overall would recommend for a small bite or brunch as this place has it all for those who are fans of Cuban cuisine!
Media noche doesn't seem right on brioche bun which is too soft a texture. The sandwich and sweet plantains were swimming in grease. Disappointed.

A coworker recommended me this place. Was going crazy trying to find good empanadas for a BBQ party. I ordered 40 empanadas my mistake was not just buy one and try it out. The chicken empanadas was sour and taste bad! Just my luck when one of my guess was eating one of the empanadas there was a worm between the chicken. My embarrassment was big enough to just not take empanadas and let all the other guess know about it. If not I would bring the empanadas and make a scene in the restaurant or call the health department. I hate to leave bag reviews in people Bussines specially now in this hard times. But if u go to Copellia make sure you verify your food ( specially the empanadas)

Got the ropa vieja and chicken with yellow rice and a mojito. The mojito was, by far, the best part of the meal and made the two entrees somewhat enjoyable. Otherwise, I wouldn't order of these dishes again, as the chicken with yellow rice had a strange, gamey taste to it and the shredded beef in the ropa dish was over salted.

My go-to orders are the Lomo Saltado, Shortrib Nachos and Oxtail empanada. This is one of my top 5 places. It's not only good but very affordable.

Finally, we have decided to try new dishes at this place and not our usuals which is always good. Their grilled shrimp for any of their salads are awesome, chicken quesadillas was ok because they used a big piece of grilled chicken breast instead of chopping it up into little pieces, fried calamari/octopus/shrimp was ok and I like octopus the most, the pork sandwich was no good but their Cuban sandwich we got last time was awesome. The only thing I don't like about that place is it's way too loud, we can't even have a decent conversation there. They are open 24/7

Came here for brunch with my girlfriends. It's a fun atmosphere but definitely gets packed! Our waiter was very attentive and humorous. All of our food was pretty good though the descriptions make it sound more scrumptious than is the reality. I ordered mango pancakes that only had unrippened pieces of mango sprinkled on top. However, the drinks were really good and we enjoyed the place overall. It's definitely worth checking it out if you're in a pickle or looking for something that's more budget friendly.
No comment

This is my number one favorite late-night spot in the city, although I do grab lunch and early dinner from here sometimes as well. I've never eaten anything at Coppelia that I did not love, whether it was breakfast food appetizers or dinner. I also really love the staff here particularly the security staff - they are super friendly do a great job and always make you feel welcome.
No comment

No comment

WOW. This was one of the most underwhelming experiences we've had. I got the lomo saltado and my friend got the arroz con pollo. We both got the freshly squeezed orange juice each and a side of yuca fries. The best thing there was the juice and even that was priced differently on the menu than we were charged (we were charged more). To begin with the atrocity, the rice in the lomo saltado was NOT cooked thoroughly. I felt as if I was chewing on straight grains. The meat was FULLLLL of fat. Every single piece had fat on it. The fries were disgustingly oily (you can see it in the photo) as if it was sitting in old oil until it was time to be served. My friends meal was okay at best but again, the rice was not cooked thoroughly. The entrees are not cheap either. Both dishes were $20 and $23 on their own. It was overall an extremely disappointing and frustrating experience. Please know what you're getting yourself into before going to a place where the food will just be as disappointing as the service. Never again.
No comment

Amazing cuban diner! The food is delicious, the prices are reasonable and the servers are very helpful and nice. I came here to try the churrasco but sadly it was very late at night and they had run out! I was disappointed and ordered some mexican enchiladas and did not expect much from it! Boy!!! Was i wrong!! The enchiladas were delicious and the rice and beans were amazing as well. As a cuban i have to say that i dont like very much beans that are not made by my abuela but these ones were super good! We ended up ordering nachos as an appetizer and we had to say they were one of the best nachos we have ever tried!!!!!! The ropa vieja is also delicious! They have a good variety of drinks as well. I was very full at the end of out visit but i had to try the dessert and wow i loved loved the chocolate mousse cake. I will definitely come back.

This store opens 24/7! Usually very packs with their happy hours from 4pm-7pm. I came here one day after work with a few of my friends. The service here was great, we didn't have to wait long for our table since we got there around 5pm. We each got an happy hour drink and I was pretty surprised by it. Usually happy hour drinks aren't that strong but this place blew my mind. I took a slip and I already taste all the alcohol that was mix in. I'll be definitely coming back here more often to try all their other drinks and food.

I'm not sure about this spot in the day but it's the BEST spot to go to after a night out. The food is delicious and comes out fast. The menu is extensive, and a full kitchen at any time of the day. The bathroom is also very cute for all you "bathroom pic girls" like myself :)

A cutesy somewhat retro aesthetic, and not too busy around 11am on a weekday. Prices are oh so good for brunch. My friend and I split the Eggs Benedict (around 10 bucks!) and the Arepas with chicken and avocado. Enjoyed the Benedict but the Arepas are 100% the way to go. So flavorful you'll definitely be wanting more so beware if you split. Highly recommend for a not-so-usual brunch.
No comment

I usually like Coppelia, the Cuban-fusion place on W. 14th, and I enjoy turning people on to them. Over the years I have brought large parties there. But sometimes - and I will admit, rarely--at Coppelia the wait staff needs lessons in human relating. This weekend, a thumb-headed older guy refused to give separate checks to our disparate group of couples. One check for two people, only you do it four times at our table. He refused. I observed that this decision could drive people away, but he persisted, So we ordered...but maybe he had already developed a 'tude toward us. Or he was just a good lawman but a bad waiter--he made at least four mistakes at our table. But he knew how to insist on restaurant "policy" This guy was old enough to maybe be an owner, and so I guess he can act badly when he wants to. I'll limit my Sunday visits, thanks to this guy
Great food and the atmosphere makes you feel like you're in Cuba or somewhere. Cuban Sandwich was great.
The huevos rancheros are delicious! This place is a lovely place to enjoy brunch, and the patio seating is a nice touch.
No comment
No comment

I liked this place very much and didn't realize it was open 24 hours . Food was tasty although a bit different than traditional Cuban food . They do have all the favorites. I tried the pollo a la plancha which was quite unique ( almost Cajun like ) and finished with the guava con queso .

OMGoodness! such Heavenly food! this place is amazing! i love trying new vegan/vegetarian places and even regular meat serving places WITH VEGETARIAN OPTIONS because let's face it, this is new york city and why exclude yourself (unless it's a dietary health issue). As a vegan that doesn't push my views on others ( i know what you're thinking, we are out there though lol) to taste real yummy food that isn't made out of soy or tofu or settling for fruit so you don't faint in the middle of the street- this is one of my those hail mary places. Listen I like superiority burger in the east vill but they have nothing on Coppelia's veggie burger!

Was recommended this place to try and the food was pretty good considering its $$ price. I only give it this rating and you may see other reviews similar to this was because of the 20% gratuity that gets added on if you are a party of 6 or more (you can also see it if you look at the pictures of the menu). We came in as a party of 5 and when the check came, they ended up adding that 20% gratuity onto the bill. I don't remember what excuse they said to even have us pay for it but we refused. We sat around figuring out what to do and the server ended up removing the tip from it to avoid the hassle. But why bother give it in the first place? If there was an update with the store, it should've been communicated through the servers and updated on the menu. I hope no one else has to go through this issue if they're just sliding in gratuity without letting their customers know. Would not recommend to anyone if they're going to get potentially scammed from this place.

It's open 24hours so this was the PERFECT meal after bar hopping/clubbing, or if you're looking for a late night snack.

I'll  give this placed 4 stars just because I have had only 3 items on the menus. We arrived around 3pm (April 13)on a gorgeous Saturday afternoon. We sat immediately by the window. Great view to people watch and watch the sun beam off your company's face... great atmosphere. The place was packed with good vibes. Food was hearty, with great flavor and totally filling.  My vieja ropa was so flavorful and tender...ahhhh it paired so well with the rice and beans. Our empanadas were unexpectedly delicious. This is a kinda fancy diner style restaurant, they specialize in Mexican/South American food, open 24h. Be prepared that the place will be packed, even on a weekday evening. I arrived on a Thursday evening, and I had to wait for a seat although I was the only person dining. The ambience is extremely noisy, good for parties to hangout though. I ordered the Mac and cheese with fried pork, yucca fries and a dulce de leche milkshake. The milkshake came out pretty soon, it was quite good, it had a strong flavor of the dulce se leche. My food came out super slow though, and I was not impressed. The yucca fries were oily and stiff, there were at least some that were hard to chew. The Mac and cheese just tasted like store bought Mac and cheese but with some fried pork skin inside. Nothing special, yet all that is surely not diner price. It was a busy evening, the servers couldn't keep up with the pace although they were trying hard to tend to every customer

Definitely experienced better. I made the mistake of ordering a non latin dish on the pre fixe lunch menu and the poached eggs ham and home fries were all sub par. The poached eggs were overly cooked no runnyness at all. The benedicts sauce was cold and clumped up. Biscuit was dense dry and overly heavy. Home fries was probably the item to eat on here but there was a lack of the chimichuri sauce. Average service but was attentive. Good juices though as i had the soursop juice which was fresh. Will give this place one more try and this time not make the mistake of going non latin on the menu item choice to see if it deserves a better rating.

We come here all the time and it's always good, but recently we went for brunch and it was FANTASTIC. Everything was fresh and delicious. Plus they have a good amount of outdoor seating that's pleasant to eat at. I saw another review on here criticizing them for being "slow to adapt" to COVID restaurant life. 1) who has the nerve to criticize the restaurant industry right now??? like isn't the whole world just hanging on?? and 2) I disagree, I live around the corner and have been going here since they reopened and each step of the way they've kept safety of their employees and customers as the priority while still providing a good experience

Had a late brunch in here Saturday morning. It's a tiny little place that had an upbeat feel and was bustling like any other brunch service at local diner. The service was great as well as the energy because Mexico v. Korea was on the TV. I ordered the Huevos Rancheros and a Bloody Mary. Overall I have mixed feelings on this place.  I had theb3 arepas and while they were tasty, the portions were small and they were more like mini arepa sandwiches.  The extra $2.50 for chips without any salsa or guac seems pricey and there are no refills on the soda.  I'd say food was 3.5, service a 3.5, cleanliness a 3 and overall value a 3.  Not sure I would come b

I've been going here for about 2 years now, and each and every time the food, drinks, and service is AMAZING. I'm so glad they were able to reopen despite COVID-19 taking out a lot of small businesses and restaurants around NYC, and the slight increase in prices is a very small price to pay for having this staple in the neighborhood. The outdoor dining, though limited, is great! The spacing between tables, the plexiglass between others, and the staff wearing their PPE makes me feel safe while still being able to dine out. The menu is not as expansive as pre-COVID times but that is understandable, and there are still very many good options on the menu. The staff is so friendly, professional, and still fast on service. SIDE NOTE: If you're going to dine-out in the midst of a pandemic, 1. Tip the staff 18%+ and 2. don't make petty complaints - everyone is doing their best to get through this pandemic.

Oh my gosh. I came here for dinner tonight and I ordered an oxtail empanada to start before my meal. The empanada was really good, I've never had one before made with plantains, and I'm definitely going to be on the lookout for these on the menu for future Cuban restaurants I go to. But let me tell you about the Lomo Saltado. It was amazing. It was the perfect blend of flavors and different foods (rice, fries, meat and vegetables). And the meat just fell apart in my mouth when I was eating it, it was cooked so perfectly. I'm going to be thinking about this place for a long time, I'll definitely be back, next time I'm in Manhattan.

My go-to "diner" in NYC. It says, Cuban. Slightly Tex-Mex but with a NYC finesse. Good breakfast, brunch, and dinner place. Always packed but I never really waited long here. Staff is efficient and friendly.

My favorite all night diner in NYC. It has some of the best Mexican food the city has to offer. It is a God send late at night, especially In the union square area. Go here any time of day, and get a quesadilla with some guacamole and any sandwich. This place is one of the better casual diners around.

Coppelia is right in my Greenwich Village 'hood on West 14th Street right off Seventh Avenue South and is such a delight to have here with its superb, tasty meals at decent prices in an area of New York City that becomes trendier by the moment. The kitchen, the drink mixers, the wait staff are nothing short of spectacular and attentive. I've been here four times since it opened a number of years ago and never leave unsatisfied. As new jerseyians, Lauren and I head here every once in awhile.  This place has never let us down.  Busy but quick service, great food, Pedro our main man was funny and actually had me cracking up while taking my order.   Just our favorite diner.  To live in NJ and say this NYC diner is our favorite is saying something!

Not too impressed. I get it, not everyone can make good Cuban sandwiches! Tops vieja was gross. This is a 24 hour joint, so maybe if you are drunk and  its 2 AM you enjoy the food more. We didn't like it. Will not return!
Food was just ok but bring a parka.  We were sitting under the AC and asked them if we could move or at least turn the AC down.  They said they would but then turned it back on.
No comment

Absolutely nothing to hate about this place! Delicious authentic Cuban food & I'm from Florida, home of the Cubans! Open 24/7!!! The only con is they tend to get super busy later at night. My bestfriend introduced me to this place last time I was in New York. Their food is so yummy! And I even heard you can catch celebrities like Rihanna in here which is so cool! We went on a Saturday night I believe & we got the churrasco, salmon, ox tail empanadas and multiple drinks. Everything was delicious, I enjoyed every single sip and bite taken :-)
Great service! Amazing food and atmosphere! The Ropa vieja which is a traditional cuban dish was spot on! Also the arroz congris, which they call moro rice was perfect!

I never knew, nor would I have guessed that, there was a Cuban dinner in Chelsea!  Coppelia was packed on Saturday night - and I can see why.  The dinner has lots of character, friendly staff, and a 24-hour menu stocked full of tasty options.  We ordered the kale salad and sweet plantains for the table.  The salad was yummy; however, we were all a little surprised that the plantains weren't that sweet.  I ordered the roasted chile poblano that was stuffed with brussels, zucchini, quinoa, and other delicious stuff - and then covered in a nice tomato sauce.  I enjoyed it; it was much less heavy than most options on the menu.
No comment
Nice outdoor seating, 24 hours, delicious chimichurri. Steak was over cooked but the huevos were fab.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

My friends and I went here late night on a Sunday and were super impressed with the food, ambiance and service. They have some really great cocktails, my favorite of which was the Matador...a spicy refreshing cucumber, mint and jalapeño combination. They also do a great Cuba Libre and have micheladas. We started with the Mac and chicharron which was so good I wished I could eat it twice! Seriously one to try. I had the churrasco as my main; it was a perfectly cooked medium cut of steak with a beautiful sear and depth of flavor. The portion was hefty (I was drunk eating but still had a take home box for the next day) and I particularly enjoyed the crispy Brussels sprouts that came with it.

I liked this place very much and didn't realize it was open 24 hours. My favorite things to order here are the Ropa Vieja and Enchiladas. The enchiladas were delicious and the rice and beans were amazing as well. This place is one of the better casual diners around.
No comment
No comment
Had the Huevos Rancheros: amazing!! We were quickly seating, promptly waited on, and the food came out quickly. Everything was delicious!

Pretty much walking distance from bars and lounges. OPEN ALL DAY 24/7! Perfectttt. We went late at night and it was really crowded but still didn't have to wait for a table so I suppose we came at perfect timing. The food was pretty good but the service was just soooo slow. They also forgot two dishes for our order when the rest of the food came out. It was also difficult to flag down a server to get our check. And even when we already did ask for our check, it took a while to get our bill back. Because the food was still good and it is convenient that this place is open 24/7, I would still come back. Just don't expect great service or come on an empty stomach or be in a hurry! You might have to wait a while before you get served, etc.
No comment
No comment
Waiter was very rude and fast. I didn't feel comfortable at all. The food took a while to the table and it wasn't anything special. I would still give it a 3 stars.
Amazing tacos! On Tuesday only 17 bucks and you get a fest!!!! The drinks are superb and the staff is friendly and very detail oriented!! Love it!! Will come back in the future!!!

I'm here for this food. This place is excellent!! The guac is delicious. I had the pan con lechon with sweet potato fries it was fire. Their entrees look a little pricey but it's absolutely amazing! For sure coming back!

Good food but served cold, no bueno. I ordered the enchiladas. I don't think it cause anything to heat the food in the microwave at least smh ;)  you can tell is probably frozen food. I hate to be serve cold food ;( make some effort your food is not cheap !! Smh again

I've tried almost everything on the menu already and had never not liked anything. The food here is delicious! Service is superb. Fun music in the background. I bring my crew here for brunch & dinner, and come by myself as well for a quick bite. Always perfect :) And they're open 24hrs which takes it to a whole another level.
No comment
No comment

Food is great, delicious. If they bring you the wrong order do not complain, you will be treated horrendously if you do, by the waiter and his friends. This is my 6th time here, today was horrendous, I dare to tell they brought wrong empanada. Immediately chastised and given the attitude and grief, all went south after this. It is sad. Tables empty yet they do not sit you. Service is bad yet food is good.

We came at 3:30 to this place, the server never came and we had to stand up for food and drinks, when we approached the bar at 4 the bartender said we could have beer and shots, the manager was right next to him and dismiss what the bartender told us, he said nothing and had a very bad attitude. Working in the service industry is really hard! I love this place for late drinks and food, but after this I guess I would not come back, not for the server because they are under staff and is hard to take everyone's order. I will not come back for the poor management, they should be kind and helpful with everyone.
Placed an order for delivery but they sent me someone else's order. They refused to send someone to exchange the order and wanted me to come pick it up instead so I opted for a refund. Ridiculous!

HO.LY SHIT. I've had good lomo saltado before but omg. I've never had it THIS great before!!!! The meat is the most tender I've ever tasted!!! The nachos, oxtail empanadas and chicken enchiladas were delicious as well!!!! I'm mad that I've been in New York for 7 years and only just now discovered this placed. And I've walked my it countless times!!! Do yourself a favor and come here to eat!!!

Service was extremely slow - maybe because it was a busy Thursday night. But our food and cocktails were simply delicious. Really enjoyed the Cuba Colada, arepas, vegetarian enchiladas, and mango tres leches cake. It's also got a cute, Cuban diner vibe but without boring diner food. There's only one bathroom, though, which was frustrating with so many people drinking. Still, would definitely recommend Coppelia for a great meal at a fun spot!
No comment
This place was recommended to me by my friend but I did not like it. Very loud and the food didn't taste good. Also staff is not too friendly
No comment

Nice place for lunch. Came on a sunday at 12 and we were seated right away. We all had sandwiches and we were really happy about it. Coktails were good and strong, service was extremely nice! Will go back!
You must try the Cuban Burger with hand-cut sweet potato fries!! Everything was cooked perfectly and portion size was plentiful. Yum yum yum.

I came here with my husband around dinner time yesterday (Saturday) evening. From the outside, you wouldn't realize that Coppelia also serves food. We were seated right away towards the back. A waitress came to take our drink orders. The drinks are pricey! I have never paid more than $9 for a glass of sangria. Coppelia charges $11 (if I remember correctly). Because I was craving one and the weather was nice, I asked her if they made piña coladas? I assumed that they did since they have a full bar. She asked me if I wanted a frozen one or a regular one? I've always had them frozen... that's what I ordered. The piña colada was good but weak.  Since I don't eat dinner, I ordered 2 items from the starters menu - sweet corn and cheese empanada and macaroni and cheese with pork chicharon. My husband ordered a chicken sandwich and morro rice. The food arrived promptly and everything was DELICIOUS! The only reason that I didn't give Coppelia a 5-Star review is because of the price of my drink - $12 + $1 because I asked for it frozen. I will be back but maybe next time, it'll be during their Happy Hour!
No comment

Nice joint for Cuban food. Loud and open late! The nachos here are mad good!!! I also had the chicken Milanese sandwich which was decent and fried plantains. I'd come back and try the different entrees.
No comment
No comment

FABULOUS! Chicken soup, omelettes , sandwiches, delicious. Service is excellent and they have booths. The place is small, and not a date destination. Its more like a luncheonette than a restaurant. Four stars instead of five, because bathroom is one customer at a time, so if someone parks themselves in there, you could have a problem. We can't wait to go back. Parking is very tough, so have a plan B .
No comment

I regretted not going in without starving myself for two days. I just wanted to order everything. However, all I could was to order a few appetizers and sides (and a well-needed drink) today. Everything was fantastic, and everything makes me wonder why I didn't walk in hungry. I'm not a dessert fan at all, but somehow I was drawn to the Malanga Cake. It seemed like the weirdest combination you can possibly imagine in a dessert. Fear not my friends...IT WAS SO EFFING GOOD. I'm hoping I'd have enough time to go back before I leave. I really do. Go check it out (and go with an open mind).

Authentic authentic authentic. From the servers to the music to the lighting to the interior design it really landed the plane with the Oxtail Empanadas. They had me at Oxtail so I didn't read the full details.  I ate the chicken empanada first which was pretty fantastic... then I ate the Oxtail empanada. Mind. Blown. The shell... was mashed plantain. The oxtail was seasoned perfectly. Highly recommended! I went in there randomly to meet up with a friend before the dinner rush. Next time I'm making reservations.

I ordered the Cubano sandwich with chimichurri sauce on the side and the ropa vieja. It was the best I've tasted anywhere in NYC.  The meat for both dishes were perfectly seasoned and tender. Im not sure of the authenticity of the taste but I'm thinking it's pretty close. However, Ive heard from many Cuban friends that it is authentic.  Friendly wait staff and the ambiance is nice too. They're open 24hrs so anytime I want my Cuban fix I'll definitely come again.

Meh service but pretty decent food for a 24/7 joint. Definitely recommend the nachos and chicken enchiladas (though you definitely need to specify what rice you want because they automatically throw white rice your way). We got La Borracha as our cocktail and that was nice and refreshing, too. Granted, I've really only come to this place past 2am so maybe it'd be a hit as an afternoon or evening spot ‍
No comment
No comment

I don't know how I haven't written a review of this place yet. I've come here a few times and I order the churrasco. It's so good! I love the churrasco sauce they put on it. The Moro rice is great and comes with Brussel sprouts so it makes it crunchy. Overall I always love the food. Try the yucca fries also they are delicious. Drink wise j usually order the mojitos and they are pretty potent. Last but not least I love the fact they are 24 hours!
No comment
Very aesthetically pleasing atmosphere. Service was incredible. Food was amazing. All that needs to be said.
No comment
No comment

Adorable diner! Good, inexpensive food! Friendly service. They gladly accommodated my dietary restrictions and made me a delicious vegan quinoa bowl with extra avocado! Thanks Coppelia. We'll be back!
No comment
No comment

Small diner, good food. Not your typical diner food, I believe most things are Cuban inspired. However, there's something for everyone on the menu. Don't be afraid to sit at the bar, the bartenders are friendly.

Due to being a holiday week, there was a bit of a wait -we waited patiently - once we got  seated at the bar - staff members were very attentive - we ordered Cuban beer along with an array of appetizers - everything was great the vibe was awesome its a must go to place - open 24 hours

I've only been here once but that's enough to make it a favorite. The service was great. About a 15 min wait for table of 4. I would stand in line for hours to get in next time if I had to. It's really that good. Service, Sangria, Food, Desert... This place is top notch. Open 24/7

Coming here late after a few drinks was spot on. The only issue was the wait and the fact that it's a bit tight and I knocked over someone's quesadilla trying to get out of my table (sorry dude). But our food was delicious: guac, cubanos, yucca fries, enchiladas and a michelada. I'll definitely be back, and I'll have to stop at the donut pub next door this time.

Dinner was absolutely delicious. Churrasco was cooked perfectly. The Lo Mein special was delicious. The juice was super fresh and delicious. Sadly the chocolate was so dry that it hurt my mouth so avoid that, but otherwise everything was amazing. I'd recommend for anyone who likes Cuban food. Very relaxed atmosphere and it gets louder the later you're there. Good, helpful service. Would return.

Open 24/7 and happy hour 7 days a week, amazing! Coppelia checked off all the boxes - great menu, yummy food and drinks and really friendly and attentive service. Loved the cozy vibe of the restaurant, and will be back soon after a late night of drinking.
The bartender was super nice and attentive to us. The food looks good and taste good.

Every time I either order for delivery, pick up, or dine in the food is always on pointttt. So much flavor and the portions are good. The last thing I ate here was a kale salad. Now I don't usually like kale in a salad but this was very good.

I was rushed form the time I walked in. I felt this was because I was a black man wearing black. I saw many other people of Caucasian and Latin ethnicity having fun enjoying themselves without being harassed or having security stand next to them while eating. I was racially profiled and rushed to eat and asked to leave and been rude to and had waiters act like snobs take my menu and act rude when i didn't respond they took my plate away with confirming that I'm done with my food. Would not even recommend this restaurant to my worst enemy. The only convenience is it being open 24 hours but the snobby attitude of the staff and security it's not worth it all. Im about to lay my bill after having to argue with them abouT me not paying before I was ready to.. and then I will leave, but my summary is fuck this place! The food and service sucks ass!

Meh. This place didn't impress me one bit. Service is rude. This bald, John Malkovich-looking curmudgeon of a old man we had the misfortune as our server was most unwelcoming. He looked absolutely miserable serving us but oddly perked up when addressing his other yuppie, light-skinned clientele. Pernil was outrageously overpriced, when at a quarter of its price at a Dominican/Puerto Rican hole in the wall I've had far better. I'm not some ignoramus comparing McDonalds and gourmet burgers. This pernil was absolutely subpar. Overly vinegared and poorly seasoned. They had the nerve to not even serve the dish with a single slice of cuero-- delicious, hardened pork skin-- but gave me two stale chicharron chips instead. I can't imagine what they're doing with all that precious cuero... gringo fools will probably throw it out, but I bet they keep it for themselves in the kitchen if they know better. And the corn and cheese empanada, to my shock, was stuffed not with queso fresco or even mozzarella, but with American Cheese. American cheese. Just let that sink in. Disgusting.
No comment

I love coppelia because of their late night food and drinks. I have however on multiple occasions dealt with their manager ERICA and she has been horrible. She makes patrons feel unwelcome. I was having a conversation with someone that was a part of my party. I was then asked to leave because, " patrons felt uncomfortable." She said what she felt she needed to say and then walked away from the table without waiting for a response. Then the bouncer engaged me and told me that I needed to leave and that there was nothing more that could be done. He took my number with the intention of letting the owner know about the situation. Regardless coppelia is good for the food and the drinks but Erica the manager is extremely below par for restaurant managers in the area, which sucks because the food and drinks are awesome,

I stopped in here for breakfast and the food and coffee were pretty good. I was mid way through my food and texted my friends letting them know I Found a great new Cuban spot.  However, the rudeness of the server overshadowed the experience.  When I attempted to pay the $13 bill with my MasterCard the server asked me if I had a chip card.  I told him no just a regular card and he said we don't take those.  So I asked him why there wasn't a sign saying that and he then asked me for ID. When I gave him my ID he then said oh okay and ran the card and charged me.  Wow.  I then realized he had also offended the African American man that came In Earlier to buy coffee.  It was a very unwelcoming feeling towards people of color.  As a Afro Cuban woman I was taken back by his behavior and will not be back again.  Cuban food should be served with love not racism.  What a shame.

Best late night spot to go to if you're looking for something good and worth your money at any time of the day. I went here Christmas Eve at 4 am and I had the best steak and waffles ever. It was like a diner with a bar.
First here in New York, and we decided to have Cuban food. We were completely satisfied.  Portions were a very nice size. Cuban sandwich was delicious

No comment

I had the Mac and cheese side for delivery and the empanadas. I really enjoyed the Mac and cheese! But the empanadas I was unaware was encased in a plantain. But it was also very good! Def recommend this place!

This place is wonderful! Deserves 6 stars.  Physically beautiful environment- but comfortable.   Food -creative, delicious, eclectic- try the chocolate chipotle chicken wings with Jicama and Blue Cheese.  Flautas covered in the Best Pico De Gayo.   And I could go on -- The wait staff was attentive, nurturing and accommodating in every way  (not to mention incredibly good looking too! ).  The were on point handling my gluten allergy  and my water glass was full all night.  The desert menu was extensive - I chose the flan with raspberry -- one of the very best flans I have had, creamy and firm.  And the cherry on top was meeting the owner on the way out. He cared deeply about our experience and was grateful we enjoyed our dinner and evening thoroughly.
Came in to celebrate my husband and I birthday,  the vibe is awesome and the food is amazing!!

No joke this was the best meal I had while visiting New York and I was only here for 3 nights and 4 days. I loved my dish so much that I went back the next day and ordered the same thing. The lomo saltado is to die for! I've had lomo saltado multiple times and I can honestly say this is the best I've tasted. I have to admit I missed the green sauce you get at a Peruvian restaurant, but even without it the dish was AMAZING! It was packed with so much flavor. The lomo came with short rib meat that melted in your mouth, thin fries (a bit on the soggy side), sliced Roma tomatoes, red onions, garlic white rice topped with scallions. My brother ordered the churrasco, a perfectly cooked medium rare skirt steak, melt in mouth, super tender piece of meat topped with chimichurri sauce served with black beans, rice and crispy brussel sprouts. Boyfriend ordered the BLT. Bread had a crisp exterior and soft pillowy bread on the inside. Bacon was cooked to perfection nice and crispy topped with sliced tomatoes and spinach. It usually comes with lettuce, but with the e-coil break they substituted it with spinach. Oh and if you're a lover of spicy stuff and I mean SPICY they have this hot sauce that you can ask on the side that is FIRE . The Gran Paloma margarita was super tasty. If you like passion fruit flavors then this is your alcoholic beverage. Everything we ordered exceeded expectations except the ceviche we ordered as an appetizer. Felt they skimped on the fish and flavor was lacking. Take my advice and order the lomo or churrasco. I promise you won't regret it.

I've only ordered delivery so this is strictly for their delivery menu and food. The food came very quickly (with 15 minutes) so I'm not sure what that means. The food was good and was standard Cuban. A decent option for dinner especially late at night (open 24 hours).
No comment

This is a causal Cuban/South American/Mexican place with authentic food.  We got the skirt steak and empanadas which are flavorful.  The cocktail drinks are very light and there is not much alcohol in them.  It could be because of the happy hour price.  The servers are cheerful and gives good service.  It is a good place to grab a casual dinner.
I'm a big fan of this place . I recommend it to any after club goers , after work crowds or even mid day shoppers being as though it is open 24 hrs
No comment
We had the oxtail empanada ($4.75), the two lunch specials (arroz con pollo - the yellow rice dish and Ropa vieja) for about $12.95. Everything was excellent.
No comment

Amazing! First time in New York and this was a great recommendation from a friend. Spots open 24hours a day and the service here's great. Cant go wrong with any dish here honestly. I tried both of my co workers meals and they all tasted amazing. After even got a coconut sorbet and that delicious to.

Chicharron chopped salad w/ grilled chicken (generous & full of flavor) and of course a La Borracha cocktail (perfect balance of punch and sweet/tartness)...couldn't have picked a better cheery lunch spot! Service was fast and friendly w/ a fun atmosphere to brighten up any gloomy NYC day!
Delicious! What a great Yelp find. Walking on a beautiful day in NYC this place had fast service and a great menu. The hash de costilla melted in my mouth. Guac with assorted chips was super tasty.

Love this place and go here any chance I get. The food is wonderful (I've had everything from the cuban sandwich, to the pernil with rice and beans and the nachos), the music is lively (I've found myself singing along often), and the service is attentive. The bathroom is cute too, with the separate sink and all, because sometimes you just wanna wash your hands! I've taken many people here and I will be back!
No comment

The food here is so good. My waiter was named Lucio and was very kind. I ordered the Torta De Milanesa with Yuca Fries and loved every bite. The best part is that they are open 24/7 which is great news for my stomach.
This place is 24 hours! And AWESOME! I've visited twice with my boyfriends after 2am and the food was still amazing and everything was fresh! My favorite late dining!

column3: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
column6: Looooove this place. Friendly staff and amazing authentic Caribbean flavor. My brunch spot for people who have never had Cuban food in the city. Has such a good range of options.

Bouncer put his hands on me. I was in a $1500 suit and $500 shoes. Exactly 1 client in the whole place but made me sit at the bar rather than 2 person table/booth. Talked to the manager about the bouncer. He blew me off. Ordered bistek palomilla with cuban toast. No toast served but got billed for it. Bouncer got in my face for "giving him the eye". Yes I did give you the eye. Not a welcoming place anymore. No longer best cuban food this side of Miami. In fact I am going to get a flight down to MIA, walk 1 block to the airport cafe and liquor store and get a real bistek palomilla with cuban toast. Then go to a world class club with chill bouncers! NY blows.

Love this restaurant, Food is always delicious and fresh. But Giving three stars because during this time with Covid I just didn't feel comfortable picking up food yesterday because you had 2 customers eating on your bench next to your pick up window with no masks. I waited 20 minutes and they were there the whole time without masks or any consideration for folks picking up. I hope in the future you would consider not having folks sit there without masks on. Thank you.
No comment
They shut the air conditioner off in the middle of our dinner. It was like eating in a sauna. We asked the waiter several times to put the air conditioner back on but to no avail. The food was okay.
No comment

Amazing place portions of steak are getting smaller but it's a great place it's also 24 hrs helllo !!! But you should try the steak , Mac n cheese , and flauntas oh yea and the yuca fries to they are made fresh yum !!!
No comment

Love the food here, and it's great that it's 24 hours. Had a great time the other night until our server angrily demanded us to leave a bigger tip than we had. Normally, I am a very good tipper as I am also in the industry, but this was too much for the quality service we received (which was meh but it's a diner so I'm not expecting five star dining). Read through other reviews and seems like it wasn't her first time doing that. Left angry and most likely won't come back.

Great great meal my first time at Coppelia! We came here on a Sunday evening and they were able to seat us right away- all though heads up, if you're a party of two and seated in the back you WILL be sitting on top of another couple, but welcome to NY I guess. Our waiter was super friendly and the food was outstanding. We ordered the oxtail empanadas to start, and split both the cubano and the huevos coppelia- all three were delicious. But I defff recommend the oxtail empanadas to start, they're a small snack so you can order them with anything. I also liked the Coppelia serves breakfast all day long. Great place! Just knocked off a start due to eating on top of my neighbors.

The food is quite good from their breakfast to their dinner menu. It is fine dinning at a low cost, with detail to presentation.

We have eaten here many times now and it never disappoints. The lomo saltado is a must try. I liked it so much I tried cooking it at home.  The hostess and service staff are friendly and welcoming. It might be a bit pricy but definite worth the money.

Stumbled upon Coppelia after a night at the bars, it was the only thing open in the area that wasn't pizza. But I was super impressed. Food was great, and the service was superb. People were super nice and accommodating. I ordered my food online via the Yelp app for takeout and while I was waiting, I was offered a drink and a nice chat. Great experience! Thank you Coppelia!

Pretty Good food for late night service.  Service is really lacking tho. No organization or sections for servers. One of the servers older Spanish guy with glasses was very unpleasant and borderline nasty! I felt as tho I was annoying him just to place my order. He was sassy and flippant. Really ruined my experience.

Their cubano was dry and just toasted bread, and when ordering empanadas we were given the wrong order when they tried fixing there mistake they still messed up the order. Much better cuban spot in Park Slope.

The food was delicious but the waiter I had was more focused on socializing so he forgot about the free iced tea I was supposed to get with my Yelp check in. I literally had to get up and remind him. Other than that, the sweet corn empanadas are delicious. It's one of the best Cuban foods I've tasted, but then again I have t had much cuban

Wow, what a gem!  Excellent Cuban food in a diner setting.  My wife had an excellent Cuban Sandwich.  Great Tostones and  Sweet Plantains.  I blew it and got a hamburger but it had a Cuban flair so I'll not be so hard on myself.  Space itself is interesting, they have a full bar and don't miss their Cafe con Leche!!!!!  Simply outstanding!!!!! I didn't like the bathroom situation though.  Generally speaking, women are disgusting in the bathroom so I don't like sharing with them.  Small knock though.  Outside the bathroom they have a cell phone charger for .99 cents which is pretty cool.
Delicious mango-ginger Caipirinha. Came in solo and sat at the bar. Great service and lively vibe. My oxtail empanadas were delish.

Ate here after the door man at Cafeteria was an Ahole to my gf and I. I'm so happy he was because we got to discover this gem as as a result. I ordered the kale salad with tostones. The salad was amazing and the mojo sauce for the tostones was the BEST I've ever had.  My gf and I promised ourselves to workout for the next two weeks straight just so we can go back and binge on the rest of the menu!! I can't wait. Everything looks sooo good.

This is the most TERRIBLE Experience ... waiter took forever to order and he was rushing us after he came to the table .. food took for ever. When we ask for the manager (a big guy ). He obviously intoxicate ... told us to live if we don't like the service!!! This is so absurd.. i won't recommend this place to nobody ... good look. !!

I get the feeling that this place is much better late at night. But we went during the day and our general impression was that the food was too expensive and none of it was fresh. The taste was there, but unless it's 2AM and we just happen to be in the area we wouldn't return.
Please don't change the chef, recipes or whatever. I love the way the cook. The food is sooo tasty like cooked with love. I will definitely come back here.
I got the fried steak when I went there. The steak was a bit over-cooked and tasted dry. The restaurant vibe was good but maybe the chef wasn't in a good mood that day.

Horrible experience the restaurant lost my cousins card and insisted that we were drunk and we didn't put 2 credit cards and found our card behind there bar. The bartender never apologized I asked him how you found it there his response was "I don't know" there typical managerial sorry was 2 sorry shots. Not professional at all in my opinion there are better places dont waste your time and get disrespected.
Never had a bad meal here...EVER. You'll even be amazed with your side dish.It's evident that they take pride in what they serve.

Coppelia is great. I have some minor gripes but im not a hater takin stars off and all that. Eat here, you'll love it

New favorite restaurant in NYC. The chicken arepas, the corn, the calamari and the avocado milkshake are all incredible. This is a casual diner with a Latin spin and the food is so special and quality. Can't believe they are open 24 hours!!

Went for my birthday dinner on a Saturday night based on the Yelp reviews. Ordered the oxtail empanada- yummy, guacamole with mixed chips- tasty, yucca fries with mojito- very good, lomo saltado- it was a little salty but very tasty and had the mango caipirinha- very strong. I had a good time with my friends. Music was good. Very causal setting. Definitely will go back during happy hour!

The first thing that comes to my mind about this review for Coppelia is - the word compassion. When I tell you how nice and compassionate the bouncer was at Coppelia when we came. He allowed myself and my party to wait in the very small vestibule to escape the cold. He could've chosen to be brash and rude. Like my most bouncers are characterized to be but he wasn't. When I told him how appreciative we were about the simple kindness due to the recent incident with Cafeteria- he was not surprised. He offered his apologies FOR ANOTHER establishment. And said "This isn't the first time he's heard that." We were seated promptly, given the ice water. All the bells and whistles. The bouncer came back to check on us. I wish I got his name. The food was amazing. I ordered the Cubano and an a Oxtail Empanada. Delicious. The staff - magnificent after braving drunken hoards of people through the night. It was around 5am. Coppelia definitely had soothed a wound, with their food and hospitality. We will definitely be back. Love you guys .

Really excellent Cuban food in this diner setting. The nachos with short rib meat and red sangria are a great way to start the meal.   I really enjoyed the shredded pork which goes very well with the yucca underneath it.  The skirt steak is delightfully juicy and expertly cooked.  The desserts by pastry chef Pichet Ong were excellent!  I highly recommend the olive oil cake and the almond tart.  I really hope they add a tres leches cake and a chocolate truffle shaped like a cigar!  Coppelia is a great addition to the neighborhood and a nice place to enjoy a post drinking nosh!

This is one of my favorite places in Manhattan.  I like it because is open 24/7. The staff make you feel like you are home. The  menu is not that big but they have the best dishes for any time of the day Breakfast, brunch, dinner exct.  Also they have a bar with great variety of cocktail mixtures. The tables are always super clean and organized. I've brought here many important people in my live and I've never been disappointed. They only have one restroom though.  Of coarse like every good place in the city, this location is not too big and is always crowded.  I recomend to be prepared to wait sometimes. Very poor service.  Management was unprofessional and pushing people out of their bar while we were eating.

Food was alright, a little disappointed because I expected more based on reviews. Staff are wonderful though.

I'm from Florida and decided to come here with my best friends because as a Cuban, I enjoy then cuisine! First the menu is very customized to be more of a cuban-american style, which is fine! But if you come here as a hispanic individual you will notice immediately that a lot of the classic dishes are not the same nor can you change them. So besides the food, the service was god awful. We had 3 waiters and an older male continue to show at our table. We ordered a round of drinks and never got them. At the end of our meal the man came back, threw the check onto the table when we asked for separate checks after, he got agitated and said "Oh! We don't do that." And walked away. When we confronted him, he said "okay fine we can." The food was subpar, having my chicken over cooked and the service was extremely unprofessional.
Great food!!! Ordered a grilled chicken sandwich, loved it!! Great atmosphere!! My son ordered a cheeseburger and my husband had the Cuban sandwich, they both enjoyed it!!

This restaurant has great food. Period. It's the service that I have a problem with. We order with them fairly regularly (once a week) and most times we pickup. When we do order in, we use seamless because if you call to order you are on hold forever. And heaven forbid something is wrong with your order when it arrives. You go into the eternal hold loop that has you hanging up after 10 minutes waiting on the line. If you want to eat the delicious food here either go to the restaurant and eat there or pickup and CHECK your order.

The food here is absolutely delicious. I have never had a dish and I didn't like. The drinks are also pretty tasty. The only downside is sometimes it gets really crowded and loud. Otherwise it's a great place to meet up with some friends and catch up.

This is my go-to spot when I'm in Chelsea. Whether it's a quick pre-theater bite (their kitchen is blazingly fast)or happy hour with multiple rounds(amazing happy hour deals on very well balanced cocktails, this is the spot. I've been known to come great for cocktails, ceviche, appetizers, entree and dessert. Their desserts are especially good, including their spiked milkshakes, and they always have an entree, appetizer, and special at the very least on a rotating specials menu. Everything from Peruvian chicken to Cuban Chinese lo mein. Love this place.

Don't come here! Server - short Mexican lady had the nerve to ask me to tip her 18% once I came out of the restroom on my way out. I rounded down to 17.5 % and she was upset and asked if there was a problem with the service. They kept on rushing us to go out since they were ppl waiting. It was as rainy day but the bus boys kept on coming to clear stuff and asking how we were doing. Food was subpar. An enchilada for $19 was meh and that was a house special. Tiny portions. I didn't complain or said anything but this ungrateful waitress feels so entitled. She doesn't know that the tip amounts are "recommended." Ended up giving her an extra $1 so I can get the heck out and make her happy. Man, don't understand how this place has good ratings at all. Crappy staff and service.

Great atmosphere, great snacks to go with beers or cocktails. We had a great meal, desserts are ok in a sense that they are not as authentic (flan) as real Cuban one. We will definitely come back and bring friends here for the great food and drinks!

I am a tough critic and rarely ever give 5 stars..I rarely even give 4...But I had dinner here the other night and the food was amazing. Delicious cuban food with amazing flavors. It's reasonably priced and the atmosphere/ambience is pleasant. I got the Lomo Saltado which was a short rib stir fry and it was honestly one of the best dishes I've ever had. The cuban sandwich is great and I highly recommend this place!

Had a basic breakfast there yesterday.  2 eggs, grilled buttered cuban bread, potatoes, coffee.  I happened in for the early bird special so all that with tip was only $10.  Nice place, food didn't blow me away, but for the price it was fine.

The Arepas are no joke. Highly recommend. The Cubano sandwich was pretty darn good too. Friendly staff.

Great place for a late night snack.  Love the Empanadas!  Full bar too.  Open 24 hours.  Excellent service.  You can get anything from some appetizers to a wonderful dinner here.  So happy we found it.

Recently had a friend in town for the new year. We went to Coppelia and were impressed with a great meal and great service. Our waiter, Juan Carlo was very friendly, attentive and knowledgeable. We had the filet mignon special on huitlacoche mushroom base. It was delicious and tender. The drinks are always really tasty and high quality. It's reasonable and I've been back many times for lunch and dinner as I live in the neighborhood.  Highly recommend.

I love this place, their food is just so yummy!! They are also opened like super late which is great for when you come out of a night of partying. Yucca fries: delicious, Lomo salteado: delicious, everything is just great. This is a place worth coming to.

Best Lomo Saltado we've ever had!! I love all the flavors in there; all the sauces. They worked together so well. And the meat was the most tender I've ever had. We also got the Cuban sandwich, but that was only alright. Totally coming back to this place for their lomo saltado!!

Love this place with all my heart, it's a regular spot for me. It's pretty expensive side but great diner vibes, great guac, they put the right amount of tequila in their drinks, and my favorite dish in the arroz con pollo.

This place (food&service) is consistently outstanding. The  churrasco was as close to perfection as one can get. From the flavor to the temp. I love love love Coppelia! Have been at least 5 times and have never had a bad experience. Facade makes this place look like a typical diner but it's anything but that! Delicious cuban food as well as typical dishes served with a Cuban twist. My personal favorites are the huevos rancheros or the Pernil. The food is delicious and realistically portioned, unlike other restaurants/diners. The loaded milkshakes are really good. Overall, it wasn't a super memorable experience, but I'd like to come back to give it another try with some other interesting looking things on their menu.

Mojo sauce! On everything , no seriously goes great with everything ! Ok I jest, but the mojo sauce (pronounced "mo-ho") is complimentary to the tostones, and that vegetarian burger is yum yum. I ordered the turkey burger and did not get to indulge in any other items at the moment. Great place to go during the witching hour (we went at 415am) and listen to conversations. One girl from a group was speaking quite articulately of the way her significant other was giving her a jolly rogering. Another couple were discussing regrets of the overconsumption of certain libations and the waiter was kind enough to cater to our needs despite all of this going on at the same time. You want good food, just go here. Seriously. And if you need a sweet fix walk down to Donut Pub (see my review of them) and get yourself a Boston kreme , a jelly donut ( raspberry jelly!) and a glazed donut washed down with some coffee or tea (I like tea). Do this and hate me later.

Must say I expect much more of this diner. The long line wait seemed like it was super exclusive to be in there, but once we sat we got to ordering. Delicious, excellent, great service and convenient location (7th & 14th). The food is good here but recently I was absolutely baffled by the service we received. We arrived and were seated without having a server welcome us. We had to flagged down a server to finally place our order. We waited 45 minutes for our drink orders and the restaurant wasn't even full. Once appetizers came out, the server forgot one of the appetizers. No one communicated to us that our original server was clocking out until we noticed no one had come to check up on us or given us our drinks. We flagged another server who then finally stated he would be taking over the other server's shift. The food arrives with one of the orders being cold. Probably because it had been sitting out for so long. Without complaining, we asked if the food could be reheated. After being reheated it was still cold. Once the bill arrives, we notice a discrepancy on the bill. Immediately the server says one moment and calls the deep voice lady manager. We never asked to speak to the manager and the server never asked us what the discrepancy was. The manager had a HORRIBLE presence as she was instantly confrontational and accused us of having bad manners. Her attitude was UNCALLED FOR, OBNOXIOUS, and UNPROFESSIONAL! She stated that we had intentionally waited til the previous server left to complain when we were none the wiser of server schedules. We were in the middle of explaining to her our point of view, when she immediately walked away from us and threw the bill on the table. This uses to be one of our favorite NYC restaurants. So much so, that we recommended it to all of our friends. However, for this experience ALONE, I will not recommend this place!

Coppella is a small cute restaurant on west 14th street. I visited this shop after I went wedding dress shopping with my girls! Staff was very attentive, and the food was great. Went to Coppelia last night after the Knicks game. Love this spot. Been here before. It's predominantly a Cuban menu but has some other Latin choices as well like Arepa, Empanada, etc. Always delicious! This time I was eating light because it was late so I went with the Spinach Salad with a balsamic dressing, sweet dry figs, goat cheese, candied pecans(very slightly sweet which was so good with the goat cheese) and I added chicken. Was a nice portion I finished it all. My boyfriend had the ropa veija which is the shredded beef with a side of rice and beans also delicious! I love that they have the menu on the table as the placemat because then you don't have to keep asking the waiter for a menu. This place is usually packed but yesterday we got a seat. Never disappoints. Best part is they are open 24/7 so you can gave their delicious food anytime of the day. Good drink menu too. If you don't want something alcoholic try the Mexican hot chocolate which I believe is iced. Yum!

This restaurant has disappointed me today. From the service to the quantity to price of the food,  this restaurant is pretty mediocre. The food took forty minutes to come out and did not even come out in a complete set so we had to wait and our food got cold.
