Looks really cozy and nice but the food was terrible. The cheese croquetas taste horrendous, they forgot to put chimichurri to the churrasco which also tasted bad (I'm cuban and I know my food) It was also burnt although I asked for it medium. It was just a bad experience overall

Normally I would give this place 5 stars.  I absolutely love the food, drinks and ambiance-- but the visit I had today was far from pleasant.  We walked into a lack luster welcome from a tall girl with a forest/jungle print track jacket, bushy long hair, big nose and big face(didn't catch her name).  She acted as if she was bothered by our presence.  She barely spoke and sat us at the bar without giving us table options.  I kept my eyes on her unfriendly big face and she wasn't doing shit!!! She gave the same half ass greeting to each customer.  She stood around multiple times glaring at her cell phone and with her hands in her pockets.  I guess it was more important than showing up for work and actually WORKING.  However, I'm not going to let her completely tarnish my feeling towards the establishment in general, but someone needs to check this chick.

Looking for some great food late night it doesn't get any better than being open 24/7. The food was absolutely amazing! I walked into Jamaican music being played all night and it made my food even better!! Don't pass by this amazing find!!

I agree that it certainly doesn't feel like a diner but I have 0 complaints! The food is great and the service is efficient. I also love that it has a full bar and is open 24 hrs. I hope to come back sometime soon.
No comment

Such a great find in Chelsea! Juan Carlos was a very attentive waiter and the food and drinks were all delicious - would highly recommend the Matador and margarita if you enjoy spicy drinks. Great experience.
No comment

This is probably my least favorite place I have ever been to ever. To get in they act like it's Studio 54, to have your order served you better count on dying first, and to get good food you better believe in miracles. I serve people for a living, I don't fault the establishment for the outcome I fault the individuals. Unfortunately in this case, I couldn't even tell you who those individuals we're. If it wasn't for my date my butt would be in bed in my 7th dream, but because I'm not and I'm subjected to this nonsense I'm bitter and upset. Are you leaving the club and hungry? Well then good luck to you and, don't look to Coppelia. I can't speak to any other hour or meal, but my 5am experience left much to be desired and I regret staring down the bouncer to get it.
No comment

Came here on a whim with my friends on a late night food run after work and was amazed. The food was amazing!! Words can't even express how good it was. I ordered the pernil main course meal and cleaned my plate! Had the tres leche mango cake for dessert and it was so good mmmm. Can't wait to come back!!

Really surprised by what a great brunch I had here! We felt adventurous so decided to go outside of our usual east village brunch options. Had multiple empanadas (the oxtail one is amazing!) and omelettes. Service was good and the place just felt like a traditional Cuban diner. No frills no fuss just good Cuban food. Would come back!
No comment

Food is very good and the atmosphere is charming. I've been here countless times and will return. Tonight I requested the enchiladas suizas... Even though they looked quickly put together with no expertise (the chicken was thrown on top of the enchiladas and not rolled up inside the tortilla), the flavors were still yummy.  I will return to Coppelia. But, if my enchiladas ever look again, like they did tonight, I will certainly send then back to the kitchen! I hope Coppelia is not lowering their standards!
Really love this quaint 24 hour spot on 14th.  Don't miss the Ropa Vieja and so much more on the menu...appealing drink selections as well.  Always delicious and fun here.
This place was amazing! Open 24/7 with excellent food and great service. As a group of 4, we shared 4 starters and a side, and everything was delicious! 5 stars all round
No comment

Menu is fantastic - so many good items to choose from. We had the Octopus and the Calamari along with the Pollo a la Plancha, the striped sea bass, and their braised pork dish. Drinks are service are equally delightful

This place was amazing! Really friendly and fast. I ordered after midnight, and the food (I ordered five dishes,  to go) came in 15 minutes. I had their spicy tequila dink while I was waiting, which was nice but not incredible. The food (salmon, empanadas, Cesar salad) though we're all excellent, and much better than most food you can get at a 24hr place. I'd come back here any time.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here around 10pm on Tuesday night to grab a late dinner. I had fish tacos as an appetizer which were really good and the steak for the main course which was also amazing. They had music playing which wasn't too loud and the staff was very attentive. Sometimes too attentive, my friend and I had our conversation interrupted like 8 times with them asking us if we were done with our food. In all its a great food spot and a bonus is that they're open 24 hours! Would definitely return here.
No comment

SHAME. This was so disappointing. So expensive for not even a decent meal. I got the pernil with yucca because I figured a Cuban place couldn't mess that up. WRONG. The pernil was so dry I was coughing and the yucca was not even half way cooked through. I told the waitress about the issues and she said "ok I'll let the chef know". She did not offer anything else and didn't take it off the bill. Will never go back

Two years ago, this was one of our favorite places.  Now it simply frustrates us every time we attempt to enjoy Coppelia. The food is cold, the portions small and quite undercooked.  Somehow the pernil was burnt and raw at the same time.  Even the fried yucca comes out undercooked and flaccid.  Third time we were disappointed and it's the last.
No comment
No comment

Love this place ! Food was awesome. Nice spot. Order arroz con pollo. It was delicious. It was so much food I ate on the same meal for three days. ( I took it home ) my best friend ordered the same. I also had the guacamole for an appetizer and she has the quesadillas! Amaze balls all of it. Only think I hated was the service was extremely slow , and it took forever for our food to come.

Man, you really can't beat taste-good, feel-good food here. Holy cow. There are no words. Just trust and come here. You will NOT be disappointed and WILL become addicted. The nachos and lomo are so Bomb it's unreal....

2nd visit here but I made sure to come back! The restaurant was busy, but a table for 2 came quickly as we walked in. The menu has a good amount of dishes to choose from, however I chose to stick with what I had before.. CHILAQUILES and an empanada! The waiter took some time before he made his way to take our order & wasn't as cheerful as he was to other patrons. But the other staff plus the food plus the wait time were definitely 5 stars. Free soda with a check in!
Had the chorizo and octopus sandwich. It was so good and the veggie quesadilla. And the corn and cheese empanada. All was so so good

Are here three times. Two times in one day yesterday. I had the chicken sandwich with a side salad. Both very good. The bread was toasted well and they did not skimp on the guacamole inside the sandwich. The kale salad has some cheese crumbles and light dressing which was refreshing. My cousin had the omelette. The bacon was undercooked and soggy, which was disappointing. We returned late night and I had the arepa. The corn shell was very crispy and the chicken very juicy. My cousin had the flautas which he enjoyed and our friend had the salmon with purple mash, which he said was good. The night server seemed to be rushing and was easily annoyed which took away from the experience. The first time I came here, I had the arroz con pollo and a mojito. The arroz con pollo was good and the mojito was delicious. Overall this place hasn't disappointed. Would definitely come back.
No comment
No comment
No comment

...Accommodated my late night order made at 12:27am. I ordered a cheeseburger, fries, and Cuban sandwich. The food was decent. It arrived cold-ish an hour later at my hotel.  However, the food was still flavorful. Had it not been so late, I'm sure the food would have arrived sooner. I'm assuming that I was probably the driver's last stop as he dropped his last round of orders throughout the city. I imagine if eaten at the restaurant the quality would have been much better.

I really enjoyed my meal here. My fiance and I stopped in for dinner and drinks after running errands in the area. I ordered a mojito, which was refreshing and strong! They had many food options and I had a difficult time deciding, but ultimately settled on the pollo a la plancha. As basic as it sounds on paper (chicken breast over quinoa with kale and avocado), it was very flavorful. If I could cook like this for myself I wouldn't eat out so much! If we're back down in the area I'll definitely check it out. I think it would be a great place for dinner and drinks with friends too.
No comment
Amazing nachos! I came during a busy time so service was understandably slow. The food made up for this! Awesome flavors! Perhaps a new fave.
No comment

What a cool little place! It's a Cuban/Latin style diner with a lively menu, staff, and interior. It's a fun spot to eat at and for NYC I found it quite inexpensive. We came in for Brunch on a Saturday and even though it was packed, our group of six was somehow seated within ten minutes. A variety of dishes were ordered: Chilaquiles, huevos rancheros, the Cuban, kale salad, and the torta de milanesa. We shared bite and everything was super tasty. Mimosa's, Michelada's and coffee were bountiful. Portions were generous but not gluttonous. The best part? They're open 24/7.

It was my first time coming there for brunch, and it was beyond my expectations: really good professional stuff , manager of the place Carlo was very friendly and nothing made us wait or hesitate to come here next time . My food octopus sandwich was amazing, highly good quality and tasted so that I really regret that I don't have a second stomach to order more. And of course the drinks, was made by good alcohol plus natural flavors what was amazing. And thanks to the waitress Patricia was super nice and friendly. I'll definitely recommend this place and will back for sure
Definitely worth it! When u need a late night snack come here. You will not be disappointed.

OMG and baby Jesus!  This place is delicious!!! They make anything in the menu by order! I've never been to a place were I can say it FREAKING DELICIOUS!!!  I am in love with this place! I had the chocolate mousse and I still dream about it!! From the texture to the actual taste was a glimpse of heaven! COME HERE!!
Consistently good food and lively atmosphere. Can be hard to get a table, and usually very loud, but fun and tasty. Do yourself a favor and get their masterful Lomo Saltado.
Nice and quiet 8am Sunday breakfast, super yummy and reasonably priced. Definitely come back as a regular. Café con leche y hash of costillas muy deliciosas.
No comment
No comment

After last night, I am adding Coppelia to my list of top food places to go to in the city.  The service was excellent, the casual vibe as well, and the food was on point.  Wait time was zero, even though it looks pretty popular from what I see on Yelp and even though there were already lots of people inside.  The other highlight of Coppelia is that it is 24 hours.  I know where I'm going the next time I stay out too late.  You can also unlock a free iced tea or soda from Yelp, which I forgot.  Overall, I'd highly recommend this place to everyone who is reading this at the moment.
No comment

I came here for a lunch date and I was just generally not impressed. The staff was rude and the food was ok. We were sat in the back corner which was very loud as it was right by the kitchen and it was also a very small area. I asked the hostess if we could move as another party in a booth left shortly after we sat down. She said we could but then the waiter started yelling at me telling me I couldn't just move. Even though he was the one who told us we needed to ask the hostess.  So by the time that discussion ended and we were seated we were both over it. My date and I both had the Turkey Club which was ok, nothing extraordinary. I'm not sure if our experience was soured by the fact that it was lunch time and the place was pretty packed. I would consider stopping by again maybe at a different time of day.

No comment

Ended up at this gem after a night out with friends, greeted by high level security and locked door immediately dulled the mood to eat but after getting inside all that changed. Food was great, by 4am it was packed but I will be back.

This place will not seat you until your whole party has arrived, which is frustrating because they will make you sit at the bar even if the place is pretty much empty.  That is my only beef with this place.  The brunch is really, really good, portions were hearty and very reasonably priced.  The restaurant has an old school diner feel to it- informal and impersonal.  Service was average, but what you would expect from this type of establishment.  Would definitely come here again.

Absolutely loved this place. The cocktails, the food, the staff, the music- all phenomenal. Had the churrasco, highly recommend. The plantains melt in your mouth & the chimmichuri is perfect atop the steak. Wide range of Latin American food available here. I will absolutely be back!

It's convenient because it's 24 hours. The dinner is more on the expensive side but the breakfast is amazing at any time. Genuine Cuban food. I had a Sangria and a spiked milkshake. The milkshake was too strong and I wasn't looking to get wasted so I didn't finish it. The root beer float is AMAZING. Cute place and atmosphere.
The tacos were so awesome I practically inhaled them. My wife had a mojito that put to shame countless others that attempt to match the real drink. Great atmosphere and kids friendly.

Good food served here, but busy, and not for a quick bite. The manager does not know that the in-house music is so loud that it forces people to yell out their order to the server or makes a simple conversation with your mate(s) quite difficult. Service could be improved too.
I had the nachos and tacos plate.  The portions were large and the food tasted great!

Great spot when you need a food fix at all hours of the night. Really fun crowd and good food. The steak was a little overdone (I asked for medium well, but it came very, very well done), but still tasty especially considering nothing else was open. The guacamole was delicious.

Been coming here for years and have tried everything on the menu. This is truly one of the best restaurants ever. Food is amazing. Drinks are amazing. Service is amazing and the ambiance is great no matter the time of day.
Amazing! The food was to die for! Everything tastes so delicious! My mom was obsessed! The workers are super friendly and very kind. Such a beautiful and fun environment and very good Spanish music.
No comment

Went there after a movie premiere with a good friend, I was starving but the way my taste buds are set up just anything won't do. I ordered and when my food arrived the smell alone was amazing. It awaken senses I didn't know I had. Not to mention I wanted to order the entire menu, a large variety of yumminess and they have desserts too  the staff was helpful and friendly even with it being busy they checked on us and gave suggestions. The prices are beyond reasonable. Bring a sweater or shawl the AC was on freeze them to death and the bathroom was even colder lol but it was an amazing experience I'd recommend it to all my foodie friends.

I came for a brunch to see someone important.  Now, the food is ok.  I ordered the Challah French Toast, but they forgot to drizzle the Dulce de Leche, which is no big deal.  I ordered the breakfast steak and it was as thin as a carbon paper, which is fine since i did not want a big thick steak in the morning.  The problem with the steak was that it wasn't seasoned well, so I ended up with salt.  Truly good food do not need salt.  Great thing about this place is that it has varieties of dishes to select from, it's usually empty enough (away from where the tourist would visit), 24 hrs open and it is very home like cooking.  So, if you want something casual and down to earth, this would be a good place to be.
The food was tasty but what really caught my eyes was the Latin Chips. Other than that , the only flaw it had was the weak margaritas. Thumbs up though.

Outstanding!  The fuse of American and Cuban is radical.  I tried the Mac n Cheese with Chicharrón and the diablo shrimp with yuca fries.  Everything was delicious.  The Diablo shrimp left a little to be desired.

No comment

This place was great. Not only was it opened 24/7 but it also has that free check in promo. I didn't redeem it but the food was so good. It was filling and the portions were really big. I got the arepa with fries and that filled me up. Thumbs up!!

Have been here for drinks only. The food i have had has been shared food like tacos and some rice which has been good but hopefully I can go back to eat and actual meal instead of just drinks. The service is good too the bartender makes sure that everyone is doing well or if the customers need anything else from him.
Amazing Guacamole with plantain and corn chips. Drinks were on point. Churrasco was well done

this is the second time ive been here and after getting a better look and feel of the place i really like it! for starters service was amazing! As i waited for my date at the bar, the bartender served me and answered all of my food and drink questions very enthusiastically and kindly. The waiter was also extremely pleasant and patient. The food was incredible! Even though this place is slightly on the pricey side, I felt ok about paying those prices because of the amazing quality of everything in return. And for a 24 hour place, everything was on point. I will definitely be returning soon!

Great food and friendly service. Five of us (including 3 kids) had a great meal. Calamari appetizer was very tasty as were the burgers and empanadas. Cuban sandwich was just right and washed down by a Cuban beer or too (Hatuey). Salud!

I came to Copellia for some breakfast after a night of partying. The restaurant was suggested to me by a worker at cafeteria because they ran out of room. When we got there I attempted to order a meal but the menu was in both English and Spanish. The meal I ordered came with carrots and raisins in it and I didn't eat them and the staff treated me like it was my fault that their menu was illegible to me and didn't state what was in the meal. I will not be back here as their menu is to complex for my uneducated mind.

Food is really good. The waiters are Latinos and really cute...lol. The environment felt authentic and the salsa music playing was right on point. The yuka fries were the best I've had. The mojito drink is tasty. Overall, I recommend it and you won't be disappointed.

One of my favorite restaurants in NYC right now. The lomo saltado is the best comfort food dish ever made. The kale salad is hearty, crunchy and cheesy. The cuban sandwich is my favorite in NYC. These are the standouts, but really the entire menu is amazing. High quality ingredients and excellent value.
Ordered food to be delivered. Delivery was glacial. Food very average. Better options exist

Every neighborhood needs this kind of spot. Casual diner and snazzy joint - what a great concept. Good Spanish wines, delicious guacamole with addictive plantains and yuccas (?) chips. I've been here before and enjoyed good entrees and salads but this time we did lots of apps. Loved the empanadas. Highlight was the trio of sorbets for dessert - the coconut!! Wow!

I've had the omelet both times I've been and it has been great. The service is why I only rated this place three stars. The first time I went there, the waiter was outstanding, but the last time I went, the server was extremely rude. They were rude to us while ordering and when we finished we were told that we needed to go because they needed the table immediately, not even giving us a minute to sit after signing the check . I, having had jobs in customer service, consider myself extremely polite and non confrontational with waiters, so his rudeness could not have been in response to me. I was disappointed in my last experience because my first time there was great. The food still was good though.

We ordered the Cuban sandwich which was mediocre and the fish tacos which smelled like rotten food. When we complained about it they said it smelled fine and that that's how it always smells - "fresh". They offered to exchange it but at that point we were already disappointed.

Good food! Cuban/Peruvian style! It reminded me of back home! Its a casual dinning place, dim light, loud, familiar, food was good!! We had ropa vieja, arroz con frijoles y maduros, sandwich cubano and a salad! Everything was good!! Fast service and nice employees!

This place is great for when you are out past midnight and want something more than pizza, street meat. Everything I've had has been good, although I have never had a craving for anything that would cause me to leave my place for a visit.
No comment

Was here two weeks ago for the first time and could not wait to come back. The beef empanadas and the sweet cheese & corn empanadas are outrageous!  The best I have ever had.  Cool vibe...friendly service.

Recently ordered some food from these folks for delivery and it was not good in fact it was pretty bad. Chili Relleno arrived looking like it had been kicked down the street and had very little flavor my partner ordered the breaded chicken sandwich also very little flavor and it was $40.  I won't be back.

We've been here many times over the years and every time it's consistent good food, drinks & service. Their caipirinhas are on point and we are happy to have a place to meet up with friends 24/7 with a warm, unpretentious atmosphere and delicious comfort food. Keep up the great work.

What a great gem on 14th between 7th and 8th! The menu has so many great options and at such a great price. One great thing is that it's open 24/7 so I can go there whenever I'm having so bad cravings.. I went for brunch and had the blue corn pancakes which I really enjoyed. The dulce de leche french toast is very good too, so soft and moist but just a little on the sweet side. I can't wait to go back to try their other items!

One of the best places for Cubanos outside of Miami and one of the best places for cortados outside of Miami.

The pork chop was pretty good. The atmosphere was really loud with people screaming everywhere. And we had to wait half an hour for our table. We had to wait an hour for our food and it arrived cold.

I give a two because the tree leche was so good. But other than that, I will not be ordering from here. I placed an Oder, they sent me the wrong Oder. And when they finally sent me what I had Oder it was poor like they didn't wan to cook it at all. $25 dollars spend on nothing cause it was really disappointing. Never again.

Such an amazing experience. The food is wonderful. I highly recommend the nachos. Oh. My. God. I'm a Mexican American from South Texas and I still consider these the best nachos I've ever had. Seriously exceptional.

The food is okay. Portion is very small for the arepa sandwich so don't get that if you're hungry. You get two sauce cup sized sandwiches -- more like a tapa dish. Very pricy for that portion. Our waiter was very distracted the whole time while taking our orders ... Charged us for the free drinks we got from checking into Yelp! But corrected when we asked.

I love this restaurant, I really do, and I've been a regular here since the restaurant first opened. I literally was one of their very first customers. I remember looking in the window watching the construction. Tonight I felt ultimate disrespect from the door guy. The security door guy at 2:30am today was very rude to me and my guess who by the way is a celebrity, that I brought to coppelia for the first time. The security door guy was rude but we let it go. Until he yelled at me and a group of my friends, telling us we were to loud. When in fact we weren't being "to loud" at all and we weren't disturbing anyone at all. The place was almost empty at the time. I have never felt so disrespected in all the years that I've come to coppelia. The food and the service are always excellent. The staff is amazing but the security tonight was unacceptable and extremely rude without cause.

I'm OBSESSED with this place. The service is outstanding from the moment you walk in. The food is incredible and the drinks equally as incredible. I've had the Saltado, Tacos (combo with steak chorizo and chicharron), and the skirt steak. All incredible. The michelada is the best in the city, and their tamarind margarita is also one of the best I've had. I always come around 2 in the morning. And it always impresses me with service, food and drink. Very rare to find this kind of place in New York. Thank you Coppelia!

Staff was very rude to my party; the volume at the restaurant in general was very loud (loud music, patrons talking loudly) but for some reason a server kept coming over to tell our table specifically to "keep it down" because customers were complaining which was a lie. When we asked to speak to a manager we were greeted with more disrespect and basically told we could leave so I will never visit this restaurant again
I love this diner. Best in New York. Run by lovely brothers. Get the steak and eggs or Cuban sandwich and yucca fries.

I accidentally discovered this place before I even moved to NYC. I've been a loyal customer for 5 years now- amazing food, great service, lovely ambient and reasonable prices. I bring all of my friends and family members visiting here as well!

The food in general wasn't what I was expecting, the place is really loud and the service took forever. Not a very good experience in general. But could be good for a drunk meal after the club in the middle of the night since they're open 24/7

This is the second time that I am here and I have to say the entire experience has been AWESOME. From the wait staff, bartender, EVERYONE. The food is absolutely DELICIOUS. If you have not tried this place TRUST ME YOU MUST COME BY.

This place is good. Better to eat in than order to go though. The food will not travel all that well. I'm from Miami and this place made me feel like I was back home for a bit. This has become my go to when I'm in charge of selecting a place for dinner.

Maybe it was just our particular waiter. But he gave me (a white person) an outrageous racist vibe! So we just left. Too bad because it looked like a nice place to eat and drink. this kind of racist scene can be common though in nyc when in south american and in this case cuban restaurants.
Wonderful culinary experience. Top notch and very tasty. Fun desserts they make right there.

I think this is probably one of the most amazing, and classiest diners open 24/7! Great Cuban food, a little pricer but it's worth it. Everything I have had on the menu including its drinks are phenomenal. Staff is always nice and friendly, service is quick. Sometimes there is a slight wait.

2am in the morning and hungry?? My boyfriend and I were searching on yelp and came across Coppelia, read the reviews and had to come try it. I was sold on the Lomo Saltado especially with all the reviews and my boyfriend ordered the Cubano. The Lomo Saltado here is definitely the most flavorful one I have ever had. The short ribs were super tender, melt in your mouth good. It was a bit salty for my liking though but still delicious. The Cubano was okay only because I am not a huge fan but my boyfriend found it pretty good. The meat was tender and definitely full of flavor, we also had the yucca fries with it which was my first time trying it. So what do I recommend? The Lomo Saltado thats for sure... oh and check in on yelp and you can get a free drink!

I had a great experience here! Affordable, delicious brunch with NO WAIT on a weekend? I'll be back :)

The food here is mediocre, dont bother ordering a burger because its the size of a slider, I asked for Maduros and got a few burnt pieces, what a joke...just go to McDonalds or Burger King then this place

I have literally spent over 10k with my friend here every year for five years. The menu changed and the food is now sub par.  The staff is ok but it's just not good anymore.  Over 10k and not even a free drink, not even once.  When I complained about the food taste changes to the menu the hostess shrugged her shoulders. AVOID THIS PLACE.  The food just wasn't good and neither is the vibe here.

Coppelia, you're the best. I dream about your salmon and purple mashed potatoes. Your delivery is always nicely plated, fast, and hot. Our go-to delivery if we are hosting guests bc it is always great.
No comment

Ah-ma-zing! I stopped by Downtown NY to pick up a friend on a late-night bus and we were both starving. I looked up 24-hour fare and decided on Coppelia. It is so much more than just a late-night diner. With delicious food (try their quesadillas and mango pancakes, courteous owners, and a cute, clean vibe, Coppelia is definitely a restaurant to frequent all the time, not just at 2 AM!

When you're looking for a great spot for Spanish food that's open very late, this is your spot. They have great Cuban food for a great price! Very worth it, I get a mix of things but I love getting a mix of rice beans meat cheese and they make perfect! There always a good amount of people there so you never feel like you just walked into a dead spot! The waiters are all so lovely!

It's open 24 hours which is awesome and an alternative to Cafeteria and the line they have going on there. I loved all of my meal from here. Now the only sucky part is not being able to order drinks because it was close to 4am. But you won't regret coming to eat here. It's lovely.

I stumbled upon Coppelia one Friday afternoon while looking for a quality lunch place in the area. The menu items I experienced still haunt me, taunting me to come back. So, any occasion I can think of (family visiting, in the mood for Cuban food etc), I make my way over to Coppelia! The most mind-blowing thing I had was the oxtail empanada: juicy, overstuffed oxtail, with a crema fresca/sour cream topping and queso fresco. I believe there were also some pickled onions and/or a green, herbacious sauce, however that cannot be confirmed. We also dabbled in the sweet corn empanadas and an avocado milkshake. Let me tell you, if you've never had an avocado milkshake, stop reading this review and run to Coppelia, because your life has yet to be crowned by this achieving moment.

I came here one night extremely intoxicated and extremely hungry. Kudos to the wait staff that put up with me, and fed me some amazing food. I had some concoction with chicken rice and beans in a bowl that was terrific. My friend had some empanadas that were tiny, but delicious. I certainly recommend this place for late night eats.

This is something I have to come eat EVERY time in in NY. I've even thought about flying in just to eat it and flying back. My favorite is the oxtale empenada, I always try to take someone new and see what they say. Never heard any complaints, just that "they can't wait to come back". I usually always get the churrasco, might switch it up next time. But it always comes through. This is a gem in NY, that surprisingly not a lot of people know about. Word of mouth will get it there!

I loved this restaurant, and I'm bringing my mom when I come back into town! The bartender was so friendly and the food is great! Try the classic mojito!

If I could give negative star I would. This is mostly for their terrible service. Food was delicious, plenty of choices, great mojitos and open 24/7. What more could you want?

I had dinner on a weekday and it was about 60% filled with customers.  The service was good and the food was good.  The other customers seemed to know all of the servers.  The charging station near the bathrooms was very interesting and the price of $1 seemed ok.

Delicious Cuban food in a fun diner environment! We got the quesadilla, the empanadas and the yuca fries. Would 100% suggest getting the quesadilla, I usually don't get quesadillas at restaurants, but this was decadent! I didn't care for the yuca fries, but everything else we got was delicious. Would recommend for some yummy cuban food!

Sitting here at the bar at midnight for the 4th nights in a row. This place is great. Rented an apartment across the street and found this place by accident. Just tried it because of the location. Had dinner the first night and it was great. Been for drinks, appetizers and desserts every night since. Have a new reason to come to NYC from LA. This place is happening. Food is delicious.

My boyfriend and I have had this spot on our list of places for the longest, specifically their Cuban sandwich. We finally got around to trying this spot during brunch and we were not disappointed at all! The sandwich was perfectly crispy and flavorful! we also got a free soda for checking in on yelp. the service was great as well despite it being busy. the menu it self looked like everything could be good so we definitely will be coming back to try more! I just got a craving for the Cuban just writing about it!

Yumm!!!! Definitely a place I'll be returning to. Had the fish tacos and the French toast (I know weird mix) and both were great. The fish tacos are very small, sometimes I eat this as my dinner but that didn't work here, that's why I added the French toast and they are superb!! Mine could've used a little more dulce de leche drizzle but they are the best I've had.  If it was on my way to work I think I would go daily for breakfast. Love that it's open 24 hours and will likely be returning soon!

Wife had Ropa Vieja, and I had a Cubano Sandwich. Great service, excellent food. We will come back.

LOVED this place. It's small but we got seated quickly for dinner and service was great all night long. I had the octopus salad and yucca fries which were delicious. Wine was nice and I wanted to come back the next day. This restaurant actually has a bunch of "sister" venues so I'll be trying these out too.

I had the cubano sandwich. It was made well but was $10 and came with no sides. The sandwich itself was tasty but not anything special. Service was good and attentive. Place is a little dark and dim on the inside but otherwise no complaints.

Went for some late night food because they are open 24/7. Doorman was incredibly rude to me and my friends. After an unprecedented wait, the food wasn't even that good. Save yourself the anguish of dealing with a bunch of pompous assholes and go to a diner for some late night food.
Recently discovered this place and love it. Good prices, good food and open 24 hours! Nice staff and cool interior as well. Glad to have this around the corner.

The vibe of this place was cool, very diner like but wasn't serving up diner foods. I should have probbaly anticipated this before coming, but I did wish there were more vegetarian or pescatarian options. I got the tuna salad sandwich and I found it to be a bit sad looking. It was a small plate, and it was more like crackers/biscuits that held the tuna salad mixture. A little disappointed about the dish, I definitely wouldn't order it again. However, I did have a couple bites of my friend's vegeterian burger and it was surprisingly good! Very flavourful and not at all dry.
So after clubbing and drinking this is a great 24 hour restaurant. The food was good. I had the Club Sandwich and my partner had the Pollo... Both were good. And the service was good.

Great local diner. The fact it's 24hr is a huge bonus when stumbling home at 4am and in need of some food that won't possibly kill you. Mexican coke too!!! There's no reason to travel to this spot. It's far from mind blowing but if in the neighbourhood and want cheap Latin diner food you're in luck.

Let me start off by saying this place should have gotten all 5 stars. The food was delicious. The environment was cool. But the service was terrible. Our waitress took 10 minutes to get our appetizer order. We finished the appetizer and then sat waiting another 10 minutes to wait to order the main course. Then she only gave us one drink. Never asked if we were good or wanted more. She was hanging out talking with other waitresses and paid no mind to us. When we were done a bus boy got us a box and cleared our table while we waited another 10+ minutes to get the check. And after seeing us sitting there with no drinks and no food finally comes over and says you guys good? We had to ask for the check. She was absolutely terrible. And it's a shame because food was really really good.

I didn't really order an entree, but if their fries are on point, I'm guessing the entire menu is darn right delicious. I may be wrong, but I believe their ketchup is either homemade, or they added spices and a little bit of BBQ sauce. My fiancé had a burger with chicharon and it looked DIVINE. The entrees are pretty pricey, but their sandwiches/burgers are moderate. It's diner food with extra class.

This place is amazing . I love the vibes and the food is amazing. the Cuban nachos was soooo good and the Cuban versus of a hamburger. It perfect for a casual date night with good food and good music.

Really solid service. Great drinks. Dined at the bar. Churrasco and Empanadas were a tasty hangover treat. Michelada with Tecate was bomb.
Very good all around. My girls had breakfast food (waffles & omelette) for dinner & really liked it. I had Enchiladas & they were excellent.

Great food options! Came in for dinner with a friend, we split the Havana salad, Pernil, and side of Brussels sprouts. The menu should have mentioned that the Brussels sprouts came with cheese, but it wasn't much and I was able to eat around it. The Pernil was PERFECT, and salad was really good too! The restaurant was packed and we were rushed out a bit, but I'm not mad at the. Everything was great and I would definitely return (and maybe try an empanada)!

Came in mothers day (sans mom) and was pleasantly surprised to be seated right away. My girlfriend was running a few minutes late which gave me enough time to study the menu. I opted for the classics. Cafe con leche, which came with complimentary mini blueberry muffins. For drinks, i got the gran paloma (tequila, passion fruit, grapefruit Jarrito, tajin rim). Was definitely quite passion fruit forward and perhaps a touch on the sweet side. For food, tried the fish tacos as well as the Cuban sandwich with a side of yucca fries.  Both were delicious.  I want to come back soon and try something else and I hear desserts are a must.

The best place in Manhattan , great food, best mojitos and exxellent service, you need asked always for MIGUE the best and more friendly bartender in the city!!!!

We went for breakfast and got the Dos Huevos and Hash de Costilla. The potatoes were great, and the bacon was really thick and delicious.

Stumbled into this place around 4am on a Saturday night... Didn't have to wait too long for a table for 3. Had the chicharon calamari and the chicharon itself... Was amazing... Incredibly yummy,  the chicharron mac & cheese is a must.   The Lomo is heavenly,  all flavors were amazing,  the ambience great.   The staff attentive and helpful and for such a wonderful meal it was a decently priced.   Will frequent again.

How can you go wrong with a 24 hour Cuban place?! Everything was excellent. The mac and cheese with chicharon, lomo saltado, and the tostones with guacamole came highly recommended, and the recommendation did not fail us. So, so good for a late night meal. I wish I lived closer!  The service could use an improvement, but honestly, don't let that kind of thing dissuade you from good food.

This is a review for 5-10-18. I came here for breakfast with my son after 8 am This Place looked so familiar. I have been here before lol. It was at night noisy and crowded in the winter. The difference is night and day literally. I orderedhue so rancheros. It had good flavor and texture. The beans were delicious and the sauce exceptional.My son ordered my grilled cheese. He liked it. I also ordered oxtail empanadas because I heard such rave reviews from it on yelp. It was just meh. The execution was poor. All I tasted was the wrapping around it which was very thick. The meat had no flavor. I give it two thumbs down. The americano was ok. All in all it was a nice breakfast.

The food was really good. We had the chicken empanadas and Cuban sandwiches which both tasted amazing. The reason for only 2 stars is because the service was not the best at all. When we sat down she took our drink order and that came out promptly but then after we ordered our appetizers and got them she just left and never took out order for our dinner. We sat there finished our drinks and our appetizer and was there waiting for about 15 20 minutes before she came back and I had to ask her if we can order two Cuban sandwiches. She then was going to other tables getting everybody new drinks and would look at our table with our empty beer bottles and never once offered or asked if we wanted another one so I just continued to drink my water. Then after we were done eating. We were sitting there waiting to try and get a box for our food and another server came over to us and asked if we were okay and I had to ask him for a box while she was at the bar talking and laughing with everyone. After that they cleaned off our table while we were there and I sat there for about another 15 minutes with my card in my hand waiting for her to notice so I can either get the check or ask for it. It's great to see when the staff is having fun at their job and having a good time but the priority isn't having fun it's the customers but it seemed to be the opposite here.

Good ambience. Fast service. Not really authentic Cuban food, the menu has a lot of Mexican food but there food was delicious and there Moro was one of the best I have tried. I highly recommend coming here.

Just left this place 5 minutes ago because they're customer service was so horrible. Walked down the street to good times diner where customer service was a lot better. Big ol manager guy with the button up shirt, get it together.

Excellent...my wife and i have breakfast here and we try the granola with fresh fruit and agave syrup it was delicious  plus the corn empandas and tostones it was really good ..i live around the corner u will c me more often ..great service thanks Pedro and William u guys make my day !!!!
This cuban place is autentic everything here is very well prepare , great selection of tequila and the food is out of thiis world!!!
Coppelia is my favorite restaurant in NYC! My favorite is the sangria, Lomo Saltado, and the Mac & Cheese entree.

Diner atmosphere only much nicer and cleaner. Service was excellent and the fish tacos were amazing! Also recommend the empanadas. Not super cheap or overly priced; you get what you pay for which is delicious quality meals!

Delicious home cooked meal; friendly staff; great hours; affordable prices.

Stellar choice, particularly for a place that is 24 hours and looks like just some sort of run-of-the-mill diner.  We had the nachos which I highly suggest -- homemade chips and a great toppings spread evenly throughout so every bite is as delicious as the last We also had a salmon special which was not particularly special, I suggest avoiding this. However, the oxtail empanadas, though quite small in portion, are really quite good. I can't wait to come back and try more of what this place has to offer.

This place was average. The beef empanada was great however their chicken soup was a little bland. My friend had the pork salad and she said that was a little bit in the bland side too. Compared to other reviews, my experience was just nothing to write home about.

Brought my husband here for a birthday brunch. We sat at the counter (I would recommend sitting away from the register area- it was too busy sitting in front of it)   The coffee was awesome and the staff was really friendly. We were there around 12:30 on a Sunday and the crowd ebbed and flowed; could be a little tricky for a larger group to find a table. The prices were very reasonable for the area and our food was delicious- we'll be back.

Im giving it 2 stars because food was hot and had some flavor, but this is NOT cuban food. We ordered arroz con pollo and they put A LOT of  PICO DE GALLO on top, which has no place in the cuban arroz con pollo, plus made it way to spicy, which again has no business in our cuisine. We read the menu, and there are way to many things that dont add up, when it comes to authentic CUBAN FOOD.

This place is interesting and delicious. I had the Lomo Saltado,which is a Peruvian stir fry. A bit salty but very good and huge portion. They are open 24/7 which is also huge. Definitely will be back.

We landed here late one night, lively action in this place open 24/7.  Had chicken arepas, wow were they good! And beef and rice - another great meal!  We liked the crowd and ambience, service was excellent.  We'll be back!
No comment

I ordered the areas and they were yummy. The plate came with 2 mini areas that were seasoned in chipotle sauce.  My friend ordered the Cuban sandwich and he said it was one of the best. The flan was the best I've found in NYC! It's a thick flan which I love! I'll be going back to try other items on the menu.

Service here was great. I sat at the bar.. had a happy hour drink, a chicken empanada to start, and steak tacos. The tacos came with a large side of rice and beans. The empanada was my favorite part.. the drink was ok, as well as the rest of the food. I'd like to come back and try something different.

This place is amazing and delicious!!! Just a word of warning, the hot sauce is super spicy (but delicious!)  I would definitely make this place a frequent haunt..but it was a little warm inside!  Maybe just needs to cramp the AC a bit :)

I went to coppelia for dinner on Friday with a group of 4. We were seated far in the back at a booth at the entrance to the dishwashing area. It was a little cramped and noisy with people rushing back and forth but otherwise comfortable. My girlfriends mom and sister though it was also a little dark and hard to read the menu, but honestly it didn't bother me. We ordered the quesadilla for an appetizer, and it was very good. It tasted fresh and all of the ingredients worked well together. I had the enchiladas suizas for my main entree, and they were tasty however I bit into a pretty decent sized chicken bone mid enchilada and that kind of ruined it for me. The rice was well cooked and the beans were seasoned well, albeit a little spicy.  My partner had the tallarin verde - I tasted some and I would definitely recommend that! The shrimp were sweet and tender, pasta was fresh and the pesto very bright and creamy. My mother and sister in law had the Ropa Vieja - also very tasty and tender and had a very generous portion. Overall, a good dinner (minus the chicken bone) and though I would try again I would skip the enchiladas.
No comment

BEST BREAKFAST EVER !! This place is a Gem !! Me and my coworkers have a early breakfast on Friday and let me tell u everything was excellent !!  Best Cafe con leche !!! Service is great!!  Thanks agai for a great breakfast !! C u soon !!
This place is amazing. Open all the time, great cocktails. Get the steak, empanadas and cubano sandwhich. This was one of the best steaks of my life. This place is the bomb diggity

Came here for the first time was trying to find a place that made Cuban sandwiches after many searches I found this place open 24/7 all the reviews I read were good so I decided to stop by iam glad I did I started with the Mac and cheese and fish tacos then a Cuban sandwich then a banging dessert called copa lolita really good and cafe con leche the waiter Juan Carlos was outstanding I give this place 5 stars.
Updated REVIEW: Since my last review, I've Gone back and received excellent portions. Both eat=in and Take-Out.  Food quality is awesome. The staff is friendly and the cooks ROCK!  HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

We were looking for a nice place to eat on a freezing Monday night, on the East Village, at a time almost everything was already closed. After seeing the good reviews of Coppelia here in Yelp, we went there and had a very nice and special experience. The place is cosy, very clean, employees are very friendly (a highlight to Cris) and the food was soooo good and tasty!! What a memorable 1:00am dinner in NYC, in a peculiar place with locals and great food, really recommend!!!!

very average experience, super loud, food meh (had Lomo Saltado, which was basically a bowl of rice with a few toppings: 5 cubes of meat, some onion, tomato and fries... for $23 one would expect something better), service extremely slow and ignorant

A Cuban diner! This place really hit the spot for the whole family.  Really good mix of authentic Cuban dishes and diner favorites.  We all shared the nachos to start.  Great FLAVORS! Added kick was the use of short ribs in the nachos. WOW! My son had their take on French Toast.  Granted he's 8, but he said it's the best French Toast he's ever had! It was flavored with a dulce de leche syrup and on top was fresh berries and bananas.  I had a bite or two of it--- really good! I had a roast pork sandwich, classic!!! Pork was succulent, great dipping sauce that came with it.  My wife and daughter had tacos! Fresh ingredients, good flavors.  I sampled them all.  Service was attentive and friendly.  Walking distance from either A,C,E or 1,2,3 trains make it very easy to find as well! Really enjoyed this place, great for families too.
Awesome fresh homemade food! Super friendly staff that takes pride in their food and service!

We were looking for a quick but nice dinner before a show, and were so pleasantly surprised by the service and quality of Coppelia! Ceviche and oxtail empanada were great! Definitely the place to come to for authentic, no fuss Cuban food - not to mention service was excellent. Our waiter was attentive and efficient, which allowed us to enjoy our meal with time to spare. Excited to come back for breakfast!

The staff here is SO friendly. You gotta start off with their nachos as your appetizers cus bajeezus its so damn good! It's so light and filling! This place is cozy and dark, and a little loud. The tables are a little too close together for my taste, and a few times throughout the meal my friend and I couldn't help listening in to the conversation at the table next to us. But we came in around 6 PM on a weeknight and we were seated right away. The bar area was a little more crowded . We ordered Coronas which were served with lime, and they paired nicely with our chicken empanada appetizer. I had the pernil for my entree, which was served over a bed of yucca. The pernil was moist and the portion was generous, but I could've done with a bit more seasoning. I took the rest home and enjoyed it the next day.

Delicious food, drinks and good service. I didn't expect such good quality and service from this part of town. We had ceviche and fish tacos plus a couple of cocktails each. We weren't going to get drinks but the cocktails were $7 each instead of $12 for happy hour, then they were so tasty we got two each. Our waiter was good too - he must have paid attention to our body language or something b/c he had really good timing.

way cute. way way cute. really good food. went there for lunch, just walking by and took a chance. so cute. it's adorable. i also love a place that gives you the option of adding chicharrón to your sandwich. you might need a nap after lunch here. but it's worth it.
This place is always a hit.  Lots of great choices.  Mac and chicharron is awesome.  Lots of time there's a wait, but if I time it right it's always my go to place when I'm in the neighborhood.

Can't wait to go back.  Only had a few drinks at the bar, and some guac with plantains.   Great atmosphere, open 24 hours, high-end yet super cozy and casual.  The menu looks delicious and will give it a try next time.

This could also be a great place to green lunch at. FYI the hot sauce is hot!

The Cubano was fantastic and the service was great. First time at the restaurant and was really impressed with the atmosphere, employees, and food. I will definitely be frequenting this place when visiting the city.

Me and my fiancée order from here almost every weekend.Great place and staff,but I don't recommend if your looking for a quiet intimate setting.I recommend the churrasco and spicy fries when coming here.Hands down two of the best items on the menu.The Passion fruit juice is another item I recommend if you manage to come when they still have it.

LOVE LOVE LOVE this place - food is perfect - just the right amount of Cuban essence - but if you want to go BIG FLAVOR  they do not skimp - they remind you Why you came, a taste of Havana! Both times the people I was dining with had the Ropa Vieja - served with Black beans & rice. Perfection on both occasions ! The appetizers are all fabulous - definitely try the blue corn crusted calamari - served with the most succulent watermelon ketchup. Also - I highly recommend the onion rings - cut razor thin and rolled in a corn meal - insane! If you are with a large table - you need at least 2 orders of each! The service is good - you aren't rushed - they are small so bear in mind most items are made to order, as they should be. Oh yes - OPEN 24 Hours - YAY! Giving the Traditional Greek diners a run for their money. Do Not Leave this place without having the the Coconut Ice Cream (they call it sorbet), it's life changing !

This place is great, possibly the best empanadas I have had since Argentina. I have never been to Cuba but these feels authentic, either way the food is fantastic. We had a group of 6 and shared a bunch of food all of the entrees are great including the churraacos, polla ala plancha, and lomo saltado

My wife and I visit this place when we were in New York. The food was very tasty. I had the Lomo Saltado.   My wife have one of the beef dishes... She enjoyed the dish very much. My wife was please with the seasoning and texture of the meat.  The restaurant was packed and everyone was very friendly. The food was served rather quickly considering the restaurant was full. I had a couple of beverages that were also very good.  Check this place out if you go to Manhattan.

$3 for two small slices of  avocado additional on my burger is way too high and it is conveniently not listed on the menu, while ALL other extras are only 75 cents. Very misleading and the manager would not speak with us nor accommodate our request to remove $2 because it would be the right thing to do. The restaurant was not busy. The waiter was willing to have me deduct the money from his tip, which we refused to do. Wouldn't you want to know that a few slices of avocado would cost $3? And the dessert cakes were not good: banana cake was dry, the Treleche cake was small and just okay. Isn't it terrific to be aggravated when you get your bill. Save $2 and lose a customer.
Yummy! that short rib nacho app is something to keep coming back for. Their food is tasty and drinks are just as good.

We ordered delivery from Coppelia yesterday after I discovered another restaurant we had planned to order from had closed.  Coppelia is pricey but excellent.  My dad loved the ropa vieja (beef stew) and my (vegetarian) guests raved about the rice and beans, empanadas and maduros.  Not only that, but the food came incredibly quickly.  Thanks!  Recommended!

The food and the service was great!  I had the blue corn pancakes with fresh berries, and a side of eggs that came with home fries and Cuban toast. I also had an iced Mexican chocolate.  The only reason I didn't give it five stars is that they don't have turkey bacon, or turkey sausage.

Loved the ambiance, loved the waiters, the salad I ordered was yummy, the grilled chicken on top was awesomely marinated. I eyed other dishes, and everything looked tasty. I wouldn't mind coming here everyday.

Ever since I was introduced to Coppelia two years ago, I've been in love ever since.  I haven't tried their breakfast, but I think everything is perfection.  The cubano, milanesa, arepas, and my personal favorite, mac & chicharron, is on point. Their happy hour drinks could be more reasonable, price wise, since $7 for a drink defeats the purpose of happy hour, but since I love this place so much, I let it slide. Service has always been friendly and quick when I've gone there for both lunch and dinner.

Checked in at 3am on a Monday morning. Large bouncer at the door ensures that the riffraff doesn't bother the customers. The food was good, classic Cuban fare. Try the oxtail empanadas and the Cubano sandwich.
No comment

This place is amazing. The good was flavorful and the staff was efficient! Definitely on my new list of favorite places to eat!!! The food was great and the prices were appropriate. The decor is an absolute eye catcher. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a place to eat 24 hours in NYC !!!

This is by far one of my favorite restaurants in the city. At one point, shortly after discovery, I ordered from this place so often I was sure they had a picture of me on their wall with my address next to it. I've had many things- the salmon is wonderful, purple mashed potatoes may look odd but taste amazing, tallarin verde- if you enjoy pesto you'd like this. It's not the same as pesto but as a self professed pesto fanatic, it's satisfying. Ropa Vieja- amazing. By far THE GREATEST THING ON THIS MENU- lomo saltado. The meat is sooo flavorful  tender and juicy, mixed up with the rice, the onions, the tomato, goodness gracious. I never thought meat, French fries and rice could make me so happy. Don't believe me? Order the Nachos appetizer, it comes with some of the short ribs they use and is delciousssss! Come here, you will NOT be disappointed!
No comment

Went there with my boyfriend for a late dinner last night after getting to a restaurant in Little Italy and seeing that it was closed. This restaurant is 24 hours but was pretty dead on a Sunday night at 12am which I expected. We had the Chicken Soup which was delicious, the beef empanada which was also very good and we shared the Churrasco. The Churrasco wasn't as long as I've seen at other places but was perfect for the both of us as we weren't starving, but we just a bit hungry. The Tres Leches cake was a perfect finisher. The service was just ok though. It started off good, but went downhill. After dropping the food, the waiter never came back to check and see how we were doing. We both work in the restaurant business and could understand him not coming back if the restaurant was busy, but we were one of four tables in the entire restaurant. We didn't need anything else, so we weren't overly annoyed by his absence but what if we did need something? I digress. We would come back here if we were in the neighborhood and it was late with nothing else open. The food was good, but service could use a little help.

One of the more distinct places I've been to for dinner in the city! A 24/7 mexican diner? I was initially confused but left very impressed. Delicious mexican style offerings at very reasonable prices. YUM! Also it was very easy to get a table in this laid back restaurant, which was refreshing after always having to think about reservations and wait times in almost every other New York establishment. Definitely recommend!

Horrific customer service - ordered via Grubhub - wait an hour - call no food - will be 5mins more they say - then another 1/2 hour goes by - call back now so no order - even though they charge credit card - avoid !
Fun latin vibe with great food and good music. Nice and cozy restaurant with friendly staff.
Yummmyyyyyyyyy Cuban food  great for a late night grab!

We are traveling from Sf I most say so far this our favorite place, for appetizer we had the ceviche. Our main course we shared some snacks, the empanadas with sweet corn & chicken, the nachos which I highly recommend. We can't forget the fish tacos. We loved this place we really enjoyed The Flan.

First off they are opened 24hours. The Mojito's are dellish and they have that amazing spiced corn and the chips and Guacamole are also very good. I've never ordered anything from this restaurant that I was disappointed with. The atmosphere is very pleasant with dim lighting and excellent service.
No comment
No comment

Great vibe and a fun place to hang out with a group of people. Get the guac & chips -- comes with an assortment of chips. The arepas were not as expected. They were small portioned and hard. It's listed under as an arepa sandwich but it's more of a tapa size. Brussel sprouts were a great side dish.
No comment
Great menu selection, swift & friendly service. We had the Cubano sandwich, which was higher-quality than some who serve overloads of mayo, fatty pork, stacks of goopy swiss.
Great food, great bar, decent service.  Best 24/7 restaurant I've found in Manhattan.  The nachos are out of this world!
Had a Saturday lunch. Decent food, efficient service. The restaurant was full so it was quite loud.

Firstly they serve cafe con leche.  Now that's out of the way you know this place is the real deal.  The Cuban sandwich is just what you want out of a Cuban sandwich.  The service is top notch.  This place is priced great for the neighborhood.  So if you're in the area or meat packing district having some drinks then stumble into this joint and order some classics without worry.
No comment

Delicious! It's like a diner, but with Cuban food. What a concept! I recommend the guacamole, oxtail empanadas, arroz con pollo and mojo. And the dulce de leche milkshake is insane! Everything looked delicious, and we will be going back soon!

Stopped in here jonsing for a Cubano after watching "Chef".  Satisfied my craving for classic Cuba food, and had a great cocktail to go with it!  Conveniently located off the L, and open 24/7.  What's not to like? Check it out!
If you need somewhere to go on a late night. This is the place to be. Food is good, atmosphere is very inviting. And the staff is good. Drinks were the best part of the night.
I loved the vibe of this place.  Had a burger and fish tacos but the banana cake with dulce de leche ice cream was the best I ever had. 1 week later and I'm still dreaming about it!
Wow super impressed . Ok I  have to give props! Lomo saltado.... Blew my mind.
Sweet Jesus yes. I went here super late at night and it was an incredible way to round out the night. The door guy was hilarious, the food came fast (got the steak); and the flavor was 110%.

Came here with my friends on a Saturday night and it was packed. Still, it moved quickly and we were able to get a table in five minutes. For me, I decided to have an empanada and the arroz con pollo. Both were very good. The empanada was a bit too flaky for me, but the arroz con pollo was amazingly flavorful. I was also shocked at how big the portion was, so the dish was definitely worth the $18 dollars. My friend, who is Cuban, agreed that this was a pretty authentic place and she enjoyed the ropa vieja. For dessert, I had the special blueberry cheesecake with oreo cookie crust and it was out of this world. Yes, it was an expensive meal, but it was so worth it, especially on a night out with friends.
My first time having Cuban. Amazing  didn't get a chance to try the dessert but it looks delicious as well

Has pretty good food. Used to be my go to until they ghosted me on a seamless order. It's always disappointing when good restaurants let you down. Probably will never order delivery from Coppelia again.
No comment

Really enjoyed the vibe here. Fun restaurant that serves great food. I was pleased with the large portions. Looked like everyone was having a good time, that's always a sign that something is right. I would definitely go again. They also have great cocktails.
Decent affordable Cuban food. Skip the dessert. Open 24/7 including breakfast all day.
No comment
No comment
Just like the other reviews said: great service, excellent food, nice size portions, lively atmosphere.  Will definitely be coming back.

I stopped at Coppelia with a business colleague.  I have passed Coppelia before thinking it was a regular diner not a Cuban restaurant.  The Cuban sandwich was excellent and the cafe con leche was outstanding.
they have a nice variety of peruvian and american dishes, good lunch special, and chill interior. My favorite part of this restaurant is the shared sink between bathrooms and lomo salteado!!

Excellent food & vibe! Especially for a 24/7 spot. Our waiter had great energy and the white sangria was delish. I got the huevos rancheros-- I ate it up real quick (only complaint was that I wish it was a larger dish; there was a lot of rice but the huevos rancheros disappeared quickly!) The desserts were excellent- the banana split was great (the banana was slightly carmelized...yum.) I definitely plan to come back!!!
No comment

We stumbled upon this great Cuban place for two reasons getting lost in nyc and meeting a lovley couple that recommended it.  Things happen for a reason, great food awesome drinks.  I had the steak and eggs served with rice and beans yummy. Great seasoning not salty at all just right.  Breakfast usually weighs me down and can put me in a food coma not this place, food was freshly cooked not greasy! See you again when we return to nyc.  Had a few mojitos too which were awesome.
Great food.. great service... was very satisfied & the price wasnt bad also... would definitely recommend this place & wld def be coming back
My friend's and i found this place on yelp. Let me tell you the guacamole is the bomb, the enchiladas is amazing. If i could it more i would have ordered my plates twice.
No comment

Delicious food and great service. We had a party of 10 and then added 2 more. I like how they sat us down even before all of us showed up. This was very helpful. One tip is that they don't take reservations, so you might want to have a drink at the bar if you need to wait for seating. They have amazing drinks though so that shouldn't be a problem!
Yes everything you need at a cuban place except the last 2x I've em been here they ran out of sweet plantains...c'mon order double once inwhile guys they laaaast!

This is the right place for breakfast or after party "eatsomething".the menu is a mix of Latino traditional plates from different places like Peru Mexico or Cuba.i use to go there after work and my fav is guacamole and quesadillas con pollo.dont forget to ask about the habanero sauce but be careful it will burn your mouth!
Awesome creative Cuban food, brunch, and ice cream!  Very reasonably priced. Charming decor. Clean. Fast & friendly service.
No comment
No comment
No comment

The atmosphere is very loud. The space is tight and the staff is friendly and attentive. It's similar to a cafeteria style seating. The bathroom is unisex. The music is loud at night. I did not try their desert but the steak is good and the salmon and purple potatoes are good as well. Good for a first date if you do not want to get intimate also great to hang out with friends.
By far the best food I had when I was in New York. The arroz con pollo is the best thing I have ever eaten
No comment
I think the steak and the fish tacos are amazing.. the food here is second to none in terms of Cuban food... I love this place and if you are seeking Spanish food this place is a Mexican dream

I very much enjoyed my dinner here last evening and was pleased that I found this place thanks to Yelp. It was a crowded evening but there were two spots available at the bar and Chris, the bartender took excellent care of us. He was very knowledgeable about the excellent tequila selection as well as the specials on the dinner menu. Our food choices were indeed excellent I had the more traditional dish well my date had something from the special menu and both of us really enjoyed our selections. The desert selection was amazing as well and we were able to get something small because our stomachs were quite full from the excellent meal that we had just eaten. Again Chris was very helpful and cordial and really added to the enjoyable experience that we spent there. The menu is a mix of chef's specials and also has traditional Cuban dishes as well with plenty of excellent dining choices.  Overall the vibe of the restaurant is very lively and relaxed but yet classy. Definitely one of my favorite meals in recent memory.

Amazed.  Just walked into Coppelia and greeted promptly by Francisco.  He offered me a seat at the counter and since I was alone, I wasn't expecting great service. Well, I was wrong! He was so attentive! But the star is the food!  If you want terrific Cuban food, at a reasonable price in a fun atmosphere -  eat here.

I'm hesitant to write a review about Coppelia because I want this gem to remain a secret forever! I have lived in NYC for about 10 years now. I've passed this "24 Hour Diner" about 750+ times. Always thinking that I wasn't digging dinner food and wanted to explore something else. Boyyyyy, was that a dumb move! A friend and I decided to check out Coppelia before a show after yelping some delicious restaurants on 14th st. Coppelia was very high in the search results, with great reviews, so we decided to check it out. The menu immediately threw us for a whim. A 24 hour diner throwing down like THIS!?!?!? Where have you been all my life. We came on a Saturday night and sat at the bar (seating wasn't available -- the place was packed). I ordered the grilled chicken, spicy kale and quinoa. My homie ordered the churrasco. OH MY LORDT! I am not over exaggerating when I tell you that this food wanted to have me get up out the barstool and start dancing! It was more than delicious, it was out of this WORLD delicious! I cleaned my plate in record timing. There legit wasn't a drop of food left on it. The portions are huge, too! The churrasco was tender and grilled to perfection. I plan on trying everything on the menu. So yes, I will be back and ready to explore the wide variety of menu options.
Best huevos rancheros. This will be a frequent stop for me. Coffee was fresh and service was prompt. Water glass constantly filled.

Really good food!  Small menu but always dinner specials.  Oyster special, ceviche and empanadas are delicious!  Highly recommend the pear and almond tart and the blood orange sorbet!  Excellent service, attentive staff with good recommendations.  Note:  No reservations and you will not be seated till the whole party arrives so there may be a wait depending on time.

This place has by far the most racist, disrespectful and unfriendly staff. About 5 of us went out to eat here on Sunday evening around 9PM. We weren't greeted when we came in and after sitting down we began to chat at a normal volume. A member of the staff came over to our table and told us to "Quiet down" and that we were "talking too loud". Keep in mind there was a table of about 5 white people around the same age as us (23-30 y/o) having a conversation at the same volume and no-one went over to ask them to quiet down. We decided to stay even after that. A member of the staff( short Hispanic man with black button shirt)  came over to our table AGAIN, and told us that customers were complaining and that we needed to quiet down. At this point my patience had expired. I got up to discuss the way we were being treated with him and asked to speak to a manager. He said there is no manager here with a very surly and nasty tone. We proceed to converse about the matter at hand to which he tells me don't touch him and that we can leave. Of course, we left. Not only were we racially profiled and singled out. We also were met with extreme disrespect from staff. DO NOT SUPPORT THIS BUSINESS.

This place was amazing for my first try at Cuban food. We tried the oxtail empanadas which are very delicious. Pollo a La Plancha was really flavorful and has a pretty good spice to it. Ropa Vieja was pretty good too. Their mojitos are one of kind! It was most definitely out of my price range, but it was well worth our date night. The music is a little louder than other places, but the atmosphere was awesome. I will definitely revisit this place when visit NY again.

This place has the best chicken soup you will ever try in your life! The Ropa Vieja is delicious, thick and with the right amount of spices. We were there yesterday and my roommate and I had the churrasco and the rib-eye special. They were both equally yummy. We ordered them both medium cooked and both meats came exactly as we expected. The guy next to me had a hamburger and it looked delicious. Order a cortadito to finish the meal and you will leave this place extremely happy! I've been there at 3 o'clock in the morning before and the quality of the food served is the same. Great restaurant!

The best! Incredible happy hour, good food, great cocktails, always friendly staff, good value. My only gripe is that they sometimes refuse to give up a booth for a smaller party, even though parties of two are in booths. Otherwise perfect!
I got the Lomo Saltado here and it was delicious! Tastes just like what I would get in Miami. Very quick service and clean restaurant. Only downside is the lighting in the place is very dark.
Was visiting and NYC and sooo glad we found this place. One of the best pernils of my life and I am Cuban. Quick and friendly service. I will definitely visit again.
No comment
Huevos coppelia was amazing. Nachos look really good. I will get those next time. Good service.

This little Cuban spot has good food and is open 24 hours (bonus). The only reason I'm giving three stars instead of more is that their presentation isn't the best (again, they certainly compensate in taste) and my meal companion's side portions were a little small for the price. For example, I ordered two chicken empanadas and my boyfriend ordered a burger with a side of plantain. My empanadas came out in a plastic container (normal), but they were a little deformed. I didn't mind because that led me to believe the shell was home made. My boyfriend had a side of about 5 plantain cubes that were burnt (but somehow still tasty). That made me feel he was a little cheated. However, the server was pretty engaging, and I liked the music/intimate diner vibe (and of course the soccer on the TV's in the background.) I was also a little caught off guard by the Doorman, but he was nice and it was around 2am.

Unfortunately, our experience with Coppelia was very disappointing.  A 20 to 30 minute wait for a table turned into 40 minutes and the food took no less than 35 minutes to arrive with no explanation or apology. The food itself was nothing special fringing on mediocre.  The starter fish taco at $9.95 was ridiculously small and the shredded cabbage was inedible. The cocktails are pricey considering this is a Cuban diner -- a diner. We came in from Queens to meet family and have lunch. Next time we will definitely tell them cross the bridge.

This place truly deserves the best rating! This is my go-to spot for happy hour drinks and great food, after hours dining, or a great meal if I happen to be hungry and in the area. I've never had a bad dish, but I would highly recommend the Lomo Saltado, the Mac and Chicharron, the Havana salad, and the Tres Leches Cake. I love the service and ambiance and hours!! Regardless of the time of day, I can count on great food and service. I don't know of any other restaurants to compare this to!

Great prices for goooood food. My go-to is always the breakfast foods. The service isn't exceptional but it doesn't need to be- it's not about that here- it's about getting an amazing deal for your money and leaving satisfied. No matter what time of day it is.

Man I really liked this place.  Ordered the Ceviche, Empanadas, Skirt steak and Cubano.  Everything was excellent, but the take home were the Empanadas, and I'm not normally a big fan of them. These were excellent and came out fresh hot.  Ask for the hot sauce. It's very spicy, but flavor was explosive.

Love that they're open 24 hours - best late night food selection in Chelsea for sure. Cocktails are great (esp. the spicy margarita) and I definitely recommend the Churrasco - juicy, tasty and who doesn't love plaintains?

Very much enjoy coming to this diner every time I go out in the city. Our server, Juan Carlos, is great. He's very attentive and accomadative assuring that guests are comfortable throughout their experience. The food is excellent, I had the nachos as an app. and the Cubano is delicious. Great place and ambiance with up beat Spanish music playing. Great place, a must try!

I have been here quite a few times and even brought friends. I came on date and sat at the bar. Had appetizer, a entree which was decent followed by the banana cake which was good. I noticed when I was eating my desert the bartender kept trying to take my plate away, one time he did managed to grab it and I had to ask him back for it. Mind you I eat really fast. once I had finished and he managed to take the plate away. He  then asked if we needed anything else we said no, he immediately told us and he was quite rude that we needed to leave because people were waiting. (It was busy but there were only two people waiting). This did not make us feel good. will not be coming back again. I eat out all the time never been told to leave a restaurant. I also work in the service industry.

Came on recommendation of hotel front desk clerk. Did not disappoint! Michelin recommendation in the window and I can see. Cubano sandwich was to die for. Juicy roasted pork and cheese melted just right! Service was top notch. My water glass was refilled as if by magic (I just got off a flight and was rehydrating). Come here - you'll be glad you did.
No comment

Went there for Haloween with a friend. Got seating by the bar without a wait. This place doesnt have cuban food. Its american cuisine. The drinks are good but the food was meh. They were trying to upsell aggressively. The flautas were good but the turkey burger I ordered was horrible. I forgot what my friend ordered but he didnt like it as well. We chose the place based on Yelp rating so figured I would do my part.
Cuban sandwich was excellent, my chicken sandwich was also grea.the fresh ingredients, large portions. Awesome yucca fries, not too greasy.

Mac and cheese with chicharron?! Oh hell yea you can be certain it's delicious. Oxtail empanada was great as well. All other food was good but those two vividly stick out in my head. Open 24 hours this place is a great Cuban themed diner. Fast and friendly service.

I went here for a simple breakfast, just waffles and eggs. When it came it looked yummy but didn't taste as it looked. Waffles tasted like the freezer ones and there were a ton of SHELLS in my eggs. Not good. Very disappointed :( had higher expectations
