A solid 4 stars! All their food is delicious, especially, the lomo saltado. You really can't go wrong with this place. And I believe they're open 24/7 so +1 for that.
Came here with friends after a visit to the city nightlife for some "breakfast"..arroz con pollo is tasty and I am glad I shared the portion with someone (it's decently-sized!).
GREAT nachos. Very busy place, nice selection of stuff.

This is definitely one of my go to places in NYC... anytime of the day! First, it's a celebrity favorite. I've run into Riri here twice now. The food is amazing. I highly recommend the guacamole! Sooooo delicious: )

A co-worker of mine told me of this place so after work yesterday we went over to have dinner and check the place out.  I was very pleased with the food and the prices are not that bad.  Will be going back this Friday to celebrate a friends birthday and I'm sure he will love this place as well.

The food is good, music uplifting,and the staff friendly. I especially recommend the freshly squeezed passion fruit juice. Given there are not many Cuban/Mexican restaurants in Chelsea, the price point and cuisine are worth making the trip in the neighborhood. Great place to come by yourself and read at the bar.

I work in the area and sometimes you get tired of the salads, sandwiches and wraps. Sometimes you want some good Latino comida (Latin food!!! The food at this place is GREAT and it's affordable!!!!! I would eat here everyday if my waistline could afford it!...lol The waitress remembers your order and it's a nice feeling to go somewhere where the server is attentive and observant. On any given day I will the chicken empanada, the oxtail empanada, the arepa sandwich (to die for!!), or the pan con lechon. I ALWAYS ask for a side of mojo sauce no matter what I order! I see so many good things on the menu and i intend to try everything on the menu but I'm stuck on my favorite things!...lol I highly recommend this place...friendly service, great food, affordable prices!

I love this place.  I've eaten there as well as gotten delivery.  The dine-in service was great.  The waiter was super busy, but friendly and efficient.  He didn't pressure us to leave once we finished eating even though it was getting crowded.  Delivery was crazy fast all three times I've ordered from it.  I always get nachos cuz I'm a nacho fiend and it's a really interesting take on this much-love app.  They say it has gouda and muenster cheese on it?  I'm not sure that it tasted like gouda and muenster, but it's some kind of melted d*mn good deliciousness along with tender beef short ribs with crema and guac.  It's actually turning into one of my favorite nacho places besides The Rail Line Diner (their nachos are kick-ass in my opinion too).  In addition, I ordered the oxtail empanada - AMAZING!  Loved it. Also ordered the sweet corn empanada that came with a super delicious melted filling.  Honestly, if I hadn't been eating my feelings that night, I could've truly gotten by on the sweet corn empanada alone...but ya know...whatevs.  #ilovenyc

We jumped in rather early for breakfast before our trek to JFK. The staff easily accommodated our breakfast orders and everything was made fresh, quickly. I could spend all day inside Coppelia and lovingly gaze at the interior. When we next visit New York, I am so hitting this place for an evening cocktail and a slice of that gorgeous cake on the counter.
No comment

I absolutely love Coppelia food is amazing the service is great, and the prices are good for being a downtown restaurant. I frequent here a lot. There salmon is the best salmon I have had and there shrimp quesadilla is to die for. They have a pretty unique cocktails menu; the mango pimiento cocktail is amazing wouldn't recommended if you're the typical kind of person. The best way to describe it is a Spanish little sweeter version of a bloody Mary.
No comment

Food is good, but small portion for the price.  The waiters rushes you and take the plate away even if there is still food left on the plate. so if you are thinking of sitting more than half an hour and enjoy a weekend meal with friends would not choose this spot. I am used to sitting for 1 hour minimum  at a diner, so if I feel rushed it's not enjoyable. We  made sure not to order dessert, as we will probably get the bill as we are waiting for the dessert, it is that type of vibe. Music is slightly on the loud side for a diner. Not thinking of dining here again, there are plenty of great diners that would offer good quality quantity and service without the hype.
My friend brought me here for dinner last night.  One word...wow.  Oxtail Empanadas and the nachos...get them now.

I used to love this place:  delicious cubano sandwiches, arepas, tostones, yucca fries.  Often, I have found the sound level to be far too loud for relaxed dining and conversation.  However, if you can dine when it´s not crowded, the food is delicious.
I love this place. Open 24, decent cocktails, great Latino beer selection, food is banging. Not super busy on a Friday late night. WHY?!?  I would live around here solely for this joint.

Yum! I had a Cubano for the first time. The service was pretty good, it wasn't too crowded (went on a Sunday night). I didn't get very much information on the menu which was disappointing but I enjoyed my meal and would definitely go back.

I came after work with a few of my friends just to get a drink before going home, and it turned into a "thing." We ordered a few drinks from the bar, and also got a few empanadaas also.. It wasn't the busiest time of the day but still having said that the bartender Ben (apologies if name is wrong) was really cool, and he made every drink the exact same way.. I would absolutely come here again!!
I like this place. I really don't have shit else to say.

Took my family there for lunch today (12/22/12).  Food was just OK.  Eldest daughter and wife had omelets...can't hurt that too much.  Younger daughter had soup and an empanada..pretty good.  Son-in-law had a breakfast burrito...not bad.  I had the Korean Tacos..pretty good.  One big turnoff...my daughter brought me a small birthday cake and asked the restaurant if we could have it for dessert after our meal.  Wouldn't have had a problem if the restaurant wanted to charge me $10 to serve it up.  instead they wanted $20 to serve it...thought that was outrageous.   Kind of insulting...not making a return trip.
24 hour diner, tasty food, warm atmosphere. Good option in the neighborhood.
Cool Latin diner! I've never had a bad meal here and the mixed drinks are great, too! I've brought a dozen different friends to this place and they've all loved it, too.
Great food, good atmosphere. And a huge plus for being a 24 hour spot. The fish tacos are a must-try. I've been here a couple of times with a few friends and they really enjoyed.

It saddens me greatly that I lived in Chelsea for 2 years and only now discovered this gem! Great food at really reasonable prices. I had the chicken with roasted kale and quinoa, topped with avocado. It was seasoned incredibly well with great flavor; portions were huge, too! Friend and I also had a bottle of very reasonably priced red wine $32 that actually tasted good! Total bill was $80 for a bottle of red, chips & guacamole to start (also a generous portion- we got through about half of it), 2 entrees and a mac&cheese she ordered to go for her boyfriend. Awesome, yummy deal! Food came out fast too and service was exceptional. Go! But not when I go, because I don't want you taking my seat! :)
I loved the eggs with fried rice. A friend had a good salad. I'd pass on the French toast...too thick for my taste. They took Hallam to another level--one not appreciated by my crew.
Food was amazing went 3 times in 2 days. The oxtail empanadas were to die for. A must have!
Grew  choice. Ordered the Pollo A La Pancho and Ohhhh myyyy... How authentic!! We'll definitely be back.

Hands down my fav place to order from on seamless.  The calamari cornmeal crusted reddish colored app is the best damn calamari' I've ever had.   All the food has never disappointed.  One day I'll show up in person for a live meal, until then I'll happily be hibernation boy ordering from my apt.

Three Letters OMG - The Best Cuban, The best empanada, The best Chicharon, they also had Aguila the Colombian beer - amazing place - I am bring my mother here lol - Check out this amazing find in New York West Village -
good service. i like that the guacamole comes with plantains. i haven't had any entree dishes yet, but their chicken sandwich is pretty good.
Mac and cheese with chicharron?! yes please! 24/7, even better! Their pernil is pretty good too although I was not a fan of the spicy fries. I'd come back though for a late night meal.
No comment
this place is on my way home from work, when I ot extremely late, hungry, feeling tired but and don't want to walk at all, this is the place to go to. comfortable, solid food which open for 24h.
No comment
Solid restaurant, great food, and great service. I love coming here late afternoon and reading at the bar.
No comment

Never noticed this place before but am so glad i know about it now. Went for Sunday brunch and it was pretty empty (rare for the super crowded restaurants in the area during this time) so we were seated right away. This made me a bit nervous but I had nothing to fear--this is my new favorite place!! the food is amazing and the service very good. I will definitely be coming back--just hope it doesn't get too popular!

AWESOME! The oxtail empanadas were amazing, and only $3.25.. they even came with cheese, and pico de gallo, but I skipped the crema. My waiter Juan- Carlos was really classy and got us everything we needed before we could even ask. I came here with my girlfriend because we were looking for a good 24 hr diner, and what an awesome choice we made! The waffles were delicious, the arepa was incredible, and the corn thing was really flavorful, but we weren't that into it. This is great for deserts, and great for fancy meal or delicious semi-cheap meals. I'll be back soon. Also they had a TV at the bar playing Monday Night Football.
Omg best cuban food ever! After partying at 4am ia the best. Is always packed i heard. Thnk god i didnt have to wait. yummm cant cant till july to go back

Waiter was juan very good service,was there late a nice change from the usual late night halal plates. I had the jalapeno margarita really tasty. We ordered bunch of appetizers to have a feel for the food, everything was tasty, strong 4 stars.especially me being spanish im very critical about spamish places being i compare everything with my mothers food tough to live up to! Fav thing i ordered was the mac and cheese chicharron Enjoy!

Freakin' delicious! Ate at the bar because the restaurant was busy and I didn't want to wait for a table. Great service from all. When I accidentally spilled my cocktail, it was swiftly replaced. Had the churrasco dish. My friend had the marinated chicken dish (there wasn't even one grain left on her plate). Pricing is reasonable . You can't go wrong, it's a must-try.
uh....24 hour cuban diner?!  yes please!!!  food is great, atmosphere is cute, and the waitstaff are friendly.  i'm so glad i live so far away from it because i'd be there everyday and night!

Went here for a late night snack; I got brunch food and it was alright, but nothing amazing.  The service was really good though; my date ordered something SUPER spicy and when we asked the waiter for milk to get rid of that fiery attack on the taste buds, the waiter did so immediately and didn't charge us!  It's pretty far from where I live though so I probably won't be going there often.
No comment
No comment

That cuban sandwich was bangin'.  SO GOOD.  Had a cuban sandwich (ordered without mustard) and two margaritas.  Friend got the exact same thing.  It was absolutely delicious.  Service was good, and when we met at 2pm on a Monday there were plenty of tables.  Will definitely return.

This is a really awesome Cuban diner. By far the croquettes are the best thing I had on the menu (though I'm a tad biased since I've absolutely love and have been craving croquettes since I left San Sebastian, Spain last summer). The chicken empanada was really good, though on the small side for the price. The nachos were delicious and good for sharing and also the huevos rancheros were pretty good but I'd probably try something else next time. Also, their sangria and tamarind float were on point. Really good food with decent service at a decent price point.
My favorite place to go for breakfast, lunch, diner, and drinks! Desserts are amazing too.
No comment

This is my second time here, and food wise, I have to say, the Huevos Coppelia, were absolutely delish! I've been looking forward to this day for months, since last time I was here. The wait staff was very friendly and helpful. Not stingy with the sauces at all. I ordered a drink called Paloma, and once again I wasn't disappointed. Happy hour price was $7...decent. My mom ordered the steak and eggs to be safe, and a chicharron& guacamole appetizer, and for drink...La Ultima. Steak was cooked medium, just as she asked, but she mostly raved about the Moro rice!! I tasted it, was rather lovely!! I'm Peruvian, and was tempted to try those dishes, but was happy to have gone a bit safer with the Cuban inspired dishes .  The 2nd drink, was like a mimosa with guava...very fresh drink. I liked the chicharron idea, but thought it was odd that it was pork rinds. I'm assuming it's made fresh, because they came warm. Maybe they shld specify that it's pork rinds. I didn't mind, we took a gamble, and strangely, they were pretty damn good. Overall, I think this place is a hidden gem. As we were leaving my mom spied the bartender making a drink in a shaker, taste the drink with a straw, then stirred it again, and he repeated this 2more times. I don't think the drink was for him, and on the off chance that it was a customers drink, they shld b more careful about spreading germs.  I personally loved my whole meal, and I wld come back, thanks to the waiters, the chef, and owner for making such a diverse menu!!

This place was decent-- good for a group of people who all like different things. I was looking for more authentic Cuban food; this is really more American diner food with a Cuban twist. The upside is that both the American-style and more Cuban-style foods tasted quite good. My veggie burger tasted great, even if it was not really a veggie burger (more like zucchini slaw on a bun). Drink prices are high, but food prices can be kept low...some entrees are in the high twenties, while some are under ten. Overall, really recommend for a mixed group of people. Plenty of seating, and lots of different options.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Yummy Cuban food at diner prices! You can get two eggs with yucca fries and toast for six bucks. They have corn empanadas and arepas, making Coppelia a great choice for the gluten free set. I also can't wait to try the blue cornmeal pancakes. My arepa was crispy on the outside, and came as two mini sandwiches, which is different from the pocket style at Caracas. The chicken was a bit too saucy for me, so I wish they had a few different arepa options. I checked in on my phone and got a free iced tea! This is not an area with a lot of affordable but good options. Definitely a new favorite in the neighborhood. And the waiters' shirts say: Winning 24/7. Indeed.

I have a mild obsession with this place, in short for three very simple but very amazing reasons: its 24 hours, they deliver to a wide delivery range, and the food is so good it satisfies my homesick cravings for Miami.
It's my favorite casual dining spot and they have the best chile relleno in town, it's not th typical dish but it's low carb so I love it!

Get the macaroni and cheese! It comes with delicious pork belly! Didn't know macaroni and cheese could be so good! Also got the arroz con pollo. This reminded me of fried rice since there was egg in the mix. Pretty flavorful. Not what I'd expect for arroz con pollo, but still yummy. Also, I checked in via Yelp and got a free fountain soda, sweet. I need to go back this place just for the macaroni and cheese!

Came here today for lunch and ordered the Frita Cubana, a burger with Cuban roast pork on top that was strenuously recommended to me by an Elite Yelper.  It was a failure.  The burger was blah and unseasoned.  I saw a beautiful burger, but if I were blindfolded I could not tell you was I was eating (unlike a shake shack burger).  The Cuban roast pork also did not have any redeemable qualities.  No seasoning, no mojo flavor, no unctuous specialness, nada, zip.  I didn't even finish it because I hated it so much.  HATED it.  The burger was a wasted lunch, especially when I could've and should've had pork buns at Momofuku.  Also had the Mac & Chicharron starter.  I couldn't get past the pepper or jalapeño taste.  YUCK.  Service was fine.
No comment

I have been searching for a cuban restaurant diner in nyc. This is the one! I would totally comehere again for their awesome authentic family friendly dining. Their portions are good, and they have amazing desserts. I got the chicharron salad with roasted pork , blue cheese, avocado ..super good only for 11 dollars! Please get the desserts too!

Really great diner in the union sq/ chelsea area. I ordered the grilled shrimp salad? Portions are huge and so delicious. The vegetable all tasted so fresh. Service was great too. AND they're open 24/7! Will definitely go back.
Get the mac and cheese and guacamole. Your life will change.
No comment
No comment
Went back. Had the Churrasco. Medium rare, extra sauce = amazeballs. And the staff are fantastic. Such a fan.

Excellent. Good Food, good service, Open 24/7, Breakfast served all day, had Breakfast for Dinner + Cuban Sandwich, Crazy combo but hey what can i say lol, Try the Blue Corn Pancakes, served with Fresh Fruit and Agave Nectar...Dee-lish! Recommended. Will Return Soon

I've been here about four times over the last two months and have really enjoyed it. The staff have gotten to know us pretty well at this point and my friends specifically like to order the Matador drinks (spicy cucumber-y stuff). I personally have entered a comfort zone with the spinach salad and/or the Frita Cubana (made 'deluxe' by adding delicious yuca fries). The tuna melt and BLT are supposed to be really good too but I've never had them personally (yet). A little pricey for what you're getting (hence 3 and not 4 stars; wish I could give 3.5) but not outrageous considering the area it's in. Conveniently located right by the 1/2/3, it's easy to get in and get out.

Cute spot with good Cuban food. The guacamole was good but not the best I ever had. I had the Frito  Cubana burger which was tasty and so big I could barely get my mouth around it. They give a generous portion of fries too. The staff was attentive but didn't have a clue what a Yelp check in offer  was! He went to check with others and we got our free soda after all. I'd definitely visit again.

Well, this restaurant is in a great area and it's opened 24hrs. If you drive you can find parking if you look really hard, if not the train station is literally on the corner. The food here is pretty good and there's a bar with about seating for 12 or more people. Theres also seating outside but it's very small outside with about 2 or 3 tables. Service was pretty fast and the wait time was about 45 minutes on the weekend around 10pm, I'm not sure about the wait time on the weeknights/ days, so I recommend getting there an hour early. I definitely want to get into the decor for a second, it's very dim and very loud with music and people talking, not very romantic, more of a social place for friends. The drinks are great and strong, especially the margarita, I also noticed that they sell pitchers of sangria there. As for dinner, I ordered a chicken quesadilla which was tasty, the beans and rice was good and the empanadas was on point, they also had Mac & Cheese that was pretty okay.
Best fish tacos! Get them every time, service is great but gets very busy during lunch. A must try for sure!

I love this place. All the different fries are unreal but especially the yuca fries. I like that it's super casual but still nice. The staff is really friendly and helpful. Never had a bad experience here.

One of my go to places. My girlfriend and I go about once a month. The food overall is delicious. I've tried almost everything on the menu. The atmosphere is good; feels cozy to me. As of yet, I haven't had any issues.

Service is amazing and matches the food perfectly!! One of my go to late night eats in the city. The fact that it's 24 hours is even better. The plantains are perfection as well the the calamari a and quesadilla. Clean and cozy facility with welcoming employees and fantastic mojitos!!!

Authentic Cuban diner food with a "bouncer" at the door. Don't let that throw you off because the inside is lively with music and great food. My go to is always the lomo saltado which is white rice with veggies French fries (yes I said French fries) and braised short rib so soft the meat literally melts in your mouth. The The seasoning is always spot on and the diner is 24/7. If you haven't been go now and make sure you check in on yelp for the free soft drink!
It's simple good food, with addition creativity. Not going to get crazy about the food. The prices are a bit high for the amount of food you get. The decor and vibe are a plus.

This is a great restaurant to enjoy in Manhattan. Great service and great food. Shredded beef was excellent as well as shredded pork. Excellent homemade desert. Appetizers excellent too had sweet corn empanadas and oxtail empanadas. Not a touristy type of restaurant - looks like lots of locals eating here.

i love diners and the fact that it is a latin diner makes it even better. they are usually busy. but the food ismtypical diner food with latin entrees like empanadas and such, burgers cooked well. and i love the sweet potato fries with the chilli ketchup.

I have been eating here since it opened...even before it got it's liquor license. The staff and food always great. Went there this afternoon, defenses down ( I violated the first rule for a New Yorker). Ordered a Cubana Frita and was served a Cubano. Small issue? I believe not. Was a busboy masquerading as a trained server? Did he know how to place an order on the computer. I think not. Was he malicious? I think not. I will return, DEFENSES UP. For me the Coppelia  experience is spoiled. No longer a place I can enjoy without doubts, defenses down. Feel silly, I have been touting the virtues of this place to friends for years. By the way, if a mistake is to be made, serve the Pan Con Lechon in lieu of the Cubana Frita.  Julian Medina...is your staff burning your laurels?

Love this place and love that it is 24 hours!  The food is great and you can get breakfast all day!  Whenever I just want to go to a lowkey spot and have good Spanish food this is the first place I think of!!! The staff is wonderful, they have master making sure you are taken care of without seeming like pest.  They also have good signature drinks (and a great happy hour).  One of my favorite chill spots in NYC.  I think the best part is, it is never to crowded (at least when I go). I always have a good time when I am here and all the dishes I have tried have been great!

Well, I was LOVING the steak sandwich here for a while, so of course all of a sudden they've taken it off the menu!  This has to be a food-cost thing, since they haven't changed the menu in any other way as far as I can tell.  Yes, a steak sandwich probably costs more to make than a chicken sandwich.  But while I was coming here at least once a week when I needed a steak sandwich fix (with their excellent hot sauce,) now I'm coming here zero.  (And to think I was about to update my review and give it 4**** for the sandwich alone.)  Hey, if you need to charge .50 or $1 more to make your profit, do it...I'll still order it...just put it back on the menu!  Sometimes in an effort to squeeze out a few more pennies of profit, you end up squeezing out customers instead!

Yum! So happy that we finally have a new cute little local casual cafe (with delicious, affordable food) in the hood. For a place that lacks really good restaurants that won't break the bank, Coppelia hits the spot. Went last night and ordered the fish tacos and a beef empanada. Although the fish tacos were a little too mayo-y, the spiciness kicked it up a notch, and the empanada was perfection in fried dough. The place is simple and casual, servers were friendly - excited to get back (and get my free cookie for checking in twice!) :)
No comment
No comment
No comment

Several times I have gone out of my way to go to this diner on late nights. I like their fish tacos, (even though i wish they were a bit larger), Mac & Cheese w/ pork belly bits is YUMS, I like that I can get avocado with anything, I like that they have both regular diner/breakfast options and also latin food options. I like randomly getting up to dance salsa when we're buzzed. Place is small, narrow, always packed and busy, takes a while to get a seat and get your order, but its always worth it. Same chef and owner as Yerba buena, but a much cozier experience and menu; flavors are more familiar and comforting, and the menu supposedly has a pinch of Venezuelan influence too, im a native so you know i love that. A cuban diner is SUCH a great idea. And conveniently located.
Man that chipotle Brownie Sunday keeps me coming back!

This is a cute little latin diner.  I tried the mac & chicharron which at first I thought was basically just kraft mac and cheese jacked up with pork belly and chicharron but then once I started eating, I didn't even care! It's very rich and delicious!  I also tried the guacamole and lomo saltado which were flavorful although similiarly heavy.

Recently moved from Cali, I live in Brooklyn but work at the west village, on my breaks I like to search for places to eat and I'm so glad i found this place ! it's definitely a great place to go to !! my waitress was great, didn't get her name, she didn't need a check book to write my complicated order (i was afraid she was going to get it wrong) when i got my food it was perfect ! very delicious ! They have a variety of things and their drinks are a bit expensive but strong ! definitely recommend this place !!

Always a fantastic experience. The food is fantastic. The service is delightful. You absolutely must try the Mac n Chicharron, it's to die for. Enjoy the drinks as well. The Gran Paloma is delicious and dangerous.
No comment

Wow ! Found this place through "Serious Eats" and just so happy that we finally got to eat here last night. Hands down- BEST CUBAN SPOT EVER !!!!! We seriously thought we were eating Cuban food down in Miami again. My husband got the Cuban sandwich and I got the Lechon and side of Morro- DELISH !! The yucca was cooked perfectly as well as the pork was seasoned with lots of garlic just like a real home style Cuban dish. We finished off with the Flan w/blueberries- yum :) Will def return again !!!! Also the staff was super friendly.

Coppelia's is situated on 14 St. between 7th Avenue and 8th Avenue in Manhattan.  It is closer to 7th Avenue and is 2-3 stores away from the Donut Pub.  The place is easy on the eyes and a comfortable feel.  When I first came in I waited for a minute or two before my waiter apologized for making me wait.  Then led me to a small table right next to the window looking out on 14th Street. There was a crowd of waiters talking and walking around the counter.   I like the menu printed placemat.  It allows you to glance and keep on glancing even after you have made your selection.  I had the Cubano with Yucca Fries.  The Cubano is $7.95 and the Deluxe is + $2.25.  The Deluxe is your sandwich with a choice of chips/fries.  It took a while for the food to come, I see they are a bit laid back here.  There's latin music playing in the background and it truly enhances the whole latino vibe.  My waiter was attentative and even stop by to tell me it wouldn't be much longer for the food to come.  He was friendly and knowledgeable about the food and the menu.   When my food came, it didn't disappoint.  A basket contained my sandwich and fries.  I found this sandwich to be quite formidable in size.   Bread pressed so thin, stuffed with the ham, cheese, shredded pork, pickles and mustard.  At first bite, you get a burst of flavor and that makes you continue to want to eat some more.    The yucca fries are thick and enrobed in a coating that is thick as well.  It has mild flavor, but when dipped in the chipotle ketchup it is outrageously good.  The fries come with 2 dipping sauces.  One was the Chipotle Ketchup and the other a Peruvian spicy sauce with black pepper.  The chipotle ketchup was the winner for  me!  It has the smokey taste of chipotle and a nice spicy kick to it.  You taste the smokiness immediately as you put the ketchup on your tongue.   I kept using my yucca fries to scoop up ketchup and drop into my mouth with the fries.     I am looking forward to coming back here and trying many other items, especially their breakfast items, which are served all day.   Since this place opens 24 hrs you can eat breakfast anytime you want.  That's another plus in my book.  Just lose those rancid smelling dish towels used as table napkins and get some AC action going and then Coppelia will be even better!

I liked it, but not my favorite Cuban restaurant in the city. I got the ropa vieja and it was a little spicy.  It's definitely not supposed to be spicy. That's not very Cuban.  Also, they didn't have their liquor license yet, so that was a little sad.
I ordered lunch from here the other day and it was delicious! They delivered within 15 min. I loved the mango tres leches and the arepa sandwiches!
Absolutely delicious food. Skirt steak with plantains, rice and beans was amazing! Tres Leches! Sandia! Always busy, so I'm not the only one that loves this place.

Great food and service, whether it be delivery or dining in.  One of my favorite cheap dishes in NYC is the mac and chicharron from this place.  It's spicy and nom-licious, and I would eat it every day if I could.  The only downsides about this place so far have been a friend's glass of spoiled milk, and the fact that I couldn't use the bathroom sink once because a prior patron had filled it with post-club woes.

Although from looking at the menu and professional pictures I wanted to try almost half of their dishes, I did not feel good nor healthy after trying their ceviche and ropas viejas. The meat was poor quality and too greasy for my taste and the ceviche was soaked in lime juice to the point I couldn't handle the acidity. I would say this restaurant is okay, but not great.

Overall this place is terrific -- great happy-hour cocktails, delicious pernil, reasonable prices, and a super-nice, friendly, helpful waiter.  Very busy at dinnertime and don't take reservations, so that could be a problem.  We got there at 6:30 and were seated promptly, but a little later and there would have been a wait.  My only complaint was that the tables are very close together and it was really loud, with people raising their voices in order to be heard.  Noise is a pet peeve of mine, so if it doesn't bother you, consider this a five-star review.
No comment

I was craving Cuban food lately, so I decided to try Coppelia in Chelsea with a friend. I ordered the tacos compechanos, which included skirt steak and chorizo. The best part that was different about the tacos was the chicharron (crispy fried pork skin), which gave it a nice crunch and flavor to the tacos. I highly recommend this place if you are craving Latin food. Open 24 hours.
Went Saturday around early afternoon for brunch. Attentive service. The sangria is nice and strong! Great for small group hang outs. I would go back.

I went for brunch and it was a really good surprise, as I am not really into Cuban food. Delicious food, friendly staff, nice atmosphere. They have Mexican and Venezuelan (arepas) dishes and fresh guanabana juices.
Yucca fries!!  Great food at a great price and super friendly service.

Incredible menu, have not been disappointed by anything I've tried yet. However, the Mac and Chicharron is easily the best thing I've had so far. Prices for food of this quality could be sky high, yet everything on this menu is completely affordable. Not to mention it is open 24/7. Next paycheck I will be trying one of the enticing Main Courses.

We headed to Coppelia desperately in need of a drink at about sunset. This is what happens when you join other manhattanhenge revelers on 14th st trying to get a shot of the setting sun whilst cars/bicycles/traffic gunn you down! Coppelia's margarita certainly did the trick. Jalapeno was a prominent ingredient in all the cocktails -- definitely a menu aiming to please. The service was friendly and warm. We had no issues getting a table for apps and drinks. Cuban corn, guac, oxtail empanadas (absolutely amazing), made this a lovely meal fitting for manhattanhenge :)
No comment
Great food with a Cuban influence. Great service.  The chipotle brownie Sunday will stop you in your tracks.  Service was prompt and friendly.

Went with 2 of my girlfriends...the fish taco are good... one of my friends had the kale salad...she loved it...my other friend had the shrimp, I took a bite and it was tasty...service was good too. I wish I would have tried more stuff. I sure will be going back, I can't wait!

I cannot understand why I was not aware of the place. I frequent Chelsea-ian on the weekends. I was starving and knew I was heading on the train home to study. No time to cook and did several hours of volunteering. I stopped by and even as a pescatarian I was impressed! I wish I had more time and company, being familiar with yucca, I would have tried the Yucca Fries. However, I chose the pancakes and I was in heaven, friendly waitresses and  happy staff made you feel like making this your regular eatery. I will return with a following, Happy
One of my new favorite spots on 14th Street. Mojitos are awesome and the food is fantastic.

I LOVE Cuban food, but most Cuban spots in NYC are either a bit too pretentious or into some random shabby chic aesthetic. But thankfully, Coppelia's Miami diner-style interior is casual but stylish. Good food at good prices, and at a GREAT location that can't be beat. Super conveniently located: pretty much a few casual steps away from the 14th St station on the 1/2/3.
Great vibes. Delicious food. Friendly staff. The menu is really really good, with surprising items you wouldn't expect. Prices are very reasonable and its 24 hours. Super solid establishment.

I am a regular here...love the brunch. The huevos rancheros are superb. I think it's one of the best brunch options in the area and it's consistently good. Prices are also reasonable for the neighbor hood.
No comment

I really love this place but for the first time, on my last visit, I felt it is just too pricy, not for the quality but for the amount of food served. Adding a few more of their yummy veggies to the rather scant portions would cost almost nothing and would add a more abundant feel to the meal. Something complimentary when folks sit down would add to the concept of a welcoming 24 hour diner with good and thoughtfully prepared Latin food, which is a big part of the charm of Coppelia.

Great neighborhood resource for any time of day or night.  Now serving beer and wine after seemingly interminable delay of their license. Full bar coming, so they say. Not haute cuisine, but haven't yet had anything I didn't like, from burgers to fettuccine with oxtail ragu.

This is one of my favorite lunch spots. They have an avocado shake that sounds odd but is A-mazing.  Try it. The Cuban sandwich and salads are delicious. The service is always friendly and everyone seems to be having a good time.
Great food, Breakfast 24 hours a day? that's cool...

This is a really fun Cuban diner! I had a really unique chicharron salad - it wasn't fancy, but it was delicious! Lettuce tossed in a light avocado salad with salty pork and pork rinds - it was a nice "light" option after lots of heavy butter / cream sauces during my travels. The side of sweet plantains was perfect to satisfy my sweet tooth. My husband had the lomo saltado, which was a stirfry, that he also enjoyed. If you are looking to satisfy some late night savory cravings, this is the place for you.

After many visits to this place I'm finally ready to write a review.. Really nice service, awesome gran paloma margaritas and French toasts to die for! The food is ok.. I've been recommending this place to all my friends!!!

Excellent burger.  Asked for medium rare and it was medium rare.  Good thickness, not the new standard of thin squished shake shack crap style. Yuca fries were interesting with a good chew.  Pernil was decent , but lacked flavor.  As mentioned in other reviews, the avocado shake is refreshing, and not an overpowering avocado flavor.  Passion fruit float was good as well.  Got here early eve, so it was not crowded, but still loud.  Service is fine.  Will come back to try more.

This Cuban diner has an authentic Cuban feel when you walk in. The food is good with great presentation for its casual vibe and there are multiple vegetarian options! During the day it is a very casual lunch spot and in the evenings with the lights turned down, the atmosphere shifts to something more fun yet still casual. Open all night with fantastic sangria and great alcoholic milkshakes for dessert. Speaking of milkshakes...one of the fun twists at this diner is the avocado milkshake (now this one is without the alcohol of course!). The flavor combo seems bizarre but they get it right. Also have to mention the yucca fries-excellent, the only disappointment is the serving size because you will go through it quickly!

The only reason this place isn't getting five stars is because of the extremely tight seating areas. Other than that, I loved this place! The food was delicious, the wait staff was great, prices were reasonable, and the place is open 24/7. I would definitely recommend this place!

I bring out of towners to Coppelia every chance I get. I even dragged along my family for brunch on Christmas eve and they made room for all 15 of us. My favorite dinner order is an avocado milkshake (fantastic!) and the Cuban sandwich. The cocktails are also fabulous, particularly the spicy Michelada and the mojitos. For non-pork folks, the veggie burger, salads and beef empanadas are also excellent.

Cubano with yucca fries was amazing.  Really well executed and I could have finished a soup bowl of the chimichurri sauce.  The bartender made me a pisco sour with cinnamon sprinkled on top that was better than anything I've had in Peru.  Then he followed it up with a mezcal cocktail on the house to welcome me to New York.  Highlight of my weekend.
Friendly, speedy service, delicious and decent sized food, decent price! I love it and I'm definitely coming back! The location is a big plus!
Amazing delivery. The nachos will change your life.
When we first walked in the hostess had an attitude and wasn't accommodating at all. fortunately The guacamole and chips were amazing as was the lomo saltado. I will definitely return!
No comment

Coppelia is amazing. I visited a number of times over the summer, at hours ranging from 12:30 PM to 8 PM to 3 AM, and was constantly awed by the quality of food and reasonable prices. The ambiance of the restaurant is lovely, with a Latin American feel, and the options are expansive (including breakfast served - literally - all day). I particularly love the huevos Coppelia, the mac and chicharron, the nachos, and the reasonably priced ceviche. The place even has fantastic happy hours! I would absolutely recommend Coppelia to anyone looking for a reasonable snack or meal in Chelsea.
No comment
No comment
The food is delicious but the portions are too small for the price. The Mac and Chicharron was great but I was shocked at the small portion.
Very genuine Cuban food open 24 hours and at very reasonable prices for the neighborhood!

Good food  (the Lomo Saltado made me cry it was so good!), reasonable prices, friendly and attractive wait staff. Can't wait to go back and eat my way through the rest of the menu. This is now one of my favorite places in the city!

On paper, Coppelia looks like an absolute winner: a Cuban bistro that behaves like a diner, an innovative menu, an attractive room, and in a hip neighborhood. Unfortunately, while the food isn't bad, the service is uneven and untrained. After two pleasant visits when the place wasn't busy, a friend and I went to dinner when it was. A waiter misinformed us about the length of the wait; the bartender ignored us while we stood at the bar, and a manager responded with surliness and attitude when challenged. In the end, we left and went to La Carbonara where we were treated with respect and enjoyed a well-served and prepared meal. I'll wait until Coppelia is a little less popular and the staff a little better trained before I think of going back.

I'm not a Cuban food aficionado, but I know what I like, and I like everything I've had here. Try the mac n cheese, the Cuban sandwich, and the avocado milkshake. Yes, the avocado milkshake. It's become my favorite milkshake ever. It gets a little loud and crowded inside, but because it's diner-like you probably won't be staying very long, anyway.
The food is inventive and tasty, which is a far cry from many of the other Cuban spots in NYC.  Try the Chicharron Mac & Cheese and House Cobb Salad.

We came here for Brunch on a Saturday afternoon, there are fair amount of customers but we sat down quickly without much of a wait. We ordered the Cubano sandwich, a side of sweet potato, Arepas Sandwich and a cafe con leche. Everything was delicious and it came with some blueberry muffin to start. We enjoyed everything and thought it was very authentic. The Cubano sandwich was good portion and Arepa was kind of small plate but taste great. Price was very affordable, definitely a good place to eat on W14th Street, we are happy that it is in a great location where we do not need to go to LES for some authentic food. We are a fan and will for sure come back again.
No comment

I was super excited to find a 24/7 restaurant that was not Chinese or Pizza. I went at 3 am and the service and food were good. We had the corn on the cob, guacamole, flautas, huevos rancheros and steak and eggs. Believe or not, the best dish was the corn on the cob. Everything else was good, but not amazing. The menu is a weird mix of Mexican, Cuban, Peruvian and Venezuelan (I am probably missing another one), which makes it challenging to get everything right. But, if it is 3am and you had some drinks, it won't matter any ways!
fish tacos were amazing. ropa vieja sooo goodz portion size was hugeeeee. couldnt even finish. seems like very good good here and service was great!

I adore this place. Everything on the menu is great-I've had most of the breakfast dishes. All wonderful. The Cubano sandwich is great.  Aguacate Cesear salad was wonderful.  Service is fast and friendly. Atmosphere is great. We eat here regularly.
This place is terrific!  Great service, very friendly and attentive.  The food was delicious.
No comment

I really truly honestly love this place and the food! Omg, the food!  I really love the Mac and Chicharron.  The breakfast food is amazing too.  Only issue I've had is being served by Sandro.  Don't get served by this guy!  Ask for someone else!  It was 4 of us sitting for dinner, and we all placed our separate orders: 2 starters, 1 soup, 1 snack, 4 entrées.  He comes back, after quite some time, with 1 starter, 1 soup, and 1 snack.  Where's the other starter!? So we ask, and he said that we didn't specify if we wanted him to bring the other starter before the food.  I'm sorry, what?  It's called a starter.....we thought it was obvious.  He continued to argue with us, but none of us specified about our starters, snacks, and soups coming before our entrées, so what was he even arguing about?  To top it off, the restaurant has this ridiculous policy of adding gratuity to the bill after 10pm.  So, we were forced to leave him an amazing tip for terrible service.  Needless to say, it wasn't cool.
Big fan of Coppelia.  The happy hour drinks are amazing.  Really refreshing and unique!  I've also had dinner and lunch here and loved them both.

Solid Cuban food, with a near-full complement of diner chow. The pernil was solid if not a little dry, but it was seasoned authentically. They have Mexican Coke, which I've always wanted to try, but didn't notice the difference.
No comment
No comment

Amazing. Omg. When I first came I was underwhelmed by the diner booths, but the food was fantastic. I got the churrasco steak. It was mouth watering,  tender and delicious.  The decorum is not extravagant but the food is soooo good. The servers are very nice as well. I would highly recommend this place. Btw you can get a free soft drink when you check in with yelp. I don't drink soda, but it's good to know they offer it. Enjoy.
Avoid the crowds; brunch on a Friday.  Delicious Cuban food. Yummy fried platanos. Nice cocktails. Next time I visit NYC, I'll be back.

I love the food and wish I could comment on the food separately...if so I'd call this place the best diner/Cuban snack food place in Manhattan. But not anymore. My husband and I used to order 3 times a week for the last 2 years for dinners and party snacks, and I ordered their oatmeal and a side of plantains every morning on my way to work. Service really began to fall off about 6 months ago and has gotten to the point where we won't be giving them our business anymore. The take-out order girl is confused by the menu, and when she can't understand what you're saying makes any answer up. She didn't understand "bacon, well done," so she insisted there was a chef's rule against cooking bacon well done. (Um...really?) What took the cake--my husband went in to order oatmeal, and asked it be made with milk instead of water, my usual. Julio, the manager, told him its not possible to make oatmeal with milk instead of water. We said this confused us--they always did before. Julio said we were wrong. We pulled up a picture of the milk-based oatmeal I'd eaten for breakfast a few days before, with their usual blackberries on top and their own takeout bag in the foreground: "no, we didn't do that. It is impossible to cook oatmeal with milk." Wait...it isn't? Then MAGIC is afoot, because I've seen it done...and then eaten it. My husband finally asked, politely, if Julio and the chef would attempt to make it with milk to humor us as regulars, Julio cursed and glared and yelled at the chef to make it. When it came out, the oats were uncooked and in a clump at the bottom of the cup, hot milk on top. No berries. Hot soupmilk. My husband was still nice and said as we've ordered there for years without problem it must be confusion with a new chef, hot milk with oats floating in it is not standard and WHY THE HELL ARE WE FIGHTING OVER OATMEAL, it takes 5 minutes and is cheap and the restaurant was slow. Julio said if we didn't like how they cook we could "go somewhere else and never come back." Years of business, tossed aside because we dare to suggest milk-based oatmeal is possible? Adios, Coppelia. We will miss you and the huevos rancheros! Oh, you know the donut shop next door to you? They make oatmeal, with milk, for $1 less. It takes 3 minutes and it not a mirage. Our daily orders are officially to your competitors, Julio. Give our regards to the chef.

This place is a hidden gem. It has a diner feel, and the menu/prices reflect that. The food was fresh, and the portions were strong. The atmosphere is a bit dark, but the service was very fast. I will absolutely be coming back, especially since it's open 24/7!
The guac and chicharron chopped salad are great! Always a staple when I'm in the area. They are open 24 hours which is even better! The only place around that has great food late night
No comment
No comment
No comment

I generally like to sample a wide number of options on a restaurant's menu--the fact that I ordered the same item each of my four times here is truly a testament to the deliciousness of their steak & eggs.  The atmosphere is low key and service staff has stood out as above average every time.

This is one of those places that is good to eat around IF you are in the area. My first experience was really good, their legendary "Lomo Saltado" beef,  won me over, and their prices just seem right for this Chelsea diner. I came back often to this place, but just one small thing ticked me (and my partner off) I don't know if this happens usually , but because the majority of the staff is latin or from Spanish speaking descent , some of the comments I heard while walking in at one time, were anything BUT necessary , i would encourage more respect from any restaurant service staff, specially this one given the area, other than that , we are good. Coppelia offers a wonderful and creative selection of fusion foods ranging from Peruvian, Cuban, Mexican, and American influences. It is a restaurant worth exploring into if you have not yet gone.
No comment

The food is middle of the road but the service is terrible. Not sure why it takes over an hour to make a salad. Also as a piece of advice, don't serve vegetables that have clearly gone bad to customers. No one is paying for rotton food. Having said that, the oxtail empanada was delicious but then again so is everything deep fried. The fish tacos were a pass.

Really nice place that does what it sets out to do. The new floors are lovely, the staff is attentive, and the vibe is fun and upbeat. The cuban food is excellent, and it's a great late-night spot. The highlight, though, are the deserts. The dolce de lece cake is amazing, and the chocolate cookies are really well-balanced. I'm only dinging them one star because the noise level can be really difficult to deal with, sometimes.

We had a bad experience in this restaurant, the food is not good, at all. They offer in their menu Peruvian food, that not does not taste or have the presentation of what Peruvian food is actually like. Also everything is overpriced for the small portion that they give you. Do not be fooled with those pictures. As a Peruvian I felt insulted.
Loved the ambiance and food here! I orderd marinated chicken with quinoa and spicy kale...delicious! I definitely want to try the mac and cheese next time.

Good for a Cuban diner!  I came here a few years ago (more than 5); I didn't remember hating it and liking their yuca fries so I decided to give it another try.  We ordered the oxtail empanadas since it had such great reviews but I only thought it was ok.  It's not the same kind of empanada that I'm used to and they put a lot of sauce/garnish on top.  It made the empanada cold and mushy.  But the wings were really good.  I think it was the chocolate chipotle sauce (?).  You only get 6 wings; it's up to you to think if it was worth it.  I had the chicharron salad that I really enjoyed.  Don't be fooled though.  It's loaded with pulled pork and blue cheese with a fried egg on top.  Not what someone would considered a healthy salad but that's why it was tasty!  I added a side order of yucca fries which was pretty good, a bit on the greasy side.  My sister had the skirt steak and that was pretty good too except they need to give you a better steak knife.  The butter knife cut better than that!  Overall, I would come back if I was in the neighborhood.  Like I said, good for a Cuban diner.
favorite place in the city. authentically amazing cuban grub, great music and vibes, friendly attentive staff, sexy little cocktails, open 24/7, nothing not to love.
No comment

The only problem is - I always love everything I order, and want to order all of it, every time. The huevos rancheros and the kale salad with shrimp are delish.  As is the steak and eggs combo. And the coffee is good and strong.  Plus, a friendly staff and an A  NYC restaurant grade.

This is one good breakfast/brunch place. The space is beautiful, spacious and clean and waitstaff is nice and accommodating. But the most important thing is, of course, the food. I've had the eggs coppelia, the huevos rancheros, and the simple two eggs, and they are consistently delicious. OK OK, what can go wrong when making eggs, you ask? That's very true but they accompany their eggs with delicious potatoes in chimichurri sauce (and these CAN go wrong sometimes...) and give you a delicious cuban toast. Plus the coffee is really excellent, far better than other diners. You leave satisfied without breaking the bank... what else can you ask for?

The place was full enough and hip. Being Puerto Rican I was excited to try a new Latin restaurant. Cute decor, quick seating, and good salsa played. Thankfully not too loud. Food was not good. We ordered the calamari appetizer. It was over  fried and bland. Followed by the paella which tasted like it came out of a box mix. A disappointing tourist trap serving up food that bears no resemblance to anything authentic.

Mmmmm Yum! Havana salad is a must. Brussel sprouts were roasted well - I prefer mine crispy - these were not, but they weren't mushy. Could of done without onions though. Service was good though I ordered my salad with the dressing on the side and it came dressed. I asked to get it on the side as I ordered and he questioned whether I ordered it that way. My friend I was with confirmed, yes I had in fact asked for dressing on the side. Not a big deal but not the best idea to question your customers. That said, I will definitely go back.

I love this place for breakfast and brunch - I like to bring friends because the food is good, it's reasonably priced, and it's got a nice, laid-back vibe. I almost always get the Huevos Coppelia - ham, poached eggs, and cheese sauce on top of two biscuits with home fries. The dulce de leche milkshake is great if you like things sweet. Service is friendly but sometimes inexplicably slow.
Best Cuban in the city, hands down. The food is a 10, reasonably priced, great service, and laid back atmosphere. Open 24 hours? I'm sold.

I wandered into here one night and didn't really know what to expect. I ordered the Lomo Saltado and it was amazing! It was super flavorful, although a little salty, and was just delicious. The main courses here are a little pricey so I wouldn't eat here regularly but definitely worth it to try, and stop back occasionally if I'm in the area again.

A great New York spot but the food was disappointing. The steaks were over salted and crusted. The creamed spinach inedible because of the amount of garlic. Service was good though and the room is fun.

In the middle of eating my veggie burger at the bar the manager asks me to move in order to accommodate other guests. Then she asked if I was upset? Thumbs down to this woman. She needs to take a remedial course in restaurant management. Coppelia, I've lost my appetite and will not be returning!

Love this place. It's definitely in my rotation of go-to places. Stumbled upon it one night when the line at cafeteria was too long. After eating there countless times, It boggles the mind that people actually wait for cafeteria's overpriced & disappointing food when Coppelia is right around the corner. Start off with the fried cebollines & oxtail empanadas - definitely not healthy but worth the calorie splurge. The soups are always flavorful and satisfying options. My favorite dishes would have to be the ropa vieja, pepper steak, and chicharron salad. The salad is even better if you substitute queso fresco for the blue cheese! There are very missteps with the food - don't get the ceviche though. It's slightly off in acidic & condiment balance and the textures just don't come together. Also, the home fries with breakfast are a little substandard. But that's minor quibbling. Only reason it's not five stars is because if it's busy the service flounders in quality - when I've been there at busy times it's downright impossible to get your server's attention & paying your bill becomes a saga.

food took an hour and 20 minutes to be delivered, fries were cold and seems like they fried them in water since they were so soggy, my pepsi was warmer then the food. the cuban sandwich was the best  i have ever had, even it being cold.
Perfect burger. Do not approve of their pickle selection. Friendly service and I nice spot overall for a good meal
omg!! surprisingly great! note to alcoholics: no liquor license!!!!! but 24 hr south american food and AVOCADO milkshakes? yes PLZZZ

New York, New York! How I love the wealth of cuisines to choose from, especially Cuban food.  We came here right before Happy Hour ended, so we were able to order some mojitos...meh.  They were weak and a little watery, but cheers to getting drinks for cheaper, huh?  Because I was full from my gluttonous excursions, I only ordered an agave nectar  crusted calamari with plantains.   It was wonderful! My friend had the Ropa Viejo entree, her must try at any Cuban restaurant we go to.  She thought it was pretty decent, but nothing too special.  The one thing I will say about Coppelia is that it's open 24 hours, so if you're craving a late night meal, you could come here.   I felt like the food was good enough, but certainly not any more spectacular for New York cuisine than other places I've been to.    The server was also spotty--I think he realized we weren't going to order a ton of food and drinks and wanted to (understandably!) make his tips worth it with bigger tables and orders.   However, it puts a  bit of a negative effect on us as customers, so that even if I had wanted to bring a party in next time, I would think twice about it.

Food was cold. Told us the kitchen messed up our order and so the food would take longer to arrive, however when it arrived it was not only incorrect, but soggy. When we got our check, they didn't give me my credit card back. I asked the manager, he took the receipt back and brought it back to me with the card and told me it was there the whole time which it wasn't. Overall: my worst dining experience in NYC in seven years.

Although they don't take reservations, they will take a "call-ahead" reservation about an hour in advance.  The wait staff were all very sweet, friendly & accomodating.  The Mac & Chicharron was very very tasty.  Guacamole fresh with mix plaintain, sweet potato & tortila chips.  Tres Leches Cake with mango was light & fluffy, a nice finishing touch.  We were a large group and not rushed out.  Yay! I'm a fan.

I guess I didn't notice that NO in Yelp's TAKES RESERVATIONS?. I made them anyway, but had to wait a half hour for a large table. After that, everything was hunky dory. Food Great! Great service from our Peruvian waiter. We had the PERLIN, CERVICHE, a side of Chicarones.  And a ton more. Best were the chicken dishes: not overcooked, plentiful and great for sharing. Try the ARROZ CON POLLO. We split a CUBANO sandwich, served on what seemed like pumpernickel. (Cuban pumpernickel?)  The CUBAN in the name is a bit of a misnomer. Even SPANISH-SPEAKING wouldn't do it. (They have Chirasco... though it's not served Brazilian carve-at-the-table style.) But this 24 hour place is LATINO, though the clientele are more CHELSEANO. At 9:30 on Thursday, it was packed. Maybe it's emptier after drinking hours, but somehow I doubt it.  --Drink Club NYC is a roving group of NYC Drinkers... a new bar every week

I wrote a tip about the delicious homemade nachos at this place but allow me to expound on its other delicacies. The chicken sandwich with avocado was amazing as was the...chipotle brownie sundae. Best Sundae Ever. chocolatey with a hit of warmth in your throat. perfect for cold winter days :)

Julian Medina has out done himself!  My meal was outrageously AMAZING and on point.  The mixed green salad with sherry vinaigrette was so fresh and vibrant.   The potato crusted tilapia resting in plantain puree and tomato sals was sheer heaven. This was the best tilapia I have had... in years... possibly EVER.  I also had a side of sauteed spinach that was perfect. The service was wonderful. Coppelia is my new home for yummy food... cant wait to try the blue corn meal pancakes this weekend!

Finally had brunch there after living around the corner since they opened. The huevos rancheros are really great, their hot sauce is really hot, and the basic rice and beans beneath the tortilla, tomatillo sauce and over easy eggs is perfect. Pancakes were fluffy but not overly cakey, the yogurt and granola features real fresh berries. This is the go-to spot!
great food, great service and it's open 24 hours a day! what else do you need?! gotta try the mac & chicharon!!!!
Best cuban I have had in NYC, great alternative to your usual NYC diner.

The service here is great. The waiter is very friendly and gives great advice. But the yucca fries weren't as good as I expected. The Cuban sandwich was also disappointing. It was kind of dry. But that might be because I didn't have any sauce in it. The sauce that was offered was mustard. And personally, I hate mustard.
Atmosphere was real nice n laid back....that chicken n yellow rice was on point!!

I adore this place. Great for meetings. Service and food are consistently great. Atmosphere is laid back and causal but also colorful - not a drab diner feel. I particularly love their milkshakes, sides, and huevos rancheros.

While there were many empty tables, we waited almost a hour until they served over a dozen customers who came in after us. So we went and asked the waitress, who was extremely rude and explained that they don't have a table ready for 3.
Delicious fish tacos! The griled chicken sandwich is amazing and order the side salad instead of fries, it is Kale, pumpkin seeds, really great!

Came here the first time yesterday and was blown away by the food and specialty cocktails! Happy hour is by far one of the best. I love the kanella cocktail. Staff is also very friendly and attentive.

We went here for dinner last night. We ordered the mazorca for apps. My daughter had the huevos rancheros,  I had the arroz con pollo and hubby had the diablo camarones. Daughter loved the huevos, hubby liked his shrimp. My arroz con pollo was ok. The rice was tasty but the chicken was white meat and WAY over done. It was toughh to chew. Waiter was friendly. Would definitely come back again to try some other dishes.

We were looking for fish tacos in the area and happened upon this highly reviewed spot on Yelp so we had to try it.  The good: It's a Cuban diner type of restaurant and has a great variety of tasty foods to choose from; and they open until 5:30am in the weekends.  The bad: The 2 $$ signs are misleading. They have small tapas-like items, such as empanadas, fish tacos and the like but they are overpriced. We got 2 mini fish tacos for $10.  Of course, we expected them to be bigger, especially for $10! The entrees are $18-25 and average sized. This place should have 3 $$$. I got the oxtail empanadas and fish tacos and even w/ a free check-in soft drink, had to pay over $20.  A meal w/ a small appetizer will cost you $30 easy at this spot. Also, the waitress gave us an attitude after she clearly got our order wrong and then didn't even wait on us the rest of the meal. That put a bad taste in our mouths. So overall, I give this place 3 stars. (Oh, I just laughed while reading other reviews on this place. THEY HAVE LINTY CLOTH NAPKINS. I walked out of the restaurant and found all this white lint on my pants. No bueno.)
No comment

Been here a couple of times recently with some girlfriends and it is fast becoming a fave spot for me. The food and cocktails are excellent. The calamari is a great dish and not what you expect. The atmosphere is pretty cool for a diner and the service is always very friendly and attentive.

Cuban diner fusion...lol.  We sat at the counter/bar and ordered a few things.  The service was great and they gave us a free mexican wedding cookie to try since i was curious as to what on earth it was.  Very nice of them.  The cuban sando, sadly, was ok but i've had better.  Not sure what it's missing but something is missing. The oxtail empanada was small and a tiny greasy.  The moros (black beans and rice) was very good.  The mac 'n cheese with chicarron (don't let this scare you, can just pick it off the top) was OUTSTANDING!  The best mac 'n chs in the city.  They use elbow noodles which is unfortunate but the cheesy sauce is sick.  It has a little bit of a kick to it and the server laughed (with me not at me) when i told him so.  I still had to finish even though my mouth was slightly tingling. Don't let the heat discourage you....it's really good.  I will def go back to try other things on the menu.  Fish tacos next.
The food here is great, everything I have tried is delicious.  The only downfall is the crazy, crowded waiting that I have to endure to get to the food.

Went last night with husband and daughter. It is a pretty cool,buzzing place and I felt happy to be there. The food was good. We had fish tacos, Mac and cheese chicharonnes, and seviche to start, then hubby had a big Caesar with avocado and my daughter and I had a nice skirt steak with plantains and rice and beans. Nice big dinner, we each had a drink, and the bill was a little over a hundred bucks. Good value, cool place.

Was pleasantly surprised by this place. Atmosphere is great, service was quick and easy. I got waffles for dinner--they were delicious and the syrup was a kind of dulce-de-leche style thing which was delicious. Split some sweet plantain fries with the table which were also very good. Friends got arepa and huevos Coppelia and both enjoyed their food. Would definitely go again.

Good steady place.  Good food, reasonable prices, friendly staff.  Excellent Cubano sandwiches. Really like the lomo saltado which is very tasty and a substantial portion. Wonderful drinks here as well. Nice atmosphere but sometimes gets crowded at night.

I love the fact that this place is open 24 hours and in a really great location. The ambiance is great too - not too traditional for a diner, with lots of beautiful photos and Latin music playing. The food and drinks are great, though the service was a bit slow and they overcharged us on one item. Go for the food, especially if you like Latin American cuisine. But don't expect five star service. Also, the prices are just slightly higher than they should be considering that it is in fact a diner.
Best happy hour in the city. Kale salad, pork sandwich, and a tamarind margarita....perfect combination!  Ask to meet Pedro....he's quite a character:)

Amazingly delish chow, and as good a quality/price ratio as you will ever find. Terrific soups and salads, the best guacamole (served with home made plantain chips), juicy ropa viega, sandwiches. Did not love the oxtail empanada...a bit rich and overly fancy for my taste. This is a sure bet...go for it!
the cubano sandwich was excellent. yucca fried fries, eh...not so much. the steamed ones looked way better. will definitely go back to try other stuff! very nice staff, and a nice establishment.

A friend recommended this "latin diner" type place to me, so what the hell, I tried it. I'm a fan, good food, nice service. It is technically "latin based food," but actually has a wide variety of menu options for those who are uneasy to try unfamiliar foods. I tried the steak over rice & beans with side of salad & a plantane, it was pretty good (although not the best steak I ever had, but I still recommend it). We also got the wings as appetizers; coated in chipolte & chocolate sauce. The flavor was slightly there, but honestly tasted more like buffalo & chipolte.. maybe a hint of chocolate? but I might have been imaging it... The table next to me got the mac & cheese with pork belly and chicharron, that looked amazing, I wish we had gotten it! I couldn't drink that night, so I'm bummed I didn't get any of their cocktails, but I think I'll be going back & try some more. That being said, I'll be going back for more yummy food!

We just really loved it. Had the ceviche which I agree is very citrusy yet we loved the tang of it. We also had the lomo saltado (an item I search for all over the east coast and possibly my favorite meal) and it was brilliant with braised instead of stir fried chunks of delicious beef that melt in you mouth.  The pernil was a large portion and not as good as the lomo but yummy.  Cocktails were great and service was top notch.  Can't wait to go back.
Love love love the food! Kale salad is outstanding. Omelete is amazing. Coffee is good, Bloody Mary is drinkable. Service is not my favorite but not terrible.
The food is great. the delivery is fast. the Heuvos Racheros are to die for.

I heard about this restaurant months ago and was excited to try it. Came here for a late night dinner and it just wasn't good. Customer service was great. The waiter was very attentive been the food lacked majorly. We started with the cheese croquetas which were good. Also ordered empanadas which weren't great. I ordered the mac n chicharron which was wwaaayyyy too spicy. I love spice but this just wasn't edible. Another ordered the churrasco with black beans and rice, beans were too watery. For a cuban restaurant this was definitely NOT authentic. Definitely will not be returning.

I've been here a few times and I can say at first I wasn't that thrilled. But recently they seem to have found their stride and the food is really good. If you're trying to compare this to a dos caminos, don't. That's like comparing McDonald's to Corner bistro. The place never gets too packed so you don't have to worry about a wait. It's not much of a scene but it's a good place to go with friends either before or after your night out. If you go, the nachos are a must to start and I really like the chicken enchiladas and rope vieja.
Best Cubano I ever ate! Service is so-so. They take your order and give you the food. Nothing spectacular, but good prices and again the BEST Cubano I ever ate.
Great food, good prices and open all night. Can't be beat.
For a first time visitor seeking a taste of Cuba you can't go wrong.  The portions are generous and the Mojitos are the best!
The chocolate chipolte chicken wings were delicious! Very friendly wait staff and great service as well.
No comment

I am about to become a serious regular at this place. It's hard to find a restaurant in New York -- particularly in the West Village -- that has food of this quality with entrees priced under $20. It's even harder to find one that has a warm and wonderful atmosphere and a very friendly staff. I particularly recommend the guacamole, the ceviche, the lomo saltado (perfect short ribs+french fries soaked in short rib juice+delicious sauteed tomatoes and onions) and especially the torrejas de oliva for dessert. The torrejas is a olive oil-soaked cake with a bruleed topping and amazing blackberry sauce -- you can definitely tell that there is a serious pastry chef (Pichet Ong) involved here. I cannot wait for Coppelia to get its liquor license, since everything on the menu will go very well with a nice cold beer.

Always looking for decent places to eat in the West Village/Union Square area, a friend introduced me to this Cuban diner. Though it is open 24/7, the food did not disappoint at all! I came here on a Saturday in the late afternoon with a couple of friends, among them a Mexican and a Puerto Rican who gave a thumbs up to their sweet plaintains! If you're looking for a heartier dish, try the ropa vieja.... delicious slow cooked beef! I ordered the ceviche limeno, which was a bit too tangy for me. If you're not feeling the Latin vibe, there are decent basic breakfast choices served all day. Friendly and attentive staff, very affordable, sanitary, nice decor, no wait time for us, and best of all, open all day & night!

I don't even know where to start with this place. I had to pretty much order every thing off the menu. Lets start with the Passion fruit soda float. My god, how delicious. I never had one of these before and I'm so happy i did, it was awesome. The passion fruit tasted fresh, my mouth is watering right now! Then we move on to the actual food! The calamari was just so well seasoned, i never had it like that before. It was finger licking good. The fish tacos, the oxtail empanadas were all amazing starters. BUT THE MAC AND CHEESE chicharron WAS MY FAVORITE!!!!!!!!!! omg I'm craving it right now. Had the perfect amount of spice and season. The deserts were just everything you expect after a great hearty meal.  Im definitely going back...like maybe tonight lol. :)

Found place by luck. We were in Chelsea because of the YMCA and needed a place for lunch. all five of us loved our lunches, but the waffles, empanadas and the arepa sandwich were the big winners.  Friendly, helpful service. Hope to come again when we visit NY!

A friend told me about Coppelia, and I'm so glad he did.  Definitely one of my favorite places in the city--everything's good, everything's affordable, and the staff is super nice.  A big plus, too, is the 24 hours they're open, because after a late night of carousing, I need good early morning food to stave off the hangover blues.  The guacamole is good, the mazorca is good, and the macaroni and cheese is great.   I've started going regularly at brunch, though, and have had everything from pancakes to a breakfast burrito to juevos and it's all good.  I'm definitely addicted.

Loved this place from Day 1.  Whether for brunch, lunch, dinner, or drinks, Coppelia has been as consistent as it gets.  I usually piece together small plates like the chicarron de calamar, mac and chicharron, fish tacos, empanadas, but everything I've had here is good.  Great value!

I really enjoyed the food here!  The fish tacos were nice and crispy without being greasy or overly battered.  my main dish was the camarones diablo which had really nice seasoned white rice, and a sauce flavored with olives and capers.  There was plenty to bring home for lunch the next day.  The margarita i drank was also good, and the staff was friendly and attentive.  Already planning my next trip back!
I love this place!  Comfy booths, lots of energy, deeelish food, fast friendly service.  I've had breakfast, lunch, and dinner here and have never been disappointed.
No comment

This place is amazing!  As a Cuban American living in the city, good Cuban food is hard to come by.  To be completely honest, I haven't tried that much on the menu but the essentials: rice, beans, plantains, yuca, sandwiches are all on point.  While this isn't very close in authenticity to a Cafeteria on Calle Ocho, this satisfies any craving for the Cuban essentials.  My company orders for lunch from here all the time and they deliver super quickly and they always have really smart and well spoke staff answering the phones.

We love this place. We, who never eat out, pick up a few frita cubanas (hamburgers topped with roast pork) and take them home. Wonderful addition to our neighborhood. Open 7 days unless the subway is shut down by the mayor.

Was excited to try this place despite having a horrible experience at their sister restaurant toloache (overpriced, small portions, bland food, plus they managed to misplace my jacket), but I guess I should've known better. The service was beyond bad, no one to greet us at the door. Once seated we were approached within seconds of having sat down, no I haven't had a chance to read the menu thank you. After that the waitress disappeared for ages before we finally had the chance to order. Then, the wrong food comes out. We ask for more coffee and hot sauce... nothing. My boyfriend goes to the bar to ask for hot sauce while our lukewarm food gets even colder. The waitress comes over to the table five minutes later sans coffee and sans hot sauce?! The starter finally makes it out after both of us are completely finished with our entrees and they still have the nerve to put it on the bill. I politely ask if they could take it off, and the waitress again disappears for some time only to come back saying that her boss had agreed to comp it but next time we should send food back to the kitchen instead of eating it. Um excuse me????How about don't eff up our order next time. Don't worry, we won't be back.

i come here all the time , all the waiters are super friendly , i love how is open 24/7 , the music some times is good some times is ok , the drink are super good the food mmmmm not a big fan but its deff  affordable so that makes it up for it mmmm  love the fish tacos their sandwiches are very good and that about it.. try the spicy margarita is sooo good and refreshing , i think i keep on coming back bc of the service and the cocktails :]

It was a ridiculously fierce thunderstom that drove me into Coppelia.  What a wonderful stroke of luck.  I just love this place.  Friendly, friendly staff and wonderful food. The mac and cheese was the best.  Now I am hooked on this place.  Can't wait to go back to Manhattan to visit Coppelia.

worst waitress and service. waited a hour for a table and ended up being told my party wasnot complete and gave the table to other party with less people. she could have told us party must be complete to get the table but she didn't until a hour later. undereducated waitress is causing trouble for the business. a lot of the big tables are seated with 1 or 2 persons. no business sense and had no ides what she was supposed to do when traffic is big, cant work under pressure. would never recommend to anyone. the food are ok just by looking at the finish and plating.
really good cheap cuban food and in a relaxed atmosphere. love that it is open 24/7. They were able to accommodate a large party of 10 on a saturday night but we did have to wait for 30minutes

For what this place aims to be, it's phoocking spot-on I tell you. Indeed, plenty of dishes ain't cuban. I went with mostly cuban fare, overordered a bit. Portions are a hearty size. I don't think you'll be disappointed, but i don't know you...you might an oink oink. Maduros were perfect, not sliced like chips (tostone-style), but length wide, quite fresh y sabroso. Moros (beans y rice) were really good. They have their own hot sauce, or at least serve it in a glass jar with no brand name or anything. I hate getting brought tabasco. We also got the ceviche, which was aiiiiiight, tasty mon tasty. Fish tacos were had by my mate. I took a bite; that was the only thing that wasn't great. Fish was bland. Guac was quite good, creamy y fresh and they hook you up with a lovely combo of plantain chips, chips and corn chips or smthg of that ilk. Mojitos were quite good. Ambiance is tight, service was perfect. I just got back from cuba a few wks ago, and while I cannot compare this place to any eatery i visited there, the food is better than most places i at which i ate the same type of food there. I look fwd to going back late-night next time.
