i love this place. coffee's not the best and the pancakes can sometimes be a little dry, but how can you not love breakfast all day AND 24hr?  food is generally pretty good across the board, but the kicker is the service and the ambience.  staff is super-nice, friendly, and downright charming without being solicitous or phony.  spot is immaculate and comfortable, and cozy while spacious.  i'm there a lot as a good friend lives around the corner, and it's just a great spot to unwind, chat, and get some nice comfort food that's not boring and bland.

Really solid japanese tapas spot with delicious small plates and a cool intimate vibe. Loved the agedashi tofu, chicken nanban, salmon sashimi, and addictive cabbage! Will definitely be back since there was more on the menu I would try.

My friend and I came for a quick dinner. We only got two things to share because we already had some food beforehand. We got one appetizer (the clam) and one entree (mentaiko noodles). Both were soooooo good. The clam was better than I thought and the mentaiko noodles were very interesting. At first I wasn't sure if I liked it but I kept going back for more. Definitely will come back and order more things next time for a full dinner

I came here for quick drinks, and some appetizers but holy shitalki everything was delicious. We got seated right away, and offered sweet potato snack. It was yummy, and we couldn't stop eating. The sushi rolls were fantastic, drink was just right amount of alcohol, and ambience was very cute. I gotta come back for a full dinner.

Great food, great for casual date or a quick late night bite. Highly recommend the sake clam, nanban chicken, and fried smelt.
No comment

This is an excellent tapas place. If you're looking for small plates, come here vs Boqueria (yes, different cuisines but this one is much more flavorful). My favs/would order again: cucumber, cabbage, sake steamed clams, cream ramen, signature chicken, omelette. Would not order again: salmon and mushroom with miso in foil, eggplant, garlic butter fried rice, the regular fried chicken. Love the small portion size - can try lots of different dishes. Inside is ok, a bit small. Would recommend.

No comment

My friend and I were food hopping around NYC and we stopped by Izakaya. We ordered two small dishes and they were quite tasty. The Shishito Peppers had a good fry and lightly seasoned with salt. The Smelt Fish had good amount of roe inside and a nice crispness. Izakaya also has Orion beer (Okinawa) on draft. Izakaya is Japanese owned, so they know what they're doing. I'd come back again for their dinner course set.
No comment

A friend of mine and I stopped for a drink here on our NYC food tour. I loved the food and the people that worked here were mostly Japanese which was awesome! Our waitress was very knowledgeable about Sake and you can tell she was on top of everything. The Shishito's were very lightly seasoned and the fried smelt was perfectly fried.
Excellent all round. Charming, delicious food (get the salmon mushroom miso and yellowtail sashimi) and great drinks. Will come again soon.

Cozy, friendly, and delicious.  "Addictive Cabbage" is no joke, and the salmon tartare with guacamole is exquisitely subtle.  The salmon sashimi is also pretty amazing: you really got to know every seam of muscle and fat in that poor, doomed, splendid-tasting fish.  The portions are on the small side, but that's a consequence of wanting more of everything.

Fantastic Japanese restaurant. This was my last restaurant outing with friends pre-Covid. Crazy to think how much time it's been. The dishes are thoroughly well prepared and everything was excellent. Washed down with good quality sake and it's a fantastic meal!

Incredible meal, we ate and drank and lost track of time. Loved it and can't wait to go back.

I came here earlier this year in January with my boyfriend, who had been here before, and left happy and full! This is a small spot but service was quick and the food was excellent. We ordered the chicken nanban, agedashi tofu, addictive cabbage, and salmon truffle flavor with egg. Everything was on point. I had high expectations for this place and it definitely exceeded them. Will definitely come back again!

Ive been here twice. The atmosphere is cozy and chill. The food is good too. I recommend making reservation, it's 1.5hour dining time for walk-in.

Love the minimalist decor. Cute little hallway of a restaurant where they serve small dishes to share. Got the sake flight, which I enjoyed tremendously. The chicken nanban was good, and the thick salmon sashimi was actually thick. The corn croquette like some other reviewer said, had very little corn, but it was fried to perfect little balls, so I did like it. The only disappointment was the garlic mushroom butter fried rice, which was just okay. I would come back to try all the other little dishes!

Small and cozy restaurant with a very Japanese feel to it. Our servers were great and friendly, always stopping by to fill our waters. For an izakaya, the dishes are reasonably priced. For two people, we ordered the toro (generous portion), curry rice, fried smelt, addictive cabbage, and grilled mackerel. The sake was a bit pricey in my opinion. Nice place, make a reservation!

Disappointing experience. I ordered two beef sukiyaki they just gave me one. And it's a very long gap waiting for each dish. Taste is average, the weight of food is small and not serving with rice.

Service was alright, waitress wasn't excited to see us but the food came out reasonably quick. The menu was simple so easy to order and generous toppings for around $15 a bowl of ramen. Pretty much a generic ramen place with bamboo walls and tables. Not blown away but a good place to just pick up a bowl of ramen for a casual lunch.

Our favorite Izakaya spot in the city! Nothing fancy but it is everything a perfect izakaya should be that leaves nothing more to be desired. A late night bite after work or weekend strolls with friends for a relaxed meal and a beer, this place never disappoints. Everything we had there was absolutely delicious - the mushroom pasta, the clam broth (which is out of this world! We literally drank the entire broth!!) and a few other appetizers. Waitress is helpful and respectful, gives us time to look over menu yet leaves us some privacy when we need to talk.

Food was delicious. Drinks was delicious. Asumi our server was amazing. Highly recommend.

I love Izakayas and I loved this one. The raw scallops were super fresh, the beef tongue was delicious, the addictive cabbage was pretty addictive and everyone must try the mushroom garlic butter fried rice! I will go back here for just that dish! So freaking good. Service was quick and great. Super quaint little place. FYI there's a no tipping policy just like Japan but my wife and I still left $$ for the great time we had.

Been looking for a good sushi spot in the city for quite some time now and I will have to say I will definitely be ordering from here again. I had the salmon avocado and tuna roll -- so fresh it melts in your mouth. can't wait to order from here again (:

So delicious!! Good atmosphere and super cute waiter named Kazu who is so sweet & THE BEST  Small portions but super filling!

Nice little cozy restaurant with friendly staffs. We ordered 6 dishes, sake clams & curry beef bowl were our favorite. Skirt steak was alright. Beef tongues were a little overcook & addictive cabbage wasn't that addictive to me. Overall experience: great, will come back again. Some of the tapas are seasonal & ramen is only available during lunch time. P.s. they extended their Japanese culture so they do not take tips.

The restaurant is very racist toward some people. We are an Asian couple. On Saturday night we arrived and were given one empty table outside. After spending ten minutes to get the waitress attention to order, we were actually kicked out so they could give the table to two white guys with no explanation. Just "we need this table back". We were standing there awkwardly. They said they would give us a table soon. But after 15 min they actually gave another empty table to another group of white people. We asked and the waitress just went "you need to wait". Given all their customers sitting at that time were white, it made sense what they were trying to do. But it's funny to see an Asian restaurant not wanting Asian customers. But I guess racism is its philosophy.
Incredible food. Great prices. Loved my experience here. Highly recommend. Get the toro.

The moment you walk in, feels like you're in someone's home. Mind you, it's a cramped environment with very limited seating. The thick salmon sashimi was very juicy and tender. As the description states it's very thick not your typical thin slice sashimi. I would highly recommend ordering this. The Curry Doria was average. It tastes like a home cooked curry meal the one that your mom makes at home. I would still always recommend going to Curry-ya for Japanese curry because it is the best in New York.

Thought all the dishes we got here were delicious. We started with a simple cabbage appetizer (lightly salted with some sesame oil / sesame seeds), which was surprisingly good despite its simplicity. Chicken Nanban was amazing - sweetness of chicken (honey?) coupled with tanginess of the sauce was so addictive. We also had the garlic butter fried rice (was super excited for this and it didn't disappoint)- has little mushrooms in it. The fried scallops were good (great if you like scallops but I don't ha) and had a dipping sauce similar to that on the chicken. The tamago omelette was cute but probably my least favorite (though it wasn't intensely flavorful like the other dishes and provided a good break). The potato salad was standard (nice little crunchy bits of bacon? In there that was a nice touch) as was the salmon sashimi (probably will save sashimi for sushi focused spots in future). My favorite of the night though- definitely the Sukiyaki. The beef in that soup was so tender, and the noodles were fun (potato based like japchae but shape reminded me of ramen). I will say service was a little awkward (server wasn't great at answering our questions but more language barrier than rudeness), but ok overall.

Atmosphere is cozy, music is great, food is excellent, sake sangria is delicious. Literally have no complaints. Highly recommend.

This is definitely a hidden in east village. Their beef tongue is the best I've ever tasted.  And it's fried rice is also delicious. It's a nice place for small parties as it doesn't have too much space for larger parties. The price is kinda reasonable. But the dishes are a bit smaller than I expected.

I'm a huge fan of this spot! It's a cozy izakaya with a hole-in-the-wall feel with great food. I loved the signature chicken nanban (fried chicken with a sweet mayo based sauce) the most and the quality of the food was high. The bottle of sake we chose was reasonably priced and service was very attentive! The slight inconvenience was they only accepted cash that night but it was minor since we had enough of it. I would definitely come here again for a low key night.

Just get the first menu item on the Meats section, its like chicken H-something. Too buzzed to remember what it was called. Anyway, so insanely good I didn't even offer to let someone eat the last piece, I just took it. You're welcome!

The restaurant is tiny and in a modern style. The signature chicken Nanban is so good, it's not crispy style but soft and juicy, with cabbage and mayo. Addictive cabbage and grilled chicken is ok. I don't recommend Sukiyaki, it's a small portion and too salty for me.

It's a very warm and lovely restaurant! Although there weren't many options on the menu, every dish that I ordered was very authentic and delicious. Love this place. I will definitely come back in the future.

Made a reservation at 6pm today and it was open right on time. Most of the customers are Japanese and almost every table ordered sake or beer. We liked beef tongue best. Wasabi on the side of salmon sashimi was very fresh. Addictive cabbage was a must for each table. Izakaya pudding was sweet w/ a taste of bitter - which was amazing (and the owner said he would definitely recommend this one). No Tips!
AMAZING. The food was excellent and FAST. Whatever the omelette thing is...ORDER IT!  You won't regret it.
It's my first time to write absolutely negative review. Really bad food, they can't do fried chicken well, use one type of sauce to deal with different dishes, almost no chicken In curry chicken.

This is my favorite izakaya in NYC.  Must haves:  Chicken Nanban, grilled Mackerel, mushroom fried rice, addictive cabbage (I make it at home now).  Tip is included in the price of the dishes.  I miss the original owners, but it is still best.  (please bring back the potato salad for the nanban)

There are a lot of different Japanise restoraunt in New York. This place is really tiny and can be uncomfortable for big group of people. Some dishes are okay, some are not so tasty. Service depends on different cooks and waiters. Can give only three stars from five according to all marks.

We put our name in and the waitress said 30 minutes we showed up 45 minutes later and she squeezed us into a small table for two and there was three of us! We waited at least 10 minutes before deciding to go somewhere else. Horrible experience won't be back.

I want to commend the staff for handling an unfortunate incident incredibly well. My husband, sister and I came in around 6:30 and were able to be served before the roof started to leak uncontrollably. (It appears that a neighbor had a flood and it trickled into Izakaya). Even though it was a stressful situation, the staff maintained composure and complete transparency throughout the ordeal. I wasn't able to catch any names, but I wanted to thank them for trying to tend to our needs. Aside from the service, the food was absolutely delicious. We hope to come back when everything is fixed!

Has their shio ramen during lunch which was pretty good! The chashu was thicc. My friend ordered the katsu sandwich and the meat was also thicc. Would recommend.

This place has incredible ramen and other Japanese staples. It's a small hole in the wall that only takes cash. But don't worry because it's cheap and Delicious. Seriously ridiculously good

Amazing small plates. Very affordable. And the sake selection was awesome. We got the Sake flight, a bottle of sake, and 7 small plates. The total was $200 between the two of us. This place is a casual restaurant for snacking while drinking. If you've been to Japan you will recognize it as authentic Japanese food (e.g., karaage chicken, menchikatsu croquette or gobou salad), but this is not your "typical" Japanese restaurant (e.g., when I went they didn't have sushi or teriyaki in the menu). The place itself is small, good for eating with a friend or a small group of friends. If you're planning on a larger group you probably want to call in advance and check (e.g., we were 8, more than that would have been complicated). In terms of quality I was quite impressed, really juicy hamburger steak, moist and tender fried chicken and a perfectly fried breaded combo platter, with a delicious melt-in-your-mouth sweet bean jelly for dessert.

I came here to get dinner with a friend on a Tuesday night - everything was absolutely delicious and perfect! I look forward to coming back here to eat the cheesy curry again! The salmon tartar and sashimi were also fresh and delicious. I highly recommend this spot! It's small, clean and quaint.

I actually thought this place was way overhyped for me. The food was tasty but extremely simple. Everything reminded me of home cooking. We tried the cold tofu appetizer, addictive cabbage, beef tataki, chicken nanban, and garlic butter mushroom fried rice. My absolute fave was the chicken nanban; it's fried boneless small chicken pieces that comes in a delicious sauce. The addictive cabbage was good but I felt like I could have made it at home. The place is also packed and there can be a long wait for a table if you come at the wrong time.

Omg the best Japanese tapas small dishes type of place. Super delicious and authentic, we walked in around 10 and they close at 11, fast service and the staff is super friendly. I recommend the miso soup it's different they add cabbage! And the scallop and salmon sashimi is so fresh. You don't have to tip, you just have to come back!

The restaurant was tiny and not crowded when we got in. We ordered cabbages, mushroom croquettes and the suriyaki. First off, the cabbages was tooooo salty. Then come the suriyaki was really sweet. I must have asked to refilled my water 3 times. There was also language barrier toooo, the waitress (while seems nice) couldn't understand what we asked regarding the food. The croquettes was weird. Couldnt taste the chicken. I would not come back

VERY authentic Japanese restauraant and the servers (we had wonderful Yudai) take the time to explain how everything is homemade and imported from the special Japanese pork from Canada to the hard to find Kagua beer which just hit the states and is a Belgium made Japanese inspired beer.  Their take on French fries which leverages the chefs Italian experience and uses Genoan mayonnaise over small tastey potatoes is to die for.  Their cod fish cakes are great.  The tempura chicken dish with 7 herb homemade sauce is also great.  The pork had great flavor but slightly chewy and on the dry side but paired with some white rice and the sauce made up for it.   We went to the panacotta dessert over Japanese red bean.  Definitely an awesome find thanks to yelpers that has only been open for 6 weeks.

I don't know how this place only has 4 stars. This was some of the best Japanese food I've had outside of Japan. The beef tataki, sukiyaki, and curry Doria were all amazing. Yes it's expensive, but all Izakaya are. Do yourself a favor and reserve a spot when you can.

I loveeee this restaurant. Delicious food, cozy atmosphere, reasonably priced and the dude who runs it is really sweet. The chicken nanban, burdock salad, and salmon sashimi (huge, delectable chunks of raw salmon) are my favorites. They always have great sake recommendations, too. If you like Japanese food, small plates, and are bored with the subpar izakaya options on the lower east side, I promise: you'll love it.

Nice hole-in-the-wall Japanese restaurant. They have limited seats, very personalized service and take reservations even on Fridays! The best dish was the Chicken nanban main dish! If you're going as 2, order a bunch of tapas (we ordered 5) and 1 main course and sake. That should be just about right. Spent $50 ea.
Very tasty food, friendly service. Can literally order anything from the menu - cannot go wrong! The place is cozy.

It takes forever to have the dish on ur table...I will just never eat here again. Seriously，the worst service I have ever had. And the staff should WATCH their attitude. They just made me write my FIRST review on Yelp ：）

Food was pretty good, until I bit into the chicken nanban and I saw blood coming out of the chicken. Bright red blood. The owner told us it was normal and didn't even know what to do with it. Finally we asked if we could maybe get a replacement and he said something and walked away. Then not even 5 minutes later the waiter asked us if we could finish our meal within 15 mins and leave because a party of 4 was scheduled to sit at the table. We told her we could move to a smaller table but she flat out asked if we could just leave. What kind of customer service is this??? We felt so uncomfortable and embarrassed. Is it because we asked about the raw chicken? I wish I could give negative stars

the food here is so good. So damn good. but your clothes are definitely going to smell like food/oil after.
Service was very slow. It took 40 minutes to reserve one plate. The food was alright, but the support was poor. Never want to go again and would not recommend.

Excellent address. Very delicious and unique Japanese bar food. All Japanese staff with very friendly young owner from Sapporo. Warm and cozy atmosphere. Great music. Perfect place to hang out with friends. Kanpai!
No comment
Very cozy Japanese Izakaya. Nice people working there and the food is jJapanese comfort food. Highly recommenfed.
Low service & little over-priced. The food is great especially the fried chicken. Superb!

Probably the best Japanese food I've ever had. The addictive cabbage and the addictive fried chicken are a MUST and they really hold true to their "addictive" name. The deduction in stars only has to do with their $28 minimum per person as well as the wait staff. They were not willing to help but instead we were made to feel more of a nuisance.
No comment

Delicious food and great service. Loved the agedashi tofu and the medium rare scallops. The chicken nanban was good, I just wish the sauce had been added more last minute so the outside would stay crispy!
Love this place! Always have an exciting menu. Make sure to get the cabbage starter. Vibe is super cozy with dim light- good place for a date
No comment
My go to spot for izakaya- just like eating below the ginza bridge without the ambience of the street

My boyfriend and I discovered this place last summer and it has become both of our favorite restaurants for whenever we just want to eat amazing food. I crave their curry doria and chicken nanban--to the point that I've tried recreating at home from recipes I found online. But they're unbeatable. Not to mention, I love their "sour" drinks. It's a highball (shochu, soda water, ice) mixed with fresh citrus juice that they squeeze right in front of you. Nothing could be more refreshing! It's not a cheap meal, but it's not terribly expensive either. Last time I went with three others, we ordered probably 10 dishes, each getting 1-2 drinks, and it was $40 per person.
Agree with the great reviews here. Every dish we had was special. I especially liked the pork, fried tofu and chicken nanban. I will definitely return.

This is the worst Japanese izakaya I have ever been to! First of all,they never told us it was cash only!!! And after we ordered, the salmon avocado app came and the salmon was not fresh and smelled super fishy, we barely touched it bc we didn't want get ill. We told the waitress and she just struck her shoulder like it's too bad, never meant to do anything about it. After we got the bill I was putting my credit card to pay that's when she said it's cash only! Plus they forced a very pregnant lady to stand for 15 minutes even there were open tables because they were "reserved", no one ever came.
Had a very nice dinner. Everything was good, some of it very good. Will be back. Enjoyed the class and their signature dish .... the fried chicken with a nice sauce.

Excellent spot. The small plates are all delicious and well paced. The atmosphere is minimal yet cozy, warm and pleasant. We ordered the family pork, tofu squid, japanese guacamole, the salmon sashimi and grilled rice ball for two people and we were reasonably satisfied. Highlights were japanese guacamole, which had a delicious, soft and nuanced sweetness to it and the squid and tofu, which was garlicky and gingert enough to bring the dish together. Overall, great place with great ideas.

Came here expecting a great Japanese meal/experience ... The only thing that enjoyed was the sake. Food was ok but it took an hour and a half for some of our items to come out. There are definitely better Japanese options in the area. Would not recommend this place ... Based on the wait and service ... Was deceived by the 4.5 star rating
Great little gem in the EV!  It's my go-to every time I have visitors.  Everything on the menu is good.  My fave is the mushroom fried rice.

column3: Salt Lake City, Salt Lake City, UT
column6: DELICIOUS! Exactly the bite I was looking for. Onigiri was BOMB! Tiny little place. Only seating for 4. Does mostly takeout.
No comment
No comment
We just kept ordering more food! From the moment we walked in the door the service, ambiance, clientele food and sake was all I could have hoped for and more. This place is amazing.

The agedashi tofu was really soft & silky, I can eat that anytime! For appetizer I got the grill mackarel and potato & corn croquette. The Napolitan Spaghetti was delish especially with good amount of bacon pieces & the fried egg with running yolk, spaghetti sauce + cheese added a rich flavor to it. I was pretty full by then so me & my friend only ate half of the Japanese curry and had to take it home. It was really yummy after warming it up, I would recommend this place to others if they want a nice cozy & casual izakaya spot in E.Village!
No comment

This place is a cozy spot with friendly service. The food was pretty good. The addictive cabbage is very nice. It was not addictive enough for me. The chicken nanban was yummy. My daughter liked it out of all the dishes. The soft tofu was also interesting and tasty. I enjoyed that the waiter explained what the food was all about. He explained the wine-winning sake, just not the price of it and my regret was that I did not ask($65). The croquette was also good, but nothing to write home about. Overall it was an ok experience for me. The food portions were extremely small. At the end of the night, we left with almost a $240 (including tip) bill for 4 people, that's 60pp, and we were nowhere near full. Needless to say, I don't feel like coming back here again.

So we were a pretty big obnoxious group. The place is small but they took our reservation and accommodated us with great service! We apologized for our lateness but all they did was continue to offer even better service and more smiles. Service aside, the food was amazing. I would recommend coming with a smaller group so it's easier to split but we  ended up ordering over half the menu so I don't remember exactly what I was eating. All I could say is that everything was so delicious and amazing!! It tasted so good I can't wait to go back to try some more tapas.

We enjoyed a really great meal here the other night. The waiter/owner was so nice and funny in his explanation of the "Addictive Cabbage"- really quite charming. The cabbage passed the test so we stayed and enjoyed several things, including the yam appetizer, the fried salmon, and the Chicken Nan Ban.  The yam appetizer wasn't my favorite, but the fried salmon was delicious and the chicken nan ban positively addicting.  This was a very pleasant, authentic Japanese izakaya experience.
No comment
what a ripoff. WAY too pricey for what it is you're getting. simple as that. is the food good? it's OKAY. Not remotely worth the price.
No comment
No vegetarian. Being in vegetarian friendly east village, I feel there should really be at least one option other than salad.
No comment
Delicious food, especially the Chicken Nanban. I give three stars though because the portions here are small for the relatively high prices.

my go to izakaya place in east village! loved almost every single dish...cabbage was mediocre ..everything else was amazing...feels like any izakaya in osaka or tokyo...(def more pricey considering its in NYC)...overall...worth to try!
Amazing in everything : cheap price for very good Asian fusion food, excellent cocktails, service is 5 stars
Have no idea why this place is called izakaya. The food was ok but overpriced. The environment and service was just normal. Don't understand why this place is so high rated.
Their house fried chicken was really good. The addicting cabbage was a disappointment. Everything else was good.
Excellent food and service. It is a small place so come early. All solid
No comment

Small place. Really slow. We ordered an appetizer but did not get it till after we asked for the bill. We had dinner and still no app. The food portions are really small as well. The only good pleasant things were the Sapporo and the mushroom garlic fried rice. Not returning

It took me a while to post this review and it's because... I am selfish!  This place cooks up amazing japanese street food and I wish it won't get too popular because the place is small but cozy and nice. Price is decent but the food is amazing. Yes I said it twice, amazing!!! Make sure you make reservation if you ever plan to dine, walk in is close to impossible. Must try!!! Good for dates.

My experience here felt like me going home and eating one of my mom's really good home cooked meals and then having to pay her a lot of money for it. The waitor recommended us several dishes: The Addictive Cabbage, the Nanban chicken, and the neopolitan spaghetti. We got all of those as well as the Omelette. The omelette tasted really good but tasted like something I could make at home if I had proper ingredients. I really liked how there was cod roe in it and was slightly spicy. The Addictive cabbage was very okay. It tasted like a bunch of napa cabbage thrown together with sesame oil, sesame seeds, and salt. It wasn't very addictive for me. I LOVED the nanban chicken. It was very juicy and came with a delicious white sauce and a little bit of soy sauce. I also like how it came with a lemon to give the flavor a bit more of a kick. And by the time I got to the Neopolitan Spaghetti I was already too full to enjoy it but I love the egg on top of the pasta. The pasta itself was a  bit too sour and salty. It had too much ketchup to it in my opinion. I wish they made it less salty and a little bit more cheesy. Overall, it tasted like a really good home cooked meal that we had to pay a lot of money for.
Nice japanese tapa restaurant! The fried tofu, chicken and mentaike tamago were very good. The grilled cheese curry was okay.
No comment
Love this little cozy restaurant.  Excellent menu. Very good prices.  Lovely staff and food is amazing.

I have been coming here since they opened a few years ago. I visited last week to find out that something in their system changed. They used to be a non tipping restaurant (just like in Japan) supposedly paying their employees more than other places. I think that made for a great experience and prices (I thought) were right. A dinner for two, with at least 3 dishes per person, and a couple drinks usually came to 100/120. Now they did away with the non tipping thing. We were surprised to find that after we payed with a card there were three lines to leave a tip and add it up. Prices have stayed the same. So there's something weird here. Initially when they switched to non tipping they raised the prices and it made sense. Now, they did away with that but didn't lower their prices. Maybe this was a mistake or something they've added as an optional? I don't know. Not cool. Unless they change this in any way I won't be coming back. Sad, because I loved this place.

.C.H.I.C.K.E.N. .N.A.B.A.N. !!! (you also can't go wrong with the rest of the menu - each plate is so thoughtfully composed and DELICIOUS. I'm kicking myself for only just coming here now. Already planning my next visit!!!

Amazing food. The Nanbon Chicken lived up to the hype despite an extended wait time. We were totally fine with it as we didn't order it with our first order. Highly recommended. The beef/pork croquette and beef tataki were both great. Meitaiko omelette was decisius with subtle sweetness. Not exactly the most authentic experience for Izakaya, but the food will not let you down.

Hidden gem I guess you can say. Went with my wife and brother in law for a light drink and came out with out tummies full. The staff was friendly and the food was on point. It was as expected according to other reviews, if not more. Definately going back, although I rather keep it on the dl as the space is a bit tight.
The place is quiet and intimate; the cabbage is to die for. The owner prides himself on his creations in a way few young chef/ owner can.
Very nice, tasty, good atmosphere, pleasant place. Food 8-9 out of 10. One problem, be prepared for a long wait.

Some really authentic dishes; people have raved about the addictive cabbage, the chicken nanban, and the delicate, wonderful cold tofu. Seeing as it is an izakaya, I'd recommend a drink: the cassis oolong, a black currant liquer mixed with iced tea, is one of my favorite cocktails, and they do it well. Honestly, you can't go wrong with anything here.

We had the Addictive Cabbage (sic), Chicken Naban, Porkchop, and Ketchup Pasta, as well as one tuna sashimi for future reference. Every single one of the dishes was delicious and felt meticulously performed, despite the laid back atmosphere. If I had to pick a favorite though, it'd be the chicken. Only thing to note is that the dishes aren't too big, so all of the above fed two people - but left us very happy. I bet this place will be a new East Village hotspot in no time. Service is also up to par with what I've experienced in awesome Japan. No liquor license yet, so BYOB - happily one of the best craft beer shops in the neighborhood, Good Beer, is around the corner. Great find, coming back next week.

With many Japanese restaurants in the area, Izakaya got it right.  I tried several dishes and have not found many other restaurants in the area using quality ingredients and a commitment to satisfying customers.  Will definitely make it my go to place.
Honestly one of the best meals I've had in NYC in months. Amazingly good food, attentive staff, all for a shockingly reasonable price. Highly, highly recommended.

Holy moly the New York Times wasn't kidding, this was a very delightful hidden gem with incredibly eccentric and delicious food. We ordered fried chicken, fried tofu, the addictive cabbage, the marinated pork belly and the curry Daria. The owners were extremely friendly and helpful, they explained all the ingredients and how they serve dishes that are only found in Japan. If I could give 10 stars I would. Definitely worth the trip!
Addictive cabbage was addictive. Chicken nanban was amazing. Burdock salad was also very refreshing - the taste was very unique. Overall the food and the service were great. I would go there again.

Tiny, lively Japanese pub. Our meal included the wagyu beef sashimi with fresh and aged garlic (delicious) and the garlic-mushroom rice (surprisingly stunning). Only let-down was the sashimi platter (not too interesting and a bit overpriced). Portions are small, so it's necessary to get a variety of dishes. A large selection of sake is available, almost all by the glass.

So good! Recommend splitting dishes with friends. The Chicken Nanban was really good. Kagua beer is really good too. But the waiter was awesome. . Gave detailed explanations on everything. I highly recommend BOTH desserts!

Went here right when they got their liquor license, but can't hold that against them (I was expecting Byob). The fried chicken, ketchup pasta, addictive cabbage were all awesome. The sashimi plate was the real negative, 30 or 35 bucks for 9 pieces of sashimi? And the sashimi was pretty poorly cut and not the best quality fish (didn't finish it, which says a lot for me)... Maybe it was an off night and I'd be willing to try it again, except for the fact that I left my credit card there by accident. Called them and they said they would put it aside for me. I picked it up the next day, and then a few days later get a call from my cc company that it was being used to make fraudulent purchases to buy gift cards....

This restaurant is AMAZING! If you're looking for your new spot, this place is it. You can taste the love that goes into making each dish. We actually met the owner and his girlfriend and that's how we stumbled upon this new place - everything is five stars about this restaurant - the food, the friendly staff, the cute mis-matched decor. Bravo!
No comment

No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Yum! While I am def a meat eater, I love when a place makes their own veggie burger and Sweetwater did not disappoint. Very flavorful lentil and black bean burger as you and see in the picture- well seasoned, moist with a crust and mushy, cause... tasty legumes! The calamari was also tender and flavorful as well. Truffle fries came with a yummy house made mayo. We sat at the cute pretty outdoor booth and it was quiet and temperate for an autumn weekday. Also, quality service- all the staff were on point, attentive and friendly!
No comment
Bit pricey. The food was alright. I had the Sweetwater burger and it was okay. My boyfriend enjoyed his vegan lentil burger.
No comment

Honestly the ambiance was lovely I love the cozy vibes inside perfect for date night and the backyard during the warm weather is a great space. The service that they provided is very attentive and lovely. The appetizer was delicious but for me the entrees were lacking in flavor and could use a little boost. But overall a lovely place.

My boyfriend and I have been to sweetwater so many times not only because it is out favorite spot to go to but also because the service is amazing. They never disappoint us!! The amount of care and love they show their customers is visible. The drinks are amazing and the food as well. Wether its brunch, lunch or dinner the food always taste great. The place is small and cozy and in the weekends it gets packed so try reserving ahead of time. Here are a few pics of our favorites!
No comment

Sooo... I was in Brooklyn for a few days visiting my friend from childhood and he took me to this lovely restaurant, which he says is his favorite. I see why. We sat on the back patio which was So Pretty. They started us out with bread (oh no carbs! #worthit). The waiter served it with balsamic and EVOO which, omg! I love it when restaurants do that. My date(?) Can I call it a date? Yes it was a date, methinks it was a date.. yay finally.. he took me on a date(screams in schoolgirl joy) . Anyways..so  then we got the French onion soup --which was good but, tbh I have had better. I don't know where but now I want to go back to double check that... He got the chicken, I got the mussels. He ate all his and so did I. He actually didn't care for the mussels, said they weren't firm enough.. *Kanye shrug* I loved em, the lemony flavor of the sauce was divine. I dipped the bread in the sauce and I ended up pretty full,  if I had opted for pasta I would've been way too full. Then he insisted on dessert, he got the key lime pie which normally they are out of. so I'll just say it twas me, I made the pie appear, I'm good luck ^_^ ...about the pie, well I'm not a key-lime-pie-girl but I had a taste, and it was high quality pie for sure... 5 stars, thank you SweetWater.

My friend and I stopped here for a late brunch this weekend. Sweetwater offered a range of yummy cocktails and nice wine list. We ended up having some bloody marys and Cava, along with the avocado toast and French fries. Food came out fast and was delicious. Fries were perfectly seasoned and crispy. Multiple servers coming by to try to clear our plates when we were still eating (at least five people in the span of less than ten minutes) took away from our experience a bit.
No comment

I don't usually think of English food as something I look back fondly of, but Sweetwater did fine! The outdoor seating here is so cute, and they make a delicious apérol spritz (5/5 so good!). It's in a bustling part of Williamsburg, so location is key. The food was just alright, but this may be because of my predisposition of not enjoying English food too much. This area of Williamsburg has so many things to try, so not sure I'll be back because the food was not outstanding IMO. But, solid option if in a pinch.
No comment
No comment

We stopped for an early dinner and we're seated outside in cute little private "pods". We wanted to eat outside and didn't have reservations but they accommodated us. It was highly recommended by various people so we decided to try. We started with some cold beers on a hot afternoon - selection was small but good. I looooved my mussels of the day. The broth was spicy and tangy and so good. The mussels were cooked well and the bread was crusty and perfect for dipping up all the delicious broth. The swordfish was perfectly cooked and flaky. The parsnip purée was also very yummy. Service was friendly and gave good recommendations. We really enjoyed our meal and will definitely return again because I heard that the burgers are amazing as well.

One of my new fave spots in Williamsburg. The octopus was flavorful and not rubbery. The Steak was cooked to perfection! Loved the vibe of this place and Sam abs Lauren behind the bar were awesome. Highly recommend!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Really wanted to love here, but my overall experience here was just ok. My friend and I ordered Ribeye Steak, Steamed Mussels and two cocktails here! The food came out fast and the waiter was really attentive. But the food was just ok. The steak was overcooked as we asked for medium and received medium well and the mussels was whatever. The drinks here are strong, but I don't really mind strong drinks so I finished mine and my friend's. The best part of my experience here was the bread. The bread was really delicious and baked perfectly. Maybe I will come here and order something else as I would just come back for some bread LOL.

Amazing place! Sat at the bar Delphine was the bartender such sweet and on point service. Cocktails were great and the French Onion soup is a must. I got a lamb burger with is one of the best I have had since New Zealand. Try this place out!
No comment
No comment

Truly awful food, unless you enjoy sucking back butter. If you buy the bass, the steak, or whatever protein, it will be soaked in butter which is how unskilled chefs at Great American Restaurants make things "taste good."  I have never eaten here and not had diarrhea for 2 days because of the butter. Tonight, I got the Southwestern Salad which turned out not to be a salad at all but a  rich salty, buttery, pile of what I would consider, more like salad dressing, that one could possibly scatter sparingly over actual greens to make something palatable and not waste it. I just go there because my kids like the place for sentimental reasons, despite that they get diarrhea every time from the butter food too. It makes no sense to me! The beer was good, but I am convinced that Sweetwater fans are in denial of the correlation between eating at SweetWater and 2-day diarrhea.

I love the look of this place. It's very old New York/Parisian. It's a very old building with a lot of charm that they've really preserved. The vibe is very comforting. You feel at home. The menu has a lot of delicious sounding options that I want to come back and try. I had the lamb burger and I loved that it came with a lentil salad and a perfectly toasted English muffin, but the flavor just wasn't there. It was pretty bland. Thankfully it had a yogurt sauce and harissa sauce but still. It lacked salt. And the salad seemed to be completely undressed. Unfortunately, I can cook better food and that's always a let down when you're paying premium prices. Still, I'll be back for the amazing environment and to try other options.
No comment
No comment
No comment

My sister has been trying to convince me to go here for months; I finally caved in and have zero regrets! I'll be honest, when I saw the menu I didn't find it intriguing. In fact, I was debating whether it'd be acceptable to pay $19 for steak tacos. I gave the tacos a chance and they are by far one of the best tacos I've had in my life. The steak was perfectly cooked, the guac was fresh with the perfect amount of lemon, the green salsa left me wanting more, the queso fresco - amazing, and finally the corn tortillas tasted homemade but can't confirm that. It was so delicious that I went back the following week only to discover that the steak tacos were not permanently on the menu but happened to be a special item on that day I visited. I was literally heartbroken, I'm probably being dramatic. I had a burger instead which was tasty. Sweetwater please bring the steak tacos back!!!!!

This place is very cute and cozy,has an old school charming look. The food was delicious everything was tasty. Drinks were good. Lacked in service, we waited a long time to order our food, but the food came out quick so I guess that balances it out. Overall pretty good!

Got lucky by doing a walk-in on a Friday night. We got the octopus, Brussels sprouts, burger, and roasted chicken. The appetizers were great but my partner said the burger was flavorless. The service was good given how busy they were. Would definitely go back again.
No comment

First time here, sat at the bar waiting for the rest of the dinner group to get here. Brian the bartender patiently heard my preferences in drinks and made some recommendations and was spot on, I had a Pablozo and Diablo margarita which was my fav of the two.  I ordered the brisket with mash and Brussels sprouts as per his recommendation and my faith in him prevailed, the plate was delicious!  Overall, the staff was amazing (sorry, didn't get the rest of the names) but my sister enjoyed her birthday immensely and everything else ordered did not disappoint. From the salads (watermelon and radicchio/endive) to risotto, roasted chicken, hangar steak- everything was DELICIOUS!  Thank you for the great service and great food! Hey

When I looked at the menu, my first reaction was "who puts a burger on an English muffin?!" I ended up ordering the brisket for dinner, which was cooked to perfection. Super tender and flavorful, beautifully braised on a bed of mashed potatoes and crispy brussel sprouts. The sauce and flavors of everything were perfect. Cute atmosphere. Great service!

Rode past and thought it would be nice to stop and get some dessert. We were seated outside which was fine, considering we did not have a reservation. The almond cake seemed unique because of the twist of ingredients they use. It was very rich and paired well with the white port.
No comment

Went for brunch. We had eggs Benedict, French toast and crab cakes with poached eggs. Uh yum! Food was fantastic and the service was awesome. Make a reservation because this place has a line to get in. It is that good! A favorite!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Had calamari for an appetizer that came with a really good aioli to dip in instead of the usual red sauce. For my main meal I had the hanger steak. Well seasoned and had great flavor along with the steak gravy they covered it with. I subbed the onion rings for french fries instead.
Best hanger steak I've ever had. Every time I am in NY, I make a point of eating here several times. Love everything about the establishment.
Charming atmosphere, but delivered fine food at a reasonable price. There is better available in Williamsburg
Absolutely delicious! The French onion soup is supreme. Every meal I've had was good to the last drop. Ambiance inside is fabulous and the staff are great.

The place was cozy but the drinks were nasty we had to send them back. We were celebrating my friend birthday so the drinks were the reason we were there. The food was ok especially the clams. Sorry to say I won't be returning.
No comment

So glad I checked this place out last night, everything was delicious! There were no reservation slots for 7pm available but we decided to stop by anyway. They didn't have anything indoors available so we were seated outside in the front. They have individual compartments for each table with a heater in each, so even though it was cold we were comfortable. Still, make sure to dress warmly. We started off with the fried calamari and the French onion soup. The calamari was crispy and tasted fresh, paired perfectly with a side of arugula. The French onion soup was served piping hot which is exactly what we needed, it was so tasty. Lots of flavor and a good portion to be split amongst 2. Then we got the hanger steak and the Sweetwater burger. My boyfriend said the burger was good but nothing amazing. The fries however, he loved. I really liked my hanger steak. It was juicy and tasted really great for a cheap price. It was served with lightly battered onion rings which were fried perfectly and not stringy. Everything was beautifully presented and the staff were super friendly and fast! Everything came out quickly and they were attentive without being too intrusive. Make sure you also get their bread basket too with the olive oil with balsamic, so so good.
No comment
No comment
Nice menu, good service and ambience, especially now with the outdoor seating and open door. Would definitely return when in the neighborhood.
Very cute place - we sat in the winter garden. Great people but food wasn't memorable - not bad but not great. Prices were fair. There are too many choices in the area to commit to a repeat visit.
I good find in Williamsburg! Very cool space and vibe. Took my lady for brunch here and it was fantastic

Had a great time at Sweetwater! Amazing vibes as soon as we walked in. Really cool, old school room. Food, cocktails, and service were all phenomenal. We had the Brussels sprouts and calamari to start. Both very good. I ordered the fish of the day which was seabass. It was perfectly prepared. The manager, Patrick, was awesome and was even nice enough to help us get reservations to a popular restaurant nearby. Will be back 100% next time we are in Williamsburg.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Third time for brunch here, as usual food was great but came on here to give tony (front of house) a specific shout. We made reservations via Resy but meant to book patio as we had a dog but accidentally booked indoor and he was super accommodating to help us! He was patient with everyone even on a chaotic Saturday lunch - thank you tony!!
Favorite spot in our neighborhood - has an atmosphere and feel akin to a cozy English pub - and the bartenders make a killer vodka martini.
No comment

Sorry to be the "Debbie Downer" but this place didn't do it for me. My wife and I were shopping in Williamsburg and decided to stop in because it was the highest rated and nearest restaurant. They immediately sat us in the back on a sunny day despite the that there were multiple tables available on the sidewalk. We order right away. They literally took 45 minutes to make a hanger steak, lamb burger, and baked fish tacos. Really!!!! We complained and did nothing. They almost made it seem like it was our fault for ordering a rubbery hanger steak. Eat here if you want to be seen in Williamsburg, but don't expect good food or service.
I'm pretty picky and I was really impressed with the chicken sandwich and my dad loved the mussels.
Best place in Williamsburg!  Great service and the food never disappoints. Can't wait to go back.
No comment

Thank you. Thank you for existing. You make me feel like home every single time. Whether I'm having a lone drink or dinner, introducing a new friend to your space or on a date. Ha! The owner Patrick is a dream. Friendly, hilarious, and great on the eyes! I love the bartenders. Nikki is my girl. My blond goddess that always takes care of me and makes great hot toddy's for when you're under the weather. And the most delicious of vodka gimlets! I wish I could go more often but it's a bit of a trek. I think of them Everytime I'm in willyburg! Their food is awesome. The roast chicken is amazing. Along with everything else. Once you step inside of this restaurant/bar you are family. I can't say enough about this place. It holds a piece of my heart. Say Hi to Patrick and Nikki!

I came here because my friend wanted to. I wasn't too excited becuase as a vegetarian it seemed that the menu only had a couple of options. But honestly, I'm happy I came. I got the lentil burger and it was great. The sweet potato fries weren't the best, but I really liked the burger. The server was very friendly and accommodating. I got a spicy margarita which was good, it wasn't very strong though. Would I come here again? Maybe. But not dying to go back.
Couldn't have been any better. Terrific Old-NY atmosphere, Excellent Food, Solid drinks, Friendly and competent service. Good job all around!!!
No comment

No comment
Great service and atmosphere. The lentil burger, lamb pappardelle, ricotta and watermelon salad are highlights.
No comment
No comment

The staff is super friendly and attentive. The food is great a taste of comfort wo overfilling. Quaint and charming. The lamb burger is divine. Yummy sweet potato fries. The Brussels sprouts are my fave. Order a drink and be prepared to want another one ...everything served here is with a smile and tasty.
No comment
Date night with my gf, we loved it! The back patio is awesome and my lamb Ragu was delicious! Her steak was a little tough, but overall a great experience.
Oh my goodness! Food was amazing. I had the lamb burger with mash. Our server was great, we love Ivan energy. He was very informative on all the items was asked about and very kind. We will be back !
No comment

I can't believe I've never written a review for Sweetwater after all this time, but it's definitely my favorite restaurant in Williamsburg, hands down. The service is always amazing, the food is reliable and great, and it's such a staple in the community. Truly a favorite.
No comment

i used to come here when it first opened eons ago before this neighborhood was the ridiculous hipster space that it is. This place is a long time staple of the neighborhood, and the food you can't go wrong. I come here for the Lamb burger. I like it when the chefs keep it good simple and classic.

Definitely the home away from home. I love everything about this restaurant. Sweetest staff ever and the delicious and consistent food abounds! Mussels are amazing, as is the Rib Eye, the burger, the watermelon salad, oh hell, it's ALL delicious. Sweetwater really turned on the Covid power and were quick to be even more inviting than they were before the pandemic hit. Easiest online menu to order from that I've come across. Fantastico, ti amo!
I had the Sweetwater burger and thought it lacked seasoning. It was really bland. My fries were delicious and crispy. Service was kinda slow. It's a cute place for brunch.
No comment

Threw a 14 people birthday brunch here in the back patio. The food was delicious and the place is really cute. I had the mussels, croque monsieur with egg and we all had slices of the Banafi pie for the birthday dessert. Other friends had the steak and eggs, French onion soup, French toast and omelette and said the food was excellent. The mimosas featured freshly squeezed orange juice and my friends said the bloody Mary's were perfect. The pics of the back patio on yelp don't do this place justice. I would definitely be back for the food and if I have another large group event.
No comment
No comment
No comment
I heard this place is great... especially if you are trying to relive an " Emily in Paris day" with tour friends.
Trendy ambiance ; wonderful service ; patio seating fabulous ; food experience splendid !

Didn't expect it but, Sweetwater Restaurant was really fabulous. Friendly service, welcoming mood. You can certainly order just about anything on the menu and never be disappointed. Everybody at the Sweetwater Restaurant was so lovely and accommodating. Love it love it love it.

Super disappointed in our experience here and unfortunately will not return. We ordered the rib eye medium rare and received a medium well/well done steak. We don't typically return food but requested a new steak due to how overcooked it was. Our waitress took it back but then another women came back out with the steak asking us to check it again because she thought it was medium rare. Very bizarre behavior to question a customer when it was clearly overdone hut we felt too awkward to return it again and just spent $40 on an unenjoyable steak. Giving 2 stars because the original waitress was nice and the other dish (mussels) we had was fine.
No comment
No comment

I was wandering around Brooklyn this weekend and stumbled across Sweetwater for brunch ... and needless to say I am happy that I did!  Walking into Sweetwater I was not expecting much, but the environment is so cozy and so warm I did not want to leave.  The brunch here is reasonable, delicious, and fast!  The avocado toast was so good - I loved the surprise parmesan cheese on top.  They also serve fresh orange juice that is so refreshing.  The menu is very classic - and we were not disappointed.  If you are trying to find a spot that wont break the bank and you won't wait hours for check out Sweetwater Restaurant.
No comment

This place is amazing. I was across the street when it started raining really heavy and I quickly ran to this place because the other restaurant did not want to serve us due to my allergy. This place was so accommodating, especially since we came right as they were closing, they gave us multiple tables because it kept raining on us, and made sure our night wasn't ruined. My friends and I all ordered the chickpea curry dish with shrimp, it was delicious. Somewhat spicy, and it was similar to a broth or soup that we dipped the sourdough bread in, such a great dinner option. The backyard seating was very cute, and so photo worthy. Overall, 10/10 experience and it definitely made my day way less horrible than it was. I would recommend this place for brunch, or take out, especially since its next to a park with beautiful views.
No comment

Great food and we waited only 10 mins for a table for two. The ambiance was chill casual or a date night feel, which ever you prefer. They had tables for larger groups and also many for couples. There's a bar at the front which makes it a bit crowded to walk to the back but we were fine since the wait wasn't too long. We ordered the lentil burger (made it vegan) which came with sweet potato fries, sea bass with mashed potatoes and string beans (fish was so good but the string beans /mashed potatoes were OK), we also got Parmesan truffle fries, so good! Overall great food, I highly recommend. Plus it's Williamsburg, great to walk around after dinner.
No comment

Amazing restaurant and one of our new staples since finding it. The food is so yummy, atmosphere is relaxed and staff are all very sweet. We have been for brunch and dinner over and over and will continue to bring friends to try it out.
No comment

Really cute spot! We sat outside and started w a specialty cocktail that was delicious. Then we ordered a salad to share. It was the cauliflower salad and was definitely enough to share. I had the lamb burger which was dry. I might have to order it medium rare? My date had the hanger steak which was very good. I would go back because of the ambience and cocktails.

I know it's Covid and it's good to support lock bars, and that's what I had in mind when I stopped by this place. The service was nice and quick. I ordered two cocktails. They arrived quite quick. BUT, and it's a big BUT, they had so much ice in it and barely two sips of actual cocktail. They have an add outside 16 oz cocktail, haha, but it's all ice. Literally! These was no space to squeeze a straw in the drink!!! I was done with it in like 2 min. No way it was worth $12. I would expect at this times they wouldn't try to trick you for the sake of keeping the business, but looks like old mindset still was not corrected by covid. There are plenty of options on the streets of Williamsburg, and I will definitely not be coming back event ( or especially) after everything opens up!!
No comment

BEST BLOODY MARY I HAVE EVER HAD. Lovely experience here. I met a few friends for a drink and grabbed a bloody and a scone. Ps. The scone was soooo good! Coconut, raspberry, pistachio. Sooo good!! The bartender was a delight. She was attentive and kind and it didn't hurt she had an awesome personality well! I will be back for sure!

Greeted as soon as I walked in and sat immediately in their adorable, Instagram worthy outdoor space. Ordered the Aerol Spritz to drink which was super refreshing on such a hot summer day. Ordered the kale/romaine ceasar salad and truffle parm fries (balance, duh).  The salad is great for one person and the order of fries easily serves two people! Service was prompt and friendly and I will certainly be back. The outdoor space is lovely.

Called 10 mins before arriving and was able to get a table for 6 in the garden. Best decision I made today and the meal was well worth every penny spent. We had the mussels, calamari, baked chicken and Salmon meals. All delicious  and well made. The back yard was small, comfy and clean .

Probably the best restaurant in Williamsburg. The drinks are fun and all great and the food is delicious. Its very hearty and makes you feel liek every meal should be served on Thanksgiving. The staff is amazing. Sure nice and efficient. My favorite meals are the chicken, steak, and even the burger. Portion size is outstanding and each dish is really thought out and served to perfection. love this place and highly recommend.
No comment

I was looking for a casual place to meet my family and which wasn't going to break the bank. I found this place on line and read reviews from several sites. It did not disappoint any of us. The food was delicious. The service was excellent and the atmosphere was welcoming. I had crab cakes and my wife had the salad nicoise. Portion size was good and price was right. Definitely would recommend this place

This place is a great neighborhood hang with a chill friendly inclusive vibe and really solid food. I had the rib eye and it was cooked perfect and I swapped the fries for asparagus which were also perfectly cooked...nice music as well.
Great vibe, nice booths for friends, but food was hit or miss. Hanger steak was great, scallops cooked to perfection, but the burger is very dry and the squid extremely chewy.

Had dinner here last night and really enjoyed it.  The restaurant is very cute, perfect for a date, and the food was delicious.  I had the hanger steak and my friend had the roast chicken.  Both entrees were decent size and the flavors were really yummy.  I'd definitely go back to try other items on their menu when I am in that neighborhood again.
Beautiful and romantic place for dinner in Williamsburg. It has a big counter at the front and the restaurant area in the back. Pasta was really good!

I had such an amazing time for brunch recently.  Our server Natalie, and Benji went out of our way to make us feel safe and well taken care of.  Our food was excellent and the back patio was safe and warm.  Thank you!

The food and drinks are delicious, and not overpriced either! Cozy, relaxed yet sparkly/ special vibe. I definitely recommend sitting in the back garden! The street tables are fine if you're into that but after sitting in the back garden- there's no going back. Ps they have blankets and heaters back there *score****
No comment
Shout out to Sweetwater's amazing outdoor situation.  It was plenty warm w hanging heaters, and also open air so felt safer that some places with full tents.  The food was good too!

Sweetwater is a warm, and well designed space, with great food, and always solid specials changing constantly. The staff are always bright and friendly. It has a great back patio to have a chat in the summertime, and to me it's a bonus that because of the architecture and materials if you sit in the main dining room you most likely won't get phone reception. Sometimes that's a blessing during a dinner in New York. It's a great part of the neighborhood.
Order the Sweetwater burger  medium rare. Cute bar, Incredible outdoors, staff is great too. Fun atmosphere.
No comment

The location, the hospitality, the food and the ambiance....everything we were looking for in a meal before heading to see the view of the city from this side of the bridge. I highly recommend this place if you're on this side of the tunnel!
Great food, and the back patio is perfect when the weather is nice! Will definitely be back

The worst restaurant ever. My food has been disgusting and ice cold the three times I have tried to order from this place on Caviar.  Avoid this restaurant at all costs as your food will arrive ice cold and all mixed in together.  Third time I have had to completely trash the food from this place and then place a new order somewhere else. Customer beware. 0 stars.

I visited this restutant on a whim, and oh what a joy. The place was dim, and it was just romantical. We were so relaxed that we didn't realize it took long for our food to arrive.  When we received it, it was delicious. To make the night even better, one of the owners came to the table, and shared that he would like to offer a slice of Italian cake on the house. He explained he recognized that we didn't complain when our food took too long to come out. At that moment I knew I found a gem, and my boyfriend and I would use this place for future date nights.
No comment
No comment

Came to Sweetwater for a girls reunion. What a lovely time! The staff was extremely attentive and made us all feel right at home. We all had the French onion soup and the Sweetwater burger. Delicious! The staff continued to make sure we were comfortable and had everything we needed. Also being that we all hadn't seen each other, we were talking longer than normal but not once did the staff rush us. It was an amazing time and I definitely recommend!

Wonderful little neighborhood restaurant and bar. The decor is authentic old world charm, you feel like you are back in New York City circa 1800"s. The staff was just perfect, friendly with great service and the food was AMAZING! I will make this a go to place for sure.
No comment
No comment

Amazing ambience, food, drink & staff! We've been to Sweetwater two times in the past two weeks and had a wonderful experience both times. Quality food & drinks worth the prices. One of the things that impressed me the most was the teamwork exhibited by the staff - it's obvious that they truly like each other and work together to make it a comfortable, welcoming environment. Kudos to this team! (We're already planning to stop in again for dinner this week!)

Awesome food. And great outdoor space in the back!! French toast was fire. French fries were crispy and dope. Frozen drink special was a perfect mix of spice and alcohol and hit right on a 90 degree day.

Random find for dinner on our last night visiting. Our visit couldn't have been any more enjoyable. The food was exceptional. But the best part of our experience was the service. The staff went above and beyond to make sure we were happy. They let us take our time and savor the experience. Both server and owner Patrick took time throughout our visit to make us feel so at home. We shared great conversation. It was truly a memorable. I can promise you, they won't disappoint. The perfect ending to our visit in Williamsburg  We will be back

This is one of our local favorites- and more than anything, this place consistently has the best service and that alone would be enough to keep us coming back! Other highlights include the beautiful backyard lit up with hanging bulbs and surrounded by plants and trees, the great food (highlights from our visit last night were curried chickpeas, mussel pot, steak and chicken) and the extensive drinks menu with cocktails always made to perfection. LOVE THIS SPOT!

My boyfriend and I have been here twice now and loved it both times. Highly recommend the octopus art art with its unique pesto fennel.  If they have the white fish special also get it! My boyfriends mother got it and I really regretted not getting it over my lentils curry which was good but not nearly as good as the fish she got. Lastly the mussels were fabulous and we were all fighting over the broth in the end. Friendly service easy to reserve a table especially at 5:30pm on a Sunday. The building ambiance's def impressed my boy friends parents too. Will be back again for many more Sunday night dinners.

Had one of the best dining experiences at sweetwater this week. Benny, Christian and I believe Hernando made it such a memorable experience for a mid week dinner. With Covid making dining stressful, they really elevated the experience and the food is always consistently delicious. Thank you!!!
Wow. Extremely affordable, awesome service, and outstanding food. Coming back from Jersey very soon!!

Food is decent enough but the service has been consistently bad every time I come here.  Tonight I was sitting at the bar and I got my burger at the same time as my beer, even though I ordered the beer when I first sat down. How does that even happen when you're sitting at the bar, 5 feet from the taps? I gave it two tries. Done.

Amazing food and even better service. Came here on a Friday night and was able to snag seats at the bar with my roommate. We both got cocktails, I got the Pabloso and my roommate went for a classic Negroni. Both cocktails were impeccable and came out super quick. Our bartender Nicole is an absolute angel and was so attentive to both our drinks and food orders. Everyone who works here is actually super nice and friendly. We ordered the octopus appetizer which was frankly amazing and I got the chicken and my roommate got a steak special with broccoli rabe and baked potato. Everything had so much flavor and was perfect. Love Love Love.

love this place! I was skeptical because there were not that many reviews on yelp/instagram, but this place was everything and more. very accommodating for a party of 7, delicious food and great staff! would highly recommend.

Sweetwater is a cute, quaint establishment. I love that the food is always consistently good.
No comment
Poached eggs with asparagus, real Parmesan and sourdough was divine. Love the outdoor seating area. Quick service and good ambiance
Gorgeous patio, great bottle of wine, get the cauliflower it's amazing! The fish special was also delicious. Excellent service.

This place is a great spot to feel comfortable and relax and drink. I had Lauren as a server and also Benjamin helped out. Come for the drinks, but I promise you'll stay for the staff! So personable and kind. Highly recommend.
No comment
No comment
One of my favorite restaurants in the neighborhood!!  Great bartenders, cozy space, and the best ribeye you'll ever have!!!!
Beautiful backyard, great food & service. Went on a cool July day (rare!) for lunch. I had a steak salad and my co-worker had seared tuna salad. Both were great.

No comment

So 4 of us had initially gone to Hotel Delmano upon hearing they had great mixology and their menu looked good.. horrible experience. We left after our first round of drinks and came to Sweetwater. Steph was such a sweetheart and so attentive! Even the food runner was fantastic. Food was great. We got the meat and cheese plate, steak tartare, burrata, beet salad, truffle fries, and a burger. (You can understand how hungry we were) two out of us four work in the industry so for us to enjoy everything overall means something. Cheers

The place is small and staff are really friendly. I requested an order of mussels and they were delicious. The sauce for the mussels was really tasty and I like spice in my food so I requested red pepper.

Went here on a Saturday for lunch and was very impressed by the food choices and wonderful service. I shared the tuna salad and the crab Benedict with my sister while my step father had the lamb burger and mom had a salad. Everyone was extremely satisfied with their food and friendly service. My only complaint is that the seating was a bit cramped but overall enjoyed the look and feel of the restaurant.
Very cozy spot in Williamsburg, worth a try if you're in the area.  Some better options open later but if you want an afternoon bite or drink, definitely a good spot.
No comment
No comment

Walking  around the neighborhood before seeing a show at the nearby Brooklyn Bowl my friend and I checked out the menu and while doing so a gentleman sitting outside commented to us that the food here was really good.  He was so right !!  Fantastic service, very well priced and diverse wine list.  The food was great.  We started with the  grilled octopus, charred and yet perfectly tender.  My friend had the pappardelle with lamb ragu and burrata (delicious) and I had the hangar steak, which was perfect.  Finished the meal with the carrot cake, dense and delicious, not overly sweet.  The owner, Patrizio, came over to the table with shots of chilled Amaro.  We started chatting and then he returned and poured more shots of the digestivo.  Fantastic !!  Will absolutely be back the next time I'm in the neighborhood and will tell all my friends as well.  What a great find.  Don't miss it.

Stopped by for a late lunch on the weekend and to catch some of the World Cup. Place was crowded but not uncomfortably so, nice and cool on a very hot day. Staff is very friendly, its a really pleasant bar/restaurant atmosphere that I can totally see myself gravitating for in the future. Friend and I ordered a couple salads which were tasty and very high quality for the price. They have kombucha on tap that I highly recommend, sweet and ginger-y which is exactly what you want. Good decor and ambiance too, will be back to try some more menu items!
No comment

With a plethora of American cuisine restaurants in Williamsburg, this one in particular stands out! Came here on a weekday with five people and we were seated fairly quickly. The menu was actually quite diverse/expansive, with well over 20 dishes on the menu. We had a vegetarian, pescatarian, and some omnivores in our group, and everyone was very impressed with the food. The chicken was cooked to absolute perfection, the sage gnocchi was a great combination of flavors, and the customer service was also really fantastic. Their brunch menu looked amazing, so I can't wait to stop in for that as well. Sweetwater is a hidden gem!
