Delicious food, wonderful service and relaxing setting. The bloody Mary's are also amazing!
No comment
Ordered the burrata, lamb burger, and lamb pasta. All were very good. Service was also very good. The outdoor patio in the back makes the experience.

Had brunch with my family at this place and the food was good. I ordered the French toast and it was good but disappointed that it came out a bit cold. Could be because some of my family ordered steak and fries. Everyone else seemed to enjoy what they ordered but with some of the orders they ran out of certain ingredients such as spinach, they did offer an alternative such as broccoli rabe or kale. Maybe we got there too late (ate brunch at 130). The outside area is really nice and cozy and the inside is very nice as well. The staff was really friendly and accommodating. I would go back
The sweetwater burger is really good the meat is very juicy and quite thick.  Truffle fries are excellent.  The onion soup is very good.

Came here with my mother and grandmother while visiting family in NY from California & because of the reviews on yelp & sadly, I was not impressed. Sarah, who was our waiter, greeted us in a timely fashion & took our order. My mother ordered an appetizer which was the fried calamari (which was salty) & it's sauce was VERY salty as well. My mother & I had the Sweetwater burger which came with a salad & fries but we subbed our regular fries for sweet potatoes fries & cooked our burgers medium, while my grandmother ordered the lentil burger. My burger was cooked to perfection, I honestly loved it. But everything else was just salty, not seasoned, but SALTY. Great place, great atmosphere, just go easy on the salt next time

Sweet water fries were so bomb!! But they do not have many options for vegans. We decided to stay for fries and wine. The service was very pleasant. The environment is very intimate. So if you want want to find a place intimate for a glass of wine and small bites with a friend, parents, significant other or first date this is a great option! Thanks for your service!

I am in love with place! Amazing food, great cocktails, great service, beautiful backyard space. I came once for dinner and twice for brunch. Their brisket Benedict was life changing. It's a must visit in Williamsburg

Cute and cozy spot for an intimate dinner.  I got the gnocchi with broccoli rabe and my friend got the mussels. The gnocchi wasn't bad but I think it lacked the chewiness. It could use a little more garlic flavor. The mussels, on the other hand, were quite delicious. I usually prefer mussels in wine but this was soaked in beer, which I think brought out the mussel flavor even more.  The service was really friendly and quick Our orders came out within 10 minutes. I would probably come back again and try other stuff on their menu. Their cocktail menu looks pretty good too!
No comment

Loved the lamb burger & tzatziki was so thick & delish. The chilled French red wine w Dauschound on label went perfectly. The beef burger was yummy too. Best part - the staff was great. The chef also runs the Bakeri in Greenpoint and gave me two loaves of bread. It pays to be friendly!
Good brunch spot and pretty backyard. Love sitting outside on a good day and order the salad with poached egg and mimosa.

Let me tell you what happened yesterday around 5 PM at Sweetwater. I was sitting on the patio and the resturant was almost completely empty. I had two friends with me and my dogs and we were eating and drinking when I became over heated and excused myself to go sit inside in the air conditioning. I sat a table near the bar and started to get worse and the room was spinning and I started sweating profusely. I was fighting to keep my eyes open and stay in a seated position. I waved for my friends when the door was opened to the patio becuase I felt at that point that I couldn't walk but they didn't notice me. The waitstaff of the restaurant were rude and I guess they didn't recognize me from the patio and kept trying to get my order and offer me a menu. How crazy is that?! At one point I politely asked for a cold wet towel one girl made a face and went over to a sink and got a paper towel that she ran under the tap. She brought it over and it was room temperature. I was very quiet and polite through the whole event though the staff acted like I was this huge inconvenience. The bartender acted angry the entire time and when she finally realised I wasn't going to order anything she asked if I was feeling OK. I told her that I thought I might be having a heatstroke and she made a face and walked to the other end of the bar. I guess they thought I was a drunk or something. I was having margaritas (watered down, very weak margaritas) on the patio earlier. But not enough to make me intoxicated and I was eating and drinking a lot of water at the same time. My friends finally saw me and came to help. I haven't felt right since then, even after drinking glass after glass of ice water. So I have just called and told a very young sounding supervisor what happened to me at her restaurant. She reacted in glib manner and seemed not to take me seriously. The entire event was very odd to say the least and I'm still not sure what to think about it. Was the waitstaff just young and inexperienced and unfamiliar with what being overheated looked like? I think its probably more to do with the waitstaff looking at customers as how they make money and not as people. I was very respectful and polite through the whole event and I have been going to Sweetwater for years and always tip well and have been a great customer. But I feel that Sweetwater is just trying to make a buck and if a customer is having trouble then that customer becomes an annoyance. My advice is go spend your money at someplace that looks at its customers as human.
No comment
Good food, casual atmosphere. The braised lamb shank was really excellent. Nice seating in balcony outside. Wait staff not overly professional.

here for dinner, a little crowded and no real small table presence for a one or two person dinner.... but still cozy! And the host was very accommodating. I had the lamb burger with lentil salad and it was pretty perfect. Nice, warm atmosphere, if a little busy on a Sunday evening. I would recommend this spot for small groups looking to split a bottle of wine and converse over a nicely proportioned meal. kind of European feel....

Sweetwater has a great vibe and yummy food. There's always a table available which in Williamsburg is rare. Only downside is it can get pretty noisy when full. In summer their courtyard is beautiful!
Great spot for a group dinner, friendly staff and a great environment. Food is amazing as well
No comment
I believe you'd have to travel to Madrid to get Gambas al Ajillo comparable to what they serve here. It's a must have appetizer! Excellent ambiance and exquisite dishes.

Went here  with my husband. He had a burger, and loved it. He said it was cooked  to perfection. I had the lamb  burger, I enjoyed  mine very much  as well. (Didn't  love the salad that came with it, but next time I will have them swap that out). Next time we are in the area, we will  definitely  visit  again.

Found this great spot right here on yelp actually while showing my Italian friends around the city. The bar and seating up front is comfy and super Italian. My friends were excited to see so many Italian drink options, plus the mouse, etc. We had a drink at the bar first and the bartender was cool and friendly. After a short bit, we moved to the back patio for dinner. Awesome, warm, relaxed environment with delicious food. I loved the lamb burger entree and octopus appetizer. The owner heard there were some Italians visiting and came around to chat. Great guy, great place. This is hidden gem!
This place is fantastic!  Great atmosphere, delicious food (try the mussels), spot-on drinks and friendly people.  Definitely my go-to place.
Nice place. Food is good, nothing fancy or special but it is good. Really nice patio ! ( not for GF, not for Vegan)

This is my new favorite restaurant in town. We came for dinner and ordered the Gnocchi and Cannelloni entrees; they were quite flavorful and very satisfying indeed. Cocktails are reasonably priced- I recommend the Spaghetti Western and the Tito Puente. Top it off with a cappuccino and the "food of the gods" from the dessert menu, which was delightful! The ambience and the crowd are lovely... overall a true blue Williamsburg experience!

The decor is cute and cozy. Great for a date or hangout with friends. The service is amazing ! Had their veggie burger/lentil burger (I believe) wasn't very impressed. Maybe I would try a different dish next time.

Came here last night for dinner, sat down with no reservation around 6pm, place wasn't busy but by the time we left at 8pm the place was jumping. Nice eating area and the long bar up front is beautiful. Drinks killed and the food was perfect. No swings and misses with this place. Excited to be moving to Brooklyn.

Awesome place. The burger with the truffle fries was one of the best I've had. The food of the gods dessert and banafi always leave me full and satisfied but wanting more! Can't wait for my next visit. The manager is the nicest guy. Marcelo you are a true gem

So great! They serve dinner until 12 pm!! Get the gnocchi pasta and rib eye steak. I was referred to this place by a friend who is a chef so I wanted to try it for awhile. My favorite part is the back garden. When we arrived it was occupied but very soon we got a table in the garden, so i was happy about that. Food was very good, well prepared, and there is thought into it. They are allergy sensitive and vegan friendly. No vegan desert though. Servers where polite and accommodating but definitely needs a bit more attention, water on the table before we ask, we waited for about ten minutes for water and then we had to ask for the bread. No salt and pepper on our table. They seem to be slow and tired, which i get, i worked in a restaurant for years. Just certain things should be no brainer, that is why we dine out versus staying home. Food gets 10 out of ten, if you add a gluten & dairy free dessert, you have me. But because i love the garden chances are, i am going back.

Great place for a date. Very good food and relaxed atmosphere.

Came here sat night and had some drinks at the bar - its a small, intimate place and the bar staff were lovely. Nice cocktails!! Good music, very relaxed, chilled vibe. Saw food coming out which looked and smelt fantastic, so will have to come back another time. Appears to be food service at the bar too as I saw someone have a massive piece of cake at the bar which looked divine!!! Cute place for a date too
Great date night in Williamsburg. This place has a really nice atmosphere and the food is great! Def recommend the half roast chicken or pork tenderloin , YUM
I recommend this place if you want to have a beer. If you want to have brunch there are plenty of better places in Williamsburg. Not recommended at all for vegans/vegetarians.

While attending a concert in Williamsburg, we stopped in for a  few 1664s.  It felt really old time.  Loved the decor and the food going by looked delicous.  Definitely a place on my to do list!

I've been going here for years now and the food and service are solid. I think my favorite is the steak frites. It's not the most innovative menu but what you get will be good. Decent beer selection and it's right next to zablowzki's bar!

Best meal experience I've had in a while! ADORABLE outdoor patio seating with unique and delicious specials. Great vibes & great food!

This was a great little stop. Very quaint. I would definitely go back. Really cool neighborhood. Great service. Tasty bites. Great drinks. 5 for vibe. 4 for food. Candle lit dinner in nice space. Very tight.

Beautiful little hidden gem in Williamsburg. We had a delicious flavorful juicy burger in the backyard and really enjoyed our lunch there.

Awesome spot. Another old staple on the block. Amazing burger.  One of the best soups I've ever had.  Great playlist. Always a place I recommend to out of town friends in for the wknd. Just an all-around good choice. And who doesn't love booths?

Nice spot! We had tasty lamb and sweetwater burgers, a nice avocado salads and beautiful bloody mary. Like the garden set up!

Went here Saturday night with a group of 10. Everyone loved their meal. Great service, good wine list but the food is the star. Specials were out of this world. Definitely will be back and have already recommended this spot to two friends.
No comment

No comment
Great bar and bartender!  Super tasty Margarita's and Bloody Mary's.  I want to return for a full meal.  Everyone's food smelled delicious!

We wandered into Sweetwater for lunch while exploring Williamsburg. From the moment we walked in we were greeted with great service and attention. The sweetwater burger is delicious! The waiter was very attentive and made sure our drinks were never empty.

We had a great lunch here, well I got to have their fantastic burger my husband was able to order breakfast!  The bartender was so friendly and made a great margarita too!  Charming and totally local but great quality!!!!

The four of us got a table right in front for dinner at 9:15 PM. The waitstaff was courteous. I ordered the paparadella pesto pasta which was incredibly fresh and filling. I also drank two vodka martinis that we're really strong. Then I ate a bit of my friends spaghetti squash bacon cabornara, very divine. I now have a raging headache and threw up a couple times this morning. I don't want to blame the food, so I will blame too many vodka martinis.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Great atmosphere, tunes, and staff. Food was fresh and filled with the right stuff. Unfortunately, the food somehow lacked taste. It just wasnt very flavorful. Still need to try the awesome wine selection and cocktails as well. Also make sure to try the "sweetwater" amber ale. Exclusive to only this restaurant, its a definite plus
No comment

I have been frequenting this Restuarant a lot over the past several months alone and with friends and business associates and up until today was ver pleased with food and service. But today the service was non existent meaning I came in to a unusually busy Restuarant due to World Cup and was basically told to sit at a communal table or leave by a waiter. First off basically no one was eating they were there to just watch tv and most probably aren't regulars. I on the other hand have eaten there many times and was treated like scum for wanting to eat. They need to learn how to treat customers.

Not only did I have one of the best burgers I've ever had, but our waiter hands down made the evening amazing. We were served with some complimentary wine, cake, and a tequila shot for the road as a "Welcome to Brooklyn" treat. I had the best time and can't wait to come back.
Well I'll be if the staff here isn't just the absolute best. So gracious and can talk smart about any old thing.

We often walk by people waiting in lines outside of other brunch spots in the neighborhood, and then we get to Sweetwater and are welcomed in and seated immediately.  I can't quite figure out why they always have room for us, but they do! They have a beautiful outside area in the back. The staff is super friendly, service is quick, and my meals have always been fresh and delicious. My only sadness is that they took the "Uova in Purgatorio" dish off the menu.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Favorite spot in North Williamsburg. Built for comfort and works for me on every level. Great drinks, entrees, burgers, staff, decor and vibe.

The only reason I didn't give this place 5 stars is because it wasn't super duper, ridiculously amazing. But it was good! I went here for a late Sunday brunch. Actually it was really last minute and our friend told us to meet him there... BUT, the french toast was really good. Very different than normal... and I've had a lot of different french toasts. It was the perfect combination of crispy but soft. Also ordered a mimosa which was yummm. We sat outside in the back which was beautiful! Vines covering everything and mesh shades above (which really didn't block anything but hey, they looked cool I guess.) I'd come back here on another sunny day. The patio was really nice.

I've honestly been here 3 times in the last two weeks, thats how much I enjoy this place. A warm and welcoming space with cool U shaped booths near the bar and a dining room past that. All the food is prepared very well, with the highlights being the mussels, gnocchi, half chicken and the calamari. Good service and the maitre de is very welcoming. Definitely my new "spot".
awesome place! went for brunch and had the best lamb burger I've ever had, awesome arugula lentil salad and perfect micheladas. service was perfect too. will be back and back!

We came into Brooklyn for a concert later in the evening at the Music Hall so wanted to check out some local grub. So glad we chose Sweetwater - based on recommendations from friends. We sat at the bar and had food and some local beers. Must check out when in the neighborhood! I licked my plate clean! Please note it's either Cash or AMEX ONLY!!

The cornflake-crusted french toast (served with spiced whipped cream and fruit) is amazing.  Try it and you'll never eat french toast anywhere else again.  We also had a lovely Nicoise salad with seared tuna.  Charming decor, a cozy patio out back.  We will be back for dinner.
No comment
No comment

The Mac n cheese was wonderful! I also had a taste of their burger on an English muffin bun and that was fantastic. Good service and everything on the menu looked great. Cozy atmosphere. I would definitely return.

A long, leisurely lunch on a late April afternoon sets up the scene for a delicious burger in their garden.  This place is great but if you can, sit in the garden.  It's an oasis in the middle of the city.
No comment
No comment

If you knew what this place used to be like, you would not eat here.  It used to be a punk rock dive bar.  It was so dirty, I threw up in the bathroom sink once.  Okay, twice.  Not from drinking.  From the SMELL in the bathroom and the gook covering every inch of it.  I can't believe they have a kitchen now.  Where did the put the kitchen -- where the bathrooms used to be?  Good god, that is just gross.
No comment

Came in for dinner and drinks at the bar.  It was my first visit and I wasn't expecting anything out of the ordinary.  Well, that changed the moment I met my bartender, Rudy.  Rudy is a gentleman and a culinary-libations scholar.  Gin is my poison and he spoke about different gins to try in an intelligent and humble way.  I ordered the hangar steak rare and it was cooked properly.  The brussel sprouts and onion rings on the side were great.  The service was attentive and friendly.  The crowd was a mix of folks there for drinks after work, couples from the neighborhood and regulars.  I look forward to coming back to try more cocktails, more menu items and spending time with a great staff.  Cheers!
No comment

I had a great date here this weekend. Nothing crazy or exciting to report, and I consider that a good thing. Because the cute decor and atmosphere got me extra points with my date, you get an extra star too Mr. Sweetwater, you cute little thing. We started with the caprice, and I got a special- the ribeye steak frites- and both were solid. The dessert appropriately named 'Food of the Gods', which was chocolate cake swimming in chocolate soup with a scoop of hazelnut ice cream on top. It was alittle pricey, but Sweetwater is perfect for a fancy dinner date.

Our server was awful. He seemed confused by any questions we had about the menu and stared at us a beat too long after every verbal exchange which made for a really awkward experience. Honestly it wouldn't matter if the food was good (it's nothing special) but just for the service alone I would never go back. Also, when asked I said they could make my drink with the house/well liqour and they rang me up with a far more expensive brand. Lame.

Ohhh my GET THE BURGER ON THE ENGLISH MUFFIN. Perfectly pink on the inside and so juicy. And for the price? Amazing. Honestly, blew my expectation out of the water. The fries were also soo good we ordered another side midway through the meal. Perfectly crispy. I think everyone likes their meal! Great experience and fun atmosphere in bk

See Chainsaw's review. The first time we met was at the old Sweetwater. She and I are nearly the same person. I also have thrown up there. In the sink. I have also seen many people pee on the floor. Nothing about that place says "eating establishment". I don't care what kind of "improvements" have been made. Only firebombing could turn that place sterile enough for me to eat food prepared there. Preferably roasted marshmallows.

The food here is not all that interesting, but it is good and thus I frequent this place quite a bit. The outdoor area is cute and the servers are nice, though not always speedy. My Mr. likes the the lamb chops and orders them almost everytime we go. The chacouterie plate is nice (though kind of hard to screw that up I suppose) and I love the cannelloni. Couscous side was a bit bland. Won't order that again. Also, bruschetta for $10 was a bit of a joke as we only got one piece. Live and learn, but will return.

I had the aged prime steak which was pretty good.  I'm not a mac and cheese fan but I would come here just for a side of mac and cheese and a glass of wine. This place is kind of pricey for the town so check Groupon, yelp, or Amazon for a discount.  The wait staff will even tell you which one has the best deal going on and you can download it during dinner.

I can see how this place is caught between a 3 and a 4 star.  In a neighborhood of rising food stars and new age gastro-amazingness, I can see how a cute simple place like this could be overlooked.  But! Let's all just remind ourselves that when life boils down (as it often does), there's just nothing that can trump solid traditional fare.  No frills, no gimmicks, just really good food at reasonable prices: solid dependable burgers and hearty italian gnocchi.  A nice meal that reminds me of how simple and easy life can/should be.
No comment

Those of us with memories of the former space - the same-named punk bar infamous for obilteratingly strong and cheap drinks - will be shocked by how far a makeover goes in constructing revisionist history, but damn, Sweetwater's looks good these days. A former pig in Chanel Vamp lipstick (yeah, that's right, slightly ever so slightly retro indesign), S'water's rocks brunch and dinner on the raised outdoor patio is also a delight. Pork chops are perfectly cooked and non-dry and the salads are fresh and vibrantly dressed. In terms of afore-mentioned brunch, choose the North African spiced steak sandwich if available - tender, lucious and rimmed with melting fat crowned by sweet exotic spices.
No comment

Very good for brunch, soups are always on point. Service is excellent. Bartender was super friendly despite the crowded atmosphere. drinks: best Bloody Mary in Williamsburg. If only they are not so busy all the time
No comment
Thank you Sweetwater for still be Sweetwater.... I always enjoy the place, the food (mmm) , the staff... Don't change!!!

Excellent burgers, plate and wine selections, lovely service, old fashioned, European style cafe. If you hang out long enough, you'll get a little of the previous bar's past whispering in your ear. Plus, as mentioned in another post, you may linger at the table, enjoying the last glass of wine or conversation.
Patio was amazing on a summer night and the staff is crazy friendly.  The food is decent, but not amazing.  Definitely go there when the weather cooperates for outside-sitting.

Hot summer night. But that's no excuse for hovering fruit flies around the table. Recommend the Martinez martini. Calamari was overcooked with some rings dried out. Aioli seemed out of a jar.  Mussels special lacked pizzazz. Neede something acidic but mussels were plump and fresh. My gnocchi were mushy and the sauce pasty but generally good flavor.  Can't really say the service was very friendly but efficient.
No comment

I already wasn't a fan of Sweetwater because I find the service to be possibly the worst in the Burg. I only go here because other people want to. My last visit they brought me the steak special (asked for rare) well done. They took it back and made me another one. The second steak was also severely overcooked. The manager offered to get another steak, but at that point my other guests were almost finished their meals. Since they screwed up twice, the manager said he'd give it to me half-price. Half-price. Like he was doing me a favor. He seemed more interested in giving the chef a tongue-lashing, which won't help me at all, than being a real restaurant manager.

Love the vibe of the place, wanted great food and to be left alone to work and got exactly that, food was great, but they even had good coffee to wash it all down. If your looking for a relaxing environment this is a place to give a shot.

Came here today with a large group on a whim for some late brunch. They sat us very quickly and accommodated our large group with no issues. The restaurant is overrun with obnoxious hipster wannabes complaining about how long they have to wait for their tables. Keep in mind it's Brooklyn on a beautiful Sunday!! Our server was a nice gentleman who we had to remind a few times for drinks we ordered. My husband ordered a burger and said it was delicious. I ordered the avocado toast and wanted to throw it at the wall. The portions are super small. The "toast" was probably the size of my hand with some tasteless guacamole smeared on it and two bland eggs. I added salt and pepper and it didn't do much. The "toast" edge was as hard as a rock and could barely be cut with the butter knife I had. When you break a sweat trying to eat something, it's never a good thing. The eggs were also cold. You know what kicked major ass though?! The iced coffee. It was delightfully strong. I only had to ask our server for it three times... (for $50 this place fell very flat and we won't be back)
No comment

It was a sunny but cool Sunday afternoon when we ate here. The patio is cute with sun shades and old rustic patio furniture. Service took a little long but once we ordered it was quick. I got the lamb sandwich, it was perfect for the weather. Warm and tasty, it was similar to a pulled pork sandwich served with a side salad. My b.f got the burger but it was not up to his satisfaction. The burger is served on an English muffin, which got soaked with the juices and the burger itself was smaller than the muffin?! I would like to go back but the b.f doesn't really care for it.

The food it's very good, I notice thy took out a lot of good dishes from the menu . I notice that the place was very dirty the salt & black pepper was very dirty , looks like the manager just be on the phone all the time instead of cleaning the place more often.

This place has terrible service. I once came here on a Sunday afternoon for brunch in a group of five. Our hipster waitress had no idea what she was doing. After waiting 45 minutes for our food, when our waitress stopped by after some flagging she offered to bring us "bread while we wait." Then she forgot it. When the food finally came twenty minutes later, it was cold. The icing on the cake -- they brought out three dishes. We had to wait another fifteen minutes before the remaining two came out.
Unfortunately the service has gone downhill here. I came into tonight for a quick burger and beer but was just told the place is closing. Bad.

I'd give food a 5, ambience a 5 (would've been a 8, but the all-over-the-place waitstaff detracted from it), and service a 2.  If I elaborated, this review would be way too long, so I'll leave it at that.
The burgers are amazing! Good selection of beers and daily menus. Be sure to check out the backyard!
Great place . Mussels are amazing . Bartender is cool . And the garden is adorable . The Service is friendly
No comment

LOVE the burger I had here on Thurs night - the one with pecorino cheese and truffle oil. SO GOOD. Love the minimal bun-age - just an english muffin. Hate it when I'm all "Where's the Beef" when a hugeass bun comes with my burgs. With fries that tasted homemade too. Ordered a nice glass of rose. The atmosphere was loverly too -- romantic with low lighting but kinda hip. Hubs had pork tenderloin -- looked good and our other friend had gnocchi - looked just OK. We started with fried calamari which was deliciously fresh, lightly fried, the leggy part of the squid not the tubes. I will go back esp when I'm going out to a show.. it's a convenient jaunt to Music Hall and Knitting Factory ( a bit more of a walk).

Not sure why one of my good friends loves this place but every time he comes for dinner in Williamsburg it's here.  it's not that the food isn't good but it definitely isn't memorable.  anything you have will be solid, but it's really nothing special.  truthfully, the last time i was there it sort of smelled when i walked in.  i'm not sure how clean the place is.  I've never had a bad time there and i am sure i'll eat there again, but it's certainly not my first choice.
No comment
I just went for a quck dinner after work, and seriously. I had the best steak EVER. Bartender was a sweetheart too. What a wonderful experience tonite!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Ordered a burger rare and it, along with every other medium rare burger at the table, arrived grey throughout. Was still tasty, and the service was good, but I'd rather not be given an option if they can't act on it.
A neighborhood staple for us. Delicious comfort food, consistent service, and cozy space. Love the grilled cheese, great burger and the mussels are a highlight.

Wonderful friendly staff, excellent food, extremely cute decor, charming lighting, welcoming great service. Not sure which aspect of our meal to rave about first. Every dish was simply delicious, and the whole atmosphere makes you really feel at home. We began our meal with a very fresh burrata complemented by apple and arugula. The breads which come are dangerous as they are so fresh and good that you may fill up on those alone. The mains of beautiful pasta, lamb burger and cucumber tzaziki, and a wonderfully presented steak were delicious. The cocktails were very nice, and there is a good beer selection. Most of all, we enjoyed the food, cozy atmosphere, and the kindness of the staff. The owner(?) even ran down the block, without a coat, in the NYC winter, after us to give us a bag we accidentally left behind. This place is definitely a gem and the best place I've been to in Williamsburg!
I have been coming here for years, the service is amazing backyard is great to sit on. Lamb burger is to die for, It really is one of my favorite places in NYC..
No comment

A lovely laidback but polished vibe offering a quality menu. The spinach cannelloni and gnocchi were great. The outdoor area in the back looked really nice, I'll be remembering to come back here on a warm summer night.
I have yet to find a flaw with Sweetwater.  Lovely decor and staff, delicious cocktails (perfectly shaken Martini and wonderful Brooklyn), mouth-watering ribeye steak with chimichurri sauce.

I knew we were in for a great night at Sweetwater when our very nice (and cute) waiter Matt recommended one of my favorites, truffle gnocchi. Mmmmm... My friends also really enjoyed their meal, and we all loved the Malbec. The atmosphere was lovely, would make a great date spot, but served me well for a night of reminiscing with old friends. Thanks again, Matt!
No comment

I've been going to Sweetwater for about 11 years & it is a decent spot for drinks. Went in recently and ordered the kale salad, burger and fries. Kale salad had nice flavor but was too light on the kale and too heavy on the cheese. The burger and fries were busted, way too much salt and the texture and tangy flavor of the beef were not hitting me right. My boyfriend, who ordered the same thing, felt the same way.
No comment

Sweet Water used to be one of my favorite bars and is now one of my favorite restaurants.  The food is French bistro-y with great burgers and awesome fries.  The prices are low and the booths are cozy.  Plus they have a great deck in the back to enjoy in warm weather.

Excellent food, great service.  The menu is a bit small and esoteric, but as long as you can afford the bill, you shouldn't be disappointed.  Don't bother with an appetizer;  you get free bread as soon as you sit down.
No comment

I die for the Gnocchi!!!! It seriously just melts in your mouth. Its probably my most favorite meal in brooklyn. I think the ambiance of the restaurant is great. they also have a patio open in the summer. Only bummer is its cash only.
Decent bistro grub if you don't mind eating inside a jet engine. I spent the night screaming into my friend's ear. Afterwards I was hoarse.

A good enough neighborhood-y joint that is likely a go-to for those who live nearby.  We met friends out here for dinner and since none of us lives near the restaurant, it was perplexing as to why we trekked out to Williamsburg for what seems to be very run-of-the-mill pub-style food.  That said, the quality was excellent and the service was good.  I wouldn't recommend going out of your way for it, but if you find yourself in Williamsburg with a hankering for a burger, this is a great choice!

It was the first place I ate when I visited NY and everything else after that was a letdown. I love the atmosphere and that they use old glass bottle for water. If  you order wine, they put a pail (literally a pail) of ice on your table. The food is great and it gets you satisfy, but not too full. The Food of the Gods dessert was so decadence...it was just swimming in chocolate. I like how small and quaint the place is and definitely one of the highlights of my NY trip.

had a great feast here when i was visiting NY last week. The half chicken and veggies were amazing, and portions were huge. my buddies girlfriend had the mussels which she said were great. We ordered takeout and they forgot our calamari which we realized when we got home, called them and they said sorry and a credit is waiting for my buddy next time he eats there...Overall a great little spot. Glad i got to try it out
No comment
LOVE Sweetwater.  Always a nice spot for a meal or a simple glass of wine at the bar, they also have a cool backyard deck for warmer months.
Consistently good food served by nice people. You can always count on a comfortable meal in a nice location.

Had a lovely experience at Sweetwater last night.  They staff is incredibly nice & helpful.  They do a great job with the food.  I had the mussels which were excellent.  Great fries.  Bruschetta appetizer was yummy.  We all had a variety of cocktails that were great.  You cannot leave w/o any dessert.  The dessert is off the hook!  Try the desserts that are like a chocolate molten cake and banana cream pie w/ an oreo crust.  mmmm.  Love the decor - cozy.
No comment

Two words: quinoa burger. AMAZING! The food is always great - although I only come for brunch. Do yourself a favor and get one of the daily scones. They come from a nearby bakery and are to die for. Comfy atmosphere. You can sit in the back, or up front in the leathery booths next to the bar. The only negative thing I will mention is that the service is lacking. It seems to be a consistent thing at brunch - there's a lot of waiting for water and coffee refills. Maybe they need more servers?

Just came back from brunch and thought I should share......overall my friend and I enjoyed it and felt the food was very reasonably priced.  We both had the skirt steak and eggs and agreed that the steak was perfect but the eggs were overcooked,  Also one small gripe - with 3 steak dishes on the menu, it would be nice if Sweetwater has some kind of steak sauce to go with it....ketchup and steak are NOT a perfect combo!  The bloody mary was nicely spiced, not overdone nor too bland but my friend was a little disappointed with the blood orange mimosa.  PAYMENT ALERT -- they only accept Amex (?) or cash.  Our waitress was very friendly -- as was our neighboring tables.....so all in all, I can totally recommend Sweetwater for your sunday brunch.

Looove Sweetwater. It's atmosphere is that of a hipster grandma, with food so comfy and pretty you want to eat it every meal. It's got the makings of a snobby rude estab. but not the waitresses! They've always been sweet and attentive, causal. Try the garden, or the earthy dining room, either way you won't wanna leave.

My boyfriend and I have been here twice and really enjoy the food as well as the atmosphere.  A little pricey but worth it - it attracts an older, more adult, sophiscated crowd, not the usual Burg hipster who just wants to go bar hopping and get drunk.  The only weird note was they won't accept Visa or Mastercard - either cash or AMEX, so each time we had to run out to an ATM machine. Other than that, we have a great time here.
Great atmosphere and beautiful rooftop garden. Everything thing on the menu is good.
amazing burger great service.fast seating. i will return. ** the mussels where fantastic.
No comment
No comment

Killer food here. Ive worked in several fine dining restaurants and I put this up here in terms of originality and great taste of food. The service was a bit slow, but it happens. Definitely recommend this place. Its a very small, yet intimate atmosphere.
No comment

This is our go-to dinner place. Laid back ambience. Cute back area if u r dining in the summer. Haven't paid much attention to the service but clearly never had anything to complain about, else i think i would hv remembered. Food - The mussels are excellent and we have probably tried it with several different broths (they change it as per the special they are serving), and it is excellent every single time. The truffle gnocchi is really good as well.
No comment

Eat here every so often. Went this Sunday night got a great booth seat super sweet waitress and host. I am always happy when I eat here. There is reason why this place has been around forever! great service, good food and atmosphere other Williamsburg eateries should study this place.
No comment

I love this place, been coming here for years. Owners and waitstaff are lovely. Amazing wine list. Food is always right on. I love their watermelon salad in the summer. Brunch is good, can be a bit crowded but it's nice to sit out back. Great vibe and atmosphere.
I love the spot, the outdoor and indoor seating areas are great, and the  food is great (but whenever I'm there I only order mussels and scallops)

Sweetwater is one of my favorite restaurants in Williamsburg.  Their burgers on english muffins are amazing, as are their drinks.  The back room gets a little crowded and noisy, but the outside seating is great.

This is my favorite restaurant in New York.  The cocktails and onion rings (yes, onion rings) alone deserve five stars.  The entrees are awesome, and if you are very lucky, they'll give you a complimentary pastry from Bakeri as an appetizer!  Plus, when the weather is nice, the outdoor seating in the back is adorable.
Incredibly friendly staff, great vibe, perfect drinks, good food. A total neighborhood gem.
No comment
Adorable decor, thought out menu, a genuine bistro surrounded by too many cliche Williamsburg restaurants.
No comment

Where do I start?  This is my neighborhood go to place.  The four cheese gnocchi is just about the best I've ever had, and the burger melts in your mouth.  Love the tin ceilings, the back patio, the sweet wait staff and amber glow that permeates the restaurant in the evening hours.  Don't forget to try the extremely decadent 'Food of the Gods' chocolate cake swimming in thick, creamy chocolate sauce! UGHHH.
No comment

Sunday brunch...they accept reservations! Good fresh food, well spiced, well priced. Music is notable, but able to hear each other at the table. Not crowded in. Good service, fairly priced. Sensitive to special requests (e.g. dietary issues). No pressure to leave. Highly recommended.
A nice quaint date spot. Cant speak for the food because I didn't have it but the drinks were nice and it had a decent ambiance.

Weary from travel and empty stomachs, my boyfriend and I wandered into Sweetwater on the evening of Thanksgiving in search of a meal and some drinks. For the holiday, they were busy but sat us at the bar right away. The staff were so friendly, they were sure to say "Happy Thanksgiving!" To all who entered and again  as they left. The bartender that served us at the bar, I wish I remembered her name, was incredible. Our drinks were made perfectly. I got the Thanksgiving dinner which was exactly what I was looking for. So good. Just like home. My boyfriend got the gnocchi and it too was delicious. As the night wrapped up the bartender asked if she could buy us a shot for thanksgiving, she made us a delicious and unique shot and did it with us. The staff all seemed very close, like family. Spending our Thanksgiving meal here made it feel like family, not so far from home. I love this bar and the energy from the staff. The place could carry itself on the quality of the food and drink...but the staff are what makes this place extra special. I'll be back next time that I am in Brooklyn!

We sat outside on a Thursday night and their back patio is gorgeous and cozy. I had the lamb burger on the English muffin with their Sweetwater amber ale. The burger was great and the beer was pretty good for a 5$ draft. I would definitely recommend the patio for a summer date or a casual dinner. Total for drink & entree & tip was 24$.
No comment

A cozy dinner spot in hipster williamsburg, this features delicious food (I got the steak, ordered medium well and cooked to perfection, the meat was so tender it melted in my mouth), my girlfriend got the Sweet Water Burger (served on an english muffin, ordered medium rare, emerging medium well and reportedly delectable in spite of this) and our companion for the weekend ordered the chicken breast, which she described as just what she needed and certainly looked perfectly edible. Aside from great food the atmopshere was perfect, romantic, cozy, yet at the same time a very scenester place. The pricing was somewhat misleading (the $9 burger turned into an $11 burger once cheese was acounted for, the $16 dollar steak became an $18 dollar steak once my request for onion rings instead of fries was processed) and somewhat blaise service from waitresses and waiters that were only too obviously working there to be "scene" rather than for a living, the bill including 4 drinks came to $100 even, inluding tip $125, my one major complain is that once we were finished eating we were hurried out of the place somewhat in order to accomadate others waiting for their dinner, instead of repeatedly asking us if we were through or if we needed anyhting else in a rushed tone, they could have asked us to move our conversation over to the bar, a minor complaint was a lack of a dessert menu.
No comment
Fantastic place,  great staff,  great owner.  Went with a group from work very happy all around.  Lamb burger,  and banafi cake amazing.

Absolutely a fantastic breakfast/brunch. I arrived hung over, which was quickly remedied with some of the best coffee I have ever tasted. I got the eggs benedict and it was superbly flavored and textured with a portion large enough to satisfy, but not overwhelm. the waitress was a bit aloof, but she was cute so it all made up for it in the end.  Hallelujah!

We had dinner at Sweetwater last night and our first clue that it was going to be good was that there was a pretty good crowd in there when we looking for a spot around 6:30, unlike most of the other well-rated eateries in Williamsburg that were all mostly empty. The place just filled up and got busier as the night wore on. The food amply justified all this patronage and the wait staff was helpful, friendly and attentive. Nice neighborhood bistro ambience, albeit busy. Not really the call for a quiet romantic evening, but a warm and friendly feeling and a charming atmosphere. Waiters working hard to make it work, floaters pitching in to keep it going. Our table sampled the fried calamari, which was pretty darn good and we're picky about that; light, fresh and tender; the surest clue that a restaurant has a high quality bar. We also had the onion soup with gruyere which won a strong nod, the sausage and bean soup was terrific, and the rib eye steak was outstanding. My wife and I shared the pork tenderloin and the beet and feta salad, both excellent. Fun evening in Williamsburg and we will go back to Sweetwater.

Bad, snotty service, but good solid food at a good price. the place is noisy and cramped but if you are looking for a place to have dinner in williamsburg, this is a good choice. for some reason this did not seem like the cleanest place to me....
best spot in willy b ! customer service is on point for everyone they are a good crew ! and the food is a+

Came in on two occasions, the first time for a brunch. The brioche french toast was delicious and the bartender knew how to make a mean bloody mary. The next time came in for a quick bite, ordering the cured meats and some cheeses, and after trying it with the suggested barolo, decided to stay for dinner. I was not disappointed! The Pork Tenderloin wrapped in proscuitto served with green apple & potato mash, yes as good as it sounds. Didnt have room for dessert, but next time I will.
No comment

Went here on a friend's recommendation. Had the watermelon salad, the sea bass special, and the mussels special. The food was great, but the sea bass took forever to come out. Our waitress made up for this by offering us a free coffee (him) and a free glass of wine (me). Really enjoyed this place overall.
Solid lunch place. Good service, fare portions. Home style cuisine, comfort food done right. Good wines, good value.
mmmm, i remember sticking my fork into the lamb shank i ordered there and the meat falling right off the bone.  i love meat.  i may have to go back there tonight...
brunch is packed.but the food is just alright.wish they will be better
such an awesome restaurant with great prices / vibe. completely underestimated gem.
Really love this restaurant.  They have the best burger in the neighborhood.  I've been here 6 or 7 times, and the food is always great.  I highly recommend checking them out.

There are many good restaurants in Williamsburg, and this one is one of the best.  Good food, service and atmosphere.  The latter is the best, and maybe the attractions.  Sit inside or outside in good weather.  Enjoy the experience.
love the atmosphere of this place. get the truffle cheese gnocchi, a vodka lemonade and the "banafi" pie with hazelnut ice cream for dessert, you will be in heaven.

I've eaten here twice and the food is okay - nothing that blows you away and both times I have been a bit stuck with the menu - nothing that really grabs me.  I had a steak on the first visit - not bad, second visit the canneloni which was okay, as others have said it was swimming in oil and something missing.  The service is attentive, except the one waitress must have had her boyfriend positioned at the bar, she kept coming over to rub his back and kiss him.  At one stage she leant over to kiss him and I had a full eyeful of her knickers.
No comment

This is a cute place, and the mussels I had were delicious. However, the service really detracted from that. The waitress was brusque and kind of rude, and kept trying to clear the table before I was finished. They had a good selection of beers on draft and they were cheap, and the mussels were addictively good.

I love the look, the food and the service.  It is a beautifully old feeling restaurant and bar.  The food and drinks are a not cheap, but worth the money because the food is soooo good, and it's good across the board.  The salads are complex and fresh and wonderful, the french fries are great, and I've tried and loved so many of the main courses that it is always hard to decide.  Inside or outside, it's always fun to eat there.

This used to be a cool punk bar, then it was a romantic little restaurant. Now the food is pretty gross.  I had calamari app, which had some pieces of quill in it. The gnocchi was greasy mushy slop.  The cannelloni was a soggy mess sitting in a bowl of oil.  Hated the food.  Two stars because the dirty martini was great.

Best lamb burger that I've ever had in my life! And their bread is good too, which I'm finding harder to come by in other restaurants in NYC. Service is friendly, and it's great for a date or a small group. It's also in central Wburg so it's conveniently located if you are looking to go somewhere nearby for drinks afterwards.

Love this place! So CUTE, there are a lot hip places in north Williamsburg but this place is very well thought out in terms of design and menu...stylish yet comforting. Similar to Du Mont and even Pastis in Manhattan but much closer to my apartment for brunch! YUM!

Used to love this place. I mean really love it! But a new manager took over and has truly brought the service & overall fun vibe of Sweetwater to its knees. Jennifer (or maybe Jessica?) has personally treated my friends rudely now on 3 separate occasions. Last weekend (which will sadly be my last visit) she was working the bar and apparently not too happy about it. When my pal got up from our table (after drinks took 20 minutes to arrive), went to the bar and asked for the type of beer he order instead of what was served, Jen/Jess stuck a straw in his glass, took a sip, said he had what he ordered then walked away. Our waiter (nice guy, don't remember name) was so embarrassed & apologetic, he said our whole group would get a free round. But at check time Jen/Jess/Nightmare veto'd the apology round. This is the most recent example of how the good times at a great restaurant have been polluted by a bad hire. Sweetwater... you will be missed!

i haven't been to sweetwater in a little bit, but i made french toast today, which of course made me remember how awesome the french toast was at sweetwater. beautifully presented and absolutely delicious, with homemade whipped cream on the side. every time i've gone there for brunch it's been a treat.
this was, legit, the worst meal i've ever had. if i were you, i'd avoid this place. it's expensive and super gross.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Date night approved!!!!! Can't wait to go back!. The restaurant is located on the first floor of the public hotel. We had reservations, were seated right away. The food was so good, I was left dreaming about their fried rice. I can't remember the exact name but it was so good. It's Peruvian style fried rice. We also had the lomo Saltado and octopus! So delicious. The drinks were delicious as well. Everything was exquisite. The place is super beautiful, surrounded by tons of greenery and they had a live band playing. And of course the service was great, no problems there. Did I mention we'll be back? Must visit!
No comment

Food is okay but this is a fun place to come with friends! Interior is beautiful, and there was live music playing all night. I was able to try the classic ceviche, sticky prawns, and roasted chicken. I was not blown away by the food, the intentionally hard chow mein that came with the prawns was an interesting choice. They also never brought the fries I ordered. I would come back here to chill and drink but not for the food.

This restaurant is inside the public hotel and was super pretty but I thought the food, service and people were all very odd. The ceviche was fresh and delicious but our waiter constantly kept giving us really weird comments about the menu and pushed us to order more when we weren't hungry. The pisco sour was the perfect level of sweet and we ordered the octopus, fish, rice noodles, ceviche and salad. The house nuts were yummy but the food was all small portions.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
The family style dinner is not good at all. They brought out very minimal food and expensive for what was offered. Nice spot tho

The bacon was the best part of brunch. The pancakes were good. The burger was mediocre. And the ceviche was disappointing. Only giving a three star for the bacon and pancake. If not I would have given it a 1 star. I will try to come here again to try the dinner menu. But will be a while before I drop by there again.
No comment

Went here for one of my bestie's bdays and the food was banging!!! The music was great and the place was just a whole vibe. I rly enjoyed their lobsters! We ordered a bunch of things and I'd def wanna go again. Even the waiter was super nice!!

The first thing you see when walking in to Popular is an abundance of greenery and lush plants. The restaurant is in a really cool hotel with a modern and sleek interior. Our server was extremely friendly and efficient. He gave great recommendations as well. As I do not drink, he recommended a delicious purple, cinnamony, virgin cocktail type drink with lime which was incredible. Definitely try this. As for the food we got the sticky shrimp, sweet potato, yucca fries, gem salad, and octopus. All amazing. Some standouts were definitely the shrimp and the yucca fries. We also got this chocolate mousse type thing with ice cream for dessert that was delicious. The chocolate was super rich and satisfying. Can't really go wrong with anything on the menu here. One of the best Peruvian spots I have been to. Overall great vibes, super trendy, and pleasant dining experience.
No comment
No comment

Beautiful restaurant, interesting menu (although not executed perfectly), very spotty service. We were told that none of the bottles of wine under a $100 were available. Also, the server kept trying to upsell things. And the server, as nice as he was, didn't possess the personality of the person who should be selling you a $50 plate of Lomo Saltado. It felt like a restaurant was trying to make a weekly payroll while sacrificing their image and a possibility of repeat business in process.

Came here for my birthday with friends and this place exceeded my expectations. It's inside the public hotel and the entrance got my attention from across the street. Beautiful place. I walked in and a live band was playing Spanish and Brazilian music, and as we were guided to our table I was blown away by the ambiance. The food came in small portions but it was so flavorful. The only thing we didn't like was the three flavored sorbet desert. Warning: the mint sorbet tastes exactly like real mint. This is the perfect spot for a classy, upscale girls night out, a date, or a birthday!
No comment
No comment
Super pricey for just okay food - BUT I must say ALL of the ceviche dishes were BEYOND delicious! Go for a ceviche tasting ONLY.
No comment
No comment

Popular has a fun lively atmosphere, it's tucked away behind the golden escalators and the front cantina bar. We were welcomed with Latin music from a live band for our Saturday night excursion. The drinks were quite tasty from the extensive options of the pisco bar. The la rojita was light and refreshing and the pisco sour light frothy with a little sour bite. I got the ceviche Classico which was very fresh and delicious. My main was the tortellini, it's served Al Dente which means the pasta isn't fully cooked. I thought it was yummy but it was a little too undercooked for my taste as there were some hard parts. If you are looking for a fun night out or a birthday I'd recommend and they have the club upstairs.
No comment
No comment
Definitely recommend this place! Such a cool vibe and food was amazing!! Our server was so nice and personable too!
Beautiful restaurant and amazing food. The shrimp rice was crispy and the duck leg melted in my mouth. I tried lucuma for the first time. It's an eye opener
No comment
No comment

I like the restaurant! It's modern Peruvian food with a lot of creativity. We ordered a bunch of main courses to share and everything was excellent. I especially liked Lomo Saltado. It was so good and very different from what you usually see. My friend ordered a cocktail that she had in Peru and it was so good. The dining environment is amazing. Service was solid too. Overall it's a pretty cool place.

Great service, awesome ceviche, awesome Carrots, delicious wine, pretty good atmosphere, but scallops were EXTREMELY underwhelming. $34 for "two" scallops which actually weren't two scallops, but an amalgamation of tinier ones? Not sure if an off Friday night or what, but highly disappointing.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Great food, lovely ambience, but service was uneven. The wait staff are very friendly, but our server kept making mistakes, bring out an incorrectly ordered entree, screwing up a coffee order, and accidentally adding incorrect items to our bill. Recommend the place, but it requires alertness and patience. BTW, I loved the filet mignon.
No comment
The pomegranate salad was wonderful. We tried three different ceviches and they were all delicious. My only complaint is that the dishes were small compared to the price we paid.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
First time dining for Peruvian food! Tasty food I like Filet mignon! And enjoying the environment surrounded by the plants

Food was amazing. Ambiance was amazing. Even our server was amazing - shoutout to Bowie! We got the calamari and ceviche to share and it was able to kick-start our meal and start it on such a good, high note. It was also such a vibe - at around 9pm, there was live salsa music playing in the lounge area (cantina/pisco bar area).

Such a disappointing experience. Came with my husband to celebrate our anniversary. Overpriced food, minuscule - not even small, tiny! - portions, rude service. The waiter was far more interested in upselling and showing his indifference rather than trying to provide a memorable service. I was so surprised to read all the positive reviews. Where was the manager Rachel mentioned in some other reviews? Nobody bothered to come to us and ask how we were doing. Such a waste of our time and money.
No comment
This place was probably one of, if not the best, dining experiences I've ever had. We had a wonderful, charismatic waiter. The food was absolutely to die for, and the atmosphere was well executed.

I saw that the photos were beautiful on Yelp but this place is absolutely gorgeous beyond the expectations set. Tucked away in an oasis on Christie street, past a secret garden, then behind these two impressive escalator space portals to the hotel above. Both the bar/lounge and restaurant have plentiful, beautifully designed seating. And the entire establishment is adorned in greenery. It's like the rainforest cafe for sophisticated adults and unsophisticated foodies like me. I had to get the Popular Pisco Sour because when in Lima... one of the best cocktails I've ever had. I also had to try the classic ceviche which honestly blew my mind - the broth? Was so delicious and almost had a delicate chorizo flavor. The dish itself, all the dishes are absolutely beautiful. For entrees we got the shrimp rice which comes served in skillet, the sticky prawns (bigger than photos suggest! Definitely entree sized), the swordfish, and the market fish (striped bass with micro green salad and delicious sauce). We also got an order of yucca for the table (served two ways, fried and boiled? With another delicious sauce). The swordfish was my favorite entree - out of all the swordfish I've had, this somehow packed double the flavor. And since the fish plates come with just the fish (and a lot of garnish) - I would definitely recommend ordering some carbohydrates off the veggie section of the menu, and I do highly recommend the yucca which is just melt in your mouth. For dessert we tried the Neapolitan ice cream - my father in law is the number one ice cream fanatic and he was losing it at how good this flag of ice cream was. I tried it, it was pretty darn good and served really cool (in a rectangle). My boyfriend and I shared the baked Alaska which also blew my mind - covered in edible flowers and a graham-ish cracker cookie crumble, the meringue was marshmallowy and soft, piped kind of comically like the coronavirus (big spiky ball). Inside the ice cream was two flavors I couldn't identify but they were in the honey, graham-y world and almost cookie dough textured. It's a huge dessert, and I highly recommend getting it whether or not you have other people to share it with. Blown away by this magical place. It's expensive, but it's worth it! Also... not pretentious at all and very kind staff. I wish I had taken photos but I was too mesmerized. Excellent place to take a good friend for a birthday surprise :D
No comment

I have a lot of Peruvian friends who have come here and loved this place so I finally decided to go ahead and try it. At the door hostess was nice and greeted us. Comfortable booth seat , server came right over and was attentive and prompt. Pisco Sours and capitan were delicious , the drink over ice with cumbers was a bit sweet and difficult to drink. Server switched it right out for us. classic ceviche is out of this world and like nothing I've ever tried from before. Tuna tradito needed more flavor but tuna was very fresh. Anticuchos were made from mushroom and were a nice twist from the traditional cow heart. Entrees were all delicious, portions on the smaller side except for the lomo saltado but we left full. The hazelnut tres leches was delicious. Definitely recommend this place. Amazing experience.

While visiting in the area , stopped in to give this place a try and it was delicious. Freindly staff, tables /seating  clean and sanitized between customers . We enjoyed the Peruvian dishes and sampled 4 to share and they were delicious and filling . Great server . Moderately priced .

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment
Two hours for food and it never showed. Server and manager did not offer anything in compensation. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE
No comment
No comment

Delicious food and great ambiance with vibrant energy! Thoughtfully curated dishes with high quality ingredients, so things are on the pricier side. But great for a special occasion or just a fun night out. Plates are great for sharing so you can order more and try everything!

This is a really good place but be prepared to spend money this place is pricey. Other than the price the food is really good I had the Lomo Saltado and the Ceviche. Both were phenomenal. The prices from the menu online is different in person. The prices is $10 more in person. Overall a good experience. The ambiance, jungle vibes, and the staff were great. Our waiter was really good with his recommendations. A great place and a great eat!

This place needs to be more popular. The inside is feels like a Costa Rica forest, quite lush looking. I would consider it the classier bar at the hotel, as the rooftop is definitely not, and is a hot mess and a breeding ground for Omicron. The pisco sours were good (classic + strawberry) and I quite enjoyed them, but not quite as flavorful as the one I had in Lisbon at A Cevicherria. I detected a slight smokiness like mezcal in the classic one. Service was decent. Bathroom is approximately the most lux one I have ever been in.
No comment

I had trouble finding a place that would take a party of 12 in within 2 weeks and was happy to come across popular. It was my wife's birthday and she really likes aesthetically pleasing restaurants, and this place certainly was. Lots of greenery and trees reminded me of Miami. I requested our tables be close together but due to  the layout they couldn't do it. Luckily 2 people bailed last minute and we were able to cut down our party size and sit next to each other. They were very friendly and accommodating on the matter, especially with bringing the cake to the back ($10 cut fee pp). We all started off with some drinks, I got the pisco sour. It was one of the best I've had in nyc tbh. Additionally we tried two of the ceviches, one traditional and I forgot the second. Also very good, with just the right amount of cream and lemon flavor. For my entree I had the sticky prawn. My friends adjacent to me ordered the scallops and duck leg. All three dishes were amazing. I wish the scallops were a little bigger but that's just my want overall at restaurants. Overall great good, music, services, and vibes. It was busy for a Tuesday night. I would 100% recommend this place as a fun option for food and drinks. I would've posted more pictures but I was on baby duty.

Popular is located inside the PUBLIC hotel and the vibes are immaculate. Went here for my 21st bday and it was definitely the place to be. Everything tasted heavenly, especially the ceviche (extremely flavorful and fresh). The only reason why I'm not giving it a full 5 is because of the portion size. The apps and entrees seem to be the same size or even smaller which was a bit disappointing. The quality and taste is definitely unbeatable though. Would revisit!! P.S. the espresso martini is made with Pisco and it is BOMB!
This place is like visiting an island I love the authenticity. The food, service, drinks, ambiance everything amazing.

Beautiful ambiance and serving staff are extremely warm and friendly. For a large group, hard to do family style and the portions are a bit small for the price (understandable in the city). The food itself was very tasty. Drinks were delicious and overall a lovely experience.

Went there for my birthday. I ended up ordering two drinks, Infalible and La Rojita, and absolutely loved both. The drinks were pretty strong in alcohol content, so worth the price. Had to get two ceviches: the clasico and elegante. Both looked gorgeous and were delicious. I like the clasico slightly more for the variety of seafood and the complementary sweet potato and crunchy corn. For mains we ordered the mushroom and the sticky prawn. Both were yummy but not as outstanding as the drinks and ceviche, and a bit pricy. The server was very nice to give us a Peruvian Chocolate for my birthday.
No comment
Love the public hotel and it's established restaurant,,, the food is great , I love the ceviche and the sea bass is so delicious. I was celebrating my friend's birthday and we both had a great time !
No comment

Worst NYC restaurant experience ever. 0 stars. I was staying at the Public for a staycation and decided to have breakfast at the hotel before going home. The server and busser/runner working were absolutely lovely! The person I'm guessing was managing was THE WORST. I was there last Sunday (11/13) around 10:30am. Everything started out fine with the server. I ordered the bread and pastry basket and a side of eggs. When the runner dropped off the food, I was surprised by the bread and pastry basket (picture attached). I was underwhelmed and wanted to ask if I could get something else instead. I tried to get the runner/busser's attention but I figured someone would be back to check on me and I was hungry so I started eating the eggs (they were not warm but as I mentioned, I was hungry). I didn't see the server and the runner was busy but someone else came out on the floor who seemed to be the manager (I'll be referring to him as the manager) so I tried to get his attention. He was focused on a couple who had seated themselves (it wasn't very busy but the staff was struggling to manage the flow of guests). He told them "I see you've seated yourselves." They responded by asking if they could have coffees and he told them "if you want coffees you can go over there. This is a full breakfast menu." They responded by saying "yes. This is where the hotel breakfast is?" They had two packages of unopened cookies they had set on the table and he said "this is a full breakfast menu and you can't have outside food in here." Their response "oh sorry." They put the cookie packages away as the manager walked away from them. The runner came back and took their order. I was able to get the runner's attention and explain to him that I'd like something else. He took the bread and pastry basket away. The manager immediately came over and said "We don't just order things and decide that we don't want them so I'm not going to be able to take this off your check. I can't resell this." I hadn't asked him to and he didn't ask me what the issue was. I told him "I understand it's wasteful and a hassle to send this back but I had expected something else. I feel like it was misrepresented on the menu and I would have sent it back right away had someone checked in but I was having difficulty getting anyone's attention." He said "Yes. It is wasteful and a hassle." We went back and forth a bit and he ended by telling me "I'll take it off the bill but just for YOUR future reference, we don't order things and decide we don't want them." I have never encountered such a rude person in the service industry. I worked in NYC restaurants for about 8 years as a server, bartender, and manager. I know working the breakfast/brunch shift can be terrible but this guy was so rude to the couple next to me and to me. Also having worked in the industry, I know that "we" do send things back when they are not what "we" expected or wanted. I also know that it's pretty awful customer service to berate the customers. Having worked in the industry, I try to give everyone the benefit of the doubt but this guy was BEYOND. He was so rude that I created this yelp account and felt the need to write my first review ever. Avoid this place for breakfast.
This place is very fun, the interior design is really lovely and the food is excellent. It gets a little loud, just in case that's not the vibe you're looking for, but we had a great evening here.

We walked in to Cantina and got a table right away. I had the pisco del dia, which was peppermint and super tasty. I wasn't sure what to expect. My husband got the coffee cocktail at the end and it was super yummy. The huancaina was unlike any I've ever had and highly recommended. We were given a ceviche clasico by mistake, and I definitely recommend that one. We ordered the elegante and it was too creamy and heavy. It almost seemed like mayo, which is not what I want in my ceviche. It's a cool spot and we'd love to go back to Popular and sit outside.

I genuinely don't think I've ever waited so long for food in my entire life. Not to mention, the waiter was serving and checking up on every single table except ours. 5 stars because the food was great, just wish the wait time was less than 3 hours. I got seated at 9:30, I was not eating until 11 pm, I wanted dessert but unfortunately could not get because I know that would have taken me another hour to get. I work in hospitality so I know the struggle, but it's definitely something that should be fixed now for future customers.

Awful, the food gave me a headache and I also threw up after I got home. I didn't drink, just had water and I was completely fine beforehand. Something was rotten or off with the fish. I have never thrown up after eating out in my life.

Food was great! Drinks too! It was an amazing experience made all that much more amazing with our great waiter Ricardo that added that warm ambience and Latin love to our dinner. I'd be back just to enjoy his service and care with his clients
I'd give it a zero if possible. Everyone here is a terrible person with no skills whatsoever. Please respond and give your point of view so I can go even further into how much u suck.

My wife and I went here for dinner and loved it. Very cool vibe, amazing food, creative cocktails, and excellent service. The ceviches are in my opinion the best in the city (try the Elegante) and the bar is a great place for a pre-dinner drink or night cap. Could not recommend this place more.

Booked a reservation for Friday night and was seated immediately. The restaurant is in the back of a hotel lobby and coffee shop/bar. The ambiance is very photo-worthy with all the fake plant literally everywhere. I got the scallops, ceviche, and duck. The pisco sours were very tasy and well made. Scallops and ceviche were awesome - a blast of interesting flavors and textures. Very fresh. The duck was just eh for me, the rice complemented the meat well and was stood out more. The lomo saltado is only offered for 2 servings so I passed on it. The wait staff is attentive. Definitely worth trying, but the price point is steeeeep.

Listen, this place was great! The food was delicious and vibe was fabulous. However, be prepared to drop some casssshhhhhhh!!! One glass of white wine is $22  and the Lomo saltado was $50.. Don't get me wrong, it was delicious, but i was definitely not prepared to spend that much on random thursday night. After dessert, splitting the bill between 2 people came out to about 100 each... Like i said, delicious food and great service, but a shit ton of money lmao

Azir was our server and he was excellent in recommending dishes. He and The entire staff were attentive and the food was excellent as always. Love this venue, atmosphere, great food, one of my faves in NYC.

I could not think of a a better place to celebrate our anniversary. We have not had service and food this good in quite some time. First the hostess congratulated us on our anniversary, then Chef John came over to chat with us before our meal and was very personable and kind, then they sent over complementary champagne for us and our friends that was amazing. It was just a perfect meal and evening from the setting, the drinks (pisco sour), to the  food: ceviche clasico and nikkea, roast carrots were great as was the lomo saltado, all finished by the ridiculous pumpkin tres leche cake with salted caramel ice cream. That you Popular for a magical evening.
Food and service was great!! We can say the short ribs were very good. They also had live music which gave it a nice vibe. I look forward to dining here again.

Ok first this restaurant is gorgeous. The decor really is eye popping. But what's important is the food it's to die for. Small portions so be warned but  the flavors are everything. I highly recommend the ahi tuna ceviche over the octopus ceviche. The lomo saltado was incredible. And the scallops were delicious. Salted caramel ice cream was so yummy. Now the service was everything we had Bowie he was super attentive, friendly, and gave us the best service. Our entire experience was positive from being nicely greeted by the host to being introduced to the beverage manager who was extremely nice! All the staff was amazing the food runner, and busser. Absolutely made my birthday an incredible experience. I highly recommend coming here.

Celebrated a friends birthday dinner. The restaurant decor is beautiful and feels like I'm in a tropical island. Food was just average. I wouldn't really be complaining if it wasn't for the service. The service was incredibly slow. Couple of us was waiting for water and drink majority of the time and to top if it off they charged us for items that was already included with our order. When mentioned they said they didn't know. Service and Communication really need to step up if you're gonna survive with mediocre food.
Ceviche was amazing so were the pisco selections, really pretty ambience felt like being in the Amazon.
Amaaaazing food -- tuna tiradito, scallops, lomo saltado, bib lettuce salad -- all top-notch  Great wine selection and cocktails on-point. Perfect vibe for a date night
We had an amazing experience at popular, the food was outstanding and our waiter Marcelo was excellent.
No comment

I tried to book a birthday dinner and was told if I had over 7 guests we'd have no alternative but to participate in tasting menu of $125pp which I think is horrid. How can you take away the option of a la carte. Also asked to reserve a table for drinks on rooftop and was told a minimum of $1500 would have be spect. Just insanity.  I will take my business elsewhere.

The ambience was great - surrounded by trees. It felt like you were in an outdoor rainforest. The food presentation along with the food itself was delicious. The ceviche was great. The pisco sour was excellent. Highly recommend.

I was a little over 15 minutes late. This is NY... c'mon now. Tried calling multiple times to let the restaurant know and there was no answer. Hostess said that I canceled the reservation on my end and that was not the case. I strictly made this reservation to be seated at the restaurant, not the cantina bar. I do not appreciate being told that I did something that I did not do.
No comment

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: From start to finish; Popular impressed with impeccable service, drinks, and food. A must whether you are staying at the Public or not. Give it a try, you won't regret it.

The decor of the place is beautiful, but don't let it fool you. The food is mediocre. Came here for a friend's birthday celebration and was more than disappointed when we had to share all the entrees, especially since we were not alluded to this in prior communication. Furthermore, we were told there would be a separate menu for our vegetarian friend. There was not a pre-fixed menu and they just modified the dishes we were already having to cater as "vegetarian friendly". Again, it seems like they were not very transparent in their communication prior to the reservation, would not recommend.
No comment

Service was good, food was mediocre .. would not recommend this place to any vegetarians or vegans unless you'd like to be served carrots and lettuce. Overall a pretty expensive spot that did not meet my expectations.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Kimchi scrambled eggs for brunch always hit! The kimchi was fresh which was impressive..and believe me my standards for kimchi are high! The salmon was a little too salty but paired well with the bland avocado and bitter salad. This place combines the best of both worlds in having instagrammable aesthetic dishes and not being a tourist hot spot. It felt like a local spot and the servers were super friendly and quick. I haven't tried the acai bowls yet but they recommended them so heartily that I'm determined to order these next time!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Amazing little restaurant! I seen this place on TikTok and I had to try the food was amazing. Their Kimchi Scramble were delicious scramble eggs and kimchi on top, I became a kimchi fan because of this sandwich. Their banana bread was tasteful, you can smell the cinnamon it was delicious I paid that with a nice matcha. It's a small little restaurant with plenty of outside seating as well. I will definitely be back.

Huge fan of Good Thanks Cafe - the space is small and cozy, and the servers are friendly and quick. Their food is also well-priced, delicious, and aesthetic. My personal favorite is their blue bowl (as you can tell), but you can't go wrong with any of their dishes.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Went back to good thanks and it's still as good as ever! Highly recommend this place for breakfast or brunch. The coffee is fantastic and the avocado toast #2 is amazing with the most fluffy scrambled eggs.
No comment
No comment
No comment
