I came here for brunch. I have to say as someone who doesn't LOVE eggs these scrambled  eggs were amazing. I added a side of bacon, avocado, and cherry tomatoes. The combination with the slice of sourdough bread tasted clean, fresh, and overall very pleasant. My partner got the chickpea curry with scrambled eggs. I had a bite and thought it light but packed with flavor. Also tried the cappuccino which lacked foam and wasn't very warm, black coffee which was fine and a mimosa which was nice, not too sweet.

Yet another health and wellness cafe that's popped up in the lower east side. Though we had a reservation, we still had to wait a long time (~15 minutes) for our table.. what is the point of a reservation if so?? The kimchi scramble was good, but not outstanding. The broccolini on the grain bowl was SO delicious, but the rest of the bowl was just okay. the "blue bowl" açaí bowl, same thing. Overall, good experience, overall young patrons, trendy vibes, however I feel there are better options in the area for the price and quality of food.

Amazing food! As a local I've been here a number of times, and loved it every time. The folded egg is so soft, and they bake the bread fresh. Highly recommend getting the pulled pork as a side! Acai bowls are amazing too.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Really delicious and excellent presentation of the food too. The seating outdoors does get a bit hot, and it can get busy on the weekends. I arrived before noon and waited ~20-mins for a table. Reasonable prices, will be back again!

It was so nice walking into an ac'd establishment when it is 96 degrees in NYC heat. The hostess was nice and all our food came out quickly. I ordered the kimchi scrambled eggs which was lacking in kimchi but still delicious none the less. I paid extra for mushrooms and though they were tasty I feel like it didn't bring much to the dish. I would definitely come back though and I definitely have an eye on their coffee.
Still my favorite breakfast in the city. I go every time I'm back for a visit. Friendly staff, cute space. Great location.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Cozy cafe with great breakfast bites. Menu consists mostly of toasts which you can also order as build your own. They also have some bowls and gluten free options. Ordered the build your own toast with scrambled eggs and side bacon plus avocado. Eggs were cooked perfectly and everything was fresh. They also make a mean cappuccino. Speedy service as well.
No comment
No comment

Ate here on a very cold Sunday. We arrived before they opened because we weren't sure what the wait would be like.  They invited us in before they opened and let us sit which was very kind.  Our waitress was friendly, helpful and attentive.  We ordered the acai bowl, banana bread and harissa eggs in addition to two drip coffees.  Food was good, but portions were small, so just be aware of that when ordering.  The drip coffees were just ok.  Decent breakfast spot with great service and no wait.  Would eat here again.
No comment

This is such a cute cafe ! They have amazing food, great service and a nice atmosphere. The restaurant was cute and clean including the restroom. I ordered the Avacado Toast 2 ($15) and the Hot Matcha Latte with Oat Milk and Honey ($5.50). The Avacado Toast was delicious and the Matcha was perfect. I will definitely be back.
No comment
No comment

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: I visited this location on a whim looking for somewhere to have breakfast and I loved it! It was easy to get on the waitlist and accurate wait times but I think there should be a sign indicating that on the outside (only says "wait to be seated", not "come inside to sign up for waitlist"). Loved the ambiance and decor as well as the friendly staff. The food was delicious and exactly as described. Overall would recommend for a good breakfast/brunch spot.
No comment

Came here for brunch after seeing posts of the kimchi scrambled eggs and the blue bowl. The kimchi scrambled eggs were amazing along with the rest of the food. We also ordered lattes which were nicely done. The entire plating was just so colorful and neat, truly a perfect photo. It does get crowded during brunch time but it's worth the wait.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Got the nduja braised beans and kale salad for brunch. Portion is a bit small but my husband and I have big appetite . Both dishes were very delicious. The beans had a nice balanced sauce and the sourdough bread had a nice crunchy and soft bite. Also got a side la labeh which was fresh and went well with the sourdough bread. The kale salad was refreshing and juicy.
No comment
No comment
This place is great. Go prepared to wait, though. I went solo and it was just the perfect experience for brunch.

Service was really friendly. I did a takeout order of the blue bowl on the phone. It took like 10-15 min. Price was expensive for what it was. I really did enjoy the blue bowl. I liked the granola that they used and it was certainly pretty because of the blue color. The place is tiny but had outdoor seating.
No comment
No comment
The scrambled egg was the best thing on their menu. The egg was soft and flavorful. But a little bit oily so if you are dieting this might not be perfect brunch
That's a great cafe. It's my first time here and it's a positive experience. I ordered the Avocado Toast. Very tasty and beautiful. I love beautiful food. I give it 5 stars and recommend this place!
So worth the wait for table! Expect abt a 30 min wait for table if yoh go on Saturday 11-1 ish

This is one of the top brunch place that is not on a high pricing side. The restaurant is on a smaller side, so it will be hard to come if you have a group of more than 4. The food, drinks, service were all great. I personally really enjoyed their banana bread with butter (I think the restaurant makes its own butter - sweet and salty that makes it perfect with the bread). I recommend to check it out if you are in lower east side.
I really love the açaí bowl here  very refreshing. Didn't have to wait long. Prices are reasonable.
No comment

Great cute spot. Service was good and the food was delicious. Def recommend the kimchi scramble the flavor of kimchi is not over powering and the egg was so good along with the sour dough underneath. Filled me up & the cold brew with oat milk was good. Seating is limited as the place isn't very big inside. You can sit at the bar top or front window if going solo

Had brunch at this cafe and left very satisfied. The short rib sandwich was generously filled, and I thought the aioli was yummy! Would return- my friend got broccolini farro bowl and I would probably try that next time because it looked so good.
No comment

I came to Good Thanks Cafe without a reservation on a Saturday and was luckily able to snag a table. I had their blue bowl, half of the banana bread, and tried just a little of their kimchi scramble but I felt surprisingly full after. I really enjoyed the food and thought that everything was on point. The blue bowl was super refreshing and I can't wait to return to try other items on their menu next time.
No comment
No comment
No comment
They said dog is allowed on Yelp, but actually they don't even allow service dog to sit inside. The stuffs are rude. Just be careful if you want to bring your dog.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I've drank and made a lot of lattes before. The matcha we were served was smaller then the tap water glasses they gave us. It made me feel ripped off and because it was in a glass, the latte got very cold immediately. We sat by the door and it was also quite windy all the time. Personally, didn't love my experience here. The food was delicious though. We did have to get more food after. I got the mushroom bowl and my friends got the sprilina blue bowl and the chickpea curry. I recommend all the items, they're light and tasty and taste very bright and fresh - but wish there were some more protein here.
No comment

The short ribs with eggs was not the same as previously. It did not have sauce and was like boiled meat. It was not as tender as it used to be. I would not order again. The smoked salmon with eggs was still fabulous.
No comment

Came here for brunch on a Sunday. There was a bit of a line around 12 but we got seated almost right away. The tables are very close together though and I recommend only coming in groups of 2 or 4 as the place is pretty small. We ordered coffee, the banana bread, and the blue bowl. The banana bread came in two large pieces and the honey butter with salt was addicting!! I recommend it. The blue bowl was gorgeous but I'm not a fan of coconut so wish I asked for it without. But the fruit was all fresh (the blueberries were massive and all sweet) and the overall taste was good! Def instagram worthy.
No comment
Such a welcoming and friendly cafe that we happened upon! Very sweet service, super good food and perfect ambiance for a cold morning. We can't wait to go back!
No comment

I've been wanting to try Good Thanks Cafe for so long, but the line was too long every time I went. I was so happy I waited in line because the food was amazing. My friend and I tried the Kimchi Scramble and added smoked salmon. The egg was super soft and the kimchi goes so well with it! 100% recommend

My 2nd favorite brunch place here in NYC! I found the egg and avocado toast to be very unique and tasty. How they make their egg so fluffy and light is beyond me but I enjoyed it greatly. Their house made juice of the day was refreshing and I legitimately felt cleansed for the day from it. Great brunch place to stop by and I appreciate the good vibes it comes along with!
No comment
No comment

This is THE best brunch place I have ever been. The food here is so fresh and flavorful with large enough portions to justify the price. I decided to get the chickpea curry and so glad I did because it is one of the most delicious brunch items on their menu! It is also filling and tasty. Highly recommend coming here for brunch or breakfast!

Kimchi scramble with avocado was the absolute best breakfast I've ever had. EVER. So unique and tasty. Not to mention, the atmosphere is so quaint and enjoyable. If I lived in NYC, I'd be a regular at this place.

Such an amazing spot for brunch! Would highly recommend checking it out- it was covid safe outside and we went in the early morning when it wasn't too crowded. The food was delicious. The latte art was so adorable and in itself made the trip worth it. Each of us really enjoyed our meals and finished with the delicious banana bread. The staff is so friendly and delightful to talk to! Would definitely recommend for a delicious brunch place - we will be back!

This spot is really special- the ambience is great, it's super cozy and clean, plus they have great music. The coffee and food is amazing. Very high quality unique dishes with great flavor pairings. Would highly recommend!
Loved the kimchi eggs here! So unique and good! Would def recommend. Also everything they bring out is so pretty.
No comment
Unique breakfast choices- great food - fresh clean flavors. Friendly waitstaff. They have both indoor and outdoor seating.

During my trip to NY I decided to grab breakfast with friends here and it was by far one of my favorite meals on my trip. I ordered the build-your-own egg dish and added avocado and tomatoes. Everything was extremely fresh and yummy. Their lattes were phenomenal as well. I will definitely be back.
No comment
No comment
No comment

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: The food was good. Hands off the Cold brew. It was horrible. Very weird taste. Service wasn't asking why I didn't drink my coffee.
No comment
No comment

I've had their acai bowls and toast and it's well worth the trip! It makes my morning so much better. The place doesn't have that many tables inside, but I got to sit outside. My friend loved this place too when I recommended it to her :)
No comment

My girlfriend and I came here for lunch and it was AWESOME. There was no wait for 2 when we arrived. We both ordered the same thing. And it was just so good. The avocado was creamy and well seasoned. The sourdough is a great choice to hold up! The scrambled eggs are great! And so beautiful. Please come. You won't regret it. Also great lemonades!
No comment

Love this little cafe on Orchard! I popped in for a quick lunch alone on my work break and had the best lunch and service. I sat indoors, and it was very spaced apart and safe per CDC guidelines. I got there right around noon but it wasn't very busy as it was a Wednesday. Started off with an oat matcha latte (a little pricey) and had the green fritters to eat. The perfect portion! I got the banana bread to go, it was absolutely delish. Looking forward to many more lunch breaks spent here during my WFH...
Lucky find!! Great little place. Had the breakfast sandwich and banana bread they were excellent!
No comment
No comment
No comment
Didn't wait to get seated at all. The food was great and plated beautifully. Not too expensive. Would definitely go again!
No comment
No comment
Good Thanks has always been my brunch go to. A lovely, laid back Aussie spot with incredible coffee and the best scrambled eggs in town.
No comment
No comment

Listen... the acai bowl was impeccable I was sad I ate it fast but it was so good I also got the vanilla latte ice coffee its also available warm I loved how cute the location is it's small but it gives it a very comforting home vibe

I love this cafe! Each time the food is amazing and the staff are super friendly. The space may be small and mean a wait, but it is totally worth it. Also, their smoothie bowls are the best I've had in NYC; so creamy and with great toppings. When friends are in town I always bring them there. A must if you're in the area!
No comment
Sooo good. The breakfast bowl was delish, we didn't have to wait long, and our French server was charming.
Stopped here for a quick breakfast before going to 9/11 museum.  Food was amazing!  Shared a breakfast sandwich & banana bread with my daughter.  Best banana bread I've ever eaten! Highly recommend!!

The food was good, but definitely not 5 star worthy. My avocado toast was hard to eat since there were large avocado chunks and the bread was also really hard. The coffee was okay too, but the experience just wasn't that memorable.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I love Good Thanks so so very much. I love it so much I'm even picky about who I bring to it, I don't want to share it with people who aren't worthy! I love getting the blue bowl and the scrambled egg on toast with avocado (like the basic bz that I am). The eggs are so fluffy and yummy and the bowl is like a breakfast ice cream sundae (not that it's super sweet or anything). I've also had the kimchi scramble and the white fish toast, both of which are delicious and spot on. Service is friendly and quick, wait times are never too long either.

So good and loved the whole experience. I ordered the avocado toast with eggs, the mushroom toast and the blue bowl and shared them. They were so delicious and I would definitely go back. The seating for covid was nice and there were regular tables or high tops, and the service was really good. Looking forward to going back there.
Such a chill spot to grab brunch. Service was excellent and the blue bowl was delicious! I will definitely be back here

Visited Good Thanks twice pre-covid and I was generally impressed by this cute little cafe in the LES. I've tried the blue bowl and avocado toasts, and it's up to par with most other brunch spots in the city. The blue bowl definitely won me over with its aesthetic and fresh taste. Would recommend visiting if you're ever in the neighborhood!

this place was awesome and everything i tried there was amazing from their açaí bowl (my favorite) to the kimchi scrambled eggs. The drinks were also so so good. This is a place that i would def go back to, esp since the atmosphere was so inviting. Loved it. Also, their service was on point .
I love this place. It's my new favorite oat milk latte. Every one is so welcoming and the food is off the charts delicious, fresh and healthy. Which makes me want to go in every day! In gratitude!!

Food is on point. Creative and yummy, with beautiful presentation. Definitely a solid brunch spot, and super healthy too. The space is a bit cramped but it's in LES so that's typical. Recommended for a casual yet delicious brunch.

Popped in for a quick bite and got the kimchi eggs plate. It's a tiny cafe so be prepared to feel smushed, but that's not uncommon for cafes in this area. The dish was pretty yummy - the eggs in particular had a great texture and flavor. It also comes with a salad, avocado and huge slab of sourdough bread so ended up being a very filling plate. Came on a Monday morning and didn't have to wait for a table too!

What a lovely cafe. The service was amazing and their recommendations were spot on. They had claimed that Australian coffee was the best out there and I was not disappointed. Their poached eggs were perfect. The banana bread is a must it was the best banana I have ever had. I cannot wait to come visit again!
No comment

Perfect spot for a healthy and filling breakfast/brunch! Cauli Rice Bowl was extremely delicious - for an omnivore like myself, the mushroom and halloumi were great meat substitutes. Miso-buttered mushroom especially made the dish so tasty. Not only the taste, but the presentation was also excellent A+++, going well beyond a cafe standard. Kudos to the chef. Servers were very friendly and attentive. Outside seating was nicely arranged - accent blue chairs and tables shaded by umbrellas. Definitely coming again - next up is Kimchi Scramble which has stirred my curiosity on the menu. I like the subtle Asian taste mixed in some of their dishes.

What really turned me off about this place was the service. We waited 15 minutes for someone to acknowledge us and ended up having to hail someone down ourselves. Once we got our food, no one checked up on us or refilled our waters. A group sat down next to us and they were friends with one of the waiters. He got them free food and free drinks while ignoring us. Once we were done with our food, obviously no one came up to us. I saw two waiters working together, taking their sweet time to set up a single table. I finally got the attention of one of the waiters and asked for the check. A couple minutes go by and I see him chatting in the front. I call another waiter who eventually brings out the check. As my boyfriend is paying, the waiter is staring straight at the card reader to make sure that he tips well. We ended up tipping 20% even though they deserved nothing because my boyfriend felt the waiter breathing down his neck. It was so uncomfortable. I rarely ever write reviews, but this place was such a disappointment.
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place is very cute and quaint! Went on a Saturday around 1 and was sat right away. The outdoor seating is plentiful with a little seating on the inside.  I had the Green cakes which were pretty good but the highlight was the Banana bread. I think our waitress forgot to put our bread in because we were done with our meals when it came. That being said IT WAS WORTH THE WAIT. Soooo moist and served with this butter spread YUMMMY
Amazing food, service, and ambiance. Had spread out seating for covid which was nice. Tiki spritz was delicious
No comment
No comment
No comment

There are variety of choices for small/ medium/ large plates, you could order depending on your appetite or you could order several dishes to share. I would highly recommend the avocado toast with scrambled eggs, which comes with bread, bacon and some veggies. Another dish you should really try is the blue bowl, we thought it was something like yogurt at first but actually it tasted more than it! It filled with coconut milk and really tasty companied with fruits.

This is by far the best place I have eaten recently in nyc. They serve açaí bowls, avocado toast, lattes, and basically anything healthy. The avocado toast is worth the price and it's not even expensive compared to other places. They actually give you avocado slices versus avocado schear which I hate when places do that. Service was also superb and the staff is great!

Yummy! Came in for an açaí bowl which was amazing. Beautifully put together, healthy and delicious. Home made gluten free granola. So good. The other dishes coming out looked equally delicious and the staff was so super friendly especially Julian. Very cute set up inside as well. Cant rate this place enough.
No comment
No comment

Great and friendly service. I got the breakfast sandwich and a flat white. The food was tasty and enough for getting me ready for a long morning walk through the city. Definitely recommend this place!
Love this place, especially blue bowl and kimchi eggs. Good cold brew and nicest barista dude at the counter!
The food and service are always great here! This is one of my favorite cafes. Friendly service and the food arrived promptly.
No comment

First time here and I love the food. I got the blue bowl and it was actually pretty filling for me! My friend got the Thai salad and she loved it as well. The best thing was the banana bread! I've never tried a banana bread this good before! Definitely a must get. Matcha lemonade was pretty good too. Love Good Thanks Cafe!
Bright food, great service, healthy and fresh. Had the blue bowl and the whitefish toast. Whitefish is pure smoked whitefish no mayo mixed in. Great coffee too
No comment

column3: Central Business District, New Orleans, LA
column6: Loved this place. Cute cafe. They don't take reservations but I was able to walk in on a Saturday and eat indoors. Great service and food
No comment
No comment

The açai bowl was delicious! The scrambled eggs with avocado and greens was incredible! The toasted bread was extremely burnt and hard, but the rest of the dish was lovely. I'd highly suggest it! The service was okay and the interior of the restaurant was lovely. It's a small cafe and it gets crowded very quickly.
No comment

Food was good but the service at the end of our meal was disappointing. The waitress added herself a 7 dollar tip from my card and my friend's card without our permission and tried to pull it off as "the system accidentally doing it when my friend asked her why the totals were different. I have worked previously in food business and retail and that is a lie. We were both going to give her a 20 percent tip but she lost that by lying and trying to steal. When we were leaving, it seemed she started talking about us to her co-worker right in front of our faces. Super rude. Most likely will not be coming here again.
No comment
Always have a great experience at Good Thanks NYC! The food and service is excellent. If I lived in LES I'd be in here all the time!

My fiancé and I have lived across the street from Good Thanks for almost 2 years and we go all the time. WE LOVE IT!!! We have tried a lot of different things on the menu and all are amazing. The staff is super friendly and welcoming. I love the toast with jam. The jam is unreal!!!! The eggs are good too and so is the smoked salmon. My fiancé loves the Vegemite on the toast too. Also love the banana smoothie - YUM!

I'll start with a positive, my açaí bowl tasted fine but it was so small maybe 1 cup of açaí and the fruit on top consisted of 1 very small strawberry, 5 blueberries & 2 slices of kiwi. For $14 it was pretty ridiculous. The staff was so busy talking amongst theirselves that I had to get my own refill of hot water for my tea and after I took 1 sweetener they took it away so I had to go to their bus station to get another one. Very odd and very disappointing.
The people that work here are SO nice!!! Great food and coffee, plus they have outdoor seating with heaters. Really enjoyed my experience here.
Small portion. Food came out not very warm. Staff rude. Won't come back. My friend who went said the same.

This is my favorite breakfast spot in nyc. It's honesty perfect for take out or to grab a low key and incredible brunch with a friend. Their breakfast sandwich and Avo toast are some of my go tos! Their scrambled eggs are soft and out of this world. Their new line of coffee also makes them a great spot for a quick pick me up too!

I had scene this place on Instagram but ended up stumbling upon it when I couldn't get into another brunch place down the street. I'm happy we were able to eat here. The food is not only beautiful but delicious. I have never had softer and tastier scrambled eggs. The sourdough toast is thick and crunchy on the outside, yet soft on the inside. Great little spot to try some delicious eggs.
No comment
This restaurant had great hospitality and welcoming vibes. The staff were the kindest and engaging as well. The food complimented the entire experience. I would go back!
Ordered macadamia milk cappuccino and chickpea curry with scrambled eggs - so good. Vibe was laid back and friendly. Server in head to toe pink was very kind. Would def come back!
No comment

Great atmosphere, and the food was delicious. I had the mushroom toast, with a side of smoked salmon. As a big mushroom fan, this dish greatly satisfied me. The bread had a great crunch to it and the mushrooms were cooked perfectly.  Would absolutely recommend this place for brunch/lunch.

Dishes are overpriced and the food is mediocre. But what really bothered me was when I ordered, the server sat down in an empty chair next to me to take down the order. He did that to every table and it was very unprofessional.

This spot is super cute! Our group ordered the Blue Bowl, Kimchi scramble, Avocado toast, smoothie, and matcha lattes... everything was great! Personal favorite was the kimchi scramble - eggs were cooked to perfection!

Having worked in the restaurant business for more than a decade, I must admit this is my first yelp review. I must also mention that I've made mistakes during that time and given poor service to people for a myriad of reasons, but never have I done to anyone what just happened to me at this cafe: I was ignored. My girlfriend and I sat there for 20 minutes while the server did everything else under the sun, there weren't many people there so this had to be calculated. I will go to my grave without understanding why this just happened. When we got up to leave nothing was said, only a smug smirk from the waiter. I look forward to spending my money elsewhere.
No comment

Fantastic breakfast spot especially if eggs are your jam! Not sure how they make the scrambles but they are the fluffiest we've had anywhere, and they're also a feast for the eyes. We had the breakfast roll and a scramble with toast and avocado. The tomato jam in the breakfast roll gave it an extra punch. We also liked the house made hot sauce on both dishes. We were too full to order anything else but we're eyeing the blue bowl for next time.
Avocado toast and Acai bowl were deliciously fresh and filling for a healthy breakfast. Wish I lived in the area so I could have them more often!
No comment
No comment
No comment

The food is absolutely fabulous. It is presented beautifully. We were going to go to the place next door, but due to the wait there, we ended up at Good Thanks. Such a delightful mistake. So much so that we came down again all the way from East Harlem to come back once more before the end of our trip. This is a must visit.
This place is amazing! The interior, atmosphere, staff and the food, of course. Everything is on point. Definitely gonna come back when visiting New York City.
No comment
I thought the food was really good and the people were really nice. The place was very cute and small. Would for sure go back.
This place was delicious!!! Fast, efficient and great service. The mushroom toast was my favorite item. Will definitely be back next time I'm in the city.

Besides this little cafe being tiny....it's amazing. When I lived in the Les, I would come here all the time and just sit by my self In the morning and people watch. Get the blue bowl!!!! And their cold brew is pretty damn great too.

It was good! I got the avocado toast with scramble on top and tomatoes on the side. Highly recommend. It was just filling enough! Had a hint of lemony zest. It said it was topped with micro greens but I only had a few leaves on mine. Other than that it was good! I would go back. Eggs were delicious
No comment
No comment

We had brunch at Good Thanks Cafe today. The food was natural and fresh. We ordered blue bowl and kimchi scrambled eggs, and both are so good! They also have great coffee too. Came at 10am on a Saturday and waited for 15 minutes for a two-person table. Overall nice experience!

Scrambled eggs on sourdough toast has never been so spectacular thanks to Good Thanks! The space is small, but friendly and bright. I want to say how pleased I am to see something to beautiful happen with just simple eggs and bread. The chefs here really have their egg games strong. I added pickled chili's (+$3) to add some extra kick to my brunch. Worth the wait and can't wait to go back again.
No comment

Love this Australian cafe!! Overall, had a really great experience when I came here one morning for breakfast. I had a difficult time choosing between the many toasts or bowls, but in the end opted for the blue bowl. I was tempted to order it based on its beautiful blue coloring and was very pleased. It was very filling and the toppings paired well with the base. The bowl is $12, which I thought was very reasonable compared to other places. The place was fairly busy for a mid Monday morning, but the service was still very fast and excellent.
Great Restaurant to have breakfast and coffee, awesome service first-time in NYC I really recommend this place. The street it's calm with traffic.

Their food is just wow... The only thing that sucks about this place is the wait for tables but it's so worth it! Every single bite I took out of my meal had my tastebuds going wild. Very tasty, rich in flavor sooo delicious!!! They also had such a nice and friendly staff. This is my new go-to place for breakfast.

Small little spot but so charming. The people here are friendly and I really enjoyed their healthier options. I had scrambled eggs with toast and avocado. The eggs were the best I've ever had; hands down. You're probably thinking, "What's the big deal, it's just eggs", but these were fluffy and buttery. The bread was really nice and all the stuff included was fresh. I will return when I visit again.
The food was good but found a strand of hair and an eyelash and the waiter did not take responsibility and instead blamed it on us.
No comment
the kimchi scramble and the matcha latte are amazing!! great staff, great atmosphere & great music.
No comment

I was really excited to try that spot since it is really close to work. Good value for the money as well. Perhaps the best coffee drinks I've ever had. I will certainly keep coming back. I was blown away.

The breakfast was amazing and the service was even better. Our server Sasha was so friendly and even took pictures for us. We celebrated our 1yr wedding anniversary at the 1 Hotel and had breakfast here. The owner Will even greeted us and had such a friendly chat. We'll be back for sure!!

If you come across this gem, look no further this is a great spot to grab some brunch or even just a coffee on your way to work. The food is amazing! Everything is super fresh and tasty! Not your average brekkie ;)

SUCH A GOOD SPOT, I don't know how they make the eggs but it's some witchcraft magic that changes the egg game. Needless to say, get the eggs with some crispy toast and creamy avocado. The lattes are great (I mean of course they are, the Aussies know their lattes) and the atmosphere is so cozy and cute! Go here to catch up with a friend or just go to eat these eggs by yourself in egg heaven. WOW EGGS!
Amazing bowl. Great atmosphere and great acoustics for NYC. Staff was really nice and relaxed.  Would definitely eat my breakfast here again.

Luckily my mother and I parked right in front of Good Thanks NYC. We quickly checked Yelp to look at some food photos and were sold. I had a hard time deciding on just one thing to try on the menu, but I went with the Good Mornin' Bowl + Feta. Delicious, light, and actually was enough for me to save some for a second round later on. My mom loved her Breakfast Roll.. and she's picky. Our waiter was so friendly and got very excited that we also wanted to try the banana bread for "dessert." We immediately knew we made the right choice. That banana bread was probably one of the best ones I've ever tasted, and I wouldn't just say that. It also had a nice light dash of salt that I loved + a cappuccino. My mother and I walked out with smiles on our faces and not even overly stuffed. It was perfect.
No comment

Top 5 scrambled eggs ever. I got mine on sourdough then ate the bread separately with butter and an amazingly smooth strawberry jelly. They have a nice assortment of  caffeinated beverages. Light and perfectly warmed pain au chocolate. Feels like a neighborhood place, awesome service. It was good, thanks.
No comment
No comment
Beautiful and healthy! I love this place and want to come back soon and try everything. So many unique acai bowls and an affordable and healthy breakfast / brunch place!
No comment
GREAT avocado toast with scrambled egg - hearty enough for the hungry.  Coffee on point as well.  If you're still hungry, get the Blue Bowl for a refreshing finisher.

The bowls were quite pricey but they were delicious. I got the blue bowl and it tasted like berries, somewhat sour and sweet. I forgot what my friend got but service was really nice. Especially since we're teenagers, they didn't ignore us. Many other places would belittle us because of our age, we got seated right away, thankfully!

their scrambled eggs are delicious & the kimchi combination is so unique and goooood! the hot chocolate foam just completely melted my heart the place is a bit crowded but it's clean, service is good & temperature is controlled (so it's not 'warm' coming in from outside). Overall, very positive experience!

Theee best Cappuccino I've had in a while, creamy deliciousness. First sip and I was smiling like a fool for the remainder of my meal. Absolutely amazing and friendly staff, extremely well coordinated and efficient. I sat at the bar which was fantastic view of the Barista making his mouth watering concoctions of caffeine. My first time visit this location and will now be my regular place when I'm in the area. I truly recommend their GOOD MORNING BOWL. It's phenomenal, expertly poached egg on a bed of mixed greens, avocado, cherry tomatoes quinoa and binding this perfection with a pear vinaigrette. Absolute Perfection

Been wantin to come here for some time now cos their food on IG looks so so good! Finally came here on a Sunday morning, didnt wait too long for a table for 2, around 11ish am. This is a small and cozy spot, think small tables, some chairs w no backing, some coat hanger racks are available at the entrance. My gf and i had to sit ontop of our jackets cos we didnt have a backing to our chair and coat hanger was stacked. We each ordered a latte, brunch dish, and shared a loaf bread (came in 2 pcs). Gf had the kimchi scrambled eggs w avocados, i had the scrambled eggs w avocado and prosciutto. The avocados were not really ripe, they were on the harder side, but overall dishes were good! Fluffiest scrambled eggs i've ever seen. And SUPER filling! We really enjoyed the banana loaf bread, with buttercream! So moist and paired well w the buttercream! Our lattes were good too! I had the vanilla latte w oat milk! Service was friendly and prices were reasonable. Definitely a cute brunch spot.
Awesome food, would recommend blue bowl & vietnamese chicken salad. Nice chill jazz tunes for a lazy Sunday lunch
Came here for brunch with my friend and it was really good! I ordered the kimchi scrambled eggs and he got fruits and yogurt. Service was quick and friendly. Would come back!

Food was okay. standard brunch food but service was honestly awful. No one took our order for 20 minutes and my friend had to go up to a server for them to take our order. Took another 40 minutes for them to make our food- which would be understandable if it was busy but it wasn't.....once again we had to flag down a server to ask and they told us "they didn't know why it took so long".  They only gave us one sharp knife bc they told us they didn't have any clean ones???? And it was also an ordeal trying to get our check....Servers were standoffish and unapologetic about the poor service. Hope they were just having an off day but the service left a bad taste. wouldn't recommend to any of my friends
Obsessed with this cute cafe! Great addition to LES. Healthy and delicious food options. Friendly staff and cute atmosphere.
Food was bangin and creative; 100% as good as it looks but still surprising- coffee was also better than you'd expect when you're trying out a cafe for the first time.
Great Aussie vibe. coffee is very good as well. Kimchi eggs are phenomenal!

Had to stop by here because I see everyone posting about this new Austrian Cafe in the city. The place is pretty small so all the seats are jammed together. I didn't like how the seats are so close to each other because it made really hard to get in and out. On the other hand the food was pretty good. I got the blue bowl and I really enjoyed it.

Delicious Aussie style cafe with friendly servers. The food portion was reasonable and the price was not crazy. Reservations were not taken but for a party of 2, you can expect a wait of less than 30 min. The blue bowl on our visit was not blue but it was still delicious and healthy-ish. Good morning bowl was satisfactory so long as you ask the dressing on the side. I highly recommend a visit to this cafe when you are in the area.

Good Thanks is an assuming hole-in-the-wall place with excellent everything; from service, to coffee, to food. It's easy to miss. They are next to Russ & Daughter Cafe. You're not missing anything if you skip the R&D wait and eat here.
No comment

Solid place. Definitely a bit over-hyped (and not exactly worth the hour wait) but I'd go back on a weekday- probably with a friend from out of town if they wanted the trendy-but-not-too-trendy NYC brunch. The food is tasty, simple and feels healthy. But if you like quantity and big portions then you may leave a bit hungry. The coffee drinks are also pretty good too. All-in-all, it not your go-to brunch spot but the food is yummy and certainly aesthetically pleasing!
Love this spot! The blue bowl is delicious, and the eggs are the best I've ever had. Long waits on weekends (~1 hour) but worth the wait!

Best eggs I've had in my LIFE. Such amazing customer service and food. Be sure to get there early during the weekend since it can get PACKED, and the wait is not fun. The banana nut bread is AMAZING, the server recommended it and it was delicious. I ordered the avocado toast with the egg on top. Delicious!
Incredible high protein foods without overwhelming health nut prices. It boasts a nice natural light setting with very bright colorful decorations. It's a great place for Sunday brunch.

Stopped in for a quick cup of coffee.  Was a very cute shop vibe and looked like they had and array of food as well.  The coffee was delicious and it seemed to be a sustainable place with the types of cups and non-plastic items they were using.  I would love to come in and try the food sometime!  There isn't a ton of seating, all banquet style really - and you are sitting next to all the other groups.  This is ideally seated for a much smaller group, maybe just one or two people.
No comment
No comment

Wow what a cool find! Went to this great Café for breakfast. The staff was amazing, attentive and super friendly. The Café itself was simple and modestly decorated. They have soooo many gluten free options that I was stoked! I had the blue bowl and omg it was out of this world! Not many places know how to make the blue bowls (also called mermaid bowls). They had gluten free granola too and it was fantastic! They even had GF bread! Oh yeah! Great place to chat for a while or a cool place to simply go and work on your laptop. I highly recommend it!
Probably the most beautiful eggs I've ever had for brunch - avocado portion and bread slice was extremely generous and their lattes were super tasty too!

Firstly, food is fire. I've loved this place since they opened. Food holds really well as take-out/delivery. Some issues with their delivery notification system directly on the website, but they have A+ customer service and made sure I got my order hot. Kimchi scrambled eggs are amazing and espresso drinks are bomb. Order takeout and support Good Thanks so they're around at the end of this all!

Chose this place based on proximity near my hotel and customer reviews. My breakfast sandwich had egg, salmon, ayula and other stuff. On a bagel, a little too much bread, but very tasty. Service was good, coffee was excellent. Recommend this place although it has a very limited menu. Basically a coffee shop with some good stuff to eat.

For brunch, there are an overwhelming amount of options in the LES/East Village. Nestled right next to the Russ and Daughters cafe is the cutest little Australian spot. Here, I had one of the top 5 brunches of my life. The kimchi scrambled eggs were a dream. Perfectly fluffy, and sitting atop a crunchy sourdough slice with a side salad and a tasty spread on the side. I loved it so much that I looked up a recipe online for kimchi scrambled eggs. I couldn't quite get the fluff at home but I tried my darnedest. Guess I'll have to come back again :)
No comment
Great service. Amazing egg and toast. Cute little spot love the iced tea not a fan of the coconut matcha but the hibiscus lemonade is AMAZING. EGG WAS FLUFFY AND AVOCADO WAS MOIST. Beautiful!!!!
Most generous serving of avocado on the avocado toast ive ever had. The sourdough bread was great too.

I might pull up again to get the acai bowl, but I spent the largest sum of $$$ on avocado toast I've ever spent today and I'm definitely underwhelmed. Is $17 for plain mashed avocado on bread with a crack of pepper, a singular leaf, and a few eggs justifiable in NYC? Not sure. Have I had tastier, more creative, and equally ~grammable~ avocado toasts in NY for far less? Absolutely (peep Golden Diner's galangal toast, for one). It simply tasted blander than what I could put together in 5 min at home. The saving grace (and sole reason I believe this place deserves more than 1 star) is the scrambled egg, which I was genuinely intrigued by. I initially thought it would be a soft scrambled egg going off images, but I actually feel it's more similar to tamagoyaki in concept, the underside of the top layer being a coil of egg layers that get pretty thin. While intriguing, it wasn't tasty enough to justify the whole toast's cost. It's not like any of it tasted bad, but you really get the sense people only come because it looks rather than tastes nice, because if you can't make just as good avocado toast at home with your eyes closed, I really am not sure what to say.
No comment

A cute little Australian cafe with great food!!! I recommend ordering eggs on toast and adding avocado rather than the avocado on toast option as it works out cheaper. Açai bowls are great and the portions are large! Reasonably priced and great coffee too! A great place for a classic brunch.

it's such a cute little space with chill vibe/service and they're food is so yummy! perfect place to have breakfast /brunch with their coffee and their blue bowl is so good and definitely instaworthy.
Great food. Great coffee. Great service. Friendly staff. Had the tostadas - highly recommended. Music was slightly too loud but it's The LES so I guess that's neither here nor there.

The price is a little much. But other than that I think it's a great place to eat. Very healthy and adorable inside. I got the blue bowl and it was exactly what I needed on a hot day. It cooled me down and tasted great!

Such a cute little place with so much to do around it. The food was fresh and there was so many healthy options! It is super busy though so best to make a reservation or be ready to put your name in and walk around.

My favorite brunch spot as of late! Cute, cozy spot in the middle of LES where you are waited on by the friendly wait-staff straight from Australia, with their awesome accents and all. The food is picturesque and the quality and flavor matches its looks. Great place to brunch on a date or with a few close friends. I suggest the eggs with kimchi and/or the blue smoothie bowl.

Stopped in for breakfast on a Tuesday morning with a friend. The space is clean and bright and the service was fine. Food was also good but honestly nothing special and pretty expensive for what it is. There are some similar places within a few blocks so I'm not sure I'll be returning.

A great addition to the neighborhood! We've been for brunch twice now and along with their delicious coffee (which you can add cbd oil to!), the kimchi scrambled eggs and the bacon egg sandwich are standouts. They recently added pumpkin bread to the menu which was outstanding. Friendly service and tasty, fresh food. This is now one of our go to brunch spots.
Had brunch here and loved it. The places is super cute the food is delicious and affordable. The service was great and we didn't feel rushed at all. I will definitely come back!!

super nice staff and great quality food. high quality coffee & i loved the coconut matcha. kimchi eggs so good with avocado. highly suggest the zucchini  fritter--great sauce & such a good texture. talked to barista a lot about australia. banana bread SO good. loved it here.

Happened to come across this cute Australian cafe on our Sunday search for breakfast. Look no further! Best food- including perfect avocado toast with any of your favorite toppings. Portions are plentiful and food comes out fast! The gf banana bread with salted butter was to die for. Great coffee and really friendly service!!! It's a tiny little quaint place and they do such a good job. So glad we fell into this cafe and will 100% be back!! Every food item that came out of the kitchen looked scrumptious and picture perfect.

Killer good - especially for breakfast.  Fantastic espressos, great smoothies - especially the Stay Good.  Can't recommend the Good Mornin Bowl highly enough.  I ate it three times in four days recently.  I also tried the Acai bowls and loved them.  Best part is service though - very warm and friendly group that takes pride in fresh ingredients, great food preparation and wonderful service.  It seems like I'm not alone, I overheard another customer saying that the Good Mornin Bowl was the best she has had in her life.
Service was absolutely excellent. Food was delicious. They know how to do eggs right. Hidden gem!
Bougie as you would expect, but delicious none the less. Not sure how they get the eggs to taste or look like they do - must try. Cocktails are also yum, bit expensive, but yum.

Loved the banana bread, solid blue bowl, but a bit disappointed at the egg and toast.. just average continental breakfast type of toast with creative looking scrambled eggs. Definitely worth the visit, but I'll stick with the banana bread and blue bowl next time.
great brunch spot! came on sunday at 1pm, no wait with a great covid set-up! well separated tables & heat lamps. got the kimchi scrambled eggs, really enjoyed my meal.

Nice nice nice nice nice nice! My breakfast was yummeroo, toast, egg, avocado-simple but just right. Delicious banana bread and if I weren't so embarrassed I'd have asked for an extra cup of the burnt honey cream butter that's served on the side. The owners are adorable! Keep nice places with nice people open by patronizing their business.
Super delicious food, light-filled and comfy space, friendly and super proficient folks working there,
No comment
I love it - worked with my server to create a dish that meets my dietary restrictions with beautifully prepared poached eggs, bacon, tomatoes & avocado. Will definitely be back!

What a nice little place! I was kinda tired of the my usual breakfast choices in the neighborhood and this place came up on yelp so I stopped in and the menu is really nice, creative and healthy. And they even have many beverage picks, all with interesting combinations not just the usual juice coffe etc. Thanks Good Thanks for the nice effort and not just doing the same ole same ole.
i had a matcha latte with macadamia milk and scrambled eggs with avocado toast. pretty typical selection but it tasted very good and well made

The food here is so delicious! I mean mushroom toast has farmers market sized full flavor mushrooms. The eggs are so fluffy and perfect. The value is exceptional and the service is tops! Will def go back for more kimchi eggs, tasty Bloody Mary and avocado toast!

We were incredibly lucky to find this place on our first morning in New York, right around the corner from our hotel. We'd been headed to Russ and Daughters, but it was so full that we walked on and noticed Good Thanks NYC a couple of doors away.  It was crowded too, but our wait was very short.  We proceeded to have the most wonderful breakfast there -- so good that we came back for each of the next five days of our stay because it was difficult to imagine a better brunch place. The avocado toast is phenomenally good, as are the broccoli zucchini fritters and the gf banana bread...and the scrambled eggs are the most beautiful and tasty you will ever have had. The breads are perfect.  The coffees and chais are superb, and the whole vibe of the place is just right.  Will and his staff, mostly Australian, are a delight and service is terrific.  I'll put it this way:  the next time we go to NYC, we'll stay close enough to Good Thanks that we can have breakfast or brunch there every day.

Expected to go somewhere else, this was our second choice - and should have been our first! Didn't take a photo of the food (was too excited when it arrived!) but trust me, it was everything! Avocado toast may be cliche, but as the saying goes, if loving it is wrong, I don't want to be right! It was delicious, perfectly seasoned and the most perfectly poached egg ever. Doing something simple exceptionally well is much harder than doing something super complicated well. And they hit it out of the park! Don't miss out on this place - I will def be back!
No comment

Been to this lovely neighborhood joint several times. The food was deeeeelish and the service is always amazingly friendly. My all-time fave is the Bacon Egg Roll. Toss-up for second place between the Green Fritters and the Mushroom Toast. The Flat White is my go-to for a tasty caffeine fix.
No comment

I'm so glad I found this place. After my hotel forgot the coffee I had ordered to my room (first world problems) I stepped out to find good coffee and breakfast. There was a Starbucks on the corner but this place has no soul so I continued until I found Good Thanks. The coffee was delicious, the food original and tasty. Sitting at the counter I could see that the kitchen was super clean. The staff was friendly. The place has a soul!

Food was good, but the service we were given by the manager (a tall bearded guy with an Aussie accent) was absolutely shocking, and for this reason I wouldn't go back. The other younger guys were friendly enough.
No comment

Service was a bit slow. I got 2 poached eggs on sourdough bread. The eggs were t poached, they were pretty much hard boiled, which made the hard sourdough too difficult to eat. We ordered the banana bread, which they forgot to bring out. The banana bread was the best party about this pot. Meh! I had had better brunches in the city.
GOOD THANKS! The best Cafe on Orchard. Just recently opened but they already have a powerful menu and as always, great coffee! The staff is super nice too and accommodating

My friend and I ordered the blue acai bowl and the two scrambled eggs with toast and we loved it. The waiters were also friendly despite the busy atmosphere. The only downside is that we had to wait a bit but at the same time, we went there on a Saturday afternoon. Other than that, everything was great and I will definitely come back here again.

AMAZING, the best breakfast ive had in months, i had the avocado toast with cherry tomatoes and an orange juice, it was so tasty and fresh and not heavy at all - gorgeous way to start the morning! would 100% recommend
My favorite brunch place in all of NYC, and I have been to many. Delicious food, super friendly service, and a great vibe. Even bought a shirt just to rep :) Highly recommend!!!
Had the kimchi scramble - delicious. The coffee here is also stand out - so refreshing to have a proper flat white!

I was disappointed and honestly surprised in my disappointment. I had high expectations mainly because I'm Aussie and I believe that Australians do breakfast better than most. But good thanks was unwelcoming, overpriced and just plain average. The food was creative but not well executed like small cafes such as Dimes, L'Estudio and Ruby's. The service was slow, unapologetic and somewhat arrogant. Maybe that's because they wanted to show their friendliness to their younger peers rather than a family. I guess I've been too spoiled by the American services over the last few years. I hope this cafe succeed but I won't be going back again.

My wife and I walked and surprised with the ambience and decor, we were quickly greeted and promptly served water and menus, although there was only 4 other people there but I think 2 of them worked there. My wife ordered the avocado toast with a poached egg and I ordered the vegetarian baked beans with poached egg and an added poached egg (sorry 1 egg is not enough for me!). The wait for our food was not too long but again not much people in the place at the time. But it arrived hot and well presented, Avocados were fresh and tasted great and the egg was poached perfect and not soaked in or swimming in water on top of the avocados. My dish was served the beans and kale and onions with 2 poached eggs again perfectly poached and topped with fresh ground black pepper and micro greens. Everything tasted great although I did need to add a little salt as it was a little sweet for my taste but it was great. I look forward to our ext visit.

Good coffee, fast service, and I'll be dreaming of my breakfast bowl for weeks. My husband didn't enjoy his as much. His toast was too thick and over cooked. It is tight squeeze trying to get in and out of the tables for 2.

Had brunch here yesterday. So delicious! Everything I want from a good brunch experience. I had the kimchi eggs and one of their pear sage mimosas! Yum! Such a fun atmosphere with great music. Will definitely be going back! Thank you Good Thanks!

This is what brunch should be. The fruit bowl was beautiful. It was colorful and fresh. All of the fruits were perfectly ripe and mint on top was bursting with interesting flavors. The green patties were full of flavorful veggies. They were crispy without feeling heavy. The service was on point and the space was bright and airy with lovely details. We'll definitely be going back.
Incredibly friendly staff and delish food!  Bright, open airy.  Great vibe.
Had breakfast there this morning, better than expected!  Great B & E, coffee, friendly staff. Recommended.
So glad to have stumbled into this restaurant. Such great food, and a wonderful friendly staff. Would definitely recommend the tonics, and the good morning bowl
Great food and great service. Could recommend almost everything on the menu, clean, healthy but also delicious. Would always recommend and easily a safe spot to go to for guarenteed satisfaction.
Exceptional food and the best coffee I had in NYC. Not normally a review writer but this time I felt compelled!!!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

File the Tin Building under it's better to have something here then nothing and I think you get the picture.  I think I visited six or seven times before I purchased anything.  I looked at the flower bar, gorgeous!  $10 per stem :(  I looked at the candy store, yum... I wanted it all but even I know I cant have just candy for lunch.  I looked at the french market upstairs and though about buying some cookies I last had in Toulouse and looked at all of their tea.  I finally found the sandwich and salad counter and tried the Mozzarella Rapini sandwich for lunch.  The ingredients are good quality and there is a bit of a kick to the sandwich that I enjoy.  The portion size could be a little large for $13 including tax.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Loveeee this place and there's something for everyone here. Came with a few coworkers to grab coffee at T. Cafe and do work. There was strong wifi and plenty of outlets in the neighboring tables. There are so many great lunch options and I love the overall vibe. It's upscale, clean, fresh, and modern. Will definitely have to come back and pick up some market goodies next time.
No comment

When you feel like you don't want to be in NYC and the weather is immaculate, you need to be here. Nestled by the water, Tin Building was SO well done, sort of a Charlie and the Chocolate Factory for foodies. While I didn't get to try any of the restaurants there, I did have a bite of the soft serve which was really creamy and had that real chocolate taste to it.
stopped for dinner at the sushi and seafood spots. so delicious. service was great. interior was gorgeous and ambiance was great.
No comment

Don't feel like visiting Tin Building will always be a super expensive meal. I went for the casual egg sandwich at Double Egg Yolk and can say it's one of the best egg sandwiches I've ever had! Plus it helps that it's served in a cool market with a lot of other options for drinks, coffee, desserts, etc. Perfect for a Saturday breakfast!
No comment
No comment
No comment

We checked out the new Tin Building it was so delightful. There were everything from fresh meat to fish to cheeses, vegetables. There were many sections for dining downstairs and upstairs with different themes including a vegetarian section. There were dressed up characters walking around as well as a ballerina prancing about. Upstairs we had a flatbread with sausage made like a pizza for the kiddo. It was not cheap but very delicious and high quality. I loved shopping in the section of oil, vinegar, mustard etc. I got some for Christmas presents for friends. I bought a shitake agrodolce! Downstairs we decided to get seats at the seafood bar, we tried oysters, sashimi, etc  everything was of superb and fresh quality. Loved it. I had a Kyoto beer it was delish! Of course we checked the candy section and kiddo got some gummy candies that were very fruity!
No comment
