No comment
No comment

The Tin Building is one of the best additions to this neighborhood. Such an elegant and beautifully designed space. There is something for everyone here, whether you want to grocery shop, purchase souvenirs, casually dine or formally dine. They also have the most beautiful candy store filled with exotic chocolates and gummies. Definitely worth visiting if you're passing the area. It's worth mentioning that they have a public restroom on the 2nd floor.
No comment
No comment

Super expensive, but fun to walk around!  There are so many fun grocery items to look at, fresh produce, etc.  Beautiful desserts, many different restaurant options (sit down or somewhat fast food), mini flower shop, and beautiful decor.  The crepes by the escalator are quite good.
No comment

A gourmand's dream! This place is filled with a variety of culinary delights. The market contains a shop for fresh fish, fruits and vegetables, charcuterie, confectionery, patisserie, bread, desserts, and so on. Surrounding the shops are restaurants each with its own unique cuisine. I loved my visit and dining at one of the restaurants. I went on to shop and stopped a number of them. You can hop around,grab items from each one, and when you're finished you can checkout at any shop.
No comment
Amazing ambiance inside. I had lunch at the French place during restaurant week and the food was excellent.

Tin Building by Jean-Georges is the latest addition to the South Street Seaport and what a great addition it is. Part food hall, part gourmet shop, part bars, part quick eats and part restaurants. All extremely well done. Jean-Georges is very visible and is walking around, talking to patrons. A very enjoyable experience and worth the trip over the the Seaport.

A total foodie paradise. I could spend hours here. There are several restaurants and food counters, so if you come hungry, you're guaranteed to find a perfect spot. The ambiance is cool and bustling. There also an adorable candy shop, meat counters, and grocery. It's worth a stop or many!

Impressive transformation and addition to the South St Seaport scene.  A combination of sit down dining, prepared foods to takeaway as well as groceries.  Can be a little overwhelming and crowded and a little pricey but worth a visit to walk around and experience.

Just not worth the price. Beautiful and good to visit but not better than other places in the neighborhood. Smallest oysters as well as scallops with Uni in the city. The uni literally looked like an orange smear. The wasabi had more presence on the plate. Not worth the $$$$.
No comment

This place is fabulous! If you like the variety that places such as Eatly provide, then this is your new favorite spot. Bonus it's at south street seaport with beautiful scenery. Jean-Georges know how to create something incredible. It's an experience. From the moment you walk on, your jaw will drop. Two floors of top notch food, drinks, and shopping. There is a cuisine for everyone and desserts galore! Feel inspired, shop for some JG spices, cookbook and fresh foods. Go whip up a dish at home. Sit outside and enjoy the breeze of the east river. People watch with an espresso or custom salad. Head inside for upscale dining or relax with tacos and a craft beer. Endless options. Go hungry and explore!

The vibe is really nice and I love that there are good vegan options including an entire vegan restaurant on the second floor. I'm disappointed in the amount of single use waste produced by almost every transaction whether it's packaging or disposable cutlery and coffee cups. I tried to use my reusable coffee cup and was rather rudely refused. Eating my $10 cupcake (with tax and tip) with a dinky fork also felt disjointed. Sustainability is important to me and there's a lot of measures that can be implemented that will also save money. Just saying.
No comment
It was like a food art museum!! Just beautiful everywhere. So many good smells. Worth a visit. Come hungry

Randomly caught the grand opening of this new glamorous looking food hall. Tried the tacos place on the 2nd floor, taquitos, and the crispy gulf flounder tacos (2 per order) were out of the world. Perfectly fried and seasoned flounder, with pickled cabbage, roasted red pepper, and mint. Perfect combination. Also tried two breakfast sandwiches from Double Yolk (1st floor) a the naked plus cheddar and smoked bacon on a brioche bun, and the tomato and mozzarella with Calabrian chili vinaigrette with egg whites on an English muffin. Hash brown was shaped like a churro. Everything tasted really fresh and well made.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Attended during their Soft Launch on a Saturday - they really need to work on staffing the restaurants seem severely understaffed, I waited about 30 minutes for an order of Tacos at a grab & go kiosk, and 20 minutes for a crepe. Space is lovely with ample outdoor space. They will need to work on the space and seating once they fully open
No comment

The Tin Building did not disappoint! It is a perfect spot to hangout on a Lazy Sunday. I had one of the croissants from the bakery downstairs - AMAZING. I don't think I've ever had a croissant this buttery or flaky. Besides the amazing food and coffee, the atmosphere of the Tin Building -- both the decor inside and the seating outside -- is really fun. It is usually VERY busy on Sundays, so be prepared to fight some crowds, but it is worth it once you sit outside with coffee and croissant in hand! I wasn't able to try all the different food offered at the Tin Building, but there is an oyster bar, Chinese restaurant, candy store, and much more! It is a great place to walk around and discover all of the culinary treasures throughout the Tin Building.
The cookies were so decadent and filling, some of the best I have had, were brought home to me but I really want to go and experience the environment myslef.
Open and elegant food market with several quite good restaurants. Tacos on the second floor were delicious and fresh, plus good margaritas.

Amazing new market located in the heart of South Street Seaport. Tons of beautiful restaurants and market stalls - there's something here for everyone. Went here for lunch with my family and we all got something different; tacos, pizza, pasta, pastries...so yum. My favorite thing was the truffle pizza. It is on the pricier side but you get what you pay for.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Before I start, this is one of the rare moments where if I could double the stars to 10, I would. From the moment that you enter until when you leave because you have eaten all of the things. All. Of. The. Things. You are are in for a treat on multiple levels.  One is that the service is absolutely impeccable and hyper responsive to needs. The food is just as though you have stepped out of NYC and into Paris and I dare you to not understand that butter and creme are staples in any relationship.  But the topping on the cake and having Jean-George show you the speakeasy himself and be so warm, friendly, approachable, and knowledgeable about every single aspect of Tin Building.  It is a labor of love and yes, you are already in love with the visual feast and gastronomic leveling of your understanding of what love on a plate feels like.... oui. Just oui. And yes, take the spot at a bar of it is open. Why wait if you don't have to.

Be careful and double check your bill, they overcharged us an extra bottle of wine, hadn't we noticed we would've ended up paying more than one hundred dollars more, after speaking to the manager who didn't even apologize we left. Great food but be careful and check your bill to make sure it's correct. T. Brasserie I'm talking about.

The tin building is a culinary explosion of variety and tastes that are amazing. The building itself on the inside is spectacular from beautiful Butcher to seafood to specialty cheeses. The restaurants were packed we ate at two of them first was the sushi restaurant Shikku i'm at sashimi guy and everything was fantastic the service is impeccable my friend is a roll guy and said the two rolls the tuna and the yellowtail was incredible . The avocado seaweed was delicious even the dessert was amazing. Then we went upstairs to the Chinese speakeasy which is behind the Mercantile room spectacular decor comfortable seats impeccable service we had the black bass scallions and ginger absolutely spectacular the drinks were unique and delicious.  Jean  Georges and Howard Hughes has hit a home run the place was mobbed. This will now be a major destination for tourists from all over the world no doubt so get here quick before it's too late.
No comment

gorgeous addition to the nyc food scene. it's much more upscale than essex market or chelsea market, so this was more of a splurge than a casual trip. the tacos, guac, and frozen marg at Taquito was delicious

Ahh, Jean-Georges.  I've been a fan since the 90's, when my boyfriend at the time treated me to my first chef's tasting menu at Vong in Midtown for my birthday.  Of course, Vong is no more, and I married and divorced that same boyfriend, but you, Jean-Georges, have moved on to bigger things.  MUCH bigger things, like the Tin Building.  So you can imagine my surprise, while suffering the worst brain freeze of my life from eating one of your (too sweet) strawberry banana popsicles, to turn around and come face to face with you in the flesh after all these years!  Not like you noticed me - you were too busy giving a personal tour to two of the tallest, wealthiest looking people I have ever seen in my life.  But you looked good, were very animated, and I am guessing Tin Building will be a success, so good for you!  Now go talk to the people in the deli department and tell them to work on the seasoning of the Vietnamese Chicken Salad - it definitely needed salt, or fish sauce or something, even thought it did taste bright and fresh with herbs.  And if I am in the neighborhood again, I look forward to trying some of the full service restaurants.
Love this place. All food has been great so far - tacos - French dough - Ice cream bar. Phenomenal place - great to have in the neighborhood
I had the skate, the fish was overproduced and covered in batter so that it was hard to taste the actual fish. Strange sides. Was expecting a fresher approach.
No comment

Watch out for prices!   They are extremely misleading.  They'll only price out the cheapest stuff within a brand, and won't put a price tag on the more expensive items.   Then when you go up to pay, it ends up costing a lot more money!  This happened at Spoiled Parrot.

I guess they're still working out the kinks?? The building is beautiful inside and out, but it's basically chaos inside with very little organization. We went on a Sunday afternoon around 3 and it was super crowded. We couldn't get a seat at one of the restaurants which is why we opted for Double Yolk. The food wasn't bad but it was nothing to write home about. They also ran out of bacon and had to go fetch? make? more-- which would've been good to know before we ordered. Not a huge deal, but I dunno, I guess I kinda had certain expectations. Check it out if you're in the area, but don't go out of your way.

We tried the dosas, tacos and soft serve. Everything was fantastic. The dosa was pretty tasty and unique. The ingredients were fresh and delicious. Jean Gorges was there greeting customers. The food hall itself is opulent and filled with everything you might want to eat. Many gluten free, kid friendly and vegetarian options. I highly recommend this new venue.

Okay, live in neighborhood and have eaten at all the restaurants numerous times. the Brassiere is the best. Most amazing staff & food. The worst one was Frenchman's Dough! I'm Italian and the food is excellent. The most obnoxious thing was that they actually charge $3.00 for grated cheese for pasta of which you get 2 tablespoons in a little dish!!! Obnoxious & ridiculous, raise your prices Jean-George if you need to make more $$$$.

Okay, I was waiting for this to open and I did expect it to be on the pricer side, but who do they think is going to pay that much for groceries including the butcher and the fish market (not much to choose from anyway)? Since no one is buying it how long is it staying in the displays? Yeah, I'll head up to the Essex Market instead. The restaurants look nice hopefully they will adjust the prices since there is nothing at Pier 17 to eat for a reasonable price.
Beautiful place! We are at Frenchman's Dough and had 10/10 perfect meal. The almond cake is the best thing I've ever eaten. Shed a literal tear.

Gave it a try. Blasting music-awful mainstream rock- ruins the experience, bringing it down to K-Mart level. Why do so many eateries do this? I couldn't wait to get out of there. Like a trip to Abu-Graib.

Amazing! We've been following them as they renovated this building and waiting for it to open. We finally went today and it's great! Tons of restaurants, markets, counter service. I want to go back every day.

Well done Jean-George. This place is really beautiful and the staff is both professional and well presented (lots of good looking guys). The selection of products and food is just perfect . We went on the public opening day and there were a lot of strollers  and curious people including myself taking pictures all over . I can't wait to come back and taste everything also because I live nearby and I really like walking around my hood supporting my local businesses.
No comment

This is our second visits to the Tin Building. We went there before the official opening and loved it so much we went back again. We ended up buying the wonderful croissants and danish again and the Swedish rye bread ( which was offered at the Fulton). Then we sat down at the raw bar. The oysters were still as fresh as they were on our first visit. This time, I took a bite on the delicious scallop sashimi. I need to say that I was not a fan of scallop sashimi, but the way they prepare it changed my mind on scallop sashimi! That it was sweet and fresh is expected, but the yuzu and serano combination used to dress the scallop made it so different and memorable. But I have a problem at the Brasserie. I  need to recommend that the barista be more attentive to his job, and look not to serve the drag together with the wine! That is not acceptable. Yes, they compensated me with a fresh glass, but this should not have happened! Not at a JeanGeorges' restaurant!
Had lunch at bar upstairs with family and friends. Food and service was impressive considering the operation just opened.

Love the food and everything here but this is now the second time we've paid for an item and it hasn't ended up in our bag. There has got to be a better system with the people ringing us up. The first time I thought it was an honest mistake - there is no excuse for the second time. Figure it out guys!

A must visit spot in NYC. The tin building is a food market with so much variety between the candy store, coffee shop, food and flower stand there is something for everyone. We even saw Jean Georges himself walking around, which was such a great surprise to see. Along with this it has multiple sit down restaurants. We tried House of the Red Pearl and had the most delicious Asian inspired dishes. The fried rice and dumplings were some of our favorites. The service was exceptional and overall had a great ambiance. Great addition to the Seaport, would definitely go back!

Recent renovations make the Tin Building a must visit for tourists & townies alike.  The markets have excellent offerings at premium prices, although the fish were closer to reality.  I found the Mao style uniforms to be strangely out of place, but I assume that they represent someone's definition of cool chic

This place is amazing, but still has a few kinks to work out.  I wasn't actually be able to be seated in the French restaurant because they were booked solid and the hostess didn't seem to know how to convey that.  She said it would be an hour wait, which I would have been okay with, but it would not have been okay with the kitchen.  So she handed us menus and then a manager came over to tell us we couldn't be seated today.  It was just very awkward and the hostess should have had the sense to tell us we couldn't be seated today.  The market place is filled with beautiful imported vinegars, oils and more.  They also had some fruits and vegetables that I don't often see locally and the presentation, made it easier to pay the inflated prices.  Will definitely be going back.

I'm giving this place 5 stars!! I've been around the world and aye aye aye aye. It's the perfect mix of gourmet delish, eye candy and specialty treats. Expensive, yes, it's New York. But not like FOH you must have bumped your head expensive. It is truly an experience for all the senses. Do you love gourmand ingredients??!! I do and the Tin Building has so many. Butcher, legit! Oysters, legit!! Had some sushi rolls, nigiri and sake at Shikku. I found the restaurant very high concept and decent in execution. The seafood is exceedingly fresh, but some of the rolls were a chefs experimentation with flavors that didn't gel well. Sake selection (and I've been trained in Tokyo) was lovely and it's a great respite from the grocery and butcher. Definitely hit up the gourmet sauce/oils/kitchenware spots. Scored a gorge pair of chopsticks. Many beautifully curated and unique finds and expensive but not like WTF expensive prices. Will definitely go again to experience more bourgeois loveliness and the House of the Red Pearl.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Small spot robust flavors! My second time here in five days. Came alone on 1/8 then again with the bf  on 1/14. We were welcomed, they remembered me, that was very special. On 1/14 Saturday late dinner (9:30pm reservation), we ordered the prix fixe from the bar, everything on the menu. We were not disappointed. Starter was salad w miso dressing and an injera type roti bread; it was light and delicious. Then we had a fresh baked sour dough with fresh soft in house made sea salt butter (Amazing). For dinner we had the tile fish and beef shoulder, both delectable and full of flavor. Tried the wizard's comb cocktail and loved it. At dessert we shared the passion biscuit and chocolate situation. Both were wonderful. So for $65 prix fixe it's a deal. High quality, bright flavors and 5star service! (We ended with hot espressos, also great)
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Nice ambiance and service. The food was good but not enough to justify $165 price tag. We dine out every weekend and try to sample restaurants on "best" lists, so have a good reference point. If  you do pre-fix with no choice of substitute for this price, it has to be special. It was not. Scallop dish was good but I had a few gritty pieces. Meat had nice sauce and flavor, but a bit tough. We went to Nura last week and the dishes were more imaginative and tastier for more then 30 % less. I would give it solid 3.5 stars, because it doesn't meet expectations of what it should be.

Visited a friend in NY who raved about this restaurant and said we had to go while I was here to experience their 9 course meal. Ohhh and what an experience it wasThe ENTIRE staff is welcoming from the moment you enter the restaurant. Our server was amazing in helping me to choose my wine selections for the evening and the restaurant was able to accommodate my dietary restrictions within the menu for the evening. I love the collaborative approach of the staff in the serving each course. I loved everything with the exception of the desserts. I preferred one dessert more but neither were my favorites however that didn't take away from my overall experience. Each course built upon the next. Everything was exquisite. If you're in NY specifically Brooklyn and want a one of a kind dining experience, I highly recommend Oxalis.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place was great! We did the bar prefixe menu and it was $65 per person. The service was great and I loved their cocktails and that they had seasonal cocktails as well. Everything was so fresh and flavorful!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

First of all, we were welcome by warm hospitality. We ordered tasting menu for $125 ppl. Food is exceptionally creative, a beautiful combination of Eastern and Western elements. One of dish is tasted like fried Chinese turnip cake but with a twist of truffle that tickles your taste buds. Every course is definitely a surprise. Overall, the dining experience is enjoyable and worth every penny.
Sophisticated menu, service and venue worth Michelin's appreciation. Check for the fixed price menu in the veranda which offers nice fusion cuisine delicacies..

Went to get fine dining from this Michelin-Star-owned restaurant. We got the Carte Blanche platter, which was $70 each. The food was admittedly very delicious, many of the bites were amazing and the flavors burst in your mouth. The tuna with squid ink was good. However, I have one huge gripe with this restaurant, and it was that we were here from way too long, from evening to nighttime. This is because the dishes came out super slowly despite finishing our portions very fast. The ambiance of the restaurant was excellent though.
No comment

Oh boy this place is delicious!!! I'm so happy that I made the time to come here and try a lot of great food. Went to the back garden where they do their a la carte menu as opposed to the prix fixe within the main restaurant where you can see the kitchen. The service was impeccable as everyone was greeting me and all the staff was super friendly. We ended up eating with a chef of the restaurant as someone in our party knew her, so that was cool to get a glimpse into Oxalis' style and learn more about what we were eating. We ended up ordered... everything on the menu! My highlights were certainly the sourdough bread (which it seems like everyone and their mother is talking about); that butter was special!! But more than that, I loved the tomato spread with the rosemary lavender bread; I could have eaten that all up! I think the mushroom kebab (which just isn't a kebab at all) fell a bit flat, but still - all in all, this was a SPECIAL meal. The buttermilk dessert + the peach tart really rounded it all out. And my orange wine cocktail was delicious and served in the perfect glass. I know they have a more rotating menu here, so I'd love to come back sooner rather than later to try some great food. It came out to a bit less than $100/person, so considering it is a 1 Michelin-star place and we got everything on the menu, I think that's great; each dish isn't quite expensive so you can come in for a drink and some food and not break the budget. Enjoy!
No comment

No comment
No comment
Beautiful, delicate presentation. Food took our taste buds on a journey. Only offers tasting menu.
No comment
No comment

Very unassuming exterior. One of the best dining experiences we've had in a while. The service was amazing, the food was impeccable and unique but in the best way possible. We did their tasting menu on Saturday and left completely satisfied.
No comment

No comment
Delicious and able to accommodate vegetarian diets for the course meal. Always great to see Oxalis's take on the season's ingredients
No comment

They try hard and they succeed.  Most of the people there are very young, including the chef, and I very much am looking forward to seeing how they evolve and mature. They're really good right now and they're only going to get better, unless success and ambition makes them think there is something bigger and better than Prospect Heights waiting for them.
No comment
No comment

column3: South Kansas City, Kansas City, MO
column6: Had an outstanding meal at Oxalis. We opted for the carte blanche menu, which offered 9+ courses thoughtfully created by the chef.  Husband has the non alcoholic beverage pairing which he thoroughly enjoyed. I had the pineapple cocktail which was one of the tastiest cocktails I've had in awhile. Every course was delicious but we especially enjoyed the potato and seafood stew. I'm not sure how to describe it but to say it was savory and delicate and so rich in flavor. We also loved the flounder dish which was so fresh and both the cherry blossoms and green strawberry added so much to the dish. Staff was friendly and informative. Don't miss out on this excellent restaurant.

I visited Oxalis on a night when they had an event with Suntory Whiskey so there were some extra items on the menu. The food was delicious and drinks were amazing. My husband and I both had drinks from the special menu, and also tried the special dessert the cherry blossom roll. The rest was from their regular menu and we loved all of it, but the lamb collar was slightly underwhelming especially considering it's the most expensive item on the menu. Not as tender as one would expect for meet that has been cooked for 16h. I still give it a 5 star because, overall it was a 5 star experience!

There are some hits and misses with the carte blanche. Their sourdough was truly phonomenal - crispy on the outside, warm and soft on the inside (it's SO GOOD). Some of the food was simply way too salty for my liking. Flavors at oxalis tend to be bold, and sometimes not matching. One star off for the taste of some of the dishes. But their service is amazing! Their mocktail pairing was also super nice!
No comment

The menu here was surprisingly complex and insanely flavorful! I'd booked dinner here on a lark, not knowing what to expect, and was so glad I'd found Oxalis. Upgrade for the truffle supplement, you will not regret it!

Truly exceptional service. I've been to a number of "top" restaurants and the service here outshined it. Our waitress, Laurel, made the experience one of a kind. The food was also unique and tasty. We especially liked the golden beets and grilled tilefish. The chamomile dessert was also not to be missed. Thank you for a special evening

Outstanding service!  The danger of a prix fixe brunch menu that changes every few days is that you might show up to worse than an unknown quantity--but rather something you definitely don't like!  This was our problem.  The kitchen was good spirited about it: they were happy to prepare a few items ala carte, and between that and some sides we made out very well.  The potato rosti was filling, with a great pesto sauce, with a crispy outer layer, and not greasy.  The bacon was perfectly prepared.  The French 75 and Corpse Reviver cocktails were strong but had an excellent mixture of flavors.  When we first sat down I felt very self-conscious about the menu options, but we left very well fed and happy.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Oxalis features a la carte and tasting menu seatings, and we opted for the latter.  The experience was truly unique as dishes were composed of ingredients, sauces and technique I don't often see together.  One standout was the pumpkin tempura (perfectly fried) with miso sauce (which had a nice spicy kick!).  I also loved the hake with a lovely herbal sauce.  The restaurant is particularly proud of their sour dough starter and feature it in a handful of dishes too.  The bread with butter was phenomenal.  Fermented sauces and ingredients are also used throughout which ties the meal together in a thoughtful way.  The vibe at the restaurant is comfortable and welcoming.

Absolutely outstanding. I have been to Oxalis no fewer than three times for their tasting menu and they do not disappoint. Yes yes the sourdough is, in fact, out of this world but so are the thoughtful, ingredient-driven preparations of the other dishes. The technique and talent of the staff shines in each bright and flavorful bite. Oxalis is far and away my favorite restaurant in New York City right now, its inventive but plainly delicious food bolstered by an amazingly friendly and welcoming staff (a rarity in this city).
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The pre fixe menu here is well worth the $105 per person carte blanche.  There were 12 dishes.  Each one was beautiful to look at.  Some of the items could have been more tasty, such as the aged black bass..  Some dishes fell flat like the grape Ceylon cinnamon, buckwheat.  This might sound interesting and perhaps tasty, but it wasn't.  On the other hand some of the dishes were quite good like the bread and butter, the grilled chanterelles, grilled Berkshire pork, the fruits and caramels.  Service was quite good.  One receives a hardy welcome at the door and multiple goodbyes and hope you enjoyed everything upon the departure.  Also the sommelier was quite knowledgeable.  There is an bar and  outside area for their snack menu.
No comment

No comment
No comment

The preset brunch was simple and elegant.  If you appreciate fine food and first class service it's easy to see the time and dedication that is spent on ensuring guest satisfaction, comfort, and quality put forth in each dish.  When our food arrived, I couldn't help but savor and marvel at the presentation, taste, and texture of each dish.  As a cook it really inspired me to rethink certain ingredients and preparations within my own style of cooking.  This is a place that has an experienced staff and a desire to give you a great dining experience that you will remember.

Garden room is gorgeous. Constantly shifting menu that's always interesting. Drinks complement the menu very well. Typically a little too fancy for me (you will be provided an ASMR description of your food upon being served), but everyone who works there is very chill. A tight ship whose baked goods, drinks, and entrees manage to all be top notch.

Mom took me and the fiancé here to welcome her new son-in-law to the family. This place didn't disappoint at all. The outside of the shop wasn't very impressive but once you walk in, it definitely felt very warm and inviting. My mom unfortunately made a mix up and didn't notice she put herself on the waitlist instead of getting the confirmed reservation. The staff did their best and offered their a la carte menu to us along with some free champagne (Obi Wine Keno Blue - cute play on Star Wars). Luckily as we were considering whether we should stay or not (not saying their a la carte wasn't appealing but mom wanted the big welcome for the new son-in-law), the general manager, Adrienne. stepped in and informed us someone cancelled. We were very lucky. (They usually have a set amount of ingredients and courses set for reservations so if you don't have reservations, from what I was told, they don't squeeze people in.) Everything was exceptional from presentation to taste. Service was wonderful and if I could come back more often for date night I would. Later, we found out their head chef (and owner) were originally from the West Coast (West Coast is the best coast - makes perfect sense why the food was so bomb) and moved out to New York to start his business here. Compliments to the chef and thank you to the wait staff for the wonderful service they provided.
No comment
No comment

During Covid, this restaurant does temperature checks when you enter, tables are very spread apart, and they change the paper covers on the tables after every guest. We started off with stone fruit on ice, which was topped with coriander seeds. This was a great refreshing start to our meal there. We also got the sourdough bread with the most amazing softened butter ever! We even used it as a dip at one point haha. I then got the tomato tart which had a delicious dressing on top. The shishito peppers came with a "teriyaki" flavored sauce, which added a variety of flavors to the peppers. The cocktails here came in cans, which I liked because the restaurant is taking Covid precautions seriously. The vegetarian main entree portions were a bit small, but I still felt very satisfied afterwards! Definitely worth the Michelin rating.
No comment
No comment

I went to Brooklyn with my partner to see an exhibit at the Museum and came across Oxalis. I have to echo the same sentiment that the service was poor / hosts were rude and incompetent. F+ at best. I called ahead of time (5:09 pm) to confirm if walk-ins were available for the tasting menu--which I was told yes. After stopping by in person, my partner and I were told we would wait 25-30 minutes at most and would receive a call. An hour and a half later I called again to see where I was in the queue and was told I'm next in line (7:30 pm). So my partner and I walked to a nearby bar to get a drink and chat. At this point (8:15 pm), we made a quick reservation for a 9:00pm slot (under the belief we would get an option for the tasting menu like promised) and walked over at 8:45 pm and spoke to the hosts. My partner and I were surprised by the passive aggressiveness and catty comments from the staff, and were told if we canceled we would be charged. Despite what we were promised verbally when we initially called 3.5 hours ago! We decided to take our business elsewhere. For how "upscale" this establishment is portraying itself to be I am surprised by the rudeness and lack of empathy my partner and I experienced interacting with this business / staff.
No comment

Amazing experience. Laid back atmosphere, which was wonderful after a long day - cocktails were inventive and excellent. Sat at the bar for dinner and bartender Sarah was engaging, attentive and made excellent drinks. The menu at the bar was simple, yet elegant and delicious. A gem of a find. Will be back to try the tasting menu.

I love this new neighborhood spot! It is now a Michelin starred restaurant which I am not surprised about at all! They have a prefix tasting menu but they are very flexible with food allergy accommodations. I came when I was pregnant and there were several items on the menu that I could not eat. Our waiter communicated efficiently with the chef and was able to accommodate every one of my wishes. It is a pretty big spacious space inside. It is great for an intimate date or a night out with girls. I had brunch there and it was delicious as well. They have a big outdoor space that I can't wait to try in the summer. It is very close to Brooklyn Museum and Brooklyn Botanic Gardens so it would make for a nice day to visit them and get a meal.
Amazing! Courteous, knowledgeable, attentive staff. Gorgeous plates. Interesting cocktails. Reminds me a lot of Olmsted.
No comment
No comment

Yummy prix fix with thoughtful wine pairings. Most of the pairings landed, some didn't, but all were creative and I felt like I had learned a little more about wine at the end of the meal. All of the courses were delicious! The trout with bergamot was incredible. This will be a place where I bring my visiting friends/family.
No comment
Brilliant, inventive, thoughtful, intentional restaurant.  Just absolutely fabulous.  We all had the tasting menu.  Can't recommend it more highly.
Lovely meal: Maitake kebab" on roti, yellow rice with cream and chard, asparagus with trout roe and smoked butter. Chamomile tart for dessert. Yum.

Oxalis was good, but for the price of the menu I didn't feel like anything I had really blew me away or was memorable. I tried the a la carte items and they were all pretty good, I think the bread with butter was the standout here. I would be open to trying the pre fixe if I go back, as I believe that's what they're really known and rated for. I do remember the service was wonderful though!
No comment
No comment
No comment

We've come here twice already (once for pre fixe menu and another for the a la carte menu.) Both times the food has been amazing! Lots of fermented + cultured dishes and creative use of ingredients. The service is also always impeccable. Definitely order the sour dough bread and the kebab, you will not regret it.

This dinner was one of the absolute best of our lives! The food was spectacular - every bite was mind-blowing and memorable. What was perhaps more surprising, however, was the impeccable service. Every single person we interacted with made us feel so special. An incredible experience all around.
Great food and discovered this restaurant has one Michelin Star  - would love to visit again around December for different dishes

Amazing food, staff, and service! Every dish from the tasting menu was unique and well executed. My only complaint, which is more of personal taste, was that I found the food to be a tad salty. The highlights for me was the dessert! The orange creamsicle was beyond anything I've ever tried.
No comment

Why didn't I find you earlier!!! Perfection! Just go to this place...but if you need to know why keep reading. Went for dinner and sat in the back courtyard. This is the more casual Al la crate setting. Still a lovely setting. But let me start with the greeting. You walk in the door and the kitchen is right there. Open and inviting. Smells of the amazing good greet you. A cook says hello and asked for our name. Even though there are hosts it was a nice way to be welcomed. We are led to our table. Every member of the friendly staff saying hello. Now let's get down to the main event. The drinks and meal! Every dish was heaven. The sourdough (fresh and warm with fresh butter.) Jambon! Totally different then plain old ham or prosciutto. The tuna carpaccio. Wow. Balanced and light. Sweet potatoes (lovely and light.) Next was the trout. This was the star of the show! I could eat this dish every minute of every day. And the beef was fantastic too. Drinks were fantastic and the wine selection is solid too. I will be back for the indoor set menu soon!

We made reservations for a party of 10. Our prefix dinner was $70pp. The service was amazing. This restaurant is more American rather than French based on the food we had. If you're looking for French food this is not the place. I felt the quality of the food was very fresh and dishes were unique and creative. I love the open kitchen as you walk in. I would've preferred to see the regular menu however our meal started promptly when our party arrived. I didn't realize we had an option to try other items on their menu until we were done with our meal. This was not necessarily the restaurants fault but rather me not asking as I was content with the meal that was previously arranged by my party. I was curious as we left the restaurant what else we could've tried while we were there but did not get a chance to try. If you have a big appetite this prefix dinner would not have been enough to fill you up. This is definitely a quality over quantity type of place.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Amazing food and even better service! The entire staff is so friendly, welcoming and knowledgeable. The food is always delicious and unique. I've been here a few times and have always been blown away. It has a very chic but urban vibe, perfect for date nights, GNOs, bdays/anniversaries or just a Tuesday dinner. My husband and I both love it here and will be back soon for brunch (which we've heard great things about)!!

Been tryin to post this review since last week cuz this place is def worth goin to cuz they do everything right. the food aint that expensive and they have most of the things people would eat. we sat outside and it was cool cuz you sit like in a space that has walls but its outside. the people was nice too.  To keep it real with u i thought the place was oxtails cuz i like jamaican food, but instead its like fancy regular food. My girl had a tasteing menu and I ordered the regular type of food. This place is also very careful with the covid.
No comment
No comment

Went to Oxalis for my wife and my first anniversary. Unfortunately the restaurant did not have room for us to take on the carte blanche menu, which we really wanted, but the food was nonetheless outstanding. In particular we loved the mushrooms, snails and coffee dish. I will absolutely be returning for that tasting menu!

My husband and I got the tasting menu. It was very good overall, but to be honest, it wasn't as amazing as I had expected. But I appreciate how well they made each dish, and the uniqueness of the ingredients. My favorites were the smoke trout and fall squash. The fish was cooked perfectly, but the sauce was a bit too salty. I also enjoyed my glass of pinot blanc. Service was wonderful.
No comment

Dined here back in December and was blown away by everything. Ordered the carte Blanche with the wine pairing so that I wouldn't have to decide a thing and dish after dish fascinated my palate and left me energized to try and run home to recreate what I had tasted. The space is comfortable and non-stuffy. Will be back soon.
No comment

I went here on Sunday night for a nice dinner with my girlfriend for our anniversary and it was fantastic! The food, service, atmosphere, drinks, everything was so so good. I also loved how not only was amazing but the servers were so warm and friendly that I didn't feel like I was in a stuffy fine dining environment. They truly made it a wonderful experience!
No comment
Amazing food, sophisticated and attentive. We went there 4 times , every time we left with fulfillment feeling. Testing menu with wine paring made my birthday complete.
No comment

Highly recommended for an adult evening out, special date night, or an occasion to celebrate. You'll enjoy an excellent meal, carefully crafted and conceptualized, from start to finish. I'd also suggest, if you're a duo, that you request the table with front row seats of the kitchen and the chef at work. I thoroughly enjoyed the added bonus of a show and it was really neat to see the composition and plating of each dish making its way to us. Oxalis offers a prix fixe dinner service (offerings change nightly) with optional wine pairing at an additional cost. My spouse and I elected to go all in and we loved the complete experience of everything being expertly selected for us - what a fun and delicious treat! We also relished in being surprised with the menu offerings for the evening when we sat at our places (hidden but neatly placed under our napkin and bread plate). Don't be afraid to ask questions - the staff, even the chef, are very friendly and knowledgeable about the dishes, the creative ingredients as well as the wine pairings. I was also shocked by my favorite course of the evening; glancing at the menu I knew I was looking forward to the soft shell crab and while everything was excellent, I was absolutely blown away by the potato, ramp, and kombu spring stew. It was so unexpected for me, I loved every bite. Both flavor and texture variety were perfect. That said, be open to being pleasantly surprised. Oxalis will come through in an amazing way and provide a very memorable dining experience. The hubby and I will absolutely return, we're already set to try the separate bar menu in the back of the establishment.
Not worth the time or $$$! Local wanna be, over salted food, super slow service, ton of bugs

If I could give this amazing restaurant 10 stars, I would. Chef Nico and his staff are top notch. We had a party of 4, expecting great things and they exceeded expectations in a very big way! The meal was truly the best I've ever had. Each of the 11 dishes were works of art, with flavors that were out of this world. The Kampachi, the first course was so savory, like nothing I've ever tasted. Literally, each bite, I closed my eyes to experience the incredible blend of flavors. We had two more appetizers that were equally fantastic. We also did the wine pairing which had perfect choices for all the courses. I added caviar to the fluke, which was outstanding. The beef with walnut miso, and black garlic melted in my mouth with the greatest flavors. Three different desserts put this evening over the top. Chef Nico and the phenomenal staff made us feel so welcome. Chef Nico, you truly love what you do and it shows in your creative food ideas, presentations and phenomenal food. This Michelin star restaurant is a real gem. Bravo, Nico and we will return! Thank you all!
This place is incredible--the food was outstanding and the service was the cherry on top. Definitely coming back. Vibes 10/10 and elite cocktails
No comment
No comment

Oxalis is one of the best places in town . Very good selection of cocktails and wines . Food is seasonal and delicious I would recommend the kebab but also the carte Blanche . Awesome  place love it !!!

Came after few days of their re-opening.  Obnoxious temp checking. Outside seating with zero ambience in some parking lot. No tasting menu and the a la carte one was extremely limited, not a single meat entree and  by 8 pm they ran out of the only non-carb non-veggie offering- fish. Then they right away ran out of bread and tarts... i am being kind giving them 3 stars. If you're not ready then don't hastily re-open. We had to go eat somewhere else afterwards. Hopefully they are able to get back to the previous standards.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Had been wanting to try this place for dinner but had an opportunity to check it out as a brunch option while in the neighborhood as part of pre-museum plans. There are other places nearby that offer brunch but I had already been to them and wanted to try some place new. Reading other reviews highlighting the "elevated" brunch experience, i thought to try it out. So yes, it is pricey for brunch but the pre fix brunch menu is unique - not your run of the mill brunch dishes but still "brunch-like" enough...and definitely filling and delicious. If you love has browns or anything potato - Do yourself a favor and order the potatoes as an add on if they aren't part of your pre fix - even if you don't live has browns, this dish may convert you. The staff also is amazing. This restaurant is all about quality service and making the diner feel like all attention is on them (in a good way), so friendly, pleasant and cordial. It is all perfection. Will definitely be coming back for dinner.

This place is amazing! Best butter/bread combo I ever had. Every dish was made well. Considering I'm a picky eater, I gobbled down everything on the menu. I can't find one thing to complain about other than why isn't this place more popular!? Would totally come back to eat here :)
No comment
No comment

SO GRATEFUL not only to have the opportunity to eat this incredible food again but for this establishment's respect for the health and safety of their patrons and staff. My friend and I ordered four dishes and split them and were perfectly full. It was hot out and the food hit the spot- light, fresh and delicious!! The canned cocktails were fantastic, I had the Rose one and one with sparkling wine which were incredible and paired perfectly with the food we ordered. The staff was impressively diligent with following safety procedures as well as spacing the tables well beyond 6 ft which made me feel completely safe dining here, so much so that I would feel comfortable taking my high-risk parents here for dinner.
No comment
Great restaurant. Food was delicious and service was spectacular. Make sure to get both desserts in the bar area.

One of my favorite restaurants in the city. Creative, delicious, and consistently well executed. They pay attention to all the details, which elevates even simple things to be really memorable (for example, sounds silly, but the bread and butter is SO good). Service is friendly and attentive, and it is clear that the staff is proud of the food, but it never gets stuffy or pretentious. Plus it is a reasonable price for a tasting menu (and they have an a la carte option if that isn't your thing). If you haven't tried it yet, you're missing out. We are very lucky to have this place in Brooklyn.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Oxalis you are simply terrific, I had a wonderful experience here today. Gets a little too crowded, but has good ambience and service. The service was also excellent and everyone was kind. Every thing was fresh, flavorful, and very yummy. I can not praise Oxalis enough.
This place deserves much more than 1 Michelin star. The service, atmosphere, food, all beyond expectations. One of New York's best for sure, couldn't recommend more

Went here last night with my dad to celebrate my birthday and we couldn't have had a better time! We did the carte blanche menu and everything was incredible. Everyone was so friendly and helpful which made the experience even more enjoyable! We both felt like this is one of the best meals we've ever gotten. Very impressed. I loved all the detail they put into the restaurant - the back area has a bar and is decorated beautifully.  I've been obsessed with the oxalis plant for a while now so this was especially exciting. Can't wait to come back. Thank you!
No comment

Amazing restaurant!!  Warm welcoming staff, clean sophisticated space with unbelievably creative and delicious food.  Mother's Day menu- Fantastic and tasty from Quiche through bitter greens salad to dessert and it was ALL VEGETARIAN!!

They added in 2 other dishes in our printed tasting menu for truly one of the best dinners I've had.  HIGHLY recommend. The food was absolutely incredible, the wine pairings were diverse and spot-on and the service was stellar.  Added bonus, customized birthday menu and a bubbly toast start-off (we were stuck in traffic and arrived 30 min late). Favorite dish was either the skate wing or a rich vanilla bean ice cream with a frozen iced pea shoot topping, although all four of us agreed every dish was terrific.
Great brunch experience! Truffle omelette add-on is highly recommended! Friendly staff, professional service. I'd love to be back to try their dinner menu.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Update; their box this weekend was also delicious as hell. The sausage was to die for and the grits and waffle were good too. Great value for the cost
This French restaurant Going to blow your mind . Food and service over the top. Must try mushroom in broth dish , OMG . And now when they got  Liquor license Add  this place on Bucket list !#oxalis #

Really impressive meal and service. The very first bite blew us away and I thought to myself "they've set a really high bar here" and much to our delight, they sustained it throughout the meal. So much so that we are already planning when we can return

Seven of us ate at Oxalis last night. We shared the caulilini, little gem salad, asparagus, heirloom beans in fish broth, mushroom tart, wild rice fricassee, rainbow trout, cream puffs and gateau basque, plus an amazing potato pancake amuse bouche  with black caviar. It may have been the best meal I have ever eaten. Every dish was cooked to perfection and served with grace and finesse. Also impressive was the wine selection that included a delicious, inexpensive white. The only dish that was less than stellar was the gateau, which was a little cold and dense, albeit tasty. All of us were blown away by this outstanding dinner.

WOW - just wow.  It's been a long time since we have been blown away by a meal the way we were at Oxalis.  They somehow manage to present beautiful and DELICIOUS (next level) food without any level of pretension.  This is a very special meal and I would highly recommend it.  Incredible!
Oxalis is a TREASURE. The food has no business being this good at this price. I think about their tuna at least once a day. Service is exceptional. Also the most Covid-compliant set up out there.

Came here to celebrate my partners birthday, had a magical evening. Food, service, and ambience well all 10/10. Don't say that lightly, Having spent my share of time at Per Se, Blue Hill, French Laundry, Le Bernardin, Daniel... rivals all without feeling stuffy or forced. Every dish had something new, unique and special to it. Even the Swiss Chard course was mind blowing. The habanero sauce under our fluke might be the most delicate hot sauce I've ever tasted. Water glasses never hit the halfway mark. One of the owners checked in on us several times throughout the night, when he wasn't carrying dishes, pouring wine, or folding napkins. Beyond the compulsory candle on the dessert, a note was hand-written, a large dollop of caviar was added to a dish, owners and waiters alike poured extra glasses and checked in often to ensure we were having a good celebration. It had the air of a place where people love what they are doing, and are excited to share it with others. Can't more highly recommend.
No comment
Excellent. Great food, reasonably priced and the service is second to none. Wine was great, and the food was definitely top class. This place is a hidden gem. Hopefully it survives for a long time.

Absolutely exceptional meal.  Sat outside here this past weekend - although it was cold, we cozied up near the heat lamp and devoured a truly superlative meal.  We felt very lucky that they are staying open and willing to serve us in times like this.  Service was lovely too.  I will be a regular at this spot.  Highly recommend.

Doesn't look like much from the outside but once you're inside, this little Brooklyn fighter packs a punch. You are met by a charming brigade of cooks shouting "wi chef" with attentiveness to each order at the pass. The hostess, equally charming but with less ferocity welcomes you with care and ushers you to your seat with charm. The service is impeccable, with each dish and wine pairing coming at precisely the right moment. You feel the passion that earned this restaurant a Michelin Star right from when you walk through those doors up until you're out of them. The attention to detail was felt and my only complaint about the food was I wish there was more! Well done!

First couple of times we went when they did not have a liquor license. They also did not let you BYOB, which was super weird. The food and service were both good. We went again recently, and while the experience was much enhanced by a solid drink menu, the food quality has gone downhill. Some of the dishes were OK. A couple, like a rubbery seafood dish, were not.
Very interesting food! Very tasteful! Good crowd. ! Good atmosphere !something unique! Recommended to try!

Came here for a quick brunch before heading to the museum. The set brunch menu was balanced and good by itself but the merguez sausages that our waiter recommended we add on were definitely the highlight for me. The staff here were very attentive and professional. Our waiter was able to pick up on the fact that we were running late to our exhibition and put in an extra effort to get our dessert and check to us in a timely manner. I definitely want to come back here to try their dinner menu at some point.
Long due review. We went there in a group of 4 people. I didn't leave hungry but I was not impressed. The food qualities didn't justify the price tag. They over-seasoned almost all dishes.

I loved my experience at Oxalis. They are taking COVID seriously, taking temperatures, social distancing and not compromising on the food or experience. The best dining out experience I've had since March!

This is one of the most pretentious and childish menus I've ever seen.  Ridiculous food at exorbitant prices. Exactly the reason why the urban American food scene is so decadent, overpriced and deplorable. Experiments with food for ignorant rich kids. I would not eat at this place if you paid me, and I live in San Francisco

After reading rave reviews about the tasting menu, we booked a reservation through Resy, that explicitly said it was dining room seating. When we got there, we were seated in a back room and were told we couldn't order the tasting menu there. They weren't able to accommodate us in the dining room, so we left and went elsewhere. It was pretty disappointing, considering we had driven an hour for our reservation there.

Meh, not impressed. Had dinner here recently and while I understand tasting menus are not usually meant to fill, for the price we paid for what is billed as a "4-6 course meal", I left quite hungry and disappointed. While I wouldn't say anything necessarily tasted bad (besides the espresso we ordered at the end which was completely undrinkable), I'd say most every dish had at least something wrong i.e. duck not cooked well, entire dish being just one (wet) texture, etc. I do just want to point out that the "snack" course which, to be frank, was basically a singular tater tot sliced into 4 pieces with a dot of mayo on top (serves 2!) was totally unacceptable. Maybe I'm being a bit nitpick-y but in a tasting menu restaurant that additionally is only doing a handful of courses (also charging $100+ pp once you factor in tax+tip+drinks), they should all be perfect or close to it.
No comment
Its a new restaurant for the neighberhood and I've already gone twice.  The food was superb and the service even better.

We had a wonderful dining experience at Oxalis last night. We opted for the carte blanche ($70) and beverage pairing ($40). All of the dishes we had were good, with a few being outstanding. I was impressed with the attention to detail, thoughtfulness, and innovation with which the chef approached each dish. Service was very attentive, and the atmosphere was both warm and casually elegant. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a great meal with impeccable service.

My husband and I ate here on February 15th, and we are still talking about the food four days later. We opted for the $60 six-course carte blanche menu and were blown away by the delicious and unique flavor combinations. We felt like we were getting all of the service and quality of a Michelin star restaurant without any of the stuffiness or pretension. This is an incredible addition to the neighborhood, and I know we will be coming back soon. Make your reservation now before it becomes impossible to get one.

One of the best meals I've had in Brooklyn in a while. The eclectic wine list was great, the service was gracious, the vibe is modern and understated, the music is fun and the food is beautiful, inventive and well executed. Thanks for a fun night.

We came in for some drinks and maybe an app or two in the back room. What a delight! The cocktails were interesting, maybe a bit quirky, but each one a delicious surprise. After a few different appetizers we were so intrigued by the food that we asked for a table and stayed for dinner. What a beautiful experience.  The food was subtle, balanced and well conceived. I'll say it again, what a delightful experience. My one caveat is that because the flavor profiles are so subtle you might miss out on the beauty of the dishes if you don't slow down a focus on the food, but if you do.... What a treat.
No comment

In the 5 years I've lived in New York, probably the best meal I've had. If you like surprises, not having to choose anything about the meal is fun, and the wine pairing was the perfect complement to each dish.
This is the best fine dining in the neighborhood. Bright, airy, not too expensive. It's just so great; fresh and seasonal food, creative plating. I'm so glad it's there for special occasions.
No comment

I would like to review the food at this restaurant but I have been unable thus far to actually eat there. Reservations are as of now not hard to get, but they've canceled me twice. They promised to accommodate me in the future, but it's getting frustrating. I will amend this review to include the food if I ever get to eat it.

I dined at Oxalis shortly after the NY Times review. My Gf was finishing up a sales meeting nearby and she suggested that we try Oxalis. We rarely make reservation's, but we arrived early enough to be seated. The space is very attractive, and it has a very nice vibe. The nabe is full of ues transplants, and on this particular evening it appeared that every one of them had invited their parents to dinner. I thought that I was in La Goulue for a minute. The food is good not great. The wines by the glass were terrible, but the staff were all polite, and very gracious. I guess that they need some time to age and I hope to try Oxalis again in the future.

A superb restaurant with wonderful service and a unique menu featuring inspired use of unusual herbs. It's the perfect place for a romantic dinner for two or a night of fine dining and drinking with old friends. Memorable things: the beautiful greenhouse-like dining area in the back of the restaurant, the herb-infused cocktails, the extraordinarily delicious food, the fact that we could get a table immediately, the prompt and friendly service. Frankly, I'm surprised this place isn't completely overrun by reservations weeks in advance; the food is on par with that of the ever-booked Olmsted around the corner, and in several ways more interesting.

We went for New Years and had an incredible experience. The food was amazing - especially the beef tartar and the poached oysters and the dessert - and the service was superb. The space was beautiful. A world class restaurant in Brooklyn!

First date night away from the baby for the husband's birthday and it was everything. We were treated like royalty just because I let them know we were celebrating- the service was tremendous and one of the owners is right there alongside the staff talking to all the guests. We reserved the dining area where it's tasting menu only- every course was so unique and delicious. As an added bonus, they throw in a couple things not listed. We can't wait to get back and check out the bar room which looked beautiful. Great addition to the neighborhood food scene!

Holiday spirit indeed.  I got food poisoning over thanksgiving and had to cancel my reservation, did so in advance but was told there was a $60 fee.  I explained the situation and this was not a last minute cancellation but no budging.  Would have been nice to get a heads up when I canceled.  Was really looking forward to dining here but a restaurant with no budging/heart is not one I want to support.
No comment

Absolutely best dining experience I have had in a long time. Every dish was amazing and my friends and I could not stop talking about it afterwards. For this price point, you have to go. I will definitely be back and bring many people with me. We talked to the chef afterwards and he was so kind and really cannot wait to see the growth of this fabulous restaurant.

My mother and I stumbled into this gem after visiting the Brooklyn Museum. The prix fixe menu is a bargain for $70. This restaurant would be at home in Manhattan for twice the price. The staff were wonderful and the service was among the best I've experienced in a long time. Every course was a small masterpiece. We loved it and would go back!

Such a great place. Whether you come for the amazing tasting menu which is truly delicious  or to just sit outside and enjoy a cocktail in the garden, Chef Nico, Steve and the amazing staff make this  an unbelievable experience! This place just flows from the moment you are seated to saying goodbye, everything just works beautifully!

Excellent, excellent restaurant. From the attentive and warm staff to the extremely delicious dishes.  We had the tasting menu and for desert we were surprised with candles for our anniversary.  Really loved the delicacy and unique flavors of all the different dishes. It's really rare to find an affordable tasting menu, especially in Brooklyn. I really hope this pop up becomes permanent!

So sorry not to be able to be positive- we were so looking forward to this place. We've been living in Brooklyn for 12 years now. We love good food. One of us grew up in Paris and we love to spend a good buck on dinner - when it's worth it. We got a tiny sized "flatbread " (bad pizza) for $17. The other dishes were fine but still not worth it. Made us feel like gentrification makes us all chumps - a little cabbage with a drizzle of vinegar can be $14 because hey, rent is high. Sadly would not return here again. (On a side note- very nice decor; Service was perfectly good; the wine was fine if overpriced.) Did not stay for dessert.

This place is already packed but it's bound to completely blow up soon. The service, the food, the drinks, the presentation - and the reasonable price for all of these things - everything blew us away. It's truly a gem in the neighborhood. We sat in the bar room and ordered one of each dish, which was perfectly shareable between the 4 of us. The farro and beef in particular were our favorites and the citrus cocktail was so delicious. We will definitely be coming back to try more drinks and the tasting menu.
Really great food with delicious balanced flavours. The waiting staff were really attentive. Highly recommended.
No comment

Definitely worth a second visit. Their menu prix fixe menu is very high end and worth the $60. They pay great attention to detail and the meal tantalizes your taste buds.The staff is very nice and accommodating. Awesome!!

So excited to have another food destination on the Crown/Prospect Heights border! As soon as we stepped inside, we started to understand why Eater had named Oxalis one of the top restaurants in Brooklyn 2019. Gabriel and his staff were charmingly polite and warm. We ordered a la carte: started with flatbread with duck offal (deliciously rich and appropriate for a wintry night) and chicory salad with carmelized anchovy (creamily addictive dressing, even if we were expecting pieces of anchovies); then enjoyed the cabbage with egg yolk (wish I could get the recipe) and grilled beef with horseradish (tender, fresh and filling).   The coffee chocolate cream cheese was heavenly. One of the best meals we've had in a long time. One of Brooklyn's finest in innovative cooking without any fussiness or pretentiousness.

Remarkable experience! Staff amazing.Food incredible! So much fun. HIGHLY recommend! Ok, so Yelp wants me to make my already highly complimentary review longer to actually post it. So I will because, while i hate to type on my phone, I like this restaurant so much. I hope this works.

If there was an extra star on yelp, I'd give it. First persons to great us, the Chefs! The food was so good I was texting my (industry sommelier friends) all night long. It's that good. I could have went face first into that mushroom pot-au-feu. Get there before the reviews as it surly will blow up. They don't have a liquor license yet, but send you a recc from their favorite bar. Reserve and go! $60 bucks for a 5 course tasting, in Manhattan $300 easy.

What a phenomenal experience. I went with my wife for our 1 year anniversary, and the staff treated us like celebrities. The beverage pairing is a must, and the cocktails at the bar were extremely unique and delicious. The food was absolutely excellent, our favorite was the beef shoulder that was cooked for 16 hours and coated with a crunchy herb rub. Highly recommend!
No comment
The Thanksgiving fixed menu was a bit pricey but worth it, the service was excellent and friendly.

Way overpriced for a fine brunch. With so many delicious, well-priced brunch options in the 'hood, we were disappointing here (though staff was all lovely). From past reviews, sounds like dinner is the way to go at Oxalis.

The food was exceptional, the service was impeccable and I highly recommend going for the pre-fixe dinner.  We had both non-alcoholic and normal drink pairing and both were unique and delicious. The duck breast was probably the best I've had.

GO! As simple as that. But in the interest of elaborating: probably the most creative, imaginative and unique combinations of food and tastes; wonderful, smiley staff, great cocktails, and totally reasonable. I think this place should be on most people's lists, and hope it is around for a long time.

Service is super attentive, the food is great, (first course needs a little work, the carrots aren't functional with the toothpick), the n/a beverage tasting is insane. Every one that they give, they gave 4 drinks, went absolutely perfectly with the dish. Kinda wished the sesame cookie was given before dessert because it's really strong and lingers for a long time in your mouth. But seriously, don't sleep on this place. It's going to do great things.

Oxalis was a superb experience from the moment I walked in. Friendly staff (from the open kitchen chefs to host and bartender), pleasant & relaxing ambiance, and delicious food throughout the whole tasting menu. Highly recommend this spot for those that are open to unexpected tasting menus and unique beverage pairings, all for a reasonable price. I definitely plan on bringing more friends here, you don't want to miss this experience!

Best dinner date/restaurant for a special occasion in Brooklyn by a landslide. When we have friends visiting and we are trying to show them the best spots in town, Oxalis ranks at the very top. If you're not a big drinker, they have an *excellent* non-alcoholic drink pairing with the tasting menu. Makes dinner much more accessible when you're with a group of drinkers and non-drinkers. Couldn't recommend Oxalis highly enough.
No comment

Creative menu with lots of unexpected flavors. The tasting menu is a gastronomic feast topped only by the quirky and delicious wines. Excellent staff who really love what they do and enhance the experience with their knowledge and story telling. Truly a gem of a restaurant.

Great vibe and great service. I went here post proposal and my soon to be wife loved it!  HIGHLY RECOMMEND 'NON-ALCOHOLIC' pairing with the meal! In-house sodas were actually better than wine pairing... sounds crazy but one must try to understand what i am saying! So worth it

Behind the frosted glass facade at 791 Washington Ave is Oxalis, where wonderful things are being made and served. This restaurant works perfectly for the part of Brooklyn it's in, which you kind of feel before you even open the door. The quality of the dishes the Oxalis team serve will astound you and are worth every dollar. They do rotating tasting menus, but also offer food and drink off an ala carte menu in the back half of the restaurant. You can tell that Nico and Co. know what they are doing, and also, most importantly, that they care. Being able to watch the chefs and cooks working so diligently in the open kitchen is quite humbling, but also inspiring. I think we could all learn a thing or two about delicious, fresh, new ways of approaching food and it'll be fun to see it happen here. Aspiring chefs, foodies, and regular people of all walks of life, in and out of Brooklyn, should give Oxalis a try. Maybe you'll learn something new, see something great, or just enjoy a nicely prepped and prepared meal, served to you by their nice staff. The last time I ate there, I tired the pig trotter and it was my favorite. I also had a dessert made with cream cheese ice cream, which brought out my inner fat kid, for sure. I'm going backwards now, but the brioche bread was amazeballs. I am really excited for Oxalis in 2019 and can't wait to see what is on the way!
Best restaurant in Brooklyn.  Not to be missed. Beautiful spot, delicious food, lovely and knowledgable staff.  Seriously, go.

I have been to some of the best restaurants in NYC (Eleven Madison Park, Per Se, Le Bernadin, Aska ...) but I was blown away by the inventiveness and quality of the food at Oxalis.  So delicious course after course it is hard to even pick the best.  The creamy farro with snails was unforgettably mouthwateringly creamy and verdant and unique.  The beef tongue was perfectly salty, crispy, crunchy and meaty all at the same time. And the goat cheese dessert was a wonderful end to a memorable meal that I will definitely want to repeat.

We just went to this place for a special anniversary, and we absolutely loved it. Upon making a reservation and noting my dietary restrictions, the manager wrote an email to confirm that they would be preparing a special menu. When we arrived, there was a beautiful table set with a personalized note wishing us a happy anniversary. They poured us delicious bubbles to celebrate (twice!), and the food was fabulous. It was an amazing meal and the warm and attentive service made us feel right at home. We're excited to go back with friends and family!

Oxalis' food, asthetic, and playlist are incredible!!! I've been here several times and most recently tried the set menu. There was a mushroom dish that was absolutely divine- the broth was incredible I could've had ten bowls of that alone. As of the last time I visited they didn't have s liquor license yet but their non-alcoholic drinks are all so amazing I didn't even care. My favorite drink was the sparking jasmine tea.

We came here on a friends rexommendatjon and w had a fantastic experience. Creative menu, friendly staff and an overall relaxing, but not too quiet, ambiance. The music was also top notch. At the end of the meal we couldn't decide which dish was our favorite and we each nominated two different ones as our personal favorites - which is always a good sign. We will definitely be coming back!

So delicious! We did the $60 tasting menu with the $15 non-alcoholic beverage pairing it was so unique and incredible. On top of amazing food there service was on point, so professional and enthusiastic!  Highly recommend!

I've been lucky enough to eat at many incredible restaurants in New York and while they're great, not many are standouts among the rest. Oxalis is without a doubt, the most pleasant, refreshing and jaw-droppingly delicious meal I've had in years. The food was otherworldly. We had the prix fixe and each dish was better than the last. The service was fantastic as was the atmosphere. I have a ton of food allergies to raw whole fruits and vegetables (I know, my life sucks) and they were so accommodating and created two entirely different dishes for me (though what my family ate for those courses was apparently also fantastic). To top it all off, the dessert (goat milk with honey and thyme - trust me, totally different than what you're probably imagining right now) was perhaps the best dessert I've had in my life and I've come to to the realization that was the peak of my dessert journey and I'm fine with that. Overall, a magical, warm, inviting, flavorful, surprising experience. Side note: try their Jasmine Tea Soda (WOW!).
I dislike veggie burgers. But they have an amazing veggie burger. Basically, everything on the menu is amazing. Damn, on my way right now.

Great drinks, came here before watching Black Panther a couple months ago. The service was good and the waiter gave us a couple of app recommendations. Did not enjoy the tuna chips dish . It's very cute inside
No comment
No comment

The menu has changed! I was a patron of HiHi when they had the chili and chicken sandwich, etc. on the menu, but I have to say, their new menu blows those dishes out of the water. The rice balls are amazing, and I've never had such succulent chicken. My toddler doesn't like many foods at the moment, so I was pleasantly surprised when she devoured the crab potato tots. My husband insisted on getting the deviled eggs, which aren't my thing, but I will be going back for more of those! Service was excellent, and they always have kick-butt bartenders who know how to make a pregnant cocktail lover a mocktail that makes it seem as if you're drinking the real thing. Looking forward to our next visit!

They have since removed the Cincinnati chili dish from their menu, so I doubt I will be returning. This was truly disappointing to learn on my last visit. They still offered chili dogs, but the spaghetti was what I really wanted. Had a great salad last time I was there, but please bring back the Cincinnati chili!
No comment
No comment

FYI, the HiHi Room has almost completely changed its menu! Several dishes that people raved in other reviews are no longer available. I had a good experience anyway -- ate the "popcorn" rice balls w/ gouda and Brussels sprouts, and both were solid.

Sooo disappointed with their new menu! Bring back the Cincinnati Chili! Myself and so many friends I introduced to your restaurant no longer come because the chili is gone. You had a staple menu item that was wrongly removed. The menu should rotate but not the chili.

Really fun eating environment with unique dishes like a Cincy style chili dog and tuna dip. Incredibly friendly staff!
No comment
No comment
No comment

What a cute little place. A bit of a time warp to the nineties. Unassuming from the outside but much larger and inviting once indoors. The menu is small but everything is high quality and well made. The cocktails are nice, especially the Bloody Mary. I love the burgers. Sliders are a great snack and maybe the best in the area. But my star is the Cincinnati spaghetti! Staff is friendly but service at times is a little slow.  Definitely worth a visit.

Say hello to HiHi! Classic American cuisine turned up a notch is what you will find behind the neon lights. Fresh crisp  salads, tender fried chicken and creamy mac & cheese took out taste buds to another level. The fried chicken plate came with soft moist mini biscuits and each piece of chicken was juicy and crispy after being fried twice in rice flour. Gave it a nice dark color. The chickeny goodness continued on the sandwich, but this time topped with a savory 5 spice sauce. Looked like gravy but way better. The salad was fresh and flavorful. Each item just went perfectly with the next. Also tried the celery soda and it blew my mind! Really good, sweet and had a kick that I was not expecting.

Always a good time. Great cocktails and good comfort food that's done really well. Recommend the sliders and the Taylor Ham at brunch. Really fun decor as well and good vibes. My only critique is that I wanted my Bloody Mary to be a little more fun. It was the minimalist modern version of a Bloody Mary with just an olive and a literal bead on the toothpick. Add some celery and a cornichon for crying out loud!
