The little sliders pack big flavor, they were delicious. Will definitely be back to try other things on the menu. Everyone was super friendly when we walked in.

Ordered delivery from here and tried the chicken sandwich, the big smithee burger and the sliders. The sliders were a little dry but still decent, the burger was very flavorful but a bit small. The fried chicken was my favorite as it was nice and flavorful and came with a delicious habanero sauce. Overall very good comfort food kind of place.

Best. Veggie. Burger!! Seriously like the best I've ever had. Trekked out here from the east village and boy was I glad I did. The staff was friendly and patient with our indecisive group of ladies. The cocktail menu is fun and has most of the classics with a few twists.  We ordered our usuals of margaritas and negronis, but one pregnant friend was delighted with her mocktail. Besides my entree, I would say the winners were the winter crunch salad, the red pork bowl and of course the spicy pecans! I'm currently dreaming about their veggie burger and can't wait for warmer weather, so I can dine in their backyard. Wish they would open a location closer to me.

Really good spot. Called to place an order for pickup but once we got there decided to eat in the back outdoor area. Ordered the fried chicken, the sliders, and the pony potatoes. The sliders were okay, well cooked but a bit under seasoned. The potatoes were heavily fried and made me feel not great after eating a few. The fried chicken was definitely the best part of the dinner. The chicken was perfectly seasoned and fried, also came with delicious biscuits. Would come back just for the fried chicken for sure.
Backyard is good stuff. Burger and veggie burger are best in area imo. Good beers and cocktails. Price is about average for area.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Beautiful backuard garden with spaced-out covid-friendly seating and great food. Pancakes are some of the best ever, a must try!
No comment
No comment
The sliders, both the vegetarian and beef are AMAZINGLY tender and tasty. The backyard patio has all the vibes you need to kick back.

The HiHi Room was certainly pretty good. Best service, clean, and beautiful atmosphere. The menu is really awesome, plenty of really good choices, I had to go with Fried Chicken Sandwich, and it was excellent. And also, the service was wonderful and the staff was really helpful. Strongly recommended The HiHi Room.

A friend and elite Yelper found out about this spot and we decided to go. The bartender/ server/ cashier (forgot his name) was super friendly and accommodating. We both got the $15 happy meal, which comes with two burger sliders, an adult beverage and a mini pineapple ice cream cone. The sliders were good. But if you're on the hungry, you may want to add an order of fries to this like we did. Will probably go back again at some point. Nice vibes. Good food.
No comment
Love this local spot, especially that they have scaled-down versions of everything, little veggie sliders and little pony beers.
Lame menu. Half the dishes are almost exactly the same, they just change one ingredient. Weak.

Awesome delicious comforting food absolutely what you need to start the day off right and happy. Socially distant outdoor seating and heated in the backyard covered patio, completely open and fresh breeze. Be well!
No comment

The Hi Hi Room 2.0 2.0 is simply rather amazing. What a cute place. Their Spaghetti Cincinatti was excellent! Spaghetti Cincinatti was done perfectly. The service was also excellent. It's totally worth it.
No comment

Get the heck outta here with your confusing Yelp situation but get the heck in here (my belly) with your incredible food. The potato salad will kiss you it's so delectable. The sliders will basically give you a drug high they're too delicious. And check out that frickin Patio in the back. Hi hi hi don't you dare say goodbye to this gem.

Let me tell you! I do not leave reviews! Ever! But the bartender I think his name is Krause?? Is a dream -- the drinks never unfilled, the banter--I can't even tell you! The raisin at the bottom of the drink of the ants on a log was incredible!! Krause should be king of Brooklyn heights. Someone hire him and steal him away! If you haven't been you should!! God bless that man and his artistic flick of the wrist.

Absolutely love this place. Not only is the food delicious and the service out of sight, their backyard is possibly the best place in Brooklyn to wait out the pandemic. Praying for an Indian summer so I can keep hanging out there for as long as is humanly possible.

These sliders are no joke. They are sooo good--smashed burgers, caramelized onions and pickles on a delicious pillow-y roll (I think they're Martin's potato rolls, maybe?). We also got the mantis salad and pony potatoes. The pony potatoes were also really good (so was the salad, but at the end of the day, it's salad). They reminded me of extra crispy tater tots in the best way possible. Looking forward to visiting again!

DELICIOUS! Seriously so so good. I stopped by last night to check out their new outdoor seating and decided to try their Summer menu. Our order included: beef sliders, the fried chicken and the potato salad. Everything was cooked to perfection: chicken was crispy and flavorful, the sliders melted in our mouth! It was barbecue food from our childhood dreams. Tables outside were sparse for good reason, all 6 ft apart. If you don't sit outside I recommend picking up to go. 100% recommend!

I really really wanted to love this place - but the fried chicken was revolting. Bland and so completely soaked in grease I was sick to my stomach for the rest of the night. Sliders were...fine. Not sure what the fuss is about but I love Court Street Grocers so much I'm sure I'll be back to give it another shot
I could't even try their food cause they cancelled my order after they had me wait 90min. very professional.
Very good burgers  fries could be better.. but I enjoyed my meal with friends, nice sitting in the back with heater .
Loved the fried chicken and the heated outdoor setup. Perfect set up for dining out during Covid. Great service too!

The food and drinks here are delicious. We ordered fried chicken sandwiches with fries, and Mac and cheese. The Wail Call cocktail was also great. The staff was very friendly and quick. I would go back.

So glad they are open again!! I could probably eat these veggie sliders every day!! Loved the Mantis salad too -- so crunchy and I wish I could buy a bottle of that dressing! Perfect food for a summer picnic!! :)

We just stopped by for drinks, but I have to say the service and atmosphere exceeded expectations. It doesn't look like much when you walk in, but the outside area is really cute and cozy, and the staff went out of their way with very friendly service.
No comment

This place never disappoints and the owner is usually there which is always a good sign making sure your food is delicious. My go to dish is the chicken scallopini.

No comment

Great ambiance. Ordered black linguine and it was wonderful. Service was great. They accommodate large groups without a minimum food and beverage price. We were able to enjoy a meal with our company group.

Hmmm.  Very nice ambiance.  If you were to walk by you would think this would be a good date spot.  But for the price I think you can find better Italian options. Complimentary bread is cold but tasty.  I've had better octopus and the spinach fettuccine wasn't memorable.  The service just was okay.  They could have been nicer.  Perhaps it was an off night there.

True Italian fare! Using the freshest, in-season ingredients, house-made pasta, all prepared with care. I highly recommend ordering from their specials and don't forget a Negroni and their incredible tiramisu for desert!
No comment
No comment

The bar is stinky like that old sour beer smell and should have tipped me off. Bartender poorer beer and had to spill it a few times to clear the foamed head. Then ordered eggplant parm and it was apparent then heated up a frozen square of eggplant in the microwave. The cheese consistency was off and off and the eggplant rubbery. Can't understand how they have good ratings.
No comment

Absolutely amazing and memorable each and every time. First visit was day before NYC Marathon 2021 and the meal was fantastic. Second visit being a dinner before a Broadway show and absolutely worth the trip to this location. Staff is friendly and accommodating. Server is so helpful in wine selection. Third visit August 2022 , 17 year wedding anniversary with kids and absolutely a wonderful dining experience. Highly recommend visiting and enjoying the fabulous food selection. It's all wonderful.
No comment
Food very good - atmosphere modern nice - good scotch selection - recommend the meat and cheese platter for appetizer
No comment
No comment
No comment

This was a last minute stop and I was decently impressed. The gnocchi was pretty good and they were generous with the house servings of fresh bread. Wasn't a big fan of the calamari since I found it rather hard to eat (huge pieces). Overall, no complaints for Da Claudio. Good pick if you want quick, good Italian food.
No comment
Delicious! Great service! Drinks were fantastic! Stepped in for lunch and was not disappointed. Very friendly team, full of smiles & good vibes. Great background music. Will be back.
No comment
No comment

The food was very good and I usually don't like Moscow mules but theirs was delicious. The vibe of the staff was a little awkward. It made me feel like I should eat and leave quickly event though they closed in 3 hours. The ambience was still pretty, I'm sure they just wanted to leave since it was a slower Sunday night.

column3: North Alamitos Beach, Long Beach, CA
column6: No comment

The pasta carbonara isn't good. They made it with penne pasta....some how the pasta made me really sick too.

Very pretty Italian restaurant! The bread served in the beginning was really good and the food came out very fast! The staff was very attentive and cleared our dishes fast and refilled our water constantly. I got the black linguine which was good and the prawns weren't too fishy and cooked right but it was nothing special. I wish the menu was bigger and the portions were bigger.

After a day of showing some friends around downtown Manhattan, I thought I would try this place based on the positive reviews on Yelp. However, I wish I had paid more attention to the health violations posted on Yelp regarding improper handling of their raw foods. I ended up trying what seemed like their most popular dish on Yelp, their squid ink pasta, and suffered from severe food poisoning! I suspect it was related to the shrimp in the squid ink pasta. In one of their Yelp health violations, they had an issue where "smoked or processed fish was held above 38 °F" which I failed to have noticed when I was reading their Yelp reviews. Sadly, I will NOT be coming back here, as the food was not worthy of nausea and BAD stomach pain for a few days.
No comment
Excellent Italian food! Service was great and the ambience as well. I'll definitely be coming back!
No comment

No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here for happy hours with my friends after our first day back in the office, happy hour menu was short and they didn't have the drink I posted a few years ago when I came for happy hours... I decided to go for the amaretto sour cause you can't go wrong with this drink right?.... Boy was it strong with zero sour, my friend got the rosemary drink and I personally liked hers better, my other friend who loves amaretto sour tried my drink and said it was way too strong for her.. got the happy hour snacks.. cheese platter, calamari and the seafood bisque(highly recommend).. food was good, drinks was ok( too strong for my preference) servers were friendly overall had a good time with great friends here.. 3 happy hour drinks and 2 happy hour snack and one entree came out to $104.. which is pretty standard for city prices. I would recommend coming early as this place does get packed and a lot of people bring their kids so Defintiely a family friendly location

Excellent food and atmosphere. A pleasant place to dine and be with friends (not too noisy) with excellent authentic -- and even slightly creative -- Italian dishes (and I live in Italy). A good wine, cocktail, and after-dinner drink list as well.

Da Claudio is just around the corner! It was our first time and let me tell you. Delicious. The bread with olive oil as a starter is classic, and the salad was simple, but the pastas blew my mind away! Would def recommend the black linguine over the spinach fettuccine, but the Shishito peppers in the fettuccine was unique and worth a try !
Delicious food and quick service! The bruschetta was only $10 for happy hour (5-7pm). The calamarata broth was very flavorful and the carbonara was super creamy.

Cute italian restaurant located in the financial district. The interior is very charming, warm, and welcoming. We had reservations but on a Saturday they still had space if you wanted to walk-in. We started with a half bottle of wine and then went straight for the entrees. I opted for the lasagna and my partner had the calamarata. The lasagna was a good size piece coated in melted cheese and in a wagyu bolognese sauce. That said it wasn't necessarily the most memorable lasagna. My partner was quite happy with the calamarata which had seafood, very al dente pasta, and a lobster sauce. Overall, it was solid italian food and made for a good, warm deal on a cold night. Nice place to stop in for a date or with a small group.

Got the fried artichokes to share, and black linguine for the entree. The fried artichokes were delicious, though there was quite a bit of the breadcrumb topping. The black linguine topped with spot prawns was ok, but was a bit bland in flavor. Ended by sharing the chocolate mousse, which was delicious! Overall this restaurant was pretty good, but not amazing.
No comment

Da Claudio did a fantastic job with their family style special menu for a birthday dinner that I went to a few weeks back. We had a group of nearly 20 people so sometimes restaurants either struggle with getting dishes out fast enough or the quality suffers. That was not the case here...everything was fantastic & the food freshness was top notch. The service was speedy and attentive & they made sure we had everything from drinks to silverware/plates. I also love the modern Italian decor which set this place up for a great ambiance. Pricing was fair for NYC prices...I would say it was well worth it for the quality of cuisine, prompt service & killer ambiance. If you are looking to book a special event such as a birthday party, family get together, graduation party or whatever...look no further than Da Claudio!
No comment
Way overpriced, bad food. They also request you provide an ID with your credit card?! Overall bizarre and bad :(
Food was above average. Service was excellent. Chairs were uncomfortable though, like sitting at a woods seat in elementary school.
No comment

Food was like a 8/10.  2 of 4 pasta dishes just weren't heated up properly, the outsides were super hot and the center of the pasta was luke warm. The gnocchi was decent, the sauce could be better. The gnocchi themselves were super soft and pillowy. The bolognese sauce was also hitting high marks along with the rigatoni which was probably the best dish we had for sure. The bread and olive oil was also tasty.
Great service and interior vibe. Would recommend as probably one of the better Italian restaurant around WTC.
I don't even know how to begin I had the angus steak with the potatoes amazing, amazing with a side of string beans every was seasoned perfectly... hats off to all the chefs involved!!!!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

My friend and I came here for their Pitch Black event. It was very well organized and the service was great. We had the Pollo Alla Milanese and tiramisu. I also ordered an amaretto sour from their happy hour menu. The food was really delicious and I'm excited to come back for lunch/dinner.

Great Family owned restaurant in the neighborhood.  Our neighbors told us about Da Claudio and raved about it so we had to try it.  We were not  disappointed!  When I think of Da Claudio I think of lasagna.  I always say I will try something else but make do with just tasting everyone else's entree because I absolutely love the lasagna.  It is not like any other I've had.  The atmosphere is warm and friendly and you are greeted with a smile when you enter.  The drinks are fantastic and you can't go wrong with anything you order.  When I think of Da Claudio I think of refined Italian food and we keep this restaurant in our rotation.  So glad it is here on a lonely little block, so go and discover, you won't be sorry.
Great food, great service, would definitely recommend. Great for date night or just dinner friends.
This is NYC. Your Italian food better be on point. The only point I'll attribute to this place is its ability to disappoint.

I came here on a late Sunday night, and this restaurant is nothing but the best! The staff was very nice and welcoming, not to mention the great conversation with the bartender, Eugene! I ate the spinach fettuccine and it was delicious. The pasta is house-made and tastes amazing! They have great portion sizes and the food came out with great timing. For dessert, I had the crostata di frutta, and it tasted so fresh and flavorful! All of the food was plated beautifully. Overall, the food was phenomenal, and I would highly recommend this restaurant for anyone in New York. And not to mention, the ambiance was incomparable.
No comment
No comment

Great place, really good food and drinks. I had the eggplant parm and it was delicious. The service was amazing and authentic italian. Surely a place ill highly recommend and a place i will be back. Great ambiance .
I loved the staff and the environment. My only issue is I got the seafood stew and the calamari & shrimp were over cooked. Would come again and get pasta for sure.

I've only eaten here twice and both times I had the lasagna because it's delicious.  I would give it 5 stars, but my friend had a risotto dish and wasn't all that impressed.  Waitstaff was friendly and atmosphere is nice. And if you order the meat lasagna you won't be disappointed.

I ended up booking da Claudio last minute while in the area on a Tuesday night without ever having heard of the restaurant before. Stylish dining room, friendly staff and unpretentious and authentic Italian food made for a very pleasant experience. The bruschetta and gnocchi stood out and the Negroni was very well made.

I was staying across the street at the Moxy hotel for work and decided to try this place out.  I wouldn't say it was a unique experience but the steak I ordered was pretty good, service was fine.  I would probably come back if I was staying at the Moxy again but probably won't go out of my way to come back here as there are better options further away.

I got the recommendation from Aloft. Came for good wine with good food. Started with the special Burrata with beets (and strawberries and pistachios). Shoot the chef good!  Everything else was excellent. Especially the staff.
The gnocchi was spectacular! The wife loved the calamari as well. It was a quick walk by but a very lovely one. Thank you for a nice time and great service.
Very friendly wait staff. Food wasn't the best but the experience and the wine were good!
No comment
No comment
Convenient location, friendly stuff - good Italian Food for fair prizing - will go there again
We recently moved into the neighborhood and really enjoyed the restaurant. The service was excellent and the food was great.

I'm not a review kinda guy, my friend told me about this restaurant and I traveled from the upper west side to check it out. I'm so glad I did! The homemade gluten free pasta is the best I ever enjoyed. The server was very accommodating to our dietary needs and made us feel like we were the only table she had. The vibe was spacious and a buzz without being too loud so we could talk and hear. It was well worth the trip and I hope da Claudio opens a location uptown too.
No comment

Loved the Italian craft beer selections!  Pastas were outstanding.  The service was unmatched.  We felt so welcome and cared for, it truly enhanced our experience.  Lasagna was hearty and bucatini was delicious.  Black linguine was as good as I've had in Venice.  We adored Da Claudio!

Nice place, but the food is odd.  Chicken had so much white pepper that I almost couldn't eat it.  The pasta special just tasted like raw tomato paste wildly sweet and unpleasant. It was all cooked really well, but tasted really off.
I love this place. The food and service is always great and the drinks as well. I love their Garganelli Bolognese. I also really loved their burrata appetizer and their desserts

I've been coming here for years and this is outstanding Italian food! I truly don't think I've ordered anything else for an entree besides the bolognese. I highly recommend to come here, the service is excellent.

The pasta here is good - I especially recommend the bucatini arrabiata and spaghetti carbonana, two simple pastas that I think can really showcase how good (or how bad) the chef is. While the prices are definitely on the higher end (this is by no means a casual spot), it's easier for me to swallow because of the quality of the food. This will probably become my go-to neighborhood Italian spot for when I'm feeling a little fancy.

Would like to applaud Claudio and the entire staff of Da Claudio - our team had a great time last night - everyone raved about the food and the lovely atmosphere and the service was perfect. Thank you for your help with making the evening smooth and very special.
No comment
No comment
Bread was awful, appetizer was just so-so, and we waited at least 45mins for our main course. Would not come back again
No comment
Found this gem on Maps. I am so glad We did. Lovely food and good service.  First time in Ny and when I come back I will be eating here again.
Still the best, just a bit more crowded. Definitely try to make a reservation in advance! Their outdoor seating is really warm and enclosed. It definitely protects against NYC winter.
No comment
No comment

Great place to wine and dine. Great selection of drinks and food. The menu is well thought out and the service is amazing. I recommend the da Claudio spritz during happy hour. For food definitely check out the calamari,  Prosciutto di Parma and the bruschetta to start. For main course I went with the Bucatini Arrabbiata. It's a a wonderful pasta that is perfectly cooked, and the spice is a slow burn, nothing to unbeatable. I do wish there were something else in the pasta because it is a plain pasta with sauce. Overall I would recommend coming for the ambiance, the drinks and the food.

Wow. I have never tried this place and decided to check it out cause we were in the city and wanted some Italian food. If you want your grandmas Italian, come here. The marinara and the lasagna are just like traditional Italian, they know all the secrets. The best dish was the lamb ragu! Full of flavor and a great texture. They kept refilling the fresh bread and drinks and Clearing off the table, which made us feel very catered to. The waitress was an absolute doll. Kind, hospitable, delicious, fresh, traditional Italian.

Had an early dinner there with another family. Greeted warmly and attended to nicely throughout.  Fine apps. Had a very good shrimp ravioli.  Probably could have had a bit bigger portion though.  Extensive Italian wine selection.

We ordered takeout of gnocchi and lasagna. The gnocchi was AMAZING and I would give it 10 stars if I could. The lasagna was good enough but nothing to write home about. I saw many other dishes come out while we were waiting and they looked fabulous! We'll for sure be back!
Lobster ravioli was very good. The spinach fettuccine that my friend had was incredible. Wait was minimal and the service was good. Small portions. Gives bread. Good food and nice atmosphere.

While staying at the Beekman I found Da Claudio on Yelp. What a Wonderful restaurant the owner and our server Andrea were so attentive to us , Incredible appetizers and great meals had by all 4 of us. My son and his girlfriend had birthdays and they brought out candles and a birthday wish in chocolate sauce on the desserts. This was followed by a complimentary round of lemonciillo!!

was in the area and it's crazy how i've never checked out Da Claudio's before! so glad my brother, my boyfriend, and i decided to check this place out. super friendly staffs. we are so appreciative and pleased with how nice the servers were and the host. everyone was so friendly. 5/5 for customer service. the indoor ambiance is super comfortable and calming. handles great social distancing. amazing bar and have various cocktails and happy hour menu. my brother and i got Scaloppine Di Pollo and my boyfriend got the lasagna. we all loved our meal. it was delicious and not too much on our plate. the bread they serve with olive oil in the beginning was good too. we also ordered the meat and cheese platter which is a popular thing here since i saw a couple of tables also ordering it. overall, i'm very pleased with my experience at Da Claudio's and the service was fantastic. so so nice. we left the restaurant feeling great. we will definitely be coming back again and bringing our friends with us!
A nice place great for a romantic dinner. Good food, helpful service and great ambiance. The lasagna was fantastic and the gnocchi was delicious. Would come back here in a heartbeat.
No comment

column3: Horizons West / West Orlando, Ocoee, FL
column6: Excellent bolognese sauce in their Garganelli dish --- best I've had in years. Savory, not sweet, with nice chunks and bits of tender ground meat. Waitress was cordial and efficient. Good music, too.

Nothing interesting on the menu foe the price!  Fried artichokes were good cheese and salami platter was blue cheese and not in the description!  Not for me steak might have been good if it was not 52 dollars to find out!
No comment
No comment

I found this restaurant by chance and now every time I come to New York I stop here.  The ambiance is inviting and the staff is very friendly.  I've tried a few dishes there and the food and the espresso has always been amazing.
No comment
No comment
No comment
My husband and I love this place. The service is always excellent as well as the food. Even the outdoor space is romantic and lively. The specials are always interesting and just as delicious.
No comment
No comment

Across from the Moxy hotel sits Da Claudio. I've eaten here 3 times & the wait staff is excellent. I came here today with a large party and overall the experience was good. I ordered the Eggplant Parmesan and it was ok & was $22.00 on the lunch menu. The lunch menu is not cheap but it is average for the neighborhood & the portions are a nice size considering the cost. I enjoy the staff more than the food here but I prefer more hearty heavy Italian food & this is not that kind of restaurant. I might go again & try a different meal.
No comment

sooooo amazing!! food was magical. Staff was so sweet and attentive even though it was busy. We got a bunch of the entrees and cheesecake for desert.I don't think you can go wrong with your order. I will be coming back every time I'm in New York.
No comment
No comment

Excellent service, delicious food, and nice atmosphere. We ate outside and they have made their outdoor area very nice. Risotto special was excellent. I also need to reiterate the service: the waitress was lovely, the person refilling our water was on top of it, and the hostess was very friendly. An altogether excellent experience. Will be back when I'm in the area.
The food took forever but it was great. Think the food would have been better if I eat it there and didn't do take-out. But good food overall.

We were a party of 16 on a busy night, and the place was crowded. Nonetheless, the service was excellent and the food was outstanding. A bit noisy, but everyplace is these days. Gluten-free pasta options - I had it with a Wagyu Bolognese that was outstanding! Great appetizers also - calamari was super.
No comment

We are a group of friends trying cacio e pepe at all the different Italian restaurants in NYC. Six of us ordered it. So it was the standard price at $24 but was by far the worst cacio e pepe I've had so far in NYC. The pasta was tasteless, lacking salt. If there was any pecorino cheese, I could not taste it. They either substituted it for another cheese or put so little of it that the taste was absent. To add insult to injury, the pepe (pepper) was not the standard roasted and ground peppercorns, but red spicy peppercorns. This dish should be called cacio e peperoncino and not the original Roman pasta dish that is notoriously difficult to make despite its small number of ingredients. On top of that the waitstaff asked if we wanted to put parmesan cheese on top.  This shows how clueless Da Claudio is about this classic Italian dish.  You don't put a different cheese to dilute the taste of pecorino cheese. It's a huge no no. The food is one star, but I gave two stars for their attempts at rectifying the disappointment by offering us a replacement. A few of us got replacement dishes. I abstained fearing that the quality of the other dishes would be reflected in the quality of what I ordered initially. That was confirmed when the replacement dishes were also of low quality.

Popped in for dinner recently and was at a loss when picking a wine to pair with my meal of cold antipasti and pasta bolognese,  friendly waitstaff was super helpful and suggested a Sangiovese which was perfect, the waitress was authentic as it gets for an Italian restaurant, young woman straight from Italy!  The pasta was perfectly cooked.  I'll be back, especially to learn some Italian from the waitress !

Came here with my dad and partner before a church service at St. Paul's. Had the fried artichoke appetizer, wagyu bolognese and chocolate mousse tart. Service here was really excellent and the owner Claudio was super cordial. The fried artichoke hearts were really good and so was the bolognese.  This place is definitely a nice find if you're in the financial district. Only complaint is that some of the hazelnut ice cream had ice crystals in it like it had melted and then ben re-frozen.  But they did have a wonderful bottle of Nero D'avola Sicilian red wine.
No comment
No comment

Our first time here. We were impressed with the presentation of the food, as well as the food. Service was very friendly, too. The four of us ordered: burrata cheese w/squash (so interesting paired with the squash. I liked to spread the cheese on the complimentary bread); special pasta (rigatoni w/ sausage & meatball; gnocchi with pesto (very aromatic fresh pesto with large gnocchis- really, the best gnocchi I've had), lasagna (it lived up to all the good reviews, beautiful texture where you can see the layers), and pasta with arrabiata sauce. You could tell all the pastas were homemade (nice and substantial, just the way you want homemade to be). We ordered the choc. souffle cake w/ mascarpone gelato (my daughter is a nut for mascarpone, thanks!) and the sage flavor was a nice touch. We will definitely be back!
No comment
We actually ended up ordering from here twice in one day because it was SO delicious. Highly recommend.
No comment
No comment
No comment
I'm so glad this place is still open during Covid-19 and I happened to come across it. The staff is amazing and welcoming! Hands down the best lasagna in the area!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place responds so well to patrons' requests. They are serving their takeout in the eco containers  - very important if you are accustomed to take out. The food is delicious. Fried oyster panini is my personal fave. Good job! Will recommend to anybody.

Went here on a date...food was great, service even better, and the atmosphere is very cool. Make sure you ask for Noemi, she was our waitress and she did an incredible job. Super knowledgeable, and friendly and really made the night nice. Will definitely be back!
No comment

I like the pasta but I give it 2.5 stars Bc it's overpriced and too salty. I tried the lamb ragu when it first opened. I didn't particularly like the taste hence I never went back. Recently I noticed they started serving squid ink pasta - I have to try it. I ordered the linguine nere (squid ink pasta) and spaghetti carbonara. Both dishes met my expectations but it was too salty. The only complaint is the portions are relatively small compared to the price. This is not the same quality as Michael White's restaurants so I was remised to see the entrees on the pricey side.
No comment
No comment

I am so glad they are open!   I work nearby and have been going here for years.   Everyone I work with loves it here.   I got takeout for the first time and it did not dissapoint.   Additionally the customer service and attention to detail was amazing.   You must try the artichoke appetizer with breadcrumbs and every pasta dish is amazing.  The salads are also great for lunch.   Please support this wonderful local business!!!
We were so thankful that they were open for Thanksgiving. We've honestly never had better service, they were very attentive, the food was excellent we will definitely go back.
Went without any expectations and it was excellent! Especially the bruschetta. Carbonara was excellent and finished with cremé brûlée!!! Would go again!! Service was wonderful!
No comment

This place has been on my to try list for awhile and I was thrilled when I realized it was around the corner from my brother's new place. We initially had planned to dine outside but it was a chilly night and after seeing that the tables were spaced apart well, we decided to dine inside.  We had a lovely table away from others but it was still nice to enjoy the lively atmosphere inside.  Great cocktails to begin, really knowledgeable and accommodating service.  They let us enjoy our cocktails, order and eat at a leisurely pace while also being very attentive but not intrusive. And let me not forget the food.  Salami/cheese plate and fried artichokes to start. Squid ink pasta and fettucine with sausage ragu for a mid course. And finally, sea bass on special and grilled octopus to end.  We loved the food, we loved the atmosphere and we loved the service.  We will definitely be back.
Great example of NYC Italian for this Texan. Yum! Easy to get to, great staff. The lasagna was a great recommendation.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Our first night in the city and we were very excited for our first dinner. We ordered for our1 yr old penne with meat sauce it came out quickly and was ok nothing special.. Then our app came out we ordered Fritto Misto came out very greasy we didn't finish it.. For our main we order chicken scallopini and after waiting 30 min we asked our server where the main was the kitchen forgot. Maybe if the lady in the kitchen wasn't busy making tacos and picking her nose with no mask they wouldn't have forgot. when then they finally brought the main the chicken was raw!! super disappointed
No comment

Had early (6pm) dinner reservations on a Friday night . Highchair was waiting for us at table. Everyone was very kind and accommodating. They also have gluten free option for your pasta as well. I had the carbonara & my husband had the lamb fusilli. The food was amazing. All around great place, great atmosphere, delicious food. Very family friendly, but go early if you can.
Went with a colleague yesterday, the food was excellent and our server was quite nice. We really enjoyed the ambiance and can't wait to try it again. Would definitely try it again sometime.
No comment

Superb food, comfortable, romantic (first date-worthy), excellent service and even better food. Happy Hour offerings are delicious. Try the Deep Fried Artichoke and Bruschetta; it won't disappoint. Spaghetti Carbonara and Waygu Bolognese Lasagna are TO. DIE. FOR. Top it off with a single (mammoth) slice of Tiramisu and you'll leave blissfully satisfied!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

First off the Resturant states it has heaters for outside, and they didn't have any. So had to freeze while eating. My wife had the pesto Gnocchi and it was bland, no flavoring at all, then the waiter came to put cheese on her pasta and the cheese grater broke and fell into her food. So had to wait for a new dinner plate for her. I had the spicy marguerita and it wasn't good, barely any margarita in the small glass cup they gave because it had a huge block of ice taking up most of the cup, so there barely any space for marguerita. The worker that was putting utensils and plates on table was a bit rude like he didn't want to be there. Also put forks and knives directly  on table after we ate appetizer. We were eating outside, why would you place utensils directly on a table that's outside with no napkin under it? I asked to get new utensils and he put the new ones directly on the table again after I told him I didn't want my fork or knife touching directly the table that was not covered. Then I had to ask again for utensils and had to tell him to give them to me in my hand because he was going to place them back on the table... my pasta was pretty good I had the rigatoni Napoleon , only bad thing about is they only put 1 meat ball, 1 small sausage and 1 small pork rib in the meal. Could've put more in it. To the appetizer, I had fried calamari and it was bland also. No flavoring at all. The sauce that came with it was good tho. Sorry to say I will not be going there again and I won't recommend this place to anyone.
No comment
Delicious food, very warm welcome and service. Reminds me of being in Italy, really loved this place & they accommodated my daughters love of pasta!

Randomly stopped by here and glad I did. Great place for a romantic date night or a casual dinner. The drinks were very tasty and strong, can't go wrong with the classic mule. Loved the cacio e pepe and with chicken added, gave it a great flavor. Would definitely stop by here again if I'm in the area.
No comment

Although the outdoor setup was not the most aesthetically pleasing, it was fine and understand the many challenges the business is probably facing because of Covid. But, the food was great and our waitress was very attentive and helpful. I got the bucatini arrabbiata and it was delicious!
Of course you should tip your waiter! He asked you if you wanted change as a courtesy. Clearly you have never waited tables. Get a grip.

The restaurant is close to 9/11 Memorial Museum and that's why we choses there to have dinner. Their service are awesome and our requests are quickly responded. I really like their manager and waiters/waitress. We started with "Insalata di Barbabietole" and it was great! As for entrees, i had their special risotto with clams and my friend had pappardelle with chicken. Both of them are ok

Found this hidden gem based on all the fab Yelp reviews after visiting the One World Observatory. I was in the mood for some good authentic Italian cuisine and this place def didn't disappoint. Started off with the frito misto which was fried calamari and shrimp and absolutely delicious. For our main the BF and and I went for Garganelli which we both enjoyed. Pasta was cooked to perfection and the wagyu beef with the Parmesan cheese was flavorful. We were too full for dessert so next time I'd consider skipping the appetizer to taste their Tiramisu. Excellent service. Enjoyable meal and would def  consider going back when visiting this area again.

Honestly, this is the kind of place I'm thinking of when it comes to eating out for a nice dinner in Manhattan. We were hosted by the literal owner of the restaurant, who was an extremely congenial and welcoming older gentleman. He escorted us to our table, gave polite conversation and saw to it that my wife and I were taken care of for the entire night as well as supervising all other tables both inside and out. The servers were so attentive, water service was on point, cocktails were fantastic, the entrees were just so succulent, and carefully crafted. I loved that the kitchen was visible from seating, large, well staffed and did not seem overwhelmed. The sourdough given complimentary was fantastic. The cocktails were adequately priced and I really can't overstate the fantastic service at this place. At the end of the dinner, the owner thanked us personally, shook our hands and escorted us out and on our way. Seriously, THIS is what local owned fine dining should strive for.
No comment

I totally agree with the other 3 star review, service was really bad for us.  Not only did we feel ignored while other tables were tended to I feel like our girl gave me complete attitude on multiple occasions.  At one point she said she would be right back after she opened some wine for a table, okay...then she continued after that to take orders for two other tables.  When I had to flag her down again after that she gave me complete attitude.  WHY?  Just apologize and we can move on....We litterally then placed our order and I asked for a glass of wine the next time she came around...she then had the nerve to ask me with full on attitude, "so do you want it like now, just really just when I come around again?"  Mouth dropped at that comment.  Sadly this made everything terrible as the food was tasty but bad service just ruins everything for me.

This was the most amazing meal I'd had. A nice small Italian restaurant with amazing pasta, great service, and delicious food. I had the lasagna and was sooo happy with it. My husband had the spicy spaghetti sauce. We were both extremely happy with our meal and very full after. We both got the tiramisu for dessert. It was a phenomenal meal and we would both happily go back.
No comment
No comment

Giving it an extra star just for the ambiance. The food itself was good but not great, especially for the price and portion sizes. Make sure to go during happy hour for $5 off drinks and appetizer discounts. Definitely a great place to grab happy hour drinks with friends and enjoy the candle lit atmosphere.
No comment

My boyfriend and I went here for a dinner date and were not disappointed. They have tents on the street with heat lamps. It was 30 degrees and windy but we were still comfortable just make sure you're bundled up. They even gave us extra heat lamps until other patrons arrived. Our waitress Elizabeth was so sweet and the service was great. The bread alone was delicious and they readily gave us seconds. We ordered the burrata, bucatini cacio + pepe and the calamarata then for drinks an espresso martini and the fuoco. Would definitely eat here again!
No comment
No comment

This wasn't just dinner. It was an experience. Quite possibly the best service we've ever received. Our kids split the lasagna. We shared a Caesar salad along with the spaghetti carbonara and the calamarata. Both were great, but the carbonara was our favorite. Finished the meal with a tiramisu, which was perfect for 2-4 people to share. Eating during happy hour was nice for discounted beverages. Tried both the Moretti and the Montauk IPA.  Kids loved the Olde Brooklyn Cream soda. Really great meal. Decent prices. Again amazing service.
No comment
No comment
Now this is how Italian is done! Everything freshly made. Every time I'm in the city for business, I always eat here! Ottimo Ciba!

I don't venture into the Financial District often.  I came to this place without much thought because I was hungry and there looked to be open tables.  I'm glad I did, because I was SOOOO impressed.  First, the customer service was exceptional.  And I say that as someone who used to work in the restaurant industry.  Second, the food was great.  The zuppa I ordered was delicious and arrived at a perfect temperature.  The parmigiana di melanzane I ordered as my main course was equally delicious and a perfect portion size.  Finally, the atmosphere was inviting and relaxing, but not sleepy -- not the easiest ambience to pull off in NYC.  I left feeling stress free and content, even though that really wasn't something I was aiming for when I chose the restaurant.  In sum, my visit was perfect.  I definitely recommend Da Claudio to anyone on the fence about checking it out.
No comment
Nice Italian restaurant - went there because it's so highly rated on Yelp. Delicious food. We had the black squid ink pasta and their special octopus spaghetti. Worth it.

Awesome little Italian spot in lower Manhattan. Service and food was great! They do have a happy hour menu in the bar from 4- 6 PM with drink and appetizer specials. My friend and I both started with the arugula salad which was delicious and very fresh. I had the cacio e pepe for dinner and it was excellent. The portion was HUGE and could absolutely be shared. I will be back!

The food was good but definitely not worth the price. I had the Fritto Misto and the Bucatini Cacio e Pepe with grilled chicken. The Fritto Misto was the highlight of the night. I would recommend as an appetizer as it comes with calamari, shrimp, vegetables, and other seafood. The Bucatini was very average, the chicken was dry and there was little too much pepper for my liking. Overall, the meal was just... ok.

I had a business lunch at Da Claudio in May 2019. I ordered the Prix fixe lunch which included Caesar salad, garganelli bolognese and coffee or tea. Garganelli is a pasta which is similar to penne. The food and service were excellent.

What a great start to our NYC trip.  I brought my mom to NYC for her 80th birthday and we wanted to start with a great Italian meal and we were not disappointed.  Our server Hanna was awesome and made some great food recommendations and picked a great Italian pinot for us. We ended up ordering the grilled octopus with an amazing caesar salad, which were shared.  Then octopus ink black pasta with huge grilled prawns and tiramisu for dessert.  Amazing stuff.  They also made a special effort for my mother's birthday.  Colin
No comment
Wonderful Italian restaurant with great style and friendly service. The carbonara was phenomenal.  Delightful and family friendly.

The food is amazing!! If you are in the mood for some authentic Italian then you need to taste the sweet flavors of Da Claudio!! Be sure to come with a small appetite.... although the food is great and the service is excellent, the portions are not really enough to brag about. I had some pasta and dessert and had a very enjoyable experience!! Highly recommend.

On a business trip I was recommended by my concierge  to stop by here for a really nice dinner.  The ambiance and decor is really nice, dim lighting, top notch white table setting.  I opted to sit at the bar since I had a long day of travel and wanted immediate service.  Tara was my bartender, very lively and talkative but didn't overdo it, she was my favorite part of this entire experience.  I started with the Insalata di Cesare for $15.00...whoa!  For my entree I ordered the Gnocchi Squash.  This is the first time I've had Gnocchi, simply due to the fact that it seems like it would be really doughy, heavy and filling...$20.00.  The dish came like 45 minutes later...what the flip?  I kept asking where my dish was seeing as how it was towards the end of the night and there were only a handful of patrons.  First bite...blah!  It was really dry and flavorless.  I asked for some cream or Alfredo sauce to get this dish out of the Nevada desert sands.  Dominic came up to me asking why I wanted sauce, I politely told him that the dish was dry and needed some Umph.  I could have, and should have, looking back sent it back since it took him an eye roll and another 20 min. to come back with my request.  Still...blah...never again.  Deuces De Claudio!  I would have given them another chance to try something else since I will be in New York a few times a year for work, however the customer service from Dominic who is the manager was no bueno!
No comment

Beautiful atmosphere. Was greeted promptly by the host and seated at a lovely table for two.  Nicely romantic.  Delicious Cesar salad was on the smaller side but was so good we looked past it.  Both entrees were very good. Service was good but a pet peeve I have is to be asked about a second drink at 7:01 and being charged the non happy hour price.  I shouldn't care because it's only $3 but then again, maybe they shouldn't care.  The thing that impressed me most about this place was the host/manager and how you could tell that he really cared about our dining experience.  Definitely try this place out!

My favorite Italian place to eat and hang out. Claudio and his staff make you feel like you are a guest at someone's home. The food is fresh and so tasty. I usually get something off the specials but also love all the pastas I have tried. The desserts are also out of this world. I love the open kitchen concept because I can see how clean it is and can see the pride everyone that works there takes in the upkeep of the restaurant. All of them are extremely professional and seem to love what they do. I recommend this place for a nice night out if you are visiting the area and if you live in the area a local place to eat on a regular basis.
No comment
Great, daily happy hour at the bar with friendly bartenders and equally friendly prices. An especially chill spot on weekend evenings. Cheers!
No comment

I was looking for something in fidi that wasn't too casual but had a laid back atmosphere. We stumbled upon this place and everything was excellent. The host was prompt to seat us and take our coats, our waitress was attentive and gave us great recommendations. We ended up splitting the arugula salad which was light fresh and the dressing was so good! My mom had the black linguine which was squid ink pasta, head-on prawns, and spicy tomato sauce. I had the Fusilli Avellinesi which had lamb ragu, saffron cream and micro greens. We ended with tiramisu and can't wait to come back!
No comment

Superb food, comfortable, romantic (first date-worthy), excellent service and even better food. Happy Hour offerings are delicious. Try the Deep Fried Artichoke and Bruschetta; it won't disappoint. Spaghetti Carbonara and Waygu Bolognese Lasagna are TO. DIE. FOR. Top it off with a single (mammoth) slice of Tiramisu and you'll leave blissfully satisfied.

Just had our office holiday dinner party here. It was great, from the atmosphere to the food. Who knew that an unassuming front door would lead to such a great dinner and this time we didn't just have to rely on the company we came with to enjoy our time there. One of the co-workers said "I didn't want my dessert to end." My favorite was that amazing tiramisu, it left me mind blown! The waitstaff did a great job as well, I feel like I can't say enough great things about the place, but don't just take my word for it please do yourself a favor and go try it.

I decided to host a team lunch here based in all the positive reviews but what a mistake .. the service was horrible we asked for bread 5 times and no bread for the table. Then they took away our appetizer that we have not finish.. the squid ink pasta is so fishy .

I came here for dinner with my girl. De Claudio has a really nice vibe and the service was pretty good. The food was just alright tho. For our appetizers, we got the meat platter, prosciutto wrapped around cantaloupe and the fried platter of seafood and veggies. The meat platter is pretty subpar. I wouldn't recommend it. The cheese isn't pretty hard and the variety of meats is pretty basic. The prosciutto however was really good and went well with the fruit. The fried stuff was standard but good. For our entree, we ordered the gnocchi and the lamb Raghu. The lamb dish wasn't that appealing. The lamb was minced and the pasta was so tough to chew. The gnocchi, to keep pg, tastes bad. It tastes like the stem of a flower. The appetizers were good enough to keep this place at 3 stars.
Our server Noami was AMAZING!!!! She was bright and cheerful and honestly a treat! The food was incredible, we both had the carbonara and it was great. Well be here next week!!!!

A pleasant Financial District surprise with good service and food. We had bucatini arrabbiata and spaghetti carbonara, both were tasty and well portioned. Drinks were fine, I had an aperol spritz and the negroni was strong. Desserts for a casual celebration included a tart lemon sorbetto and a light chocolate cake. Service was warm and efficient.

Came here for a work lunch, our party of 3 was seated right away, the staff was attentive and prompt with filling our glasses, bringing out the bread, inquiring about menu questions and taking our orders. Me and the second person got the penne alla sorrentina from the prefixed lunch option (which includes a soup or salad, a pasta entree, and cup of tea or coffee). Unfortunately, our food took a long while to come out, the cesar salad was underwhelming and lazily served (super large pieces of romaine) and the pasta was a bit too al dente for my personal taste but the sauce was good, basic and light but good. The third person ordered the chicken Milanese which they really enjoyed. I had a neutral experience, so I would give the place a second chance.
No comment

My wife and I were in NYC to begin an Atlantic cruise and needed to find a quick dinner. I made a reservation, because it was so convenient to our hotel. But the meal was unexpectedly great. My wife had a Caesar salad, and I had the potato gnocchi. The gnocchi were substantial without being heavy. They melted in the mouth and satisfied my hunger. The wine was first class and a good value. The meal started our vacation with a perfect send-off. I recommend eating here whenever you want traditional Italian food prepared with loving care.
Place is delicious! Everything is very solid! Service is great! The pastas are some of the best in the city! All around great place! Highly recommend!

Food was delicious and had lots of flavor. Service at beginning was good but then went downhill after that. I was by myself and came in early. Appears that once they receive larger parties, Managment pulls your server to accommodate the larger. Would suggest to communicate that to the customer. The manager checked in along with another server. Would have rated a 5 if that had not occurred. Had the white fish special with brousell  and mushrooms.

Today I had a great lunch experience with some co-workers. We all decided to settle for Italian food. We did some Yelp research and we nailed it with this restaurant. Is a bit pricey but it worth every penny. Our experience was pretty pleasant, the staff were friendly and accommodated us in a good setting for our business lunch. I wanted lasagna so bad but and they didn't have it ready so i went for the octopus pasta and let me tell you! This plate in my opinion was better than getting the lasagna, it was so tasteful and well prepared. Did i said is pricey? That was a lunch special $26.00 but oh my Lord it was so good. I finished up with sorbetto of one ball of blood orange and the other of lime, it was the best combo because is a great desert with the sweet and sour taste! Go for it!! Overall i rate this restaurant 5 because overall they did a good job from the welcoming to the exiting.

Great location for authentic Italian! They take great pride and make their pasta in house. Everything was so fresh. We enjoyed the prosciutto, steak, and chicken. I loved this olive oil! The service was top notch.
No comment
No comment

Where do I start! This is my favourite Italian place - from the calamari to pasta to desserts all of it so delicious. A special mention to their desserts and dessert wines. Been there a couple of times and has always been great.

This is my first time rating a restaurant, which I'm doing just for da Claudio. Most underrated restaurant in nyc. The food is AMAZING. I've gone here many times with friends and family and just... wow. Hands down best Italian in fidi, maybe even the city.

The guys ordered lasagna and loved it. Us girls had great pasta dishes. The salads was good, and big enough to share. I appreciated that they would seat us even without a reservation. Very clean and modern. Definitely worth a go!
Incredible authentic Italian.  We were seated in the bustling back section, and enjoyed the water service, bread and everything we ordered.
No comment

I love this place! Such a warm, inviting, Italian restaurant that welcomes you like you're family. And the food is fantastic. Newly renovated and very cozy. If you're in the area and you're craving Italian, give this place a shot! You won't be sorry.

Excellent service. Good food. Enjoyed the pappardelle with sundried tomato sauce - pasta was freshly made. Also shared the artichoke appetizer which was delightful. Portion sizes for lunch spot on; not heavy at all. Bright spot a little off the beaten path in the Financial district not far from Foley Square. Worth the trip!
My last night in NY and this place hit the spot. Seafood pasta and a glass of wine. Perfection.
No comment

I grabbed dinner here with my parents and it was excellent Italian food! On par with the food I've had in Rome, Italy. We got their fresh mozzarella starter that was on top of some roasted yellow beets and tomatoes, drizzled with fresh olive oil and balsamic. YUM! I had their lamb ragú as my main course and I enjoyed every bite! Sooo tasty, I could tell the pasta was homemade. Prices were reasonable, I highly recommend!
No comment

I am impressed, Da Claudio is definitely pretty darn cool. Good value for the money. Da Claudio has an amazing Garganelli, give it a try I believe you would really like it, I certainly love it. Team made sure everything was ok. Da Claudio: Go here, go here now.
This place was across the street from our hotel and it was fabulous. Our waitress held good energy and the food was beyond tasty! Would definitely go back.
No comment

I've had this restaurant saved for a while and finally ended up here on thanksgiving. My s/o and I were very pleased with the food and drinks. We were even more pleased with the exceptional service. They went above and beyond. We will for sure be coming back.
Food was delicious, cocktails were great and ambiance/staff were so gracious. If you are looking for some gluten free pasta this is your place! So good!

This place is a little gem in a neighborhood short on good eats. Da Claudio is modern, hip, clean and comfortable. Great geometric acoustic panels on the ceiling help keep the dining noise in check. The food is delicious! We had an array of pastas and seafoods - all cooked al dente to perfection. Most impressive however was the superb, attentive, and friendly service we received from our server, Terra. I'd come back just to sit at her table - really helps the food, wine, and cocktails are also so tasty! Thanks for making our night so enjoyable, Terra!
No comment
If you are looking for top quality Italian cuisine. Its one of the best places to be in nyc. Lovely ambience, friendly and courteous staff and tasty food
No comment
No comment

I wish I had a picture of the food that was so generously and beautifully plated it for us however... Our plates are wiped clean because everything was so incredibly delicious. I first discovered this restaurant by accident in a massive thunderstorm in there and city and had to find something quickly... What a haven that I found. Hospitality the cuisine the wine list are really very special. I've come back again now twice and the artichoke appetizer is still my favorite. The scratch  made garganelli and the veal scaloppini are delicious. The owner Claudio is so delightful and makes you feel completely welcome and Jose our bartender is incredibly attentive and kind... It's really nice when someone remembers your name...
No comment

Just stopped at Da Claudio for a quick happy hour and the incredible server Brittany took care of us.  She was trying two spring inspired cocktails, we choose the Old Fashion with tang and raspberry. It was so flavorful without sacrificing the strong taste.  She was attentive and creative.  Will definitely be back, especially for Brittany.
No comment

We walked across the Brooklyn Bridge and searched for a place nearby.  We couldn't have been happier with Da Claudio.  Delicious Italian food, outdoor seating, attentive server.  Give this place your business; it's great.  Also, one person in our party had an egg allergy, and they were very nice/accommodating/understanding about it.

This was my first time at this place two nights ago and will not be my last. First of all, I love making reservations and the fact that this place uses open table is such a plus. Me and two of my girlfriends showed up and it was so cute inside with a beautiful bar and lighting. They had all the tables spaced out nicely with plastic dividers that made us comfortable. So once we sat down our server Flor was incredible. She helped us pick out drinks that were delicious, the margarita, aperol spritz, and la costeria. For apps we got the cheese and meat plate and the bruschetta which was so tasty. For mains, I had the rigatoni special which was incredible and my two friends had theBucatini Cacio E Pepe which was such a nice portion. The star of the show for me was the dessert. We had the tiramisu, torta, and gelato. They even gave us a complimentary shot and little almond cookies. We've already made a decision to make this spot a regular event.
No comment
Came in here right before they were closing and they didn't disappoint. Food was fantastic and service was great. Awesome personalities work here.
No comment

Da Claudio keeps getting better. A fresh summer menu of Italian intrigue and superb happy hour choices make this a cosy modern American Italian treat. Specials such a zucchini blossoms and some very fancy fritti misto are but a few treats waiting to tempt the palate. The decor also works well being both intimate and open. And if you are lucky you may meet Claudio. And if you are really lucky Tara may make you a cocktail or too
No comment
No comment
I have taken guests to DaClaudio on three occasions (one dinner and two lunches) and we had an excellent meal and great service each time.  Highly recommend.

My son and I went to Da Claudio's on a Sunday night which was very quiet.  I'm so glad we found this restaurant.  We loved it and it was so nice to sit outside, have a couple of drinks, a delicious appetizer and dinner.  Everything we had was excellent!  The waitress was so sweet and asked us where we were from and to be sure to come back to visit them next time we're in town.  She was so personable.  I think she said it was her 3rd day there.  It seemed she'd been there for a long time.  Next time we make a trip to NYC, I will make sure to go there!

Go here for great pasta dishes.  I've lived downtown for 3 years and just went here for the first time 2 weeks ago and went back a week later...will it be 3 weeks in a row?  Any appetizer...hit...Squid ink pasta hit... risotto...double hit...bucatini Cacio e Pepe...triple hit.

Came here in November for date night and it was his turn to find the spot and he did sooooo well !! I absolutely loved this place everything was delicious across the board. The service was exceptional ... it was a really quiet night I think we were one of three tables inside which I totally did not mind ... I really enjoyed the Decor and style of the Resturant and loved the artwork .... we will def be back soon ! YUM

Feel the need to leave a comment just because their service was wonderful. Everyone was genuine and considerate. The food was great, only a bit too salty for my taste. But honestly I was amazed! Their bread was one of the best I've had, even though it wasn't made in the restaurant. Anyway, loved the experience!
Amazing. The risotto is served in a parmesan wheel. The artichoke appetizer and lasagna are very good as well.

The Gnocchi was very soft and the pesto didn't have much flavor. The carbonara didn't have much flavor either. The salads were good, but the maitre D' / host was a weirdo.

Great place! The food is fantastic and beer selection is also quite good. Service is top-notch, as well. Will certainly be back!!

My favorite Italian place! Very welcoming with super nice host and waitress / waitresses and delicious food. The only place opened during the snow storm with owner making their signature lasagne! Love it!

Here's the Deal:  My only visit was for a business lunch and I really liked the place. I think it's a welcome addition to the financial district. I thought the prices were reasonable and the food was delicious.  The servers were friendly and helpful with menu choices.  I like the open lay out of the restaurant too!!   Definitely a place worth checking out!!!

I sent my work colleagues there for a group dinner and everyone has been raving about the food and atmosphere. They are from all different backgrounds and origins and had nothing but good things to say about it.
Delicious delicious deliciousness! I'll be dreaming of this place all the way from Cali and will be counting down til the next time I can have more deliciousness!

Having been here a few times, I can say that the food is all right, portions are small, and prices are not commensurate with quality nor size.  In an area where competition for Italian food is becoming steep, it would help Da Claudio to step up their game.  That being said, the food is OK but not great.  I mean, how hard is it mess up pasta, right? I can whip up a great pasta meal right from the box, too! So, there may be expectations for something delicious when prices are north of $20 for pasta dishes, so this review is intended to help you manage and lower them.  The ambience is, however, lovely for a sit-down meal and service is friendly enough.
Awesome food and service! Kind, caring and professional personnel. Certainly a great place for a special dinner
No comment

I don't understand how this place has 4.5 stars. Everything about the experience in da Claudio was very underwhelming. I travelled from Hong Kong expecting NYC to be home to some of the best restaurants. Service was mediocre at best. Our food came out slow, and the dishes served were that of a 2-3 star restaurant. I ordered the bucatini arrabiata and my friend ordered the black linguine. Both dishes came out an hour after our initial order. The food was ok, but nothing memorable. Cocktails were ok but nothing amazing. Being a restaurant with a 4.5 star rating in NYC I was expecting much more. How disappointing this meal was...

Friendly staff had the Torta di Cioccolato e Ricotta $10.00 (Chocolate and ricotta cake with ricotta gelato.) Was fine but very small, especially the baby scoop of gelato. Great little salumeria near the entrance and a lot of space to roam.
No comment
Had the fritto misto and gnocchi for takeout. Although you have to expect takeout to be of lesser quality, the flavor and portions were very underwhelming.

I have been here a few times for a decent if overpriced for a weekday lunch. Yesterday, however, I had a fried oyster sandwich (panini Sebastiano) that was 92% focaccia, 4% shredded cabbage, 3% breading around the oyster and 1% actual oyster.  for like $16.  I skipped eating most of the bread. I was hungry again by 3 pm.

Excellent Italian and American fare. I had the Steak with a balsamic reduction and roasted potatoes. I was in heaven! The steak was cooked perfectly and so savory and tender. The restaurant had this olive dip that they serve with your choice of bread which gives a nice touch and character to the restaurant. The restaurant is spacious and was bustling with a lot of people. The owner Claudio was there and was so friendly and kind. I love restaurants that the owner is actually working in the restaurant. This ensures quality food and service. If you're in FiDi, I'd highly recommend it!

The food was alright but would probably have been better if the pasta dishes came out hot. They were a little less than lukewarm. I did enjoy our buratta dish and the cocktails. I would definitely give it another try. Service was great!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Delicious Italian cuisine. You will not be disappointed no matter what you order. We spent a week in NYC and twice chose to eat here. The first night I chose a lasagna as I was not feeling very adventurous. It was baked to perfection and filled with flavor. On my second visit I had the octopus; wow! The presentation was beautiful and it was seasoned to perfection. My wife and father in-law fell in love with their specialty drink. I did not get the name but it was their twist on a margarita. The manager and owner where both onsite and took time to explain the menu and answer any questions we had. We where very pleased with our dining experience.
No comment

We were looking for an Italian restaurant near our hotel and this was about a block away so the location was great for us. As soon as we walked in we were greeted by our waitress who was extremely sweet and helpful. She was probably the best part of our dining experience, not that the food wasn't good, it just wasn't great. I ordered the carbonara and it was literally spaghetti and pancetta  with maybe a bit of Parmesan.  Other family members' meals were good though and the tiramisu was amazing.

It was a Friday afternoon when we walked in being the first guests of the day. The restaurant is large, well decorated, very modern and just straight out beautiful. Service was prompt and our waitress did a great job of going over the menu in detail. I'm kicking myself for forgetting the name however there is a margarita drink with pomegranate. This will be one of the best things you will have in life. The food was great and decently portioned. I had the eggplant   Parmigiana which was perfect, better than my own I sadly admit lol. The misses had the pollo alla Milanese which was hands down the juiciest chicken breast I had. Her mom had Filei which was mouthwatering. Safe to say we will return and soon.
Loved the food just impeccable,  and the staff, they are just kind and made perfect suggestions for our dinner
No comment

The service was impeccable and the food was absolutely delicious. The ambience is perfect for a get together and for a nice date. I had the octopus appetizer, the clam pasta, the penne special with veal, and the gnocchi. Everything was mouthwatering, especially the gnocchi. My friends and I got there with only 20 minutes of happy hour left, but our waitress was happy to put in our orders and the serve us the drinks whenever we preferred. Overall, the experience was wonderful and I can't wait to come back again!

This place did not disappoint! Called to squeeze in a party of 8 for a Bachelorette party and they seriously came through! Not only did they accommodate us an hour after calling but the manager even asked the Brides name and sent out a big slice of Tiramisu with a custom note of Congratulations with our lovely friends name on it! She was beyond surprised and so happy plus the food and drinks were yummy and the place was packed! 2 thumbs up

No comment

So, I received a recommendation from the Aloft Hotel just down the street on Ann St. Mike, the front office manager, recommended the place. I took a walk down to look at it and was very pleased with what I saw. I sat at the bar after being greeted by very nice staff. Tara, my bartender, greeted me graciously. She was perfect in being attentive, but not intrusive. I ordered the caesar salad and the fusilli pasta dish with lamb ragu. Both were excellent. The fusilli is a true gem with the saffron cream - just the right combination of flavors. My dinner was a good value for the money, but the people made the experience. I would/will go again, and I would recommend Da Claudio to anyone staying in or near the Financial District. Buon appetito!

No comment

I have lived downtown for many years and am happy that there are so many great places to eat now!  Da Claudio is still my favorite go to because I know I will enjoy true hospitality at its best.  The food is fresh and flavorful. My favorites are the Cacio e Pepe, octopus, and the prosciutto di Parma.   If you like burrata, the special here is not to be missed and the fish of the day specials are also always very good.  The staff is welcoming, attentive, very knowledgeable about the menu, and always happy to recommend the perfect wine or cocktail to compliment your meal.   Great food, great service, great vibe - that's probably what keeps the local regulars coming back to Da Claudio.

Great food, fast delivery, and exceptional service. Be sure to ask for Hannah - she's kind, knowledgeable, and makes the whole experience a 10/10.

Went here for Valentine's Day and had a great time. The service was great, the waiter was so friendly and helpful with the menu. Very cozy vibe, it was a great night here. Will be back, thank you for the great experience.

Disappointed all the way around from service to food quality. Our waiter didn't even come to check and the food quality was truly over rated!  The decor inside was nice but I would not go back to this restaurant.
My team and i enjoyed happy hour drinks and food after our flight to nyc. We stayed for dinner and more drinks. Location is so close to world trade center stop and ambiance is casual fancy.

On a chilly summer night in NYC, this hit the spot perfectly.  We took advantage of some great happy hour prices on drinks and delicious apps.  I had the bucatini arriabiata which was perfectly spicy.  My husband loved the fusilli with lamb ragu.  They asked whether we had a special occasion and it was my FIL's birthday and they came out with a personalized happy birthday plate.  Great place.  Recommend.
No comment

Very nice downtown Italian spot. I had the special pasta which was light and flavorful with mushrooms  and artichokes. Very delicious. Great selection of wine- by the glass I enjoyed a very nice Gavi. Service was outstanding and what you expect from a fine restaurant like this.

Totally obsessed with this place, it is a real hidden gem. Definitely one of the best Italian restaurants in FiDi. All of the pastas are fantastic, but I think the bucatini is my favorite. Lots of good starter options, great specials, a solid wine selection, and the service is always top notch. I bring folks here all the time, for everything from business lunches to double dates, and everyone always loves it.
No comment

Service top notch and staff very educated in the foods and wines they serve. Food was phenomenal and fast but of the highest quality. The atmosphere was comfortable yet upscale. Will return when ever we are back at the area!  Just keep doing what you are doing. You have perfected the restaurant experience.

That little restaurant in NYC was the best I every had Italian food. We had 2 dishes.  The spinach pasta was delicious and the kale salad was good and tasty.  I wish they had  one in Los Angeles so I can recall the taste again. Yummy   First time to NYC. I'm sure if I go back to NYC I will be back to eat again.
No comment

My adult daughters and I visited the city and after learning Les Halle's was closed looked for a nearby equivalent. After some work, made a reservation at Da Claudio. It was just a block away, and the atmosphere and food was very good. It was a quiet night in the financial district, Friday before Christmas. The restaurant was busy, but calm. Our server was attentive, but not intrusive. We will certainly be back to expand our menu experience.

This restaurant was absolutely fabulous... the food, the service. We had a dinner party for over 30 people from out of town... and they all couldn't stop talking about how good the experience was. Our server Julianna was attentive and beyond pleasant planning it with Linda was simple. We also frequent the restaurant as locals and have only had the best dining experiences. I can't recommend going here enough.
No comment
Amazing dinner here last night! The customer service was top notch, the lasagna was absolutely delicious, and the ambiance was perfect. Would highly recommend and we will definitely be back!

I had an okay experience here. We started with the octopus tentacle salad, which was decent. The spaghetti alle vongole (clams) was a little undercooked - probably trying to be al dente, but not quite there. We also had cocktails - my boyfriend's was a complicated one that involved egg whites, and I had a fruity drink. Overall, nothing stood out to me. I'd say I prefer the Italian takeout place near my apartment.
We stopped in for a late lunch after a morning of sightseeing. Seriously, the best Italian food I have ever had. Amazing!  Try the gnocchi and Fumetto. Great service as well.

The food and service was here was fantastic. In NYC for business and decided to try this place on a whim based upon other Yelp reviews and I was not disappointed; staff was friendly and attentive, wine list with a whole host of old world offerings was impeccable, and the pasta was sooo damn good (I went with the Spaghetti Carbonara but also heard the table next to me raving about the gnocchi). I'll be back next time I'm in NYC!

I travel a lot to NY for work and always make it a point to visit Da Claudio while I am there. The food is amazing and the service is always great. Noemi is always my server and her service is always exceptional. Consistency in service and food quality keeps me coming back.
No comment

This was a place I found with my fiancé by a review on here. This was by far the best dinner I have ever had in New York. You will be impressed the staff, environment, and food. This is the place to bring a significant other, as it is overall impressive!

This afternoon I went to Da Claudio for lunch. I had the Brodetto di Pesce (fish soup) with Lobster Tomato Broth, Clams, Mussels, Shrimp and Calamari (squid). It was properly flavored and not at all overpowering. The fish was perfectly cooked. Service was perfect, the room was small but pretty, and the entire staff was extremely pleasant. I will give them 5 stars as the service carried them over the foods 4.5.

I've ordered their meat and cheese plate a few times but had yet to actually dine in until last night. I live in the area and walk by this place weekly and always thought it looked so cute from the outside. I stopped in after work last night and grabbed a bite alone at the bar. The bartender Jose is extremely friendly and attentive. I overheard him explaining their large Italian wine list to the ladies next to me, so he actually has a good grasp of the wines they serve. I ordered a glass of wine, their meat and cheese plate and their fusilli with lamb ragou. The meat and cheese platter here is generous and tasty, satisfying those sweet and salty desires. The ragou on the fusilli was really flavorful and the meat was extremely tender. Some pieces of my pasta were a bit beyond al dente to the point of being a bit underdone. I notice this is the case with thicker noodle pasta sometimes so would just flag that. I also think generally that the prices for the past dishes are on the higher end, almost all at least $20. Otherwise I was extremely pleased with my experience here and will definitely be back!
No comment
