No comment
Spaghetti was alright. I've had better elsewhere. Service was decent. There was only two other tables full when my friends and I ate here.
No comment

Serious gem in my neighborhood, the pasta dishes were absolutely delicious. Perfectly balanced and flavored. The dessert was one of my favorites I've had in my seven years here in New York. The service was great, reasonably priced bottles of wine, and a lovely and non pretentious atmosphere.
No comment

We always have the best service here. Very friendly and efficient all the time. Dominic the manager is always good at checking in on us and making sure everything is running smoothly. Elizabeth is our favorite waitress, and Jose is a visionary at the bar. Great food and great people will always keep me coming back. Favorite place in the neighborhood for a local!
No comment

We walked into restaurant and was greeted and seated right away. Staff were very prompt and friendly. Prices for meals were reasonable. Food was brought out quickly and presented well. Pasta was tasty and plenty of sauce. Salad was large portion and very tasty. Chicken was a little dry and small portion for the price but well seasoned and tasty. My brother in law has lasagna and said it was better than he has in Rome. Complimentary bread and olive oil was given and was homemade and fresh. Great restaurant without the huge price tag.
No comment
No comment

Just arrived in NYC and starving. Staying in the financial district, I can't usually find a decent place to dine downtown. But this time, I stumbled upon Da Claudio. A hidden gem. Nice open space with a view of the kitchen. Plenty of seats at the at bar. Score! I ordered the crudo antipasti - uni with egg yolk, yellow tail, and smoked salmon. Delicious! The house made nero linguine with prawns is a must have!
Fantastic menu with wonderful specials. I love the ambiance of the cool downtown space with financial nerds meeting artists and local residents.
No comment

We stopped by here on our family trip to NYC. It is off the beaten path but worth the effort. We had an amazing dinner. The waitress gave us some great suggestions for dinner. While everyone else enjoyed their pasta dishes I had one of the best steaks of my life. If you get a chance, check this place out.
I tried this restaurant out last weekend and thought it would be good based on the reviews, but it was average at best and I thought the food was pretty bland.

I am not one to write reviews but unfortunately my experience has to be noted. Overpriced for the qaulity, The NY strip was not worth the price paid. I am shocked with our $200 bill for me and my girlfriend as tonight's dinner was not worth it.

Had wandered the night before in what I now know is the food desert of this section of the financial district. My hotel suggested this restaurant and I am happy to say that it was a fantastic suggestion. And a great little find. I concur with everyone that the service, from the owner to our lovely waitress to the support staff, was superb. And the food was exactly the comfort we were looking for. The ambiance was great: nothing too fancy - simple and inviting. A great neighborhood restaurant that I will remember next time in town.
One of the best options in northern FiDi. Really have enjoyed coming here over the past few years. Great pasta and great main dishes.
No comment
No comment
Mediocre overpriced Italian food. It defintely has no right to be 4 stars. Service is great, however, $26 for a dried out salty piece of porketta is unreasonable.

Very delicious! We went with everything the pleasant waitress recommended and were not at all disappointed! Had chicken scallopini, beet salad and Nutella cheesecake with salted caramel. Wanted to lick our plates clean. Such great flavors. Best meal we have had in NYC! Seasonal pumpkin drink was wonderful, too! Great service, too. Price reasonable and a great value for such a wonderful meal! Thanks Yelp for pointing us to this restaurant!
No comment

Fantastic service, great wine and unbelievable food! After much research on yelp I found this gem and made a reservation on opentable. Stopped in for dinner on a Friday evening. Enjoyed the polipo (octopus) and a special mozzarella burrata appetizers. Both were huge portions. We cleaned both plates and should've stopped there, but they have fresh homemade pasta!! We tried two different homemade pasta dishes. Both mouthwatering and delicious. We could not finish them because we were full from the giant appetizers. We took the pasta leftovers back to our hotel and finished them off for a midnight snack! I wish they had a location in Chicago!!
This place  is definitely on my list of the best restaurants with Italian food! Loved everything, drinks, appetizers, entrees!

I stopped in twice on a recent visit to NY and loved the food. One night, I had the pasta fagioli soup, which was yummy, and one of the salad specials with grilled romaine - I didn't love the salad but it was ok. The next trip, my friends and I had pasta dishes. We all cleaned our plates - I had the bucatini arrabbiata and it was very good. The actual pasta on all the dishes was delish. My friends had and really liked the spaghettini alle vongole with clams and spaghetti carbonara.  Additionally he food prices were very reasonable. The one con was that service was slow.
No comment
No comment
No comment

What a gem!  Lovely, simple, contemporary decor followed by superior service. The young waiter  from Mestre(I did not get his name) was quick, efficient, accurate and informative, not pushy  but personable with no hint of  corporate language.  The menu was varied and the ingredients top notch.  The burrata was a dream. Heads on prawns were fresh, and the squid ink pasta with spicy tomato sauce were a delight. The gnocchi were just right.
No comment
Great food and fantastic service. Good location for grabbing dinner around Fidi/Downtown area.

No complaints here besides the fact that I don't know Italian, so the menu was hard to navigate.  However, our server was very helpful and answered all of our questions.  I had the spaghetti carbonara which was delicious with big chunks of pancetta and a creamy green sauce.  I'll be back to try the pasta with spicy tomato sauce which looked delicious on another patron's plate!

Stopped in last night.  Nice place, good vibe.  Shout out to Tara, our server.  Very pleasant, personable and professional.  Food was pretty good.  Not the absolute greatest but definitely okay.  If you are in this part of the city, it would be worth checking it out.  Entrees in the low-to-mid $20's.
No comment
Very nice place. I like the atmosphere and the FOOD! I like very much italian cuisine, and it's great there! Recommend.

My coworker and I grabbed a lite lunch to celebrate my birthday.  It was a nice location in an area where there are way more fast food options available than places to grab a decent meal.  Not sure if it was a special but we had a Caprese salad that was delicious I nearly licked the plate.  I had the Garganelli (wagyu bolognese, parmigiano).  It was tasty, even more so the next day when I enjoyed my leftovers.  I'd definitely visit again.
No comment

Amazing meal here with my fiance! The atmosphere was not pretentious at all and the food was amazing. Had, by far, the best gnocchi of my life. The owner was friendly and interactive with the diners, but not in an obtrusive way, which added to the overall experience. Small touches really made this restaurant stand out, while the atmosphere was still casual.
No comment

I used to enjoy this restaurant, but the menu keeps changing and the portions keep getting smaller!  They exchanged some delicious items on the menu for unique dishes that just don't work.  I ordered a Caesar salad which consisted of a few skimpy uncut, cooked salad leaves.  The main course was alright, but not nearly enough food.  The meal was quite expensive, but my table was pretty hungry afterwards.  Also, this place charges for in-house filtered water and ice.  My cocktail was $15 with a $2 extra fee for ice.  The waitress tried to explain the charge unsuccessfully.  Although I like the vibe here, I feel like this restaurant is attempting to take advantage of its clients.  I can't imagine that the owner, who walks around and seems like a very warm Italian man,  actually approved some of these business decisions.

Thank you fellow yelpers for guiding me to this place. Spent a few hours at 9/11 museum, exited there kinda down. Wanted a good Italian meal. Da Claudio did not disappoint. Very nice restaurant. From wait staff to manager, service is great! Food is amazing. There was 4 of us. Started with appetizer-the frito mixto was insanely good! We shared 2 entrees-enough to have room for dessert. The Nutella cheesecake and tiramisu all home made in house were sick!!!! So good!!!! Will definitely return.

Great find by my hotel. Everything was delicious and the bartender was helpful and attentive. Highly recommend the cacio e pepe.
A reliable spot in FiDi/Fulton area where it can be difficult to find a good meal. Low key spot, good neighborhood spot.
No comment
Delicious food.  Great portions.  The staff and owner are wonderful!  I go here frequently.   The drink are great too.

The food was ok. The burrata came w thinly sliced peaches. My carbonara was not very delicious, big disappointment. When I got the check, I was also disappointed the burrata was $20. Generally, not very super delicious food that was overpriced. They are open a bit on the later side, so that's how I ended up here. Might try again but not anytime soon.
No comment

A hidden gem in fidi! We stumbled across this place and it's absolutely delicious. It's always crowded enough to have a good vibe and energy but not overly packed where you're sitting on top of your neighbor or waiting hours for a table. The black linguini with prawns and lasagna are real winners and the grilled vegetable app is fabulous!! Wine is fairly priced and service is great! Highly recommend good for a date night, place to bring parents or if you just want a nice dining experience alone! Enjoy!!

Great Sunday evening dinner.  Quiet and romantic lighting.  Attentive servers.  Nice wine list.  I had the squid ink pasta.  It was fantastic and had a lovely spicy sauce.  My husband had the lasagna and loved it.  We are so glad we found this restaurant while staying at a nearby hotel.  Highly recommend!

I recently stopped by here to grab something to eat and I really like the food. The price is reasonable and the food is good. The restaurant is also nice. I will be coming back. I recommend this place, try them out.

Waiters were all genuinely friendly and there was a good happy hour and really good selection of wine. Food was alright. If you're looking for amazing italian, this is not really that place. We were adding copious amounts of salt to everything because the food was a little bland. One guy filling water kept cursing in Spanish under his breath so overall the total experience wasn't a great one. May come back just for drinks and snacks.
No comment

First time was somewhat better, decided to give them a second chance cause we live around the corner, but there won't be a third. Waitress w an attitude ("just as I said, black sea bass"), when asked what bass comes with failed to mention beans or fennel or some greens (said squash and zucchini). And when I asked her what that was wrt fennel, confidently said squash. Do I look dumb? Came to us only when called while to the table next to us about 3 or 4 times. Hate beans. $37 sea bass oversalted. Worst $37 ever spent. Would have ruined the night if I didn't find out the next min that GROM serves hot chocolate as of today.
Delicious meal and impeccable service!  Visiting from out of town, highly recommend Da Claudio to locals.

What a great place and service!!! I stopped by at Da Claudio the other day for a quick dinner and sat at the bar. The bartender Edgar was super attentive and friendly. He mixed an amazing bourbon, honey and raspberry cocktail. For my meal I had a linguine pasta, that was recommended by bartender Edgar and it was a great choice !!! Really recommend this place: great service and great meal!!! Definitely will come back soon again.
As we remembered from Cafe Linda, the food, wine and service was absolutely 5-star.  What else can we say?
Food was simply fantastic. Italian food is hard to standout- what a bargain for the quality of food in NYC.
Absolutely fantastic food here! I had the exquisite lasagna and custom wine. The prices were exceptional during happy hour and the service was great. I will be returning to this establishment soon.

Came here based on the recommendations and was not impressed. Had the spaghetti carbonara, which was almost flavorless. In fact it seemed to be some sort of black hole of of flavor in which no amount of salt (which you should never have to do) would satisfy the sucking void of taste happening in my mouth. Tried to wash it down with a glass of Chianti. Tasted like old cranberry juice. If I was paying attention, I would have realized the fact that the front door is hard to open was the universe giving me a heads up.

Picked this restaurant based on the reviews and proximity to where we were, and wow, we were not disappointed at all! Absolutely delicious food and meticulous service! Everyone loved their meal! I had the wagyu beef bolognese lasagne and I was to die for. My daughter had the rosemary pappardelle with the sun-dried tomato pesto and absolutely loved it. My wife went for the Scaloppine di Pollo, which also was delicious. Following the meal, desert was of course on order, and the tiramisu and Nutella cheesecake did not disappoint. Service was top notch, so I definitely recommend it and of course, we will be back if coming back to New York City.

The food came out under cooked. We asked to remake the dish. When we got the food, the portion of the dish was ridiculous. The dish wasnt worth of 20 dollars. also the waitress gave us a wrong check and we almost payed extra for nothing. Such a disappointment!!
Delicious lasagna! Among the best I've had. Their soft shell crab special is also amazing.
No comment
No comment

Excellent food, especially the artichoke appetizer and the beet greens salad!  The service was knowledgeable and very accommodating to my husband's dairy allergy. Welcoming, informal atmosphere and reasonable prices. Definitely 5 stars!
No comment

Horrible food and service. Never been more disappointed. Sea urchins were not fresh. Pasta were bad. Calamari were tiny. Very overpriced. Rude people. Can't understand how they got those great reviews.
No comment
Great spot for appetizers / Happy hour in the early evening, I've been there 3 - 4  times. Friendly staff. My wife and I had dinner there a couple nights ago and had a couple excellent pasta.

Relaxing and beautiful atmosphere. The pizza is authentic Italian styles, hand tossed dough & wood fired. All the pasta is handmade and they have an excellent drink menu. I went with a part of 6 and the food was timely and service was great.
Visited on a recent trip to NYC and absolutely loved this place.  It was rather crowded, with tables in very close proximity, but once you get settled the service and food was excellent.
Horrible service. We were thinking about tippling less than 20% however we later learned that a 20% surcharge was included. Good food.

Read the many 5 star reviews and went for dinner. Wishing now I paid attention to the hand full of dissenting voices. In my view, the prices are higher than the food deserves. There are some tasty things - a very nice beet salad, for example. But generally, it's mediocre Italian food trying to look authentic to an American audience. The service was speedy and efficient - they're trying to turn tables, and you are made to feel it. This is the second review I've ever written on Yelp, and I feel uncomfortable being so negative, but I was really annoyed to have spent so much money on this dinner.
No comment

Fantastic supreme service and even more amazing food.  Ordered a grilled veggie panini and all the ingredients were so fresh and delicious.  The price was $12 and I have never been so happy about a sandwich that doesn't have any meat in it.  The pesto was made to perfection, with just enough kick in your taste buds.  The meal also includes fresh salad on the side.  I had this for take-out, but the owner was nice enough to offer us some parmesan cheese with balsamic reduction on a small plate, while we waited for the masterpiece of a sandwich to arrive in our hands.  Will definitely come here again for more deliciousness!  Staff are so nice and friendly, willing to answer any questions you have about their menu!  Decor is beautiful, even though they're on a weird street/area.
Amazing food, friendly staff, perfect ambiance, fairly priced, great menu.  just amazing all around.  everything we got was loved by us all.  highly recommend.

Great service and a really nice spot.  I had the gnocchi, which was fresh and light with peas and candied lemon.  It was an early meal on a Sunday evening ... liked it so much I might go back again tomorrow!

My experience was from a delivery order. The portions are extremely small since the charcuterie for 2 was barely for one person. The gnocchi had hardly any sauce on it. It was overpriced for the minuscule amount of food. Maybe the in restaurant experience is better.

While in NYC with my family visiting a college we stopped in here for dinner. The decor is very nice and staff extremely friendly. I ordered the lasagna which was good not great but kinda expensive ($24) for the portion size. Same went for my wife's eggplant parmigiana ($22). My daughter was having a hard time finding something to order since she doesn't eat meat and decided on one of the specials which was a grilled salmon. Her salmon portion was small, a bit dry, and was not worth the $35 price tag. Btw those picture shown on their site on Yelp has much larger portion sizes than I observed at the resturant. May or may not return just due to other choices in the area.

In New York for a week on business with almost no time to eat!  Da Claudio had an online order option and it was right around the corner from the Hilton Millenium on Church St. where I was staying.  Pick up was on time and effortless and the place was so inviting I decided to have a glass of beautiful Barolo and relax for a few minutes.  The bartender Jose was sweet and kind, he seemed delighted to open a bottle just for my order :-).   I then enjoyed a fresh pappardelle with tomatoes and rosemary that was so good, I thought of the restaurant a couple of nights later when I had slightly more time.  Again, Jose didn't disappoint - he even remembered my name!  Sat at the bar and had a spectacular seafood bouillabaise-type dish with lovely bread and fragrant italian olive oil - to die for!  And of course another glass of that Barolo /Barbaresco wine (can't remember the name but it was jammy and lush on the tongue - yum).  Da Claudio has now become a New York favorite in a city full of incredible eateries but not always filled with charming and caring serving staff like Jose and his colleagues.  Their kindness and attention to detail is what makes this restaurant truly stand out.
I come for business to this area and this is an amazing meal. Great service and even better food. I eat here almost every tome I come to NY.
The food is really good!! Love the pasta with squid. Will definitely come back again.

If the staff had been more friendly we would have given this Italian inspired restaurant a 5 star rating. We ate lunch here. Good location close to financial district. Two of us had the roasted chicken with grilled seasonal vegetanles (mostly squash).  Excellent and quite a large portion. One of us had the buratta cheese over chopped cucumbers and it was excellent. Tiramisu desert was great, as well. The bread basket was just okay.
I had the Garganelli - it was fabulous! Do not overlook this resturant - the Italian food is homemade and tastes wonderful.
No comment

I feel bad giving this place only 3 stars but I was not truly impressed.  The salumeria was ok. Some of the assortment was really good. And some was really not so good.  I had the trofie baby octopus dish and she had the gnocchi.  The gnocchi was WAY better.  WAY.  Mine was bland and with only a couple of pieces of octopus... the Nutella cheesecake was good - not too nutty.  Our server Brittany was attentive and patient.  Thank you!
Food, service, and ambiance was very good.   Not too quiet nor overly noisy, so comfortable.   Wine was a little pricy.   But would definitely return

Delicious, yes please. I would totally go back. I have also recommended this place to many people. Homemade pasta and completely reasonable prices. The service was also awesome. I hope this place survives, located at a really ugly spot. lol.
Food was good but overpriced. Besides, you are forced to tip, it is already added even for two people. When the bill comes they ask for more.
No comment
No comment
Food was quite spongy but not bad, chicken in the pasta felt microwaved rather than genuinly cooked. Pizza was good very soft but good nontheless.
Sat at the bar, food was great and service was friendly. Wine was decent as well, but would have liked to see a greater selection. Wine was more expensive than the food...but when in Rome.

We had Lasagne and Fussili and both were extremely tasteful and delicious! The waiters are very nice, it was a great experience all in all. I absolutely recommend this restaurant! Affordable, friendly and their food is top notch!
Great service. Cute lights in the window. Good selection of drinks and even in happy hour. Food was yum too!! Enjoyed ourselves.

It wasn't bad but it wasn't great either. Had the gnocchi that were good but the pesto sauce was bland. The green beans undercooked and bland. I also had the spinach as a side, calamari and dried beef appetizer which were all unexceptional. Service was good. Don't think we'll be back. Too many great restaurants in NY to waste on "ok."
Was here around 4:30, happy hour, almost no guest at all. The bartender was quite uninterested, ordered a Cosmo, have had better. The complementary snacks were quite ok, don't think I'll come back.

The Classic Burger is delish. Real French fries. Veggie salad, fresh corn, avocado, tomatoes and feta cheese. Yum! Service great. Near WTC and 9/11 Memorial and National Museum. Music and ambience great.
Great service, amazing food! We were 4 people ordering 5 dishes and they were all a great success! The eggplant lasagna was perfect, something I would like to come back to. Very recommended

Totally out of my image. This is one excellent and must visit Italian restaurant in Financial district. I had a wonderful night with my mate. The owner is generous with sense of humor. Their gnocchi is super tasty with white sauce. I'm really impressed cause the price is relatively low. The UNI spaghetti as the seasonal dish was a little salty at first. BUT they insisted to offer me a new one even though I felt it's an acceptable salty. The remade one was astonished, the sauce had wonderful uni flavor and coated well on the well cooked spaghetti. Absolutely on the revise list.
No comment
No comment

Really great service, attentive staff. The food was good but not great. I would have hoped for fresher pasta. Beautiful presentation. We got the fettuccine with truffle oil and mushrooms and the spaghetti carbonara with pancetta. The two dishes were good but I've had better. Beautiful decor. Very quiet restaurant so a great environment if you want to have an intimate conversation.

In a city that has plenty of quality Italian restaurants Da Claudio is your local FiDi pit stop.  The food isn't there to blow you away, but it is there to fill you up with friendly people with a local vibe.  I've enjoyed three meals at Da Claudio and they're very consistent with nice people and a decent meal.  The wine list definitely needs some work, but overall it provides good value for money and is worth stopping in.

The service was gracious from the moment we walked in. My husband, me and our baby (in a stroller), we're on a walk after dinner and wanted to stop in somewhere for dessert and coffee/wine. It's always risky just popping in a restaurant you've never been in Manhattan with a stroller, but this worked out great. They were very accommodating and seemed genuinely happy to have us. I had Tiramisu, which was light, flavorful, and a large portion. Husband had the recommended Nutella cheesecake, which was very tasty, great hazelnut flavor, and chopped hazelnuts on top. The food was just what we wanted. The service was excellent. We are looking forward to returning for dinner sometime soon.

We were wandering around trying to find a fun place for lunch. I found DI CLAUDIO on Yelp and glad I did. Atmosphere is clean and modern. The Chardonnay was good. The grilled Caesar was excellent. The dressing creamy, croutons crunchy, and the Parmesan additive. We ordered the carbonara and it was superb. It was creamy with just the right amount of Parmesan and pancetta. I would come here again!

Went with a group dinner with my wife's coworkers.  It was okay and hit the spot, but nothing that wow'ed me.  The lasagna was tasty, but maybe something else would have been better.  The bread and the spread were delicious and the specialized drinks.

A true neighborhood gem.  When I moved to Battery Park a few years ago, I had a bit of culture shock due to the lack of good food options. (Say what you will about Murray Hill, but there are a ton of reasonable, solid dining options.) Sufficed to say, Da Claudio hits that spot of quality food, decent prices, and a true place for the locals (and tourists too I suppose).  I pretty much always order the Chicken Milanese because it's the best I've ever had.  It's light yet filling, everything you want in a meal.  A good wine list, and nice appetizer selection as well.  This place isn't about to be featured in Eater or Thrillist, which is probably why I love it so much in the first place.

We had a business dinner for 18 at Da Claudio and everything was just right--we had chosen a specific menu of choices and it was all printed out nicely, our chosen wines were open and ready to pour when we arrived, service was excellent, attentive, and the food was very good.  Nice atmosphere, a standout especially in FIDI where there are not as many choices as in other neighborhoods for good, reasonable restaurants. Have been many times for lunch, too, highly recommend the octopus appetizer!

This hidden gem is amazing ! The service, food, drinks, atmosphere are a home run... it's my new favorite. The wait staff make you feel like a regular , the food was spectacular... I can't even pronounce what I ordered but it was based on our servers recommendation ( mushroom fettuccine dish with a creamy garlicky truffle sauce) it was divine ... my husbands carbonara was on point too! This place was amazing! I'm go glad we found it on yelp!  Best choice of the night ! Clean , wonderful, delicious experience!!!!  We will be back!
No comment
Great Italian - modern, delicious, family ambiance. Veal was tender and tasty. Carbonara to die for. Octopus was simple and delicious. Yes!
No comment

We go here as often as we can. Great vibe, cocktails, wine, food - the whole package. You just get a warm feeling walking in the door. Claudio is a welcoming host, Gabriel a talented bartender (mastered the skill of being there just when you want him), and the FOOD is divine. We've gone for romantic dinners, family dinners, just drinks, nights out with a big group - honestly this is our favorite place.

Dish was ok. Not too bad but service wasn't very good. I said to the hostess I was there for lunch. They seem to forgot about me after I was seated. Well the bartender took an order. They didn't bring me bread. And I even saw my food sitting on the kitchen counter and no one seems to care to bring it to me. Bartender was busy making drinks and no one paid attentions for that food. The place wasn't even packed. And this place wasn't cheap.
Our service was excellent and the food was fantastic. I had the Lasagna and my wife has gnocchi and we loved it.

Went last night on a whim! My dad had the lamb chops which were phenomenal (especially the potatoes) and mom had the parsley risotto with cod but only 3 tiny pieces of cod, very skimpy. I had the fettuccini with pesto and tomatoes which was very fresh but needed more flavor. All and all was great. Also, they made a mistake on the check but fixed it very quickly. Even saw Danny DeVito having dinner with his family!

Amazing service amazing. The food delicious feels like I am in Italy. My waitress Noemi was fabulous she suggested that I have the spaghetti with smoke proscuto. Her attentiveness to us was just lovely. I am definitely comming back with my family and friends the next time I am in NYC. The owner is  exceptional really cares about his clients. I love it. Go Da Claudio. Excellently incredible.

The food here is really delicate and most important of all delicious. The manager/boss literally checked every glass for water stain before putting them on the table. Of course, from all those details you can see around the place, one thing is for sure: people working at this place loves it very much. That's why you could feel their passion in every dish they serve. Great experience.
No comment

My only complaint about this place is that the food is just not very good, which is the most important thing to a restaurant. We had the lasagna, gnocchi, and carbonara, but only the lasagna was good. Gnocchi tasted very sweet which was kinda weird, and the carbonara was too salty. I decided to get the nutella cheesecake that everyone on Yelp has raved about, but that was disappointing too. The texture seemed like a no-bake cheesecake that I could easily whip up at home.

Food is really good here but service is a bit slow.  Also, the food is pretty expensive considering the portion.  I'm sure people coming here are expensing it so no issue with the hiked price.  $20-$35 for entrees during lunch is a bit outrageous considering the portions are tiny.  But it is fidi and the choices are limited...hard to find decent food down here.
Excellent food at a highly unlikely location.  Nice, bright atmosphere.  Pork tenderloin is to die for.  Wine by the glass selection excellent.  Really sweet lunchtime bartender.

This is probably the best Italian restaurant I have ever been to. The atmosphere is very mellow and welcoming. They have an extensive wine selection and specialty drinks. I ordered the lasagna which was absolutely amazing, and just the right portion. Try their house sparkling water too.

Beautiful, spacious restaurant. Setting is great for a business lunch/ dinner or dinner date. I've also stopped in for coffee meetings as well. Love having this gem in FiDi. I wish it opened at 11AM though and didn't close from 3-4 for a switchover. Perhaps they can have a simplified menu during the lunch/dinner change?

I came here with my boyfriend one night after receiving some terrible news.  I was sad and looking forward to a quiet dinner.  The place was empty, but the server seated us next to the only other guests in the restaurant.  Wanting some privacy, we asked to be seated in another section.   The staff had no problem with this.  But while we were seated, the owner (? or manager) (short brunette male) came over and asked us why we were seated in the chairs.  We explained.  And he said 'it's ok this time'.  No comment.  I live in the area and really wanted to like this place.  My salad tasted like it had been sitting in the dressing for too long all day.  My boyfriends risotto was not worth the calories.  Not sure why people give this place good reviews.  Mr manager/owner - don't power trip, especially on a dead night!
One of FiDi's best kept secrets. The food is fantastic and the service is on point with charm.

Superb. Italian with a unique flair.   Our party of 6 made a varied selection from the regular menu and specials and there was not a bit left on any plate.   The homemade pastas and gnocchi were amazing.   Great attentive service too.

We were searching for a restaurant for a good meal. Upon entering Da Claudio was impressed with the vibe and the attention. Special shout out to the bartender a beautiful dark haired perfect woman who with only a look knew to send the waitor over the mark of a true professional! My only regret, we did not sit at the bar, would have loved to interact with her. All the entries ordered by 5 of us were excellent and the wine list supercede expectations. All in all this restaurant was  a worthy find ND highly recommended.
No comment
Yes. I've been here twice. I am a huge fan of its design, space, and decor. Plenty of room between tables. Sitting at that big nice bar was nice. I'll be back!

Da Claudio is a great restaurant option in the Financial District. Claudio and his wife own this eatery and it is obvious that they have put a lot of love into their place from the delicious food to the fun vibe. I have known Claudio for years since I have lived down here for so long and I was thrilled when I found out he was opening his place on Ann Street. Please go if you want a delicious Italian feast with family and friends.

My wife and I came here for dinner Friday night and had a great experience. The cheese and meat plate was delicious for an appetizer. I had the fettucinni and my wife had the salmon which were both excellent. Good service and close to the WTC Path. We will be back.

Fantastic meal. We ordered the fettuccine, cheese plate, polenta, and seafood appetizer.  They have a good wine selection and the service is very attentive. All in all, I would recommend and will return!

Came here with my work colleagues for lunch. The service was extremely slow. The majority of the table had ordered paninis and it took almost an hour to be completed. The waiter recommended the "Linda" panini and it was more bread than actual shrimp. In addition, the bill was brought to the table while we were still eating. The restaurant was not crowded to warrant such haste considering our wait. For the price, I was very disappointed. Considering we were a party of 9 and the slow service, we were not offered any comps or discounts either. I will not be coming here again.

This is my very first review on Yelp and I am happy to make my compliments to this Italian Restaurant: was there on an informal business meeting and really enjoyed the service and the food.  We loved the combination of Italian smoked burrata with golden beets and Lola Rossa salad! Will go back for sure, and recommend to friends.

Had a great gnocchi that was perfectly complemented by their house parmigiana. Our waiter spoke Italian which made our dining experience so much easier to enjoy as my grandparents cannot speak English, but come from Italy. Very impressed and would come again.

Consistently good food and excellent service- try chicken  Milanese, prawns with black ink pasta, and paperdelle, which are always excellent. Service is friendly, professional and attentive. This is one of our favorite go to restaurants!

I had the pleasure of going this nice restaurant with my family & uncle & aunt visiting the US for the very first time this past weekend. We loved the atmosphere & how quickly accommodating they were to sit all 6 of us. We all loved our authentic Italian dishes & the great selections of wine that go perfectly together. Service was fantastic and we felt like part of the family. My family & I will definitely be returning soon.

This was a lovely lunch stop on our way to the 9/11 Memorial. The staff was extremely attentive. The food was great! We split a yummy salad and order O's spaghetti carbonara. Both were delicious! I would definitely recommend. The atmosphere was perfect for relaxing in the middle of a busy day of sight seeing. There was no street sign on Anna so when in doubt, turn at the food truck, the restaurant is on the opposite side of the street.

A great spot in Fidi! The food and wine are super high quality - I loved the lemon pasta with octopus and even the grilled vegetables were perfect. The space is big and perfect for large groups. Their paintings are a little random but add some interesting Italian comic-book like flair to the space.
A true Italian gem where the managers care about their customers from start to finish. Cheese and hams are imported, so delicious!!!

We used to go frequently when we lived in the neighborhood, and went back on Friday as our daughter wanted to enjoy their pasta for her birthday. We ordered 3 different kinds (of pastas), along with the fritto misto, meat & cheese plate, and fish of the day, and everything was delicious. The owners are so nice and welcomed us back and wrote her name with chocolate on the tiramisu plate, which was sweet (literally & figuratively!). Also, I like the space a lot, which has high ceilings and a modern vibe. We'll be back!
No comment
I must say their lamb ragu is on point. It's amazing!!! The location isn't great, kind of hidden really. I am not looking foward to this place getting too busy to handle walk ins.
Great place! Awesome food and awesome service. The price is also reasonable. I would come back again definitely!
No comment

A hidden gem in the financial district area, Da Claudio serves amazing Italian food... By far better than any Italian restaurant in that neighborhood.  The spaghetti carbonara was delicious and the menu allows you to substitute regular pasta with either whole wheat or gluten-free pasta for a surcharge of $2.  I also tried the pork shank which was incredibly tender and whatever sauce it came with was a perfect combination of sweet and savory.  The space is nice and open, with a large kitchen that you can see.  The bar is long and there is a section in the front where you can buy cheese and cured meats.
The food was tasty,  but meager servings.  Same with drinks. Service was okay too.  I live right nearby and will not go back.
Probably the best Italian food I've ever had! Was pleasantly surprised and impressed. Took my friends from out of town here and they all loved it!
No comment
It's hard to find reasonable pricing for Italian in the financial district. IT HAS NOW BEEN FOUND! Delicious pasta and cool drinks.

I cannot rave about this place enough. I've been a local for 2 years and no restaurant beats Da Claudio's. Amazing people, atmosphere, food, and always a new surprise on the menu. The food is delicious - have tried everything and nothing disappoints!!!! They go above and beyond, everything they do shows extra care and uniqueness that makes this place so special
Good place located in downton manhattan，nice owner and great Italian food，love it！
Found this restaurant by accident while staying st the Hilton.  I had the best Scaloppine di Pollo ever!  The service was good and nice atmosphere
No comment

This place was so great!!! Our server, Dondre, was so great! He knows all the food and can make excellent recommendations. The tiramisu is to die for. Highly recommend! Cutest restaurant in the financial district.

Yummy ....yummy I mean yummy cocktails, and the daily specials are just that very special and delicious!unique classy and fun. Do yourself a favor come in and have a drink my brother is behind the bar ;)
Went here on a Sunday night. Great food, nice ambience and great service! Must try :)
Delicious negroni. We also really liked the carbonara and gnocchi. A few nonalcoholic drinks on the menu in addition to the cocktails, which we really appreciated!

I came here for dinner with a group of friends and we were very impressed. I had the Wagyu bolognese and it was delicious. The pasta is all homemade, the ambiance is great, and the service was even better. Highly recommend if you are looking for nice authentic Italian food that isn't too pricey!

Honestly expected a lot more from this place from reading the reviews online. Maybe it just wasn't our style, but the atmosphere wasn't terribly welcoming + it took longer than appropriate for a server to take our drink orders. Was also very LOUD. We were sitting with 4 and barely spoke because we felt we had to shout at each other. The food was okay, nothing to write home about, especially for the prices. Definitely better options in the nearby area for Italian food, in my opinion.
No comment

As a very busy surgeon, I have often looked to Da Claudio for the perfect meal at the end of a demanding day.  Once inside, I look forward to chatting with my now dear friend Claudio and discussing what magic is being prepared in the open view kitchen.  The menu is outstanding- special plates are always interesting, but I highly recommend the carciofini as appetizer followed by the bucatini arrabiata.   For the main event, any of the entrees are outstanding.  The fish is fresh always and expertly prepared.  Having been raised in a traditional Italian family, food is very important to me, and Da Claudio is a throwback to that concept, but with a "Nueva Italian" twist ( as Claudio likes to say).   Highly recommend

Came in for a nice (expensive) dinner after museum walking.  We each had two glasses of wine, mostly off the recommendation from our server, the cab was the best.  The artichoke appetizer was good, small though to split.  My fiance had the lasagna and really enjoyed it.  I had the papparadell which was also very good.  We split the broccoli rabe and it was fine, on the bitter side.  We got the nutella cheesecake and a espresso martini for dessert.  The cheesecake was good but the drink was STUPID GOOD.  A must try.  Our server was excellent.  We would return.
No comment
No comment

Had dinner here, food was fine but nothing special. Service started off well but floundered by the end. We ordered wine before our entrees arrived and received them when we were almost done eating despite the place not being that busy. Also, when they were clearing the table one of the staff was careless and dropped a knife with food on it onto my shirt. Mistakes happen but nobody even tried to do anything about it or apologize. Maybe bring a glass of club soda or even take off a glass of wine on the house. It was very odd and not hospitable. Not an enjoyable experience for the price.
No comment
No complaints whatsoever! Delicious meal, friendly and attentive service, don't miss this place if you like good Italian food!
No comment
Awesome wee Italian place. Had the luscious butternut squash soup and spinach tortellini. My husband had the black linguini. A relatively quiet, upscale place, with reasonable prices.
Here for New Years Eve and found this amazing place.  We ended up visiting it twice for dinner before returning to Colorado.  Just a perfect place with a perfect menu.
Delicious lunch. Warm and friendly staff. Pasta special with gnocchi, squid and beans divine. Fresh and imaginative salad.  So close to World Trade but away from all the crowds of tourists.
They change their spaghetti octopus with trofie, and didn't update the menu. That's the worst. I didn't get what I was ordering for.
Italy brought to NYC.  Food is outstanding and very kid friendly. Something for everyone. My fav go to
No comment
This is my favorite dinner restaurant in all my 10 days of vacations in NYC. All was perfect!!!

Finally authentic Italian  the food was amazing. Wished I was with a group because so many dishes looked amazing. My new regular is born with a big enough space to accommodate.  Already can't wait to go back tomorrow

I went visit Da Claudio last week with my fiance and and old coworker. We had a cheesplate at the bar while enjoying a perfectly made Old Fasion followed by one of their signature drinks. Bartenders are really professional and helpful, It reminded my of those mixiologist bars. Strong menu and cozy place. I wish you the best of luck! We will be back.
No comment

Wow what a great find on a Sunday in the financial district!  The pasta is outstanding with homemade noodles and sauce that is flavorful but doesn't overpower.  Service was prompt and attentive.  Highly recommend !
Good food and atmosphere. The spicy black linguini with prawns is very good. The roasted potatoes side dish is also very good.
Excellent. Staff was great. Shared 6 dishes and enjoyed all of them. Lamb Ragu was spectacular.
Ate there last night. The food was 5 stars. So delicious, I can't wait to go back!  Best italian I've had in a while!
No comment

What a great meal...The service was incredible and the food was great and just what I wanted the night before the big 5 Boro Ride!  Would definitely recommend this and come back for another meal!  IF you like chicken the chicken with capers and lemon sauce with grilled veggies is incredible!
Best gnocchi I've ever had. Burrata was amazing, bolognese was perfect and the coctails were well balanced. I will definitely be back
No comment
Food was not memorable. We did go in on a Sunday night, it was very slow so not sure if it wasn't the regular chef but the food was below average. Much better Italian in the area!

I can't say enough amazing things about Da Claudio . Every time we go in there we are greeted by the owners and the accommodating friendly . Da Claudio have managed to create a Resturant that is great for a dinner with the family or a night out with friends. Recently they hosted a school event for us for about 150 people and they were flawless . It's hard to find a place that has great food, reasonable prices  and in a super friendly environment . If you want to go and just grab a drink the bartender makes a mean fresh cocktails .

Delicious, authentic Italian food, friendly service (if you get the right guy) and wonderful presentation. The burrata and prosciutto appetizer is visually appealing upon arrival, then after cutting into the burrata and letting it ooze into your mouth you will be far from disappointed. The shrimp risotto daily special I had was also satisfying, but I can't remember the name of it. Definitely coming back to this restaurant again for lunch or maybe even for dinner to try the prix fixe menu.

Da Claudio is a gem in FiDi. I ordered dinner via yelp last night but the pasta I ordered was not available anymore. The host kindly called me and offered other options. I've been to Da Claudio three times in the past year and service has always been on point. The food is delicious and the restaurant is very well managed.
A lovely dinner, a very gracious and patient wait staff, a really delightful evening.

With such high ratings for this place, we decided to come here. Staff was very friendly (and desserts), which earned this place an extra star, otherwise it would only have been 2 stars. The appetizers sounded pretty tasty from the description on the menu, but when presented,we asked ourselves if that's what we actually ordered. Needless to say, the appetizer wasn't very tasty. Moving onto the entrees. We were very excited to try the lamb ragu. Tasty lamb meat, but the sauce itself was VERY salty. The fusilli pasta also seemed to be on the under cooked side as the texture was a bit hard/doughy. The other entree we ordered was very salty as well, so the entrees were very disappointing. The desserts were delicious, however. The tiramisu was PERFECT. Very fluffy, creamy, delicate, and delightful. The sorbets were very good as well. Too bad we couldn't enjoy the appetizer and entrees. We can't see ourselves returning just for desserts, unfortunately.

Amazing staff! I have had the pleasure of having Yummy Spanish bartender assist me in my birthday partie and his service has been SUPERB. Their prices are right on target! I will definitely  book them again in the near future! Bartender here is your guy! Thanks, for such a fun night!!
Delicious food, the fried artichoke appetizer was fantastic as was the Nutella cheesecake with salted caramel.
We had the lasagna, eggplant and fish special at our table of four. We loved the food, atmosphere and service!

chic, trendy american/italian experience. bar tender does excellent work. salmon was cooked to perfection, super friendly staff. if your looking to escape the typical fidi irish bar dinner, this is a great option

We heard a lot of great things about Da Claudio's so we stopped by to check this restaurant out and will definitely return. We scoped out the menu and food and it looks amazing. We enjoyed cocktails at the bar with their delicious cheese and meet plate. Warm, friendly staff along with great pasta offerings. I am looking forward to returning for dinner after work!
Excellent food, modern Italian restaurant , friendly staff , excellent wine selection ,

My favorite local Italian restaurant. Owner (Claudio) is extremely warm and inviting and the food is simple yet amazing. Gets packed by locals and their families so make sure to get your reservation in early.
Delicious food, attentive but not hovering service; best coffee I've ever had. And on a rainy afternoon, it wasn't crowded at all which was an unexpected treat.

Always a great meal here. This is a hidden gem for Italian in the Financial District, and a must-do when I am there. I have brought a number of friends and colleagues here over the past year, and it is always a hit.

Outstanding, PERIOD!!  We were a group of approx 25 people and they nailed it!  The food was delicious and the service was top notch!  They did not give you an opportunity to want for anything- there were there to refill glasses, clear dirty dishes, bring out more food, or ask if you wanted a drink refill. Claudio was present and actively supervising. This is a local favorite-to-be I'm sure, but it's now a destination for this Hobokenite.

We were down in the financial district after moving away a couple years ago and decided to try this new place. What a GEM!!! Great vibes, even better food! We got the pesto pasta and spaghetti carbonara...both amazing. I would give anything for this place to have been open when I was living down here.  Will definitely be making more trips down here!!!

Service is prompt and attentive.  Waitress helped us with happy hour specials.  Menu is somewhat limited and portions are average.  Overall a good restaurant and price point for what you get.  Would go back.

Wow! Absolutely amazing! Great fresh tasty food. Spot on service from all. Our waitress Ivana was excellent! The owner Claudio who we shortly Interacted with was very hospitable and professional. The place is super immaculate as well. Literally the cleanest restaurant bathroom in NYC!
Loved the eggplant parmesan. The squid ink pasta had a red sauce on it that overpowered the ink, but it was still tasty. I would go back!

Stumbled upon this gem after visiting the One World Observatory. We were immediately greeted and pampered throughout the whole meal. The ambiance is wonderful, and the food is even better - the best lasagna and scaloppine di pollo I've had in my life. Try the tiramisu and you won't be disappointed! A++ we will be back the next time we visit NYC!

I don't write reviews but what happened tonight at De Claudio's has changed that. My GF and I went there for their Mother's Day dinner with my family. She and my father ordered the Pollo for two and it came very quickly. When she cut into the thigh we discovered that the chicken was undercooked (only after having a few bites that I completely regret) so we sent it back. It took them 20 minutes to refire and I was shocked to discover that instead of cooking a new chicken, they just put it back in the oven and completely dried it out. Then the check comes and instead of comping a dried piece of salmonella, I find they kept it on the check. Have you no pride De Claudio's? Either refire the entree with a new chicken or comp it, but instead you choose to give us crappy food and expect us to pay for it. I know I'm never coming back because I guess our complaints fell on deaf ears. Oh, and now my GF and I both have food poisoning so thanks for that De Claudio's, you are gone but definitely not forgotten.

Great service and ambiance but the food was not worth it. Spicy oil served with bread simply tasted oily (in a bad way); eggplant Parmesan was on the chewy side; Nutella cheesecake tasted store bought.

I stay close by here for extended stay business trips and love this place - I've eaten here 4 nights in a week and never get sick of it. Great food with great service and a nice, contemporary atmosphere. Also has gluten-free pasta which is a plus if that's your preference.
The fritto misto appetizer and the pesto linguine pasta were both very good! We enjoyed the atmosphere as it is classy as well as casual!

If you add together the quality of the food, the service, the price, the open space, the selection on the menu and the friendliness of this neighborly Italian restaurant you have to give it the best rating. Go find out yourself.

Came here for lunch. Second visit to the restaurant and the food was even better than my first experience which I thought was very good the first time. Would recommend the Pesce Del Di' which happened to be halibut that if I recall correctly.  Finished everything off my plate.  Colleague ordered the Pollo Alla Milanese which was surprisingly moist for breaded chicken. Cheese and meat plate very good.  Tiramisu was delicious too.
Very tasty dinner. Highly recommend the seafood appetizer and pastas. We tried the squid ink pasta with shrimp and carbonara and both were amazing.

Great food, nice decor, right ambiance. Definitely a must go. Located in a quiet street, near many history downtown monuments and landmarks. Service is impeccable. The friendly staff helps you along your entire gastronomic journey. Well done!
Excellent food! Modern and clean interior. Highly recommended for a solid new Italian spot in nyc.

This place a bit small, but never feels uncomfortable.  I find quality restaurants in FiDi / City Hall area very hit or miss, but the food and service both very good. Presentation was excellent, and quantities were fair. Strong wine list and "interesting" Italian cocktails. Price was descent, but def no bargain. You can really see they are trying, which you dont see in 80% of restaurants anymore. I can't see myself being a regular here, but definitely would hit it up 1-2x a year, no questions asked.

Tempted not to write a review as we'd rather no one knows about this place. We just had the best appetizer ever (polpo). Unbelievably good. Octopus/potatoes/olive tapenade combination made in heaven. Lasagna was pretty good. The other appetizer was 2/3rds fantastic and 1/3rd pretty good. Herbed potatoes were terrific. Service was exemplary (Yvonna). Would have been 5 stars but for the lasagna. All in all, well worth the trip.
Always rely on Yelp when traveling. Never steers me wrong. This place is another example of that. Very nice ambiance, friendly service, yummy food.
Love the food and atmosphere here! The staff are super friendly and always say yes to the bread and olive oil butter!

I went to De Claudio restaurant last  week, with my friends that i haven't seen for long time! Well love this place, service is great and food is super delicious! Waitress was very polite and professional, she brought impression to our table like we were seating at my friends home and having dinner (my friends are very lovely couple enjoying their retirement)! I had black linguine with shrimp and grigliata mista di pesce, it was great there are no words to describe it, have to taste it! My friends had eggplant gnocchi and steak tagliata and pollo organico alla milanese,  they were happy with their food as well!  They also have great selections of wine with reasonable price! I Highly recommend this restaurant, pleasant and lovely environment with polite and professional service who are always there to make sure we're doing fine! And yes they exceeded my expectations... Definitely coming back soon

I was super excited about the opening of Da Claudio. I went their a few times already and I absolutely love the food! I thought the portion sizes were perfect. I went home stuffed after every meal. Most of their meat and fish come from local and sustainable farms so I can understand a higher price tag. My only comment would be about service. All the wait staff is extremely nice, but I felt that things were a little bit disorganized.

Definitely the best dinner spot in FiDi!! Delicious Italian food and fun cocktails! The Lonely Frida and the Fantasm cocktails are fantastic and a great pairing to any meal!  The one thing that cannot be overstated is the staff! Especially the owners who are a huge treat to see at every meal.

I go often as near me.  Want it to be fantastic!  But the specials have been more miss than hit.  And while they serve one of my favorite cocktails - the menu there is not deep.  Still would go for a drink over their food.
This is a hidden gem in the middle of FiDi - authentic Italian cuisine with a modern twist, reasonably priced and favored by locals.

Italian food by real passionate italians.  Our lunch here was fantastic on every level you could want from a restaurant.  Service was impeccable and everyone at the table agreed that the food was to die for.  You can tell they take great  pride in high quality ingredients.  Fresh homemade pastas the way you would expect if you were sitting in a Tuscany vineyard enjoying the best life has to offer.  Will return for more!
Very good and inventive menu. Burrata salad and Soft Shell Crab specials were excellent. Great place for lunch.

Food and service were very good! I had the Bucatini Arrabbiata and my wife had Linguini and Clams. Both were pretty solid. Pasta's were cooked perfectly. Drinks were also good. It's a nice space, but the lighting was a little bright for a Saturday night. Much needed addition to the neighborhood.
the food is really nice there and i love their Tiramisu!!!
Great atmosphere. Friendly staff. Everything we ordered was fantastic. Chicken Milanese, Carbonara and Beef Cheeks special. Will definitely be back!

Great little neighborhood restaurant which was highly needed! The space is open and beautiful  Attentive staff, fresh food and perfect service.  I am so happy there is a great new place to walk down the street too!! I read the reviews that the portions were small but in my opinion, they are normal size portions and not the obnoxious cheesecake factory style size.  Good wine selection as well.

This is our second time revisiting Da Claudio....while it is true that the portions are small for the money....hopefully management will size up the portions......We tried the two fish dishes 26 and 28 dollars.....excellent presentation....tasty and flaky......The atmosphere, presentation and the staff are excellent....will certainly be back.....

No comment

Amazing atmosphere cute place with lots of decoration great seating but do make a reservation. Greek type of food I got the lamb burger. And it was cooked perfectly with seasoned fries  everything was delicious great waitress . Everyone loved there meals
No comment

I loved our dinner here!  The restaurant is cozy and full of chatter, the food delicious.  We ordered a few apps and a dish to share amongst our party of four.  This was the way to go for us so we all were able to sample a bit of everything.  We had a strict vegetarian and two pescetarians in the group, we were all pleased.  Plenty of choices.

I ordered grilled branzino via UberEats and it was *extraordinary* as was the simple green salad I forgot to take a picture of. Everything tasted flavorful, fresh, and cooked with love. I can't wait to come back and order it again - 5 stars, 10/10, all the things.

First time here and they have a back garden, you wouldn't have expected! It was so cute, the drinks were great but my friends and I didn't have any food, next time! The staff were friendly as well, fitting us in during the busy hours.

Very good food, nice atmosphere & friendly staff. Really enjoyed our dinner. Would have liked a bigger wine selection.

Came here at about 8 on a Sunday night and there was a pretty good crowd. We sat in the back, and had a few appetizers and split and entre. We had a beet salad which was pretty good, then split a Vegetable Pide and the Octopus. I didn't love either of these items. The Vegetable Pide was very artichoke heavy and not that exciting. The octopus was good except for the middle was a little chewy. I would come back.

Food was amazing! Drinks great and service on point! Definitely recommend, share everything!

Leyla is a restaurant specializing in Turkish cuisine on the UWS.  It's a great neighborhood find, once you find it.  The location is on a side street, and there's no real signage.  I make this declaration after Sat. evening dinner with a friend at the small bar up front.  Indoor and outdoor seating is available.  This is not a large place, nor is there a big menu but everything seemed just right; from soft lighting and contemporary decor, to sound level and soundtrack, to informal but attentive service.  Two of us split the three cheese pide, lamb shank and pistachio desert.  All of it was delicious.

Stopped in for a late lunch - charming space with good service. Lots of vegetarian options, good portions and a nice cocktail list. Definitely a neighborhood favorite, but it is sometimes hard to get a table.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Great food and the wine selection was good. Service was excellent though I got there as it opened and I guess my waiter had more time to spend with me. Hummus was amazing.

Wandered in for a delightful solo brunch. This has got to be one of the most hospitable places on the UWS. I was seated in the beautiful back garden and everyone from the bartender to the busser to the server were so friendly and kind. The herbed tomato salad was wonderful and the mimosa was out of this world. Prices are fair, too!

One of my new favorite spots on the UWS. Cozy, intimate, and chill vibes. Great service, delicious cocktails, and the food hits the spot every time! If you looking for suggestions, the octopus and lamb shank are out of this world! It's hard not to get them every time I go, but also good is the lebne and the fritters for appetizers. Honestly, you can't go wrong.
No comment
No comment

This place is excellent! I loved the zucchini fritters (including the minty yogurt it came with), creamy puréed Fava bean bruschetta, and perfectly crispy and light fries that came with the delicious lamb burger entree. Great staff as well. Shout out to Kaan who was the excellent, chill, sociable bartender who served us during our visit. I'd go back. I especially recommend happy hour if you're on a budget.
No comment
No comment

Only ordered 3 dishes and a glas of wine, but very happy with all, and staff exceptionally accommodating since our party of 2 was in a bit of a rush, with no reservation. Will definitely go again when in the area.

Came here with great excitement based on the reviews. The restaurant was mostly empty. When we asked for a table, the mc said he could only seat us if we have him our phone number and that he adds us to some sort of list. This is the first time I heard of such an invasion of privacy, and I have been living in UWS for years. He further started mansplaining the rule, as if it was the most natural rule, in a grilling way. We wanted a weekend brunch, not anxiety Central, so we left. If I wanted to be grilled by arrogant men, I would have not left the country and lived in Turkey, no thank you. We went across the street to an Israeli place and had a delicious relaxing brunch.

Well well well. I'm back to the yelp game, and I've just recently moved to UWS. Leyla is nearby and looks quite promising so I thought I'd give it a shot. It hurt me to say, but the experience I received wasn't what I was expecting. The servers were great, and the ambience was even better. It's a great place for a second date although there is a reason I wouldn't choose it for a first one and exactly why I'm going to knock off a star for this review. The food took so LONG to get to my table. The zuchinni fritters were great, and I would actually recommend them! The lamb shank was also good but not great. The risotto under the lamb shank was great though! Would I recommend this place, I would for a date but not for the food if you get what I mean. Ambience is a 4.5/5 and food is a 3/5.

Nothing to write home about, but def Yelp about ;) I do want to give 5 stars to the busser person he did a great awesome job, I think he was French African...I am always ready to speak French cause I don't want to lose it!! Anyway, sadly our server was just blah...not even an intro of good evening I'm...etc. He was devoid of any welcoming charm. He took our order and no interaction with him until we had to ask another server we needed the check. I was once a server in a much larger and busier restaurant and I made it a point to interact with each guest after they received their drinks and then their food!!! The food was just okay. The pide was tasty, but the size of it was a joke...the price point doesn't match the quality of the food. Won't be going back.
The best Turkish food in town! Lamb shank is perfect and mud heaven desert is to die for.

I came here with a friend and we both loved it. This will definitely be a date spot. We decided to order tapa style which is preferred for us. Almost everything was so good. I didn't love the fava bean bruschetta though. It is a smaller joint, so I would recommend a reservation here.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Great food. A bit of a wait for Saturday brunch if you don't have reservations, but it was worth it. Cute decor inside and food is solid. One person in our party had a lamb burger and said it was excellent. The fries that came with it were very good. Shakshuka was good as was the greek salad. We also tried the hummus and the spinach yarma both of which were good. Would definitely recommend if you are in the area!
No comment

No comment
Great food, excellent attentive service. A bit pricey, but that's to be expected in Manhattan.
Truly one of my favorite restaurants on the UWS. Incredible food (especially the pides), great cocktails, and good service.

One of the tastiest lamb burgers I've ever had! You could really taste that it was lamb, and That's not the only thing that was good! The cocktails, pide, truffle fries and salad were all delicious. Next time I'll have to order some Turkish coffee and a dessert, but I'm determined for there to be another time since Leyla was such a hidden gem!
Need to fix their attitude Asap.... Change your manager or whoever. Never coming back.

Stay Away! Made a reservation one week in advance for my wife and I. when we arrived we were seated at a table located in the hallway leading to the back courtyard. There was absolutely no light. We respectfully and politely asked for a different table. There were at least three or four other tables available within 10 to 15 feet. The manager insisted that he could not help us change tables and became rude and insisted that I cannot go to the back of the restaurant to retrieve my wife. In all of my living on the upper West side of Manhattan (40 plus years) I have never experienced such arrogance and inability to address a simple problem. I will be sure to let my family and friends who live in the area know about this. Good luck with your unacceptable attitude and inability to address a simple request.
I love this place. Their brunch is mind blowingly good. Also their Zucchini fritters are a must order. I've had the risotto twice now and it's so delicious. The fava bean bruschetta is great as well
No comment
No comment

Amazing, amazing food. Ordered takeout from here and couldn't be more pleased with what we had. Pickup was super easy. The food was ready right on time. The restaurant is on W 74th St, right next to Columbus Ave. It provides a nice and quiet dining experience for both inside and outside guests. We had ordered the grilled branzino, the quinoa hummus salad, Karides Güveç, falafel, and the slow cooked short rib pide. All the flavors from these various dishes were incredible. I couldn't stop thinking as I shoved the food in that "this is so good!" I can't wait to order from them again. I wish I had taken picture of the food, but as soon as we got everything out of the bag, it was almost gone. Next time. Thank you, Leyla!
Absolutely lovely spot with delicious and interesting food.  Came here with a vegan friend, and tons of options for both of us.  My new fave on the UWS

Very disappointing experience - made a reservation and table wasn't ready for a good 10-15 minutes.  More importantly, one member of my party has a food allergy and his dish had to be returned to the kitchen and remade even though he clearly communicated the allergy in the beginning and in a note in the reservation.  Servers appeared rushed.  Prices and food are decent but staff needs better training.  These hiccups ruined the group's dining experience.

I ordered dinner for a small group via GrubHub at 6:01pm.  The Web site stated it would arrive around 6:30-6:40pm.  By 7:10pm, nothing showed up, so I called the restaurant to ask for timing.  The front desk was unhelpful and wouldn't answer my questions and made excuses.  The manager was rude.  I rarely write negative reviews, and I recognize that mistakes happen.  I expected something like, "really sorry, we will rush it and get it to you fast."  And I recognize that GrubHub isn't always the best for restaurants and perhaps orders through GrubHub are deprioritized vs. in person customers.  But the attitude of the people I spoke with warrants the negative review.  After staying on hold and hearing excuses for 10 minutes, they basically said "too bad, how sad, we won't give you an estimate for when the food will come."  The front desk and manager really couldn't care less -- I was a hassle in their busy evening.
No comment
No comment
Everything was amazing from the appetizer until dessert, fresh and flavorful food . I highly recommend this place .

We wanted to go to Leyla to have a nice family dinner. My wife is allergic to dairy. We were not able to have anything on the menu, because they were not able to accommodate any changes.  All the food must be pre made because they could not even substitute plain rice without butter.  The service was rude and condescending.  Now that I am reading through other posts, it's clear they have no ability to adjust for any food allergies. Do yourself  a favor and skip Leyla. There are so many other great restaurants on the Upper West side.
No comment

This isn't my first five star review for Leyla and it won't be my last. I hadn't been in about 6 months (after going A LOT last spring). Had my birthday dinner here Friday night. I always get the muhammara because it's the best of the best of the best. The olive oil and red peppers they use to make it... idk how they do it... it tastes like good quality olive oil. I could eat this by the spoonful. Really appreciate the generous serving size!! Got the hummus as well. Very good hummus! I got the shaved zucchini salad for the first time. The tahini balsamic dressing is delicious. I wasn't sure if I'd like the zucchini (I always get their other salads). If you're on the fence like I was, GET THE SHAVED ZUCCHINI. Honestly didn't feel like zucchini at all. It was shaved super thin and delicious with everything else in the salad. Can't go wrong with their Tommy Margarita either. Smooth, refreshing and light.

Terrible experience here. They forgot our appetizer and when we told the hostess (because the waitress never came to check on us) that our entrees already came out and we want to cancel the appetizer because they forgot, she said "ok that's fine". It wasn't fine. I ordered the vegetarian entree, manti, and it was flavorless. My husband's lamb burger was over cooked when he asked for medium. Not a place we'll be returning to. Also, FYI the outdoor heaters are a joke so if you're getting a table outside you'll likely be chilly.

No comment

I don't write reviews often and give 5 stars but our brunch experience at Leyla yesterday compels me to do so. First of all the decor and ambience was completely divine. It's modern and elegant yet warm. My girlfriends and I shared the spinach yarma, a cheese pide, and had the shakshuka and the Turk for brunch. Plus some cocktails. Everything was fresh and excellent. We stayed for a while and they were completely accommodating and lovely. Shoutout to Gina who served us. We will definitely be back!
Went there only for Turkish tea and dessert (baklava). Looks like a great place. Will be back for dinner some day.

So it was three of us for dinner this past Saturday. This was my fifth time there since the restaurant opened and this time was a disappointment. The Bronzino was limited in quantity and the potatoes were lukewarm at best. Service was too rushed. 5 minutes after our split salad the entrées arrived. The Turkish wine was very good as was the cheese pide. The biggest issue.....one bathroom! I allowed a customer with her elder mom to go in front of me to use the only bathroom and paid for that with a 10 minute wait. I did a close approximate count of customers at that time. 15 were outdoors and at least 35 were indoors. Expecting to serve 50 customers with a single bathroom is very unfair. Guys set up a second bathroom there, no excuses get it done. We are going into 100% capacity later in May and your restaurant bathroom issue will only worsen.
No comment
No comment

We came in late (9:20ish) for our 9pm reservations & they were extremely accommodating. The food was great!! Smaller portions but high quality. The atmosphere was welcoming, classy, clean, and stylish! They have a lot more seating inside than it looks at first. We stayed until around 10:45 (talking with family and lost track of time). Even with the late stay the service was amazing, they never rushed us, and it was a great experience. Would highly recommend this place to take a visitor from out of town, family, or anyone!
No comment

Absolutely loved it. Friendly staff and excellent drinks. Food was fresh, well balanced, and slightly different than other Turkish places in the city. Not a huge fan of the dessert but will be back for everything else!

Ruth was our server and was extremely patient as my companion and I asked many questions about the food. She was very knowledgeable about items on the menu and made great suggestions for potential substitutions. The atmosphere was lovely. We ate outside where dogs are able to join the party, and one of the other servers was kind enough to offer the dog dine water. I recommend the short rib flat bread and beet salad. Great selection of wines. I'm glad we found Leyla.
Food was amazing but they ignore you. Any follow up service I asked the staff. I think it's a tricky space. Thank you.
No comment
The food was absolutely superb and the drinks were just as good. The freshness of it all and the great service will definitely have me and my partner coming back soon.
No comment
