No comment

I'm very confused with the glowing reviews and suspicious of where they come from since my hummus, falafel and pita (which actually was store brought bread cut into slices, nothing like the Mediterranean pita bread) were way below average. And these are just basics of any Mediterranean place. Hummus tasted like it came from a jar, prolly store brought with the bread with little to no tahini and hence quite grainy with just beets added on top. My friend's veggie risotto was under seasoned and not very tasty either. Drinks were okay and service was good which was literally the only saving grace of our night here. For authentic Mediterranean food without subdued flavours and store brought stuff, try hummus place in the neighborhood. You will not be disappointed!

One of the best dinners I had while I was in NYC. The food leaves you pleasantly full and not at all heavy. I highly recommend their ice cream + tea dessert; it was so good that me and my friend still talk about it.

I can't wait to return! We walked in without a reservation, hoping to get a light supper before a show at the Beacon.  Hostess was very friendly and suggested we would be more comfortable at the bar instead of at a more crowded outdoor table.  Bar staff were friendly and helpful, and service was exceptionally quick.  We stuck with vegetarian options:  3-cheese pide(sublime), Greek salad, and eggplant caviar.  Finished our meal with the tahini pide dessert.  The meal was delicious and perfectly filling.  Highly recommend!

Went on Wednesday and sat inside. The staff were very accommodating and made the experience feel incredibly safe. Ordered drinks: Duman and Botanist, appetizer: short rib pide, and I had the lamb shank for dinner. I wish I was exaggerating but everything was probably some of the best flavors in the area, without a doubt. It is too bad the times we are in because I'm sure the inside has a ton of energy when full. Go support Leyla need to keep the restaurant around!
No comment

Had an ABSOLUTELY AMAZING time with my family here for our Fourth of July dinner. The menu offered many delicious items, each very different from the next, and all very, very appetizing. There were 5 people total in my party, so we were able to order and try almost everything on the menu. Our server TJ made our experience even better! She was very accommodating and welcoming, and gave us some wonderful recommendations from the menu. Overall, a wonderful experience, and will definitely will be coming back whenever I'm in NYC again.
Very tasty food, highly recommend. Also, the restaurant is doing a great job keeping clean and social distancing.
No comment
No comment
Gem of a restaurant in the UWS. Stumbled across this place and was blown away at how delicious everything was. Highly recommend coming here

This is our FAVORITE restaurant in the neighborhood. We moved to the area a few months ago and happened to grab a menu. We were so happy to get to go back for the Valentine's pre fixe menu this weekend. Everything was beyond delicious and the service was wonderful. They're doing a great job keeping tables spaced apart so everyone could feel safe and comfortable now that indoor dinging is back. The menu is great for take out/delivery too!
No comment

We pulled ourselves out of our usual EV/LES routine of restaurants to the UWS at the request of a good friend and wow what a surprise. Leyla knocked it out of the park for us. Authentically Turkish and Middle Eastern, our group of 4 all shared a table of vegetarian and pescatarian dishes that were just perfectly delicious and varied in flavor from one to the next (Branzino gets top marks as well as the Veg Pide). It's not always easy to find good options that are vegetarian friendly. As expected from other reviews, the service was attentive, on  time and smooth in its process. A manager, or maybe an owner, even stopped by the table to ensure that we were doing well. We will be back.

Truly amazing lamb shank and the best place to get dinner before seeing a show at the Beacon Theatre. We ordered a salad and pide (don't remember the exact items, they were good) but the 5-star review is really for their lamb shank. The meat was so tender it fell off the bone, incredibly flavorful, and paired well with the mushrooms and creamy risotto. Definitely one of the best lamb dishes I've had in the city and can't wait to go back.

I brought my parents here for a night in the city. Affordable restaurant, pretty good reviews, etc. I was embarrassed when we walked out. Not only was the food average, but the chefs were unaccommodating and the service was putrid. My mom has a dairy allergy - nothing out of the ordinary - but we figured a restaurant in New York could handle that. We were completely wrong. Not only did my mother go through six dishes asking if they could make simple changes like taking cheese off a pita bread or asking to have rice without butter since the pre-made rice is cooked with butter. All three of us understand that accommodating an allergy may take a little extra time, but the staff was unwilling to even help us, simply offering my mom a side salad or some cooked vegetables. I'm no Guy Fieri, but even I know how to cook a little bit of rice without butter and I know it takes 10 minutes tops. Don't waste your time with chefs that can't deviate from a menu to accommodate an allergy and service that quite simply is arrogant.
No comment
Food is great but staff remains unmasked during the surge of covid cases. Won't go back until they increase precautions. I felt uncomfortable dining in.

Love this place!! Such a great atmosphere and service. Discovered it a month ago and my friends and I have been back like 3x since. The bartender is amazing - drinks are so beautiful and delicious. The food is also incredible and great to share.

We swung by on our night walk and were struck by how cute the outside was - they clearly put some thought and effort into the decor.  The woman running the front was gracious and helpful and friendly and we ended up putting in an order and I'm glad we did.  The kids got chicken sandwiches (sauce and pickles on the side, which made them a little bland - but fully dressed they were very good).  My wife and I got the grilled salmon and chicken tarator and both were well cooked and tasty.  We all shared the hummus and fava bean bruschetta which were *delicious*.    They also added some baklava which was very tasty.  Overall, highly recommended.  We'll be back!

column3: Del Marietta - Southwest, San Jose, CA
column6: I loved everything! The food, decoration, service! Even if it was very busy we had our appetizers really fast! Must try pacanga, muhammara and lahmacun & try Turkish raki

This place is amazing all around! Came here for brunch on a weekend, it is super small inside and outside so make a reservation beforehand. We sat inside but felt like we had the whole place to ourselves, and staff was soo accommodating. The brunch food was so unique and delicious, you must start with a Pide because that is what they are known for. Come here if your looking to switch up the usual brunch in NYC !! Cocktails are also great here!
Great little spot! Nice decor, very tasty  food, great service. bartender is very friendly and knowledgable on the menu. Deffo we will come back :)
Really good but tiny portions for the prices. Came for the short rib pide and ended up getting a second item off the menu that was also tasty but they were both the size of appetizers
No comment
No comment
No comment
Apps much better than entrees. Drinks were solid, service friendly and attentive. They have a back garden thats prime seating

Delicious dinner on Tuesday night. Comfortable casual but upscale atmosphere. Attentive service and enjoyable food and wine. Appetizers to desserts all had something to recommend to a friend and return to enjoy again.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Genuinely my favorite restaurant in the UWS. Food, drinks, service, vibe all top notch. Get the Pide, spinach yarma, and lamb shank.

My friend and I made a reservation and were seated promptly. After that, we became invisible to the entire staff. There were staff members standing around and walking by and we tried to ask them multiple times who our waiter was. At one point, someone took our order. He did not introduce himself and acted like he was doing us a favor.  We ordered hummus and a cheese flatbread to start. The flatbread was delicious, but the hummus came with what tasted like rye bread. My friend and i inquired with the staff about other bread choices and every person we asked was confused. I've never been served hummus without pita bread so i was surprised when someone told me they don't have pita bread. After a very long wait, our main entrees came and the food was good but not once did any staff member come by to ask if our food was ok or if we needed anything else. We wanted to order dessert, but decided since the service was so slow we wouldn't have time. When i asked for the bill, that was the quickest part of the night. Someone immediately swiped my card on a portable cc machine and within seconds i paid.  I found it funny that the quickest part of the evening was them taking my money. After leaving, my friend and I still did not know who our waiter was, or who the tip went to unless it's split amongst the whole staff.
Sucks.  I say this only to make it easier for me to get a reservation.  Seriously, really good food and really good service, on a nice, quiet side street.  Love this place (I didn't say that!)
No comment

Found this spot after just moving to the neighborhood.  WHAT a find!!! Fantastic options if you are vegetarian.  Shared 2 starters (Vegetarian Pide, Cheese Pide) and 2 salads (shaved zucchini/asparagus) and Mahummara and the pistachio baklava for dessert.  I would order ALL of them again!! We sat outside in front and it was delightful, but also saw there was a great back garden which would love to try the next time.  Place was impeccably clean, wait staff attentive (but not too attentive like they can be if they want you to leave).  Food not only delicious but visually appealing and as I said would order all of them again.  Will be my  'go to' neighborhood option!!
No comment

Our friend recently moved into the neighborhood so we checked Leyla out on a raining spring day. Not an expert in Turkish cuisine by any means, but this place was awesome! Great food. Nice ambience. The owner gave us a crash course in Turkish wine and we loved the Kayra bottle. Lamb shank was cooked perfectly. The three cheese pide was a great app. Closed it out with some yummy baklava. Will be back and would recommend! Glad to see a newish restaurant survive the pandemic!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Absolutely disgusting. Stay away and take your money elsewhere. There's a reason why it's always empty and going out of business. Owner is so incredibly rude and violent. He should not be operating a business and doesn't know how to treat a customer.
Very nice quiet tucked away spot. Ambiance was excellent, and they offered a lot of nice dishes that I wouldn't have normally found on a typical Mediterranean menu.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Leyla is our new favorite UwS spot. Second time here and we once again started wIth the 3 cheese pides. It's a thin flaky oven baked bread with cheese honey and truffle. The lamb shank is phenomenal. Ambiance is nice and relaxing and the service is good as well.
The food is very good and have maintained its quality through the pandemic.  And their service staff is also good. Good style and vibes.

This place is the hidden gem of Manhattan! Beautiful atmosphere, friendly & accommodating waitstaff, and reasonable prices. Our chicken was falling-off-the-bone tender and the lamb burger was perfectly done. Beautiful flavors & some of the best food we've had in the city.

I highly recommend the grilled branzino if you like fish. The cocktails were fantastic! I ordered the botanist which is a gin cucumber cocktails. The restaurant had a nice romantic vibe. They dim the lights for dinner. The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because the service was slow. We had to wait a while for someone to take our order for drinks initially and after we needed refills. Overall I do recommend Leyla's and am planning to come back.

I was really pleasantly surprised, especially for the UWS. The ambiance is wonderful, service was quick and friendly, the Turkish wine was tasty, and the food was really good. Late in writing this, so now I'm forgetting what we got, but the shrimp was amazing!

Nice option on the UWS. Closer to a 3.5 star rating but I'm willing to round up for a nice option in an area where choices in this dining range are limited. Cocktail menu was a little one note but the negronis were nice and strong, so we were happy. A few items happened to be "sold out" at our 515 reservation, so a bit of a disappointment there. Zucchini fritters were excellent - the yogurt sauce was superb. Muhammara was good but not revelatory, pide was the equivalent...happy making but not epic. The pasta that all wax rhapsodic about was good, but again, I wasn't blown away. Satisfied for sure but not giddy with the fun of a new discovery.

I must've passed this place for the hundredth time before I finally tried it and boy, I've been missing out. Leyla isn't your typical restaurant on one of the the main avenues so it's hard to notice. Or so you'd think, except that it's packed even on a Tuesday night. My boyfriend and I had the 3 cheese pide, zucchini fritters, frekeeh risotto, and the branzino. I would highly recommend the pide and fritters, they're highly unusual but delicious.
No comment
No comment

Oh my God, Leyla was truly phenomenal. It's the little things that make Leyla so great. The staff mentioned to us that we really should try their Slow Cooked Short Rib Pide, and they were right, it was certainly outstanding. The customer services was amazing. Leyla - You've hooked us.
No comment
No comment

Just awful. We got up and left. They wouldn't accommodate my gluten-free allergy which was stated when making the reservation. My friend is vegan and they also denied to swap out her risotto for a vegan friendly option. I'm not sure where the waitress was from but when we asked if there were specials for the evening, she didn't know what "specials" were and told us "everything is special" on the menu‍We asked to speak with the manager about our diet restrictions. Manager politely explained.... they do not do substitutes because they have two kitchens and I would have to order both dishes and swap it myself . However, she was very pleasant and was probably just doing as told....we accepted the conditions and just went to another restaurant on Amsterdam. It's a very cute place but I can't imagine in NYC, a restaurant isn't friendly for vegans or Gluten Free. I leave this review to note to others: Diet restrictions folks beware
No comment

My family and I have been coming here for a while and this was the first time we've recommended a restaurant this highly to our friends. Even though we are aware that they are highly over priced for their portions, we wanted to support our Turkish community. After talking up this place all day to them, we were embarrassed by the actions of who we believe is the owner there. We were treated very disrespectfully and unwanted. I will not comment on the food here, however their hospitality is very unprofessional. We were also told that if we don't like it to go somewhere else. We are very disappointed to say that this person is the reason we will not be returning.
No comment

The best place in UWS, extremely cozy with exceptional food and extraordinary cocktails and wine. I enjoyed having dinner and drinks at the bar but table setting is equally lovely. The stuff is professional and very polite. We loved chatting with bartender Bruno who was very helpful and suggested and made amazing drinks.
No comment

Food was bland and average at best. Our waitress outside was unfriendly and especially unhelpful with regards to questions about the menu. She also didn't return once during our meal while our glasses sat empty. She did ask if we wanted desert though, after I flagged her down for the bill. I won't be rushing back.

My husband and I have tried our fair share of Mediterranean / Middle Eastern restaurants in the city (it's our favorite cuisine), and we keep coming back to Leyla. We've never been disappointed by anything we've ordered, and constantly struggle with the decision of re-ordering fantastic dishes or trying something new that is sure to be equally delicious. The zucchini fritters are a particular highlight, as is the three cheese pide. We are so grateful that Leyla has reopened for takeout and delivery on Seamless while NYC is shut down during the COVID-19 crisis. We will definitely be ordering from here again!
No comment
No comment

We live in the area but had not yet had the opportunity to dine there, and then the pandemic happened. So we decided to try them for takeout instead. We've enjoyed everything we have ordered so far, including the pides, lamb shank, and lamb burger. It's a little pricey for what you're getting as the portion sizes aren't very big, but the flavors are delicious. Also we are trying to support our local businesses during these difficult times, and they unfortunately don't have any outdoor seating, so we will continue to order takeout and delivery from Leyla to support them!

Leyla is a hidden gem on the UWS.  Beautiful setting with both indoor and outdoor seating.  The staff is incredible and the vibe is warm and calming. We had the pleasure of letting the host design our meal for the evening.  From delicious flatbreads to a spectacular dessert.  I started off the meal with their signature drink, a passionfruit martini which was sweet and refreshing.  Our table enjoyed the Greek salad and Muhammara, which I loved and highly recommend.  Also the Fava Bean Bruschetta, Kataifi Zucchini Fritters, and 3 Cheese Pide were our favorites.   The Karides Güveç and lamb shank were our main dishes and the Pistacchio Mud Heaven for dessert was the perfect end to a wonderful night.  I can't say enough about this sensory experience.  I am excited to return and try many more dishes!
No comment
No comment

the food at this restaurant just isn't very good, I thing upper west siders are in denial.  How can you possibly make a lamb burger with little flavor?  Somehow they did.  The cocktails we got were beautiful and very well balanced so I think the bartender there is the only person who knows what he's doing (or cares).  The staff weren't necessarily unpleasant, they were just inattentive and not at all invested.  The one thing that did blow our minds was the rice pudding dessert, it really was great and 100% original, loved it

Loved everything we ate!  We were a party of 5, and we purposely ordered different appetizers and main courses so we could taste as much as possible.  Everything was outstanding.  The service was welcoming and attentive,  and the decor (in the garden room) was beautiful!  We can't wait to go back!

D.R., Upper West Side , NYC:  Beware: Forty-five minutes before the reservation, a man called to say the restaurant could not honor the reservation (which was booked and confirmed days ago through Resy and reconfirmed by Resy at 4:13 today). When I asked for the manager, the man identified himself as the owner.  He was very abrupt, offered no apology, no let me make you another reservation, drinks or desserts or something on us. I would think perhaps a bad day, but a similar rudeness happened here two years ago.
I've only ordered take out but both times the food was excellent. So tasty and some of the dishes are unique. Lots of vegetarian options. The eggplant dumplings are amazing!
No comment
It's a nice restaurant with great ambience. The prices are a little much. The apps are small but pricey. My friends didn't think the cocktails were good and worth the money

We came here after I read some reviews on Yelp. An absolutely gem, Turkish cuisine with a twist, sort of Ottoman Empire meets NYC UWS! Decor is so warm and inviting. Believe it or not, but even bathroom decor is amazing! Food was very good, we had choban salad, muhammara, stuffed eggplant, Lahmacun and 3 cheese pide. All delicious and served in a nice plates and wooden trays. Main course we had eriśde and lamb chops - very tasty, lamb well marinated and tender, full of juices. No desert as the food was very filling! Keep up the good job! Also great for romantic dates - music selection is fantastic, with great Turkish songs from back in the days to very modern, and what's important volume is so well adjusted that one can hear the music, yet have pleasant conversation at the table. We will be back!

Tucked into an intimate side street so don't miss it! The cocktails were spot on and the Turkish tea delicious! The interior is romantic and well decorated. We will definitely be back for the food! Everything looked wonderful and authentic.

My girlfriend and I went here last night- food was great, drinks were great, friendly staff, really was an excellent date night dinner. Definitely felt compelled to post a review and recommend. Will be back!

$11 for half a normal size of lahmacun, is this a joke?? And the menu contains only a few turkish dishes. If you are not going to stick to it don't call it turkish. Total disappointment. Ended up paying $30 for a dinner that left me still hungry...

We have a new favorite Mediterranean restaurant in the city! We live across the street and have been watching the construction for a while, eagerly awaiting the opening of this place. Yesterday we finally had a chance to go, and it was well worth the wait. The food was absolutely delicious. We had tapas-style appetizers to share (buttery beef tongue, an eggplant dip packed with flavor, a divine cheese pide, and a yummy lamb pide), and then each had an equally tasty main course. Service was a little slow, but I attribute that to opening week growing pains and the servers were so kind and made such good recommendations that we didn't mind the wait. On our way out we noticed a certain famous movie director and uws resident was dining there too, so this restaurant is clearly quickly gaining a good reputation! We will definitely be back.
Lamb shank was delicious!!! Also my gf ordered Freekeh risotto... 10/10.  Very tasty!! The sizes of the portions were adequate for the price.

We just loved this spot on the UWS. Ambiance in the back room was cozy and comfortable (after the AC was lowered a bit ;-). Our server was fantastic...suggesting menu items worth considering. The food was sensational...started with a zucchini/asparagus salad which was different and very tasty. Moved on to the short rib pide flatbread which was a real hit for us....soooo good! Then the zucchini fritters with an interesting yogurt dip. Finally the roasted lamb shank with a creamy orzo. All dishes were really creative and tasty! All in all, Leyla was a great experience...a solid 5. We will certainly be back soon!
Amazing food, great service ! Everything we tried on the menu was fantastic . You can can order anything on the menu and will be satisfied with your pick .
Food tasted good. But paying $14 for 4 pieces of falafel, no pita no veggies just a side of tahini? No way!

Great new addition to the UWS! Pleasing ambiance, delicious food and delightful waitstaff. The Mediterranean menu offered tasty and unusual. Fava bean spread, zucchini fritters, eggplant and more... will definitely return!

This is a really great spot for date night. My boyfriend and I came here on a Thursday evening around 7:30 and we were promptly seated without reservations even though it was a full house. We loved the ambiance (the music was the perfect volume, not too loud, and the lighting was quite romantic) and the food, of course was amazing. We highly recommend the 3 cheese pide and the wines (we got the montepulciano and the emir - both were very good). The hummus and lamb shank are also a must. If you're looking for a nice place for a cozy date night with your partner or friends, this place is really great. It's tucked away, not on the main road where the cars drive by and it doesn't have a large sign outside so you would easily walk past it but that's what makes this place more charming :)

I'm removing two stars. Went back and service was really lacking. Also, the line for the one and only restroom is annoying both if you're trying to get in there or if you are sitting near. They were out of wines on the list, our waiter was surly. Food was good but I was bummed about this second trip back. Probably won't return in a city with so many other options.

Came here for brunch and had the shakshuka and a couple of pides to share with my partner. The meal was lovely, super flavorful, definitely one of the better shakshukas I've had. The portions were not huge but we were definitely full after sharing these. The staff was super friendly and the ambiance was great, could also serve as a great date night. Highly recommend this new spot in the area!

This was the most horrifying dining experience I have ever had.  IF YOU HAVE ANY FOOD ALLERGIES OR INTOLERANCES DO NOT COME HERE. When ordering, I indicated that I had a gluten intolerance and asked for confirmation that the items we were ordering were gluten free. When our salad arrived, I started serving it when I realized there was a piece of bread under the initial layer of the salad. I called over the waitress and told her what had happened. She was VERY nonchalant, did not apologize and then said that maybe I HAD PUT THE BREAD IN THE SALAD because the salad does not contain bread. There was no bread on the table, so her accusation would have involved me bringing my own bread (in my pocket?) and putting it in the salad just to send it back? This is a truly unbelievable accusation... when she could have just apologized and brought out a new salad. When she brought the new salad I gave her the benefit of the doubt and explained that what had happened was very worrisome because I would have had a severe physical reaction if I had eaten the bread. She again didn't seem to care so I asked that she tell the manager. After a meal of closely examining every bite before consuming it, we received no real apology and no acknowledgement from the manager. My mom asked to speak with the manager, again assuming the waitress didn't understand the health risks associated with what had happened. The manager came over and simply said the kitchen may have dropped in the bread.......... I would strongly, strongly advise against anyone with food allergies / intolerances from coming here, as they clearly don't understand the safety risks of their actions. I also wouldn't advise ANYONE to come here because you'd be hard pressed to find worse customer service in the city and if they treat food allergies / intolerances so nonchalantly I can only imagine that they are similarly nonchalant about other food safety issues.
inventive yummy food, attentive (tho at moments a bit too) service and reasonable prices made for a solid meal.  We espec liked the Pide appetizer.  Ill def return.

I don't often write reviews but this is worth it. Went to Leyla as a neighborhood restaurant yesterday for Brunch with my family. I arrived early and was seated straight away not having to wait for the rest of my party. The waiters were exceptionally neat, clean, happy and very good at giving excellent service; all three plates were delicious with the food very fresh and well presented; prices were reasonable and sparkling water was free for the table. I would highly recommend this restaurant and will definitely be returning. (We ordered hummus; poached eggs in tomato sauce and the 3 egg + 3 cheese omelette - I asked for 3 whole eggs not 3 whites and it was no problem. All meals were delicious especially the latter). We considered ordering the lamb with the polenta fries because we thought that was such a modern and fabulous addition to a menu but will save that for next time.

Brunch here was a delight. This relatively new spot is a great find with friendly service and outstanding food. The pide's are a must with delicate yet well balanced flavors, while the shakshuka is one of the best I've had.
What a fabulous addition to the neighborhood. Such a cute place and the food was delicious.
I went here with my wife and we loved our meal.  This place really checks all the boxes.  Great cocktails and fantastic food.  Make sure to try a Pide if you go, the short rib pide is delicious.
We came here for a Sunday brunch. We ate Croque Hanim and the three cheese omelette. Everything was very tasty. People who work here speak Turkish and the atmosphere is elegant and authentic.

Dined here recently with a diverse group of friends in our Thirties.  What a gem - flavor combinations were inventive but still reminiscent of comfort food, the wine list was perfectly curated, and the GM/Somm/owner hosted us like family with great recommendations and a tasting of an interesting bottle on the house.  We had a great experience - will definitely be back.
Rude rude rude. Misrepresenting wait time- told we would be seated immediately and waited 45 minutes with no apology or anything. Not the way to treat clientele.
Absolutely outstanding and a welcome addition to the neighborhood. The breads, appetizers and mains were all delicious. Order several for sharing.
Above and beyond in service! Highly recommended. The cheese pide was among the best tasting foods I've had in my life! Make a reservation if possible,  even on weeknights.
No comment

So so delicious highly recommend if in the area. Got the greek salad, zucchini rolls with pesto and pine nuts, lamb sausage pide and the branzino. Will definitely be back. They take reservation on resy. Super fast service.
Great new (to me, at least) neighborhood gem. Creative dishes, wonderful flavors, spot-on service, and smart cozy environment.

I've been here 8 times since it opened and have referred friends.  The food is absolutely excellent and the service has improved immeasurably as they have learned a lot since they opened.  One has to reserve in advance, since they've been a huge success.   It's worth it.

Very disappointed. My friend and I got super excited when we came across this restaurant when searching on yelp because it was literally a block away from our house and we love Turkish food. Should have checked the menu online before going. The menu is very limited and only like two items are truly Turkish dishes. And everything is super overpriced. If you dont mind being ripped off, I guess the tiny little lahmacun tasted good.

Nice higher end Mediterranean restaurant with friendly wait staff, good selection of wine and a nice atmosphere for an after work dinner/drink .  We ordered a few sides like three cheese pide, muhamarra eggplant caviar but the main attraction was the Papaz Yahnisi. It came out perfectly cooked and went well with the red wine that the waiters recommended.  A great place to visit every now and then for a nice meal.

Had high expectation of this restaurant but was disappointed as soon as I had my first forkful of the Greek salad.  The vegetables were soggy and tasted stale, indicating that it was prepared way way before serving.  The fish dish was very good but the desert was really uninspiring. My biggest disappointment was at being charged a $1.00 for a few pieces of a cut-up pita. This is in a restaurant that charges $13-$16.00 for a glass of wine.

Nice decor. Bland food, surprising for Turkish fare. Slow service, the food took a long time to arrive. Then after the food was finished the check took a long time to come and finally after the credit card was dispensed there was another long wait for the signature.
Very good food, a bit pricey but a great new add to the neighborhood.  Service is great and it's intimate so good for dates too

Just had wonderful B'day party dinner for my wife & 6.  Wonderful service, food amazing.  Soup of celery root truffle is almost a meal - delish!  Authentic Turkish - felt like we were back in Istanbul!  But amazing service and every attention paid.  Bronzino absolutely delish! Shrimp awesome!  Wish i had not reviewed.  Hope no one goes so we can always get in...

My new favorite neighborhood spot. I was really impressed with the flavor profiles and creativity on the menu. Flatbreads were amazing, must try. We had a bunch of their starters, which we like more than the entrees. Will probably have just starters next time we come back.
No comment

I really enjoyed this restaurant. Food was just fantastic and flavorful. I wish I hadn't been dining alone so I could have tried more dishes.  Think of the dishes more as tapas sized, but still plenty of food. Lovely atmosphere, great service and the cocktail- specifically the Botanist was supreme.  Try the Turkish white wine as well- not a wine you get often in this country.

Enjoyed this new neighborhood restaurant this evening and LOVED it. Cocktails were yummy (had the Botanist and the Drogheda's spirit), service terrific (Francesca) and meal delicious. They describe themselves as "Mediterranean brasserie that combines key elements of Turkish rustic-haute cuisine with a worldly take of the finest mediterranean recipes."  There are Turkish elements and dishes, but not everything is purely Turkish...but everything was purely delicious.  We enjoyed the Lahmacun - and it was flavorful and crisp.  We also started with the eggplant caviar, which I enjoyed more than any baba ganoush I've had in recent years. Great texture and light flavor.  The Parmesan crusted chicken was moist and flavorful, and the star of the show, the eriste, did not disappoint!  It was a wonderful Turkish pasta dish that I positively loved. All in all, I would highly recommend Leyla!
Great place!! Food was delicious, fresh and inventive. The service was spot on and the ambiance was terrific. Definitely putting it in the rotation.

Wasn't expecting much because its a very non-descript spot on the UWS..but WOW, the food was inventive, creative and delicious! The smoky eggplant appie was one of the most interesting things I have EVER had! Flatbread was warm and yummy--different from typical flatbreads. Hummus very solid as well, as was my lamb shank entree. As Arnold S. would say, I'll be back!

A most enjoyable dinner at Leyla last night.  On this repeat visit we brought a guest and hoped the restaurant would deliver as expected.  No problem!!  The rooms are charming, and our request for the back room for a quiet spot was honored...for a while..and the noise level did pick up..But the food trumps all..each of the many dishes we ordered was  presented beautifully and served with a smile, and met our hopes for a delicious dinner.    All went well and we look forward to our next visit!
Absolutely incredible food and great people make this place amazing. Must try. Fantastic drinks by Bruno. My wife and I had a great meal and felt like old friends.
Food was great. Service great but I dont understand 1.00 charge for additional bread. That is a turn off when you order hummus, etc

I have been here for dinner a few times already. Everything on the menu is delicious and creative. Hard to pick a favorite. Good selection of wine & cocktails, too. Been a local for over 10 years. Very different tastes than all the other restaurants on the UWS. Great job there!

We were super excited to try this addition to UWS. The place was super nice (4). Great space, perfect noise level and cozy ambience. The food was honestly delicious (4). I'm a falafel aficionado and they were outstanding. Now the disappointing part. Service was terrible. Let me take that back, HORRIBLE (1). Let me be clear, it was 9.30 and wasn't packed. We got in, no hostess so we lingered there until we went for the table ourselves. They took at least 15' to take our order. Ran out of water/sparkling, never refilled them. Ran out of wine (!!), never offered a 2nd round. We waited another good 15' for them to asks us for desserts. By then only 2 were available. And then brought my expresso with no spoon or sugar to be seen. But the worst of all was the overall attitude...the whole night we felt they were doing us a favor. Their energy was a downer and, in a service industry, that's the original sin. Now, here is the kicker, it was our anniversary night, so thanks for a great experience. Luckily we won't be calling a family lawyer anytime soon but definitely won't be going back there. Hopefully you take all this as a constructive criticism...everybody (in this case really EVERYBODY except the chef) has a bad night. Cheers.

A solid take on Turkish/Mediterranean food but with disappointing service and some unnecessary snags. As other reviews attest, the short rib pide was well-seasoned and delicious - a must-try if you decide to dine. The raki-infused branzino was also excellent if you like anisette flavoring - the fish is filleted so no need to wrestle with the skeleton if you find that challenging or unpleasant. The eggplant caviar appetizer was unremarkable and came with far less bread than was required to consume it. When we asked for an adequate amount of bread, we were told that we would have to pay an extra $1, which was gratuitous in my opinion. The affect of our server was also quite dismissive and unpleasant, and at the end of the meal my companion and I were handed a digital device to sign the check but unknowingly received the wrong cards to sign for, which should have been checked with us beforehand.
Best food and service yesterday I had chicken Marsala it was amazing .

Arrived on time and they sat us rather quickly.  Liked the ambiance, the servers, and especially the food.  The Mango Bellini was great for the family.  Everything was tasty and brought within a reasonable time.  Great serving sizes.  Did not feel rushed and definitely will return!

The best spot I tried in New York I was wondering where the good food was at and it's here Verde on Smith great service. we had  the unlimited mimosas and they kept coming quick.  Food talk fried mozzarella were so cheesy and stringy, chicken dish was so good I forgot what it was called but it was stuffed with eggplant and cheese. I tried my cousin steak which she order well done and let me tell y'all it was well done but juicy I wanna say best piece of steak I had.. drink must grab beside mimosa's Strawberry blossom so refreshing made with strawberry's. Don't sleep on this place y'all

The food was horrible along with the service as well. I will never come here again and to top it off they charged gratuity on top of the bill. My service was not even worth the gratuity they put on the bill. What happened?

For my entree I had the Chicken Sorrentino. The Chicken Sorrentino didn't wow me. There is way to much cheese in the dish and the mashed potatoes had no flavor. This is why I'm giving the review 4 stars. The server was nice. He kept refilling our water and ensured that when our plates were empty he would clear the table. I'm willing to give the restaurant another try maybe I'll attend their brunch.

Brunch is very good dinner not as much. Dinner can get expensive as well but brunch is yummy and pretty reasonable.

I love that brunch is served everyday. I had the penne ala vodka with shrimp and calamari as an appetizer. The food was really good and the restaurant itself is a pretty restaurant. The only downfall was it was busy so refilling our mimosas took some time and also bottomless brunch being 60 mins sucks. I'm used to 90 mins or two hours. I do love that the mimosas and Bellinis had different flavors and we got to try most of them. I would go back to this restaurant.

Friendly and good service from the moment you walk in. The restaurant ambiance is more like a bistro, but it is Italian food. The food is basic but tasty and there are several things to choose from pasta to various types of meat.

Friendly staff, good food, and good drinks. They have bottomless brunch and the drinks were pretty strong. Perfect for a day out with friends.

I have been here twice before and both times the food was excellent! Both times I ordered the same thing - Breakfast Avocado Toast and a Pineapple Bellini. It was a great portion for the price, and the bottomless drinks are a great value - although I only ever ordered one drink and never ordered the bottomless. The only complaint I have about this restaurant is the service. On my first visit, I had no issues. However, on my recent visit a few days ago I was very unhappy with the service and attitude from the waiter. I ordered a Fried Egg on my avocado toast, as the menu stated you have a choice between Fried Egg, Scrambled, or Poached Egg. When he brought out my food, there were scrambled eggs on top of my avocado toast. I then informed him that I had ordered fried eggs, to which he told me that these were fried eggs because the eggs are fried. He went back and forth with me, trying to correct me that the term I was looking for was "Sunny Side Up." However, I am a chef so I think I know the difference between different styles of eggs. Also, a quick google search will show you that Fried Eggs are the same (also known as) Sunny Side Up - there are just two names for it. Once you scramble the yolk, the egg is no longer a traditional "Fried Egg," but rather scrambled eggs, as you have scrambled them. So if what he served me wasn't scrambled eggs, but rather a Fried Egg, I am confused as to what their scrambled eggs look like. Although it may have been a simple mistake from the kitchen, it was the attitude and condescending attitude from the waiter that really turned me off. All he had to say was "No worries, let me bring it back for you." It is just strange to me that a waiter at a brunch restaurant seriously doesn't know what a Fried Egg is and has the nerve to correct me when a simple Google search proves him wrong. Even after showing him the Google search, he still insisted I was wrong. It was so strange to me! Next time I visit Court St I may just check out a different brunch spot, not to run into this waiter again!

Yes... okay yes to this restaurant. I don't know how I found out about it but I've had it bookmarked for quite awhile. Came in for an early dinner last Saturday and was not disappointed. We were seated on the back patio which is gorgeous and thee perfect vibe for a summer evening. They started us off with complimentary bruschetta which was yummy! We got the mussels and calamari to start..highly recommend both. The star of the show for me was the Bronzino. I was in lovee. It was grilled to absolute perfection and the flavors were insane. I highhlly recommend. If you don't mind deboning it yourself I'd go for the whole one instead of the filet. Service here was awesome too. You need to bring cash to this place though because they charge you when you pay by credit card --which I think is tacky btw. I would come back though WITH CASH!

I went there for brunch on a Sunday at 1:30. Me and my friends had a reservation and were seated a little later, which was fine because some of us were running late. we were seated in the "outdoor" area which was pretty well heated and covered. I ordered Canadian eggs Benedict that came with brussels sprouts and potatoes, the brussels sprouts were OK nothing exceptional, the potatoes were good and the eggs Benedict were pretty good, not too much hollandaise sauce however, they got cold fairly quickly. I'm not sure if it was the space or just eating a bit slow. Also got the unlimited bottomless brunch which was $22 a pretty good deal and you were able to switch the drink so I started with a peach Bellini, then to a mango Bellini and I also tried a pineapple Bellini. all of them were delicious and the waiter was really on top of bringing us a new glass when we were finished. A small tip is to pay in cash so you don't get the 2-3% credit card charge.

I was taken here for my birthday brunch in December. Upon arrival, staff checks your vaccination cards. (Pretty standard in NYC) We had a reservation and were seated almost immediately. It was around 2pm, so there were only a few other diners anyway. For the meal, I ordered the pappardelle in tomato sauce. It wasn't on the menu, however I knew they served it based on a previous post. My bf ordered the burger and fries. We also had the bottomless brunch mimosas. The food was delicious and was served in decent portion sizes. The mimosas were pretty great too lol! Definitely left there with a buzz. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Overall giving this restaurant five stars, will definitely be back.
Weekend in Brooklyn and we found this place for our last dinner!  Staff, food, cocktails were all awesome!  We sat outside and enjoyed people watching and feeling the life of the city around us!

Came here with my mom for her birthday and it was so good! Prices are reasonable and food is amazing

Highly recommend this place for brunch, would like to return and try their lunch options IG: @mayzmind

The brunch is amazing and the mimosas are great! The service was fabulous too, and I love that they have brunch everyday. The prices are not expensive and it is a nice calm atmosphere. Definitely recommend.

Verde on Smith used to be one of my go to brunch spots a few years ago. I haven't been in a long time so when a friend mentioned she went and enjoyed it so much and asked would I like to have our next meet-up there I was more than willing. We went for a late weekday brunch and the weather was a bit meh so it was pretty empty that day. I ordered the shrimp fettuccine Alfredo and it was a nice portion with good flavors. I also ordered crème brûlée for dessert and a cappuccino. We were permitted to stay past the 90 min brunch seating time allowance as it was a slower day. We really enjoyed our meal. It's great to know that they have been a consistent staple all these years. I saw menu items I knew and loved from a few years back. Definitely a great option for brunch as they have weekday and weekend brunch. The wait service was very pleasant and helpful!

The brunch here is great. Very affordable prices. I've only done take out from this place but I highlight recommend the French toast as well as the steak and eggs which comes with a side of roasted potatoes and veggies.

The food is delicious!!! The French toast and mimosas were everything!!!! I will definitely go back!!

Had taken a day off for myself to have  some time without hearing mom mom mom all the time. Anywhoo I stopped at this spot for brunch and I have to say I love it . Bottomless mimosas, Bellini , screw driver or Bloody Mary for $21 was amazing to start with. The waiter kept making sure my cup wasn't empty and that was just what I needed. I ordered the classic steak & eggs and yum. I was happy with the whole experience. Will definitely return for more brunches!!!

As Spring break is coming to an end and the weather was beautiful, I decided to take the kids for a mid-week brunch date. As we walked closer to the location I noticed that there is an front outside dining and inside dining.  However, as we entered the location we noticed that there's also patio  dining (the  ambience of the location is breathtaking). As we sat, I thought to myself "I hope the food is plenty full" and to my pleasant surprise the food was exactly that. So much so I have to get a to go container. I would definitely return and recommend.  Verde on Smith is a most go destination.

Omgg sooo good I love this spot.. The bartenders are great I think I met all of them so far... lol. Everyone in there is nice far as the staff. I definitely recommend and I will be back..

I've been to this place once (ate at the bar) and also ordered delivery from here. Delicious both times. The vibe at the restaurant is lively -- they keep busy and it's a nice-looking, diverse Big Apple crowd. I think they have an outdoor area too but I'm a bar kinda guy and their bartender was great. I had the vegetable omelette with a side of Italian sausage (and mimosas of course) and everything was top notch. Couple months later, ordered delivery which came piping hot and tasted just as good. There are so many options for food in NYC. I'm just thankful to have run into this place, my new go-to brunch spot.

Surprised by all of the great reviews. Maybe it's strictly a brunch spot. For $120 the two plates of pasta were bad. Not ok...literally unpleasant to eat. The vodka sauce was watery and flavorless, with the prevailing note being onion. The carbonara was all cream and similarly flavorless. Simply not worth it. Did not finish our plates. Additionally, it was a $10 surcharge per plate for spaghetti and penne...Went straight to Vinny's  afterwards for good food. If you're looking for bottomless Italian brunch there are many MUCH better options out there.

I had my birthday brunch here back in September 2019! It was a vibe for sure. The drinks were flowing and the food was A1. My friend managed to tell our waitress to bring over a cake too which was nice and everyone sang "happy birthday" to me. Apparently, there was another table that was also celebrating their birthday!

We came here yesterday for my sisters birthday on a Sunday around 3:30 pm. We decided to go with the boozy brunch option ($22 with an entree) while the others in the party settled on just regular brunch/dinner courses. The table behind us was excessively loud and people actually asked to be moved away because of how loud they were. All the tables were pretty crowded together. It was hard to maneuver around. We were sat in the back room.  I could barely hear the music. Also our waiter wasn't the friendliest guy, was whatever about everything. We were waiting pretty long for our last few round of drinks and then the waiter came up to me and my sister and said "ok your time is up" after not being seen for 15 mins. I will say the food was good. I ended up getting the chicken sandwich with fries and it came with brussle sprouts as well. Those were delicious. But the Alfredo pasta was pretty bland. I wouldn't come back here unfortunately, there are definitely better brunch options out there.

Came here for brunch while visiting Brooklyn. The food was so good and the bottomless drinks were amazing, not bad for $30 for 60min. My friends and I all chose the Bellini and we switched the flavors, tried them all basically. We all agreed pineapple and mango were the best. Friendly service as well, all the servers were welcoming and they worked together as a team. You're giving a "shot" of hand sanitizer upon entry.

Who doesn't love Brunch @ Verde on Smith. Gem in Brooklyn on a great street filled with a number of eateries. Yes the wait is long on weekends but timing is everything. The food hasn't failed me yet. So I will always be back..Front outdoor seating as well as backyard seating so there are def options but just get there early when dining for brunch- No reservations for brunch either. See ya soon!

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: Sangria and mimosas are really good would go back for the drinks. The food was okay, had the salmon with spinach and rice
Went here as on a date last night and everything was great. The food was delicious and the drinks tasted just as good. The servers were nice and accommodating. Will definitely come back

Verde on smith is such a vibe .. I've been here twice, once for dinner and one for brunch . Both times were amazing . The food is amazing and the Bellinis for brunch hit the SPOT . Their steak is amazing and the staff is very attentive and helpful .

Wow - 5 star experience!  My cousin is in town from SF and we were looking for a spot in this area.  I found Verde on Smith on Yelp and made a reservation for outdoor seating for 3 of us.  Because outdoor wasn't specified on OpenTable, I called to make sure and the guy who answered the phone was very nice and accommodating.  As we got closer to the date of our dinner, there was a Covid surge in NYC and the outdoor dining was even more imperative.  We grabbed drinks at Clover Club next door and headed over at 7PM on Fri.  It was not crowded at all - they let us check out the back patio - but to me it felt too enclosed, so we opted for a little "bubble" on the sidewalk.  It was great.  They even put a space heater in there to keep us warm.  The menu looked great - lots of options in the Italian/Mediterranean realm.  They started us with delicious bread (refilled twice) and we ordered a bottle of wine, apps (Goat Cheese Salad and Tuscan Stuffed Shrimp), entrees (Lobster Feast for them and Salmon Scaloppini for me), Creme Brulee for dessert, and Sparkling Moscato for them and Irish Coffee for me.  All of it was delicious.  We devoured everything.  Service was great - even though we were outside, they checked on us multiple times (refilling our water as needed), everyone fully masked, and even zipped up our little bubble each time they left.  We were all impressed by the food and the service and more importantly, I felt extremely comfortable with the seating during this tense time in the city.  Highly recommend this place, and even my visiting cousin told me I should come back again.
Pretty packed for a Saturday at noon, but I'm sure that's because of their brunch! Got a spot at the bar right away and enjoyed my meal. Ambience, food and drink was great.
Everything about this spot is good... attentive and customer service great... food good ... price is RIGHTTT.. mimosa dont miss..
Food was absolutely delicious. The spinach omelette was on point very filling and flavorful.  The bottomless mimosas could have been stronger but they we good for the price I paid.
The food here is so delicious. My husband and I came here for brunch for his birthday we had the bottom less mimosa. Everything was A1 I would definitely be back food was so good

Good atmosphere, attentive staff, delicious food and good wine selection. Intimate indoors, cozy back yard dining area, still an overall great experience. If you're driving parking might be a little tough. Will definitely visit again.

Brunch is a go to! I've been to brunch a handful of times here. The pancakes, French toast, chicken crepes, and chicken Alfredo are all pretty great. Definitely a must try!

She had a great personality and was good at her job overall. She made the experience great. There was also a gentleman there who was just as great but I forget his name. In addition to the excellent service. The food was so good. I had a steak eggs Benedict (for the first time) and it was so good. Also a side of French toast for the table and that was so good as well! The decor is awesome as well. We sat in the back patio area which had Christmas decor (thought that was super cute) and the inside has its own vibe. Loved it. Loved everything. Not my first time there. It's been a while but it was just as great if not better than I remember.

Went for their brunch, left feeling accomplished! This place is great! We didn't have to wait long and it was packed. The food was absolutely delicious! The waitress was delightful. Nothing back to say at all! Will definitely visit again.

Went for lunch, very nice environment. The food was pretty good too. I got the chicken sandwich and the other people got the caesar salad with chicken and shrimp. The food and environment was good but the service could have been better. It was not a busy hour and we waited around 20 minutes to order and another 20 after we had finished for the waiter to check-in on us. If you have time, this is a good spot.

Went here on a wimp on a quick date . The wait was about 40 minutes , I do recall is going during the week, which wasn't bad at all. For starters , I had the crab cakes , which was cooked to perfection . And for the Entree (I requested) penne Alfredo with shrimp , which was kinda salty to the taste.

My cousin was in the mood for Italian so we came here. Looks are deceiving cause from the outside the resturant is in an unassuming building squeezed in between the other restaurants that line Smith. We decided on sitting in the outdoor dinning area but from what I seen inside is gorgeous. The food was good I had the salmon and munched on my cousins veggie lasagna which was really good too. The drinks were strong! My cousin had the blue sky drink which he liked and I had some sort of martini. The drink plus the heat was responsible for me taking a nap at 11:30 pm. I liked this a lot I would definitely be back!

I come here regularly. I always try something different on the menu. I had the bison burger it was delicious. The bottomless deal never disappoints. Hard to find a brunch spot in the middle of the week

Ask for Luigi and Eriq at the bar! Fantastic brunch in BH with lovely owners & great food

What can I say about this place..I can say my husband and i  had a phenomenal time at this restaurant.  We celebrated his birthday with brunch and it was soooooo good. The atmosphere, the vibe, and the food all great. They sang happy birthday to my husband and offered fresh strawberries with chocolate drizzle and cream on a plate that said happy birthday. The French toast was delicious as well as the steak and eggs. We met some great people who was also celebrating a birthday as well. As a matter of fact there was another young man celebrating his birthday.  Overall is was a phenomenal experience and we will be back. Thanks to the staff and manager of Verde restaurant.  Oh I forgot we had two pitchers of mimosas  which were delicious.
Food was delicious and drinks on point. The place is really cozy. Great service!! Will definitely be back

The food, the ambiance of the bistro, the service, everything about Verde was phenomenal. I am traveling from Texas and this was a very pleasant fall experience for me. What made me the happiest the most was about the servers they were the best making sure we got everything perfectly. And that for me tells how the place is run by great owners and are great with everyone who works there. Will definitely come here again and i have already recommended my from Home to definitely come to Verde on Smith when they visit New York.

This place was pretty busy on a Saturday evening. Showed up around 6:30ish. Seated quickly. They have outdoor seating on the sidewalk and also outside in the back of the restaurant. Nicely lit. Romantic Italian music playing in the background. I had a Sangria which in my opinion tasted like juice. Hefty glass but a waste of calories for me. Didn't bother to order another. We had calamari for starters and it was fresh and delicious!! Not greasy. Loved it. It was a lot. So took some home. I ordered the penne bistecca which was delicious!! So tasty. Again a lot of food on the plate. My man had steak and mashed potatoes which was also tasty. It came with salad on the side! So good! Lots of food. We both ended up bringing it home and had it for next day brunch!!! Will definitely return! Loved the ambiance and service.

Miss brunching in Brooklyn? This is the place for you! Ample amounts of outdoor seating available in the back and front of the restaurant, 90 minute bottomless drinks to add on to your entree for an additional $16.99. Need I say more? Well how about most of the brunch options are under twenty bucks like the french toast, pancakes and omelettes ! If that hasn't tickled your fancy, stop by for the steak and cheese sandwich that has ACTUAL pieces of steak on it, not that smashed flattened chopped up mess that some call a steak sandwich. This is the real deal. Comes with a side salad and fries too. All of which I ended up piling onto my sandwich! Be ware of peak hours! This place gets packed! All for good reason.

Great service! The Bellinis are delicious and so is the food. The staff go above and beyond. Definitely coming again.

They were making sure all the tables and guests were far apart, and provided hand sanitizer to everyone as they entered the restaurant. It was not packed and everyone maintained their distance in the backyard and in the front of the restaurant. The garden patio was lovely and the food was great as well. The drinks were ok. Service was great!!! The restaurant was clean.. I loved the heated outdoor section. We had bottomless mimosas... The waiter brought them out back to back without us having to prompt or call for service. The food was great. No complaints at all about anything.

I would give 10 stars if I could! We came for chicken parm and it did not disappoint. Generous portion and the sauce was delicious, tangy and perfectly al dente noodles served up with tender breaded chicken coated in mozzarella. Some of the best chicken parm I've ever had.  We returned the next day because the service and food were amazing and we really wanted to try the Kobe burger.  It also was fantastic! Perfectly cooked and juicy.  The atmosphere, service, and food were all incredible back-to-back!

We were in the neighborhood and decided to stop by to try out. We ended up having some spicy margaritas and moscow mules, which were refreshing and delicious. Also had an order or crab cakes which were OK. place is nice and has outside seating in front and back. bar holds about 6-8 people. This place is known for their everyday brunch so I will swing by and try that out soon.

My coworkers rave about Verde...so I decided today was the day to try them out.  FANTASTIC!!!!! I ordered the shrimp scampi with saffron risotto.  There were 6 jumbo shrimp, tasted great.  Garlic and olive oil are wonderful with the shrimp.  The saffron risotto was aromatic and beautifully cooked.  What a wonderful lunch.   Can not wait to order again!
The food was Great! The service was Great! I highly recommend this restaurant. Its not a big restaurant But the place was very nice and cozy. The price $$ means a little expensive but it's worth it.

Came to dine a few weeks in the cute place they have outback! My girls and I proceeded with agave margaritas made amazing, and ordered calamari and mussels. The mussels I prefer with white sauce and they were delish. Not a lot of broth, but still so good! They always serve bread with olives and oil- I love me some bread. The calamari was crispy and fine. Service was nice. Will be back to try more for dinner. Recommend to locals and anyone else looking for good quality Italian cuisine.

I've always wanted to come here, I'm a major yelper and I've had this establishment bookmarked for quite some time now. I must say it did not disappoint me nor my two friends. The drinks were tasty and strong, you get an array of flavors and specialty drinks. The staff makes sure your comfortable, gives you adequate time to order what you want. The food was Exquiste for brunch, I had the French toast which was dripping in syrup and the taste is indescribable. Come and try for yourself and you'll know what I mean. I give this place a 10/10.

I had a really good time, The ultimate mimosa and screw drivers had me feeling preety good. I ordered the ceaser salmon salad and it was delicious. Everything that my friends ordered they truly enjoyed. The ambiance and the decor was very chill and laid back. There definitely was a wait but it was well worth it. They took the necessary precautions to enjoy that staff and patron was both protected...Looking forward to going back.

When I dinned for brunch I was met with more abrasive service in comparison to when I went for dinner. The workers behaved very dismissive towards me and my partner our whole brunch. During my dinner experience I may of been graced with our waiters presence once besides when our food was being brought out. Overall I don't think I will be going back which is a shame because I see the potential. Like I said the place is beautiful and if the food taste quality and service was improved upon I think this place could've been a favorite!!
